title: Great location, spotless cleanliness, friendly staff and good amenities
text:
For my first visit to NY, I lived right here in Manhattan Times Square. 

The hotel is located convenient to everything - Central Park, subway, best pizzas and the street is buzzing at all times. 

Michael, from the staff, gave me great recommendations for the day and I was happy to receive personal advise from a New Yorker. 

The premise is very clean and the room was very good and comfortable. 

I’d definitely recommend if you are visiting  the neighborhood

title: Title: Disappointing Lack of Loyalty Recognition at The Chatwal
text: My recent stays at The Chatwal, New York, have left me feeling disheartened and undervalued as a loyal customer. Despite choosing The Chatwal for four separate visits within the past year, I found myself receiving no special recognition or appreciation for my continued patronage.While I did enjoy the perks typically associated with my American Express Platinum card, such as room upgrades, I expected The Chatwal to extend personalized gestures acknowledging my loyalty beyond these standard benefits. Unfortunately, this was not the case.As someone who values the importance of customer loyalty, it's disheartening to feel like just another guest, especially after investing my time and resources into staying at The Chatwal multiple times. I believe that loyal customers should be acknowledged and rewarded for their dedication, yet my experiences at The Chatwal fell short of this expectation.I hope that The Chatwal, New York, takes this feedback into consideration and implements measures to better recognize and appreciate the loyalty of its guests in the future. Until then, I may explore other accommodations that prioritize and value customer loyalty.

title: Beautiful art deco gem in great location
text:
Where to start? 
Service- attentive without being intrusive. We were welcomed by Peter at the door, who was genuine and personable and remained so during our stay. 
Room-black out curtains, practically sound proof, spacious with a nice size bathroom. We were upgraded based on amex platinum, which had other perks. 
The Lamb club- the manhattans were spectacular and consistent. 
We did a lot of research and determining where to stay, because there are so many options. Our son is in college in the city so we’ve stayed several places. This is a great hotel and  location, consider if you are  going to a show, you will be  nicely removed from Times Square. 
We will absolutely return.

title: Staycation for Anniversary
text:
I can’t say enough about the Chatwal. The staff was awesome and thanks to Adam at the front desk for making our trip memorable. We were granted a larger upon request as well as late check out!! Thanks to all the staff and the awesome bellman (Mike was awesome) I wish I can remember the other two gentlemen but hats off to them. A quick staycation for our anniversary was extremely pleasant. We will be back!!

Rodney & Nekeisha Edwards

title: Chatwal, a wonderful hotel in NY Theater District
text: WATER FOR ELEPHANTS, a play staged and started at Atlanta's Alliance Theatre was opening on Broadway and a group of Alliance supporters went to NY to see it there and celebrate. The group leader  had booked The Chatwal. We had never heard of it. Fabulous staff. Shout out to Michael and Steven. Lovely rooms, perfect theater district location and the restaurant is warm, historic feeling and the food is excellent.

title: The Chatwal Suite - NYC
text: Beautifully designed 5 star boutique hotel in NYC, a walk from Times Square. The Chatwal suite has a wonderful and spacious private terrace with a fire pit overlooking theatre district and surrounded by NYC skyscrapers and vintage buildings on 44th ave. Truly a unique New York experience. The hotel is simply wonderful, interior is a trip back in time into the 50s, however looking modern and brand new. The room is a bigger trip back into the 50s however everything is fully tech activated, with a push of a button, and a surprise hidden TV in mirror in both washrooms. Enjoy!

title: A diamond hidden in a big city
text: This hotel was new to us and we gave it a try as a new addition to Hyatt and it was fantastic.  We really appreciated the staff and how helpful and friendly everyone was.  We also loved the apple cider stand that allows us to grab a cup to go, the breakfast was delicious and I feel bad because I only got a few names, next time I'll get the rest. The doormen, Randy and Michael were quick and the always there to get the door. The breakfast was spectacular, so delicious and we would recommend the pancakes and French toast -- yummy, thanks to Frank. We will be back!!!

title: 16th birthday 🎉
text: We took my daughter and close friends to NYC for her 16th birthday. Staying at the Chatwal was the best choice we made for our accommodation. The warm welcome, very friendly, courteous and professional staff (including the receptionist, concierge butler, wellness center staff and doorman) made it the perfect birthday weekend  for my daughter and friends.

title: Fantastic location to times square and Bryant Park
text: Travel and leisure rated this hotel is number three in New York City for 2023. It has a lot of charm. The location is perfect for walkable to Bryant Park, Times square, NYC Library, Rockefeller Center , Radio City, Lincoln Center, St Patrick's, Central Park, Tavern on the Green, ton of restaurants. We walked to all the places mentioned. Close to a hop-on hop off stop. Cabs are easily available. We did not eat in the restaurant or drink in the bar.. The staff at the front desk was so kind to send a bottle of champagne. It was our 25th wedding anniversary. Unfortunately we did not get to drink it! The room is a little tight. I would remove some of the furniture. We were on an inner room. Did not hear any noise from the city which was well appreciated. Love the bathroom. Great rain shower, toiletries, robe and the Dyson blow dryer. Going to have to get a blow dryer from Dyson now... dang it. Coffee was provided in the morning You could grab one by the elevator to take to your room. There's just so much to see in New York City and I wish we had had a drink in the bar at least one night. Maybe instead of the champagne and drink in the bar that would have been great exclamation The only issue that I had was there were hardly any door men at the door....until checkout day on Sunday. The doors are pretty heavy to open. Most of the time they be lounging by the front desk. There's an opportunity for better service there. Otherwise, great service was experienced from housekeeping, reservations, and front desk.

title: My New Favorite NYC Hotel
text: I generally stay at. The Conrad. It was booked. The Chatwald came highly recommended. What a fantastic spot. It’s a fabulous art deco inspired hotel Bar and restaurant throw you back in time. The rooms are spacious, comfortable and spotless. And the staff could not be any more attentive or professional. I travel frequently. To NYC. I think I have found my new ago to hotel. Kudos to the management and staff.

title: Excellent stay
text: My husband and I were celebrating his 60th birthday so I wanted to stay at a beautiful hotel with excellent service. The Chatwal met and exceeded our expectations and wishes. The restaurant was also wonderful. We loved the ambiance as well as the food. I would definitely stay again. Lastly, though located in a very noisy area, our room was surprisingly quiet and we slept well.

title: 5* Luxury
text:
Beautiful hotel in the heart of Times Square, great location for the family with ZERO noise once inside the hotel.

The staff are all super friendly and happy to help with everything. Thank you to the doormen who helped get us taxi's on 6th Avenue, especially on our last day with all the suitcases

Food was excellent with 5 star service at breakfast

Room was great, the bathroom was amazing with a powerful rainfall shower and a jacuzzi style bath tub. Japanese toilet was also great lol

Comfy beds and a lovely cake provided for my wife's birthday that she loved. Thank you!

The pool was very small, its more of a workout swimming pool with a strong current and the hotel tub fits 2-3 people at most otherwise you're on top of each other.

Lovely spa area and changing rooms though.

My only criticism would be to have tea and coffee facilities in the room but we thoroughly loved our stay at the hotel.

title: Everything was top notch
text: Fast check-in. Big room. super quiet. Super clean. Comfortable bed. Frette linens in bathroom and sheets on bed. Loved everything. We couldn't even hear a horn from the streets below. We will be back to this hotel again soon.

title: Hidden gem!
text: I booked this hotel as a treat for a mother-daughter weekend, when we were in town to see a few Broadway shows. It's such a gorgeous hotel. The staff made us feel so welcome and at home. The location was super convenient. My 11-year-old loved the little treats left for her in the room. The pool was a bit underwhelming, but that wasn't a big part of our booking this hotel. (It was making a few little kids very happy though!) Our room was small (we booked just a queen) and somewhat dim, but it was very clean, comfy and quiet. The bathroom was huge and wonderful. They had coffee in lobby in morning and hot cider to go in evening. We can't wait to go back.

title: Great location for theater and very comfortable accomodations
text: Location, Location, Location and Quality, Quality, Quality. Very comfortable and clean rooms,. Very attentive service and  staff.  The breakfast was outstanding and only wish we had tried the restaurant for dinner. We would definetly plan on staying again when we attend Broadway plays.

title: Great Experience
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for the night to catch a Broadway show. The hotel is located within a block of Times Square, so it is incredibly convenient, but is quiet. The staff were great in working with me ahead of time to set up some extras, like a bottle of wine and flowers, in the room before our arrival. They also arranged an in-room couples massage which were great. We did in-room dining and the food was fantastic and came up incredibly fast. Overall I would highly recommend The Chatwal for its location but really for the amazing staff.

title: Excellent Theatre District Hotel
text: From the moment we arrived, we felt at home as we received a warm and gracious greeting by our Welcome Ambassador, Michael Karaduzovic.  He quickly took our luggage and was kind enough to tell us about a few of his favorite restaurants including the restaurant in the hotel called The Lamb Club.  We ate there for lunch and I had one of the best burgers I’ve ever had in my life.  We then met Tiffany Sotero, our Guest Services Ambassador who was equally as wonderful. She gave us an in depth explanation about the hotel and amenities, all with a beautiful and sincere smile.  The hotel rooms are top notch with beautiful black granite bathrooms, very clean jacuzzi tub with a rain shower head.  The bathroom mirror has a built in TV and the most amazing thing was the heated toilet seat.  The hotel is extremely clean which is very important to me. The overall experience has been excellent and I look forward to staying there again.

title: Surprising fine-ness right in the theatre district
text:
Surprising nice hotel right off Times Square. 10 stories tall, with a spa, bar, and restaurant. Hyatt affiliated, and so quiet, even with traffic and theatre right below. 
Very friendly and responsive desk staff. The only question was the iPad in the room… which had no functionality aside from being a replacement for an alarm clock/radio. Ah well…

title: Lovely stay
text: A wonderful hotel.  The room was Impeccable, and the bud vases with orchids in both the bathroom and the room were a beautiful touch— I was very impressed.  The staff were all helpful, friendly, and professional.  I will definitely be back!

title: A wonderful hotel in midtown NYC with exceptional service!
text: You will love this hotel! Beautiful hotel centrally located in midtown NYC, great facilities and exceptional service. This is my go-to hotel whenever I come to NYC. The affiliation with Hyatt is a great benefit, since Hyatt's program is the best in the hotel industry.

title: Perfect sanctuary
text: Perfect elegant but fun and well appointed hotel near theatres and restaurants —we walked to nearly everything. Excellent, friendly, attentive service. Doormen are extremely helpful. Loved decor. Will return!

title: Phenomenal luxury experience!
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to NYC and my stay at The Chatwal. Everything was very pleasant and relaxing from the rooms to the dining experience! I will definitely consider staying there again during my next visit to NYC.

title: Helpful Staff
text: The staff were very helpful, e.g., Michael Karaduzovic, one of the welcome ambassadors.  I appreciated the assistance.  It is a pleasant hotel with excellent restaurant an good location for theater and walking, and slightly removed from crowded Times Square.

title: Good for business
text:
I've been coming here for almost a year and they take care of their frequent visitors. My suite upgrades (Globalist) are nice and large. I feel like it's a studio in NYC haha

Breakfast is okay but room service is prompt (wish they were opened earlier). For the area it's quiet which is impressive. 

I go out of my way to stay at this hotel. It's better than the more convenient Beekman and I'm happy with the experience.

The only complaint is that the gym is dinky. If you need a workout once a week it'll do but if you're a regular then you prob want somewhere else. 

For business workers the desk is solid.

title: Old Hollywood
text: I love the hotel theme ‘Old Hollywood’ . It was beautiful and regal. Our room was clean, with great amenities, and I loved when housekeeping returned to our room in the early evening to “Retire” our room. Nice touch!!! We will definitely return when visiting the city.

title: Broadway Weekend
text:
My family stayed at The Chatwal hotel in NYC this past weekend. We chose the hotel as part of the AMEX luxury hotel package and due to its proximity to the theater we were visiting. After reading the reviews, we expected a pleasant stay. Let me tell you, we did not! We had an EXCELLENT experience, a PERFERCT stay.  

It all began with the gentlemen at the valet stand and the extremely accommodating doormen. I am in need of a walker due to a broken foot. They made every effort to accommodate my needs. 

The young ladies at the front desk were also a marvel; at check-in and with every call during our stay! She explained the hotel amenities and the added benefits the AMEX provides. Our room was ready early, but we decided to have a cocktail in the lobby prior to brunch. The lobby bartender, Christian, was amazing, he made a signature Old Fashioned cocktail that was the best I have ever had. 

The young lady hostess at the Lamb’s Club, I believe her name was Yuwa?, was also extremely friendly. After we made the reservation for brunch, she took some time to talk to us and go over some of the hotel's history including notable guests and events. BTW - Brunch was fantastic! 

The room was exquisite, we were upgraded to a Junior Suite that was spacious and very well appointed. The bathroom was amazing, I was captivated by the rain shower (45 minutes!!).  heated bidet, twin sinks and plenty of towels and toiletries. 

It would take all day to explain every detail that made our stay perfect. We have stayed at many of NYC top hotels, Mandarin, Ritz Carlton, Plaza, etc. but if you have cause to be in Midtown, this is the place to stay.

title: Perfect Location; Excellent Room and Service
text: I found this hotel through their great offer with AmEx and they really delivered. I appreciate how positive they were about providing the benefits. My room was quite large, very clean and comfortable with lots of luxuries. We had a very nice time at the bar with an excellent bartender and friendly, low key mix of people. Breakfast was also delicious. Location is a short walk from Grand Central, right near Bryant Park. I will be back!

title: Chatwal Chic
text: For our anniversary, I took my wife to the chic and sophisticated Chatwal Hotel in New York where we had an utterly elegant stay.  From start to finish, every detail was attended to. Brittany at the front desk was very friendly and Oliver who introduced himself as the guest experience manager took very good care of us. His attentive, cheerful and  welcome reception was a great start. Fully aware that it was a special night for us, Oliver made sure that wine, chocolates and other tasty treats were placed in our room.  In addition, we were very grateful to him for upgrading us to the Garden suite which made us feel like we were transported to a serene and happy place.  We definitely recommend The Chatwal and look forward to returning to in the future!

title: Great hotel
text: This hotel was amazing. Very good to look at all the help was pleasant. The only things I was not fully pleased with was the size of the gym and pool as well as the pillows for sleeping. This hotel is perfect if u have an American Express it goes hand and hand!

title: Amazing place to stay
text: We went on a quick trip to NYC to view a couple of Broadway shows and were more than happy staying at The Chatwal. Not only is the location perfect, but everything inside the hotel was clean and prestigious. The room had all the amenities that we required and even some that went above our expectations. Would definitely stay again when we go back.

title: Wonderful stay
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left, we were taken care of. Parking valet was excellent and timely. Front desk and concierge were pleasant and helpful. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. The bathroom was amazing. Bed was clean and comfortable. Closet had ample space. The location is outstanding. We will book here the next time we are in the city.

title: What a lovely experience in Midtown!
text: This is a jewel of a boutique hotel.  Well managed and well maintained, you feel you have stepped back into the gorgeous days of Art Deco.  I expected to see Hercule Poirot walk in and have dinner with a client in distress.  Lovely appointed room, large bathroom with great water pressure.  The location is excellent for any midtown adventure.

title: Perfect Getaway
text: Location was perfect for Broadway shows, dining and shopping. Staff were very friendly. Hotel was well appointed and clean. Rooms were spacious and the restaurant was ideal for breakfast and dinner. I would highly recommend and will definitely be returning.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel - small, warm and elegant.  Great location.
text: We enjoyed our stay.  I had two rooms so that one of our children could join us for our visit to the city.  We were very happy with the hotel and the staff.  It was convenient to shows and we thoroughly enjoyed a few drinks at the bar.  We would definitely return.

title: Great Stay
text: It was our first time, staying at the Chatwal, and I can say that it was a clean, upscale, quiet, gem in the otherwise busy Times Square area. The staff were fantastic, including the concierge, who helped us greatly with reservations prior to arrival, and also while staying there as well. Reservations can be very tough to get in New York City, so I would definitely recommend using Alfonzo at the concierge desk. Looking forward to coming back!

title: Only place we will stay
text: I stayed at the Chatwal the week before Christmas. The location was perfect for everything that we wanted to do. The staff were lovely. They anticipated my needs and were helpful at any opportunity they had. We can’t wait to stay there again next fall!

title: Great location paired with great service
text:
The hotel is located near time square, so it’s within walking distance to lots of landmarks and must-sees. But the hotel itself is very quite, providing a much needed privacy and comfort after a full day of activities.

The hotel and rooms are well designed, of a low key but appropriate level of luxury.

Services were their highlights, far exceeding many other hotels of the same level that I have experienced. The staff really tried to accommodate their guests’ requests and they did well.

Restaurant can be a little pricey but the atmosphere and the food quality justified the cost.

Overall a very pleasant experience with Chatwal, and I would certainly consider coming back if I visit New York City again.

title: Quiet stay in the middle of the action
text: We had such a pleasant stay at The Chatwal. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. The staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Conveniently located to everything. Morning coffee beats starbucks! Look forward to our next stay.

title: Wonderful stay
text: Overnight stay this past weekend as I had tix for the Rockettes and as a treat which I do occasionally to “get away”. My first time staying at the Chatwal and I was impressed. I booked a 2 double delux room and it was definitely not cheap but decided to splurge.  The stay was the weekend before Christmas so I expected the prices to be expensive. It is a luxury boutique hotel in a prime location  to Times Square, Bryant Park, Rock Center. Lots of sights within walking distance. I’ve stayed at several hotels in the city but this one tops all of them! The room and bathroom were huge!  The room was so quiet. We’re down the block from Times Square but you wouldn’t think we were. Didnt hear any street noises or sirens. It was a peaceful sleep. Really nice touch with a welcome letter, wine, chocolate and fruit! I had to double check with the front desk if it was part of the room before I open it and get charged for it ;) They assured me it was for us to enjoy. There was a slight hiccup when I checked in. I was early and the room wasnt yet available but my bags were accidentally brought up to another room which they thought was my room. Not a big deal since I had the show to see and my room was of course ready after the show.  The bed was turned down for us. What made it most memorable was the service. Every staff member was so friendly especially the staff member who handled our bags/ and the door. I did not get his name unfortunately and I’m bummed about it so I can properly give him the credit but he was just the nicest and most helpful. He always greeted me by name and that was so nice he remembers!  (how can anyone remember names esp with so many people in and out!) Everyone always had a smile and greeted us. Such great service and found my new fave hotel. Look forward to staying here again!

title: Forced to pay $200 for being 12 minutes late to agreed checkout time
text:
I was kindly allowed a 2pm late check-out yesterday evening, which was extended to 2:30pm. I went downstairs to the lobby at 2:42pm, and was immediately reprimanded by the manager for my tardiness and told that an additional $200 was to be charged to my bill for the lateness. 

I politely asked for her to waive the fee as a courtesy, since after all it had been just over ten minutes of the agreed checkout time. She was quite insistent and unaccommodating and still ended up charging me $100. 

I am appreciative that I was granted a 2:30pm late check out, however Lydia's attitude came across as unfair and unnecessarily strict and inflexible towards a respectful guest and loyal Hyatt member.

title: Loved this hotel 12 years ago and even better 12 years later
text: The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. I've stayed at many other Manhattan 4 and 5 star hotels and The Chatwal has the best staff of any of them. The location is perfect and the rooms are so quiet you would never know you're basically in Times Square

title: Fabulous stay!
text: The hotel is beautiful and our room was perfect! We loved the large shower, gorgeous balcony, and the service was impeccable! The location so close to EVERYTHING made our stay wonderful. We ate dinner at the restaurant and it was delicious. We had tickets to a show and our waiter did everything to make sure our meal was perfect and that we were on time to the show. We will definitely make The Chatwal our go-to when visiting New York City.

title: Charming, quiet find in midtown.
text:
What a charming hotel with a delicious restaurant. Excellent service from the front desk and a really nicely upgraded room (Hyatt globalist benefit). 

There aren’t many rooms on the floor so fortunately it was relatively quiet. We did hear the automatic shades open for our neighbors but for a midtown hotel it was much quieter than I expected. 

The meals were exceptional and the service there attentive. 

Japanese toilet nice touch. The rain shower and water pressure excellent. 

Will absolutely return.

title: Best hotel near Times Square
text: The hotel staff went over, and beyond to ensure our stay, was enjoyable! The room was clean and very comfortable. The location was walking distance to several main attractions. I’ve stayed at several New York hotels before and this one by far is now my favorite due to the customer service and location.

title: Clean but needs maintenance
text: Great location.  Expensive.  Didn’t try spa but pool not accessible in evening after dinner which was disappointing. Rooms were clean but toilet ran nonstop and door leading to rooms locked and only building maintenance could open… after 40 minutes…

title: Wonderful hotel and outstanding personnel.
text: Just stayed at the Chatwal Hotel in NYC and gotta say, it was awesome. Michael Karaduzovic, the Welcome Ambassador, was a standout. Really made my visit special with his top-notch service. The hotel's a perfect mix of luxury and comfort. Definitely a great spot in the city. Big thumbs up!

title: Great!
text: I chose the Chatwal because I am a HYATT GLOBALIST and wanted to use a suite upgrade award.  I really felt like I hit the jackpot with the Library Suite (room 801/802). It is giant.  I also benefited from free breakfast every morning which was over the top. Every aspect of my stay was great.  My only complaint was the location which for some is probably a plus.

title: Best hotel staff ever!
text: This hotel was a big splurge for us, but we were treated so well and the staff is so amazing, that we’re already saving up to visit again! Don’t hesitate; book your stay with this fantastic hotel! (And if you’re celebrating something, be sure to tell them, and they will be so incredibly kind about it your entire stay.)

title: New York’s best hotel
text: From the second we arrived to the second we left….perfection. Nothing was a problem. The fastest room service ever experienced, the most comfortable bed, blackout curtains that really work and it’s so quiet….even being steps away from Times Square. We loved everything about the faultless hotel and can’t wait to go back. Truly a 6 star experience. Thank you everyone who made our stay perfection!

title: A quiet haven in hectic NYC
text: Very comfortable and convenient. A great ‘old world’ experience in this era of cost cutting and service curtailment. Friendly helpful staff, no matter which ‘shift’ or time of day. Outstanding housekeeping service provided in spacious rooms.

title: lovely stay
text:
Nice rooms comfy bed and comforter! lighting is a bit confusing but no big deal!
a very nice place to spend a weekend in the theater district!! very convenient to all transportation or to just walk.  will return

title: My visit to The Chatwal
text: Hotel is stunning. Staff is friendly, welcoming, gracious and helpful, Room was beautiful and very comfortable. One of my best hotel experiences ever! Food and beverage service at The Lambs Club was extraordinary!

title: A Truly Special Experience.
text:
There are a lot of great things about this hotel - the proximity to the Theater District and Bryant Park, the details of the rooms, from spacious closets and bathrooms, and the in-hotel dining.  But what truly sets the Chatwal apart from other hotels is the genuinely friendly and caring staff.  Myesha, who greeted us at the front desk was so welcoming, not only as we came in, but each time we passed.  The housekeepers who did performed the nightly Turn-Down Service, (Reyna and Pasang) and all the Doorman were so polite.  Top of all the staff, however, was Mike!  Mike greeted us upon arrival and then made certain we felt at home throughout our whole stay.  

On our final night, he brought up Chocolates for our two young girls.  We came for long weekend to celebrate the birthday of one of our young daughters, and they had a cake waiting for us in our room with a card for our daughter, and greeted our daughters by name each time they came down in the morning or back from a day of sightseeing.  The staff at the Chatwell strive to make sure that you feel right at home.  The extra touches go a long way and the staff's kindness made our trip a truly magical NYC experience.  Thank you so much for making it a wonderful stay!

title: Our New Go-To Hotel in NYC
text:
Our new go-to hotel in NYC.  Boutique hotel with fabulous location near Times Square and Broadway shows.  Attentive and professional staff wrere very helpful.  Restaurant in hotel the Lamb's Club, was excellent for pre-show dining as well as breakfast and lunch.  
We upgraded to a suite to celebrate a special event.  The rooms were luxurious and very comfortable.  And QUIET! Although only a block from Times Square, we never heard street noise.  
This hotel is expensive.  It's not for everyone.  But if you are looking for a luxury, personal, and convenient property, the Chatwal is an excellent choice.

title: Not 5 ⭐️ Hotel
text: Over rated. Not truly a five star although they bill you at that price.  First, the picture of the “pool” is a joke. Its more of a swim pool. Its not open for half the week. It has a weird dark vibe.  (Check the history) The only thing great about the place is the location! However, you can stay at other places for the location at half the price. I have no issue paying for great service & experience, but this place isn’t worth it. Seriously consider another hotel!

title: Wonderful
text: What a pleasant and luxurious stay we had.  I wanted a hotel near Times Square with both a pool/hot tub, and a pretty outdoor balcony.  Chatwal gave us both and beyond.  The private terrace of our room was absolutely magnificent.  I practically wanted to sleep out there -lol.  Keep in mind, not all terraces there are the same.  Manpreet, the manager, was amazingly accommodating and considerate of my family's needs.  He noticed we were a party of 5 and extended his generosity by offering us a room upgrade.  What made it most special is that he didn't really HAVE to do this - but id it anyway :-).  Then, he ensured that we were personally welcomed in our room with champagne and a hand-written note - What a nice touch.  We accepted and stayed in the Chatwal Suite with terrace, and Wow- What a treat!  While soaking under the rainfall shower, it almost felt like being transformed into another dimension.  In other words, it was a beyond Spa-like dream experience from only a shower :-o. But it was that garden terrace that had me from the moment I saw it.  Thank you, Manpreet- for everything.   Thank you, Tanzam for your unmatched butler service :-).

title: Excellent value
text: Upscale hotel, good location yet quiet, excellent service. Excellent value compared to others in this category. In-room dining quality was very good, but the menu would benefit from a broader selection of choices.

title: Fantastic
text: Coming to New York is usually a chore; this hotel made it a pleasant experience. My son came up for the first time to see the city and because the hotel was so incredible he did not want to leave the room. Everyone was kind, helpful, and welcoming. I would definitely return

title: Save your money and time for better service elsewhere
text:
Pros
- Bed is really comfortable and you’ll get a nice night’s sleep
- Toto/Japanese toilet in bathroom
- Rainfall shower pressure is excellent
- Small treats were provided like chocolate truffles and chocolate covered crackers upon arrival
- Location (ie it’s near several train stations such that you don’t need to walk to Times Square to catch a train)
- Breakfast (food-wise) at the Lambs Club is pretty good

Cons
- Service, service, service. For a hotel that bills itself as luxury and 5-star, the service was subpar and underwhelming, especially at the price point you pay and in relation to the service at comparable hotels.
- Service at the Lambs Club (for breakfast x2) was uncomfortable at best. Server was inattentive and did not make you feel welcome. Small mistakes with our food for two straight days with breakfast. Who gives hot milk for an iced coffee. Rude/aggressive when we tried to explain about breakfast credit we wanted to apply to our food. 
- Service at the front desk. Rarely see people at the front desk or at the front door. Ali was the saving grace and always positive when we saw him. Anyway, we had booked via AMEX and they provided us with some breakfast credit, which was explained to me either as “free continental breakfast or 80$ per voucher (for 2 people total)” when I arrived. When we went to redeem this at the restaurant the server was rude to us and said that is not true and to deal with it at the front desk. We went to the front desk of the hotel and explained the situation and again was made to feel like I was in the wrong. “Who told you this? What time did you get in? We don’t do this (80$ credit) anymore - it’s just continental breakfast.” Ultimately they honored what they (initially) told me and I appreciated that, but thinking back on it it makes no sense for me to have known this was your previous policy….unless someone at the front desk explicitly told me this was an option. Bizarre. And although breakfast ended up being included and was actually pretty good, we ended up eating elsewhere and not going the third day because of how uncomfortable we felt on day 2 of breakfast at the Lambs Club. 
- Service for an issue with the room. They don’t tell you this but the bathroom has a TV in it. No instructions btw. Only found this out because I noticed a red light that was on in the bathroom and it seemed really sketchy. I asked the front desk and they said it’s a TV light and to use the remote in the bathroom to turn it on. I let them know that I had tried the remote but it didn’t work - could someone come and fix that. I don’t need the TV but if it’s broken, why not fix it for other guests. When we return at 1am to the hotel the TV is blasting in the bathroom, and I tried using the remote to turn off the TV and it doesn’t turn off. I called the front desk to get someone to turn off the TV so we can sleep. I call 15 min later and they said someone was coming up. “Oh hey, btw, did you use the remote. You have to be really close to the TV to turn it off.” When I say really close, you had to be about 3 inches from the TV for it to turn off. When have you ever had to be this close to a TV to turn it on/off. Again, it’s the lack of clear communication or even instructions on the remote that would have avoided this issue.
- Service upon check-out. They would not provide an invoice b/c I had booked through Amex. I have booked several hotels over the years via Amex (including competitor “luxury/5-star hotel brands”), and this is the first time I was made to feel like I had five heads when I requested a final invoice/bill. I wanted to make sure that the breakfast credits were applied correctly (the staff replied “Of course we do” in an almost defiant tone) and there were no surprises as it’s good practice in general to check the final bill because you do give them your credit card for any “incidental charges.” Ultimately I did not receive this final bill and am hoping I don’t get any random surprises. Also felt rushed out despite no one else in line.
- No room service after 11p despite them advertising themselves as having 24h room service
- No Netflix despite there being a Netflix button on the TV remote. “Our TV’s don’t support this.” And honestly this really summed up the whole experience at the Chatwal. And while this is no fault of theirs, ESPN was not working when we were there for the US Open due to the Spectrum/Disney issue. It’s a little frustrating when you’re there to watch the US Open in NYC and the TV in NYC does not play the US Open nor do your TV’s allow streaming or smart capabilities that could have allowed us to stream it on the big TV. Ended up watching the Open on my phone. 
- If you get a back-facing room like we did you will not get any natural sunlight. I’m not joking when I say I didn’t realize the sun was out (it was hot and sunny every day) when we opened the blinds every morning at 8:30/9. 
- While none of these is individually overly egregious per se, the sum didn't make for an enjoyable visit. When on vacation you're there to get away, not have more issues to deal with.

TLDR: Price not worth it. Amenities are dated. I will not be returning. Go to the EDITION or Langham or anywhere else really that knows what customer service is.

title: Excellent customer service; top-notch stay
text: A welcome gem where my every need was taken care of, after spending the day in the bustle of Manhattan.  Their customer service was supreme.  The food presentation and flavor was wonderful -- and a nice surprise.  Finally, I enjoyed relaxing in the lap pool.

title: Excellent Hotel right off of Times Square
text: We stayed twice at this excellent hotel in August and would recommend it to anyone wanting well run luxury and quiet accommodations close to the Theatre District and convenient to many fine restaurants and Broadway Theaters.

title: Very good hotel in a perfect location for tourists
text: Very convenient location near Times Square. Large room by New York standards. Comfortable beds. Amazing bathroom. Loved the Japanese-style toilets. Door to the hotel was a bit cumbersome and the doorman was not always there (or at least not observant). That's minor, though. The Lambs Club is also worth a visit.

title: part of the best
text:
if you like the best .this is the place . It starts with the best breakfast to the best Old Fashion at the bar.
Location is great close to many shows and fantastic restaurants . The concierge service is brilliant.

title: Not worth the price other than location.
text:
The hotel and service is average. The location is amazing if it meets your requirements for being 30 seconds from Times Square and the theatres. 

The rooms are quiet and you will get a good night’s sleep - unless your neighbour is watching tv; if that happens, you’re hearing what they’re watching.

I really, really wish I was writing a much more positive review. I spent months researching New York hotels for a special occasion, with multiple specific requirements, and was delighted to find The Chatwal.

I was looking for a bit of a unicorn - quiet rooms (not always possible in NY), a bath as well as shower, AND a terrace. Oh yeah, near to the theatres as well. With 24 hour room service, or at least room service for part of the time. I told you I was looking for a unicorn. 

From what I could see from reviews, Chatwal ticked all of these boxes, and I excitedly booked the £700-850 per night room with terrace and bath for three nights in mid-July 2023. 

The hotel has grand heritage and the story of the Lamb’s Club is lovely. I won’t go into it here but it’s definitely worth looking into.

Unfortunately, the hotel does not live up to it’s heritage in either physical presentation, or service, and if you are looking for an opulent, luxurious stay with immaculate service, you will not find it here, I’m afraid. 

I did not experience the “looked after from start to finish” or “pampering” at all, recounted by other reviewers and instead, witnessed several complaints from other guests during my stay. I wish I would have known half the stuff I am putting in my review beforehand, so I could discount it as an option rather than be disappointed.

I have no idea what you need to do for fresh flowers and monogrammed linens but clearly, our custom was not as valuable to the Chatwal as that of others. I don’t actually want those items, my point is that there is a huge discrepancy of how people are treated. 

The terrace pictures on the website aren’t exactly telling the whole story of what the terrace looks like, which is located surrounded by buildings (I do appreciate to be expected in NYC but there’s creative photography and then there’s misleading), with an overwhelming noise of various A/C/heating units. The terrace is absolutely not worth it, don’t pay the extra for it. There was a water feature which didn’t work. I asked at the front desk if there was a button we needed to press to turn it on and was told that in order to make it work, an engineer’s appointment would have to be booked. 

If you have a water feature on a terrace, you expect it to be working, not for the guest to have to raise, only to be told an engineer is required. If I’m booking a room with a water feature on the terrace, it’s a given I expect it to work as standard. That’s not unreasonable, that’s logical.

The bathroom was nice enough, however, the shower leaked onto the floor, no matter which way you stood in it. There is no way the staff aren’t aware of this because it’s a case of physics for how the bath slants downward toward the floor and the cleaning staff must be either mopping a flooded bathroom or removing sopping wet towels every day that the shower is used.

As another poster observed, the door staff were rarely present, and we didn’t see the famed Concierge once, although we did have a conversation with a very helpful person on the Concierge desk one evening and were disappointed not to see him again as we wanted to give him a tip. 

There is no room service between 9pm-6am, despite the literature in the room advising 24 hours. The literature was printed post-pandemic, so is reflective of what the hotel advertises on its website as well. The staff simply shrugged when this was brought up and reiterated the times it’s available.

The elevator is long overdue maintenance to bring it up to date and is the slowest we’d ever experienced. We took the stairs after the first encounter with the elevator.

When returning to our room one day, we experienced a member of staff shouting angrily after us as we climbed the stairs, instructing us to go back down, and advising us only guests can go up to the hotel. We said we were guests and the attitude changed, however, it would have been better to ask first and even if we weren’t guests, there was a better way to approach things. 

We went to the Lamb’s Club for breakfast one day and it was absolutely fine. Nothing spectacular but nothing at all wrong with it. High prices but not totally out of line with comparable locations.

The bar man in the hotel bar was excellent. He really made a huge difference to our stay and lifted it considerably. The dessert chef (apologies if this is the wrong title) who came round to offer bonbons whilst we were at the bar in our last night not only made absolutely heavenly bonbons (seriously, I’d pay to ship these to the UK), she shared a beautiful story that Chatwal is missing a trick on by not including her on their website (if she consented, of course) and making more prominent use of her talent for surprise and delight for guests. 

The hotel is not terrible. The location is excellent and you will get a good night sleep. It’s just way past its prime and heritage only gets you so far when service is also lacking. 

For context, we were in New York for 4 days, went to two Broadway shows, two Michelin starred restaurants, many pancake places, Ellis Island, tours all around town, Central Park, New Jersey etc and spent only sleeping and getting ready time in the hotel, including any visits back to change before going out. We did not spend all our time there and the review is from that perspective. I would return to Chatwal if they had an offer on because the location is excellent and we did get a good night’s sleep. I love the heritage and hope it restores to its former glory.

title: Pampered from start to finish.
text: Impeccable service all around. Dessert was the best! Ali was terrific and helped make a birthday celebration special. Alfonso, the concierge was extremely helpful. Art deco space was beautiful and loved the pictures in the restaurant.

title: An Unforgettable Weekend
text: I will be recommending this hotel to everyone I know. Our experience was truly unforgettable. The hotel staff are friendly and welcoming, the food and drinks are top notch and the rooms are simply perfect. We have zero complaints whatsoever and think that the Chatwal is the place to be in the city. We will be coming back every chance we get.

title: Chatwal + Broadway Show = Magic
text: Incredible stay for 24 hours in NYC with a Broadway show. Impeccable hotel and service in outstanding location near Broadway and beautiful Bryant Park. Treated my parents to a night here to make their visit as comfortable and convenient as possible and The Chatwal delivered, from the valet parking arrival through checkout.

title: Great location but not worth the price
text: As others have mentioned, the hotel is in a great location -- half a block from Times Square, and surprisingly quiet considering the location.  However, the room was dark and dated, with leather covering the door handles and bedside table, which wasn't very hygienic nor pleasant to look at in terms of the wear and tear.  Almost half the time we came into the hotel, there was no doorman, so we had to pull open the extremely heavy front door ourselves.  It didn't matter if there was no doorman during the days though since you can't catch cabs or get dropped off in front of the hotel during the day because the road is apparently closed during the day per the taxi drivers -- seemingly for construction. There were multiple occasions when there was also no one at the front desk or concierge desk -- I was shocked by the lack of service in the lobby.  However, the day housekeeper (Cindy) was great -- super friendly and the brightest spot of our stay.  We probably saw Cindy more than any other employee through the stay, if that's any indication.

title: Our favorite in NYC
text: The Chatwal is a real gem.  Smaller, intimate, Art Deco, impeccable staff, and dynamite location in the Theater District, but on a quiet side street.  It is expensive, but worth it in my opinion.  An oasis in the city.

title: Birthday Weekend
text:
Amazing! Hotel
Staff was attentive and kind. Took every effort to make our son’s birthday memorable! Balcony room in Times Square! Nothing beats being in the center of NYC energy but having the option to relax from above! We will be back!

title: Lindo hotel pero no vale lo q cuesta
text:
Teóricamente es un hotel de lujo, pero tiene pros y contras.
Pros: 
hotel muy lindo.
Habitación es cómodas y modernas.
Atención excelente.
Si te gusta estar en time Square, entonces es perfecta la ubicación.
Contras:
La limpieza no es de un hotel de lujo.
El wifi es muy malo en la habitación y nulo en el balcón.
Cuando te das una ducha se moja mucho el piso.
Si no te gusta el alboroto de time Square, no vayas a este hotel.
En síntesis:
Muy lindo hotel, el personal es muy atento pero creo que le faltan algunos detalles para considerarse hotel de lujo

title: Great Location
text: Very welcoming. Everything is very clean and very nice. Prefect location as you're not directly in the middle of the busy area, but only a block away from the fun. The beds were not very soft. That's the only possible complaint, unless you like firm mattresses.

title: Outstanding experience
text: The Chatwal is a true 5-star hotel — the attention to detail and gracious hospitality puts this hotel in the uppermost echelon of its class. In particular, both before and during our stay, the Concierge was excellent, as were all aspects of the experience.

title: Not a great hotel for the money
text: We stayed in this hotel for a week at the end of March 2023. For the price, it's pretty dumpy. We only chose this hotel because of the indoor pool and learned when we arrived that it was closed several days during the week. The drain in the tub wouldn't drain. They claimed to fix it but it didn't work our entire time there. The staff wasn't friendly in our experience at all. We flew in red eye, tried to get our room early, that's okay that they couldn't accommodate but they promised to clean our room and get us in earlier than check-in. They were actually able to get us in the room just 10 minutes prior to check in. And I was traveling with children. The best staff we found were the doormen. And the location and proximity to Times Square and Broadway cannot be beat. Definitely not a value for the money you spend. I don't mind spending money if the experience is exceptional. This was definitely NOT.

title: Urban Oasis with Understated Luxury
text:
The Chatwal is a true urban oasis - just steps away from Time Square yet  you can find completely serenity once you are inside. The soundproofing is excellent and the in-room AC/fans/fridge etc all worked beautifully with barely any detectable sound. I am a light sleeper and I must say that when you are in here you don't hear any thing - nothing from the street below, nothing from the guests in the other rooms, nothing from the elevator or the hallway outside. Even with the hotel fairly full, you feel  as if you are all alone, 
The rooms are spacious by NY standards, but the bathrooms are ENORMOUS. Everything is spotless and well maintained. The staff are attentive but not intrusive. We had breakfast both in the nicely appointed Lamb restaurant downstairs and as room service, the food tasted great. (Portions are huge!) Stayed here for three nights and lots of wonderful memories.

title: Perfect hotel in Times Square
text: If you go to NYC for Broadway the Chatwal is an oasis in the hustle-bustle of Times Square. The entire staff was beyond friendly and efficient. The rooms are lovely and peaceful-beautifully appointed. The Chatwal Hotel is so special!

title: Chatwal used to be nice
text: Thoroughly disappointed in all aspects of this property. It has declined completely. Rooms are small, dark and dated! Do not stay here, it is extraordinarily overpriced and living on its past reputation!

title: Perfect Stay
text:
A very well run Hotel with excellent staff and facilities.
Especially great if going to theater and restaurants.
Its extremely quiet inside and very comfortable.
A perfect place to relax and enjoy the City.

title: a fantastic 5* option for midtown
text: Fantastic food and incredible staff make this hotel special. Quality is clear everywhere from high pressure showers to electronic curtains to heated toto toilet seats. Extremely responsive, friendly, and professional staff and mgmt team make sure everything is above expectations. Small touches like fresh flowers and chocolates in the room are also great. My favorite hotel in the city.

title: Fabulous stay
text: Very cool historic hotel with all the amenities. The Breakfast was delicious and we went down each morning. The Location was the best part, so centrally located. We would definitely stay here again. Even though it was near time square the rooms were dead quiet!!!

title: Peor experiencia en mi vida
text: Si quieren arruinar su visita a New York . Esta es la mejor opción . Costoso , no reconocen la men tesis del Hyatt , no dan Kate check out , in trato despectivo , discriminatorio , costosos . Todos mis peores calificativos

title: Chatwal superior service
text: The minute you walk through the door, you leave the frenetic city behind you.  The Chatwal staff delivers superb service.  The room was impeccable.  Had no complaints whatsoever.  The location is steps from fine dining and top broadway theatres. Perfect!

title: Chatwal
text: A wonderful experience, again! We can always count on the Chatwal and their terrific staff, and excellent restaurant. The per night rate has increased significantly in the last year, so prepare to pay for all of the goodness.

title: Beautiful hotel in a theater District
text: From arrival to departure everyone we encountered was terrific. The service in the bar and restaurant is amazing with attention to every detail. A beautiful respite in the middle of the theater district. And the food is amazing!

title: Great MidTown Upscale Hotel
text: Chatwal is literally steps away from Times Square yet is an oasis when entering lobby. Quiet, excellent service, great accommodations. I mentioned to valet I would need my car by 6am. I was called by 5:50 and keys were brought to my room. Excellent service.

title: TOTALLY DISAPPOINTING
text: First, we had to search for our transportation car upon arrival.  Driver stayed in the car while we searched for him.  Second, hotel has plumbing issues. Water backs up in tub while taken shower.  If you leave the hot water running longer than 2 minutes, you start hearing a loud annoying noise.  Hotel and transportation not accommodating if you need to make changes.  Too many issues for the cost of stay!!!

title: Exceptional stay; midtown; next to subway, restaurants, shows and more
text: We stayed in the hotel for 4 nights in one of their suites.  Just about perfect.  The hotel is located within walking distance from subway, restaurants, broadway shows and more.  Although next to Times Square, the hotel is absolutely quiet and peaceful throughout.  The rooms are impeccably clean and appointed with the best of linens and bathroom products.  We received a nice bottle of wine, some snacks and a beautiful bouquet of flowers as a welcome gift.  awesome.

title: Best experience in New York
text: The location is excellent, right in the middle of time sqaure. Minutes to subway and train station.  I can express how much I love the staff and everyone of them.  I am going to come back here next time we are in new york.

title: Spoiled by so many attentive details
text:
I’ve visited NYC countless times and stayed at many luxury properties and whilst I was attracted to visit The Chatwal somehow I was put off by its Times Square location until this march when I spent six nights. I’m so glad I did…this is by far the best hotel experience I’ve ever had in Manhattan. The location feels miles away thanks to ultra quiet rooms and yet close to everything.

But it’s the endless details and the friendly staff that make the difference; check-in was flawless and I was recognized as a Hyatt Globalist. I was assigned a fantastic suite where complimentary premium water, a plate of fruit, fresh flowers and a delicious plate of charcuterie (which was my dinner) were left with a handwritten welcome note. 

The bedroom was huge and comfortable and to my disbelief my initials were monogramed in the pillow covers..what a magnificent detail; then the butler (Sonna) rang to offer her services as all guests at the hotel are assigned a butler. 

A big thank to Suyapa from housekeeping whom everyday left the room spotless and even put fresh orchids in the bathroom; One day I even found a backgammon game set which later I noticed were left to all the guests. 

In room service was also perfect and prompt; Cindy at the front desk always greeted me and Steven the doorman went to get the Sunday New York Times and left it in my door before 7.00am. The front desk team led by Adam Hermann is fantastic and followed up on all the details. 

Finally Congrats to Francisco the Head Concierge who assisted me with several things; he has over 20 years experience in the Times Square area thus a huge plus for guests looking for hard to get Broadway shows. 

The details in room are too many to list here: plenty of complimentary water, complimentary fast wifi, an Illy espresso machine with pods replaced daily, luxurious linen and towels, ultra luxury toiletries by Asprey in the bathroom etc. 

This is a boutique hotel and therefore they are able to focus on serving very well guests; whilst not cheap I found it to deliver much better value than most large luxury hotels. 

The phrase “your home away from home” has become a meaningless cliche but not at The Chatwal; These people truly know what they do and they care. I will most certainly return.

title: Beyond All Expectations
text:
This hotel is absolutely fabulous - it's hard to describe. Even though a block from Times Square, it is totally quiet - we slept deeper and longer than we have in years. 
The staff are constantly friendly - and there when you need them. The lobby and rooms are steeped in architectural history, very beautiful. There is nothing that wasn't perfection - and we having a family birthday with 12 of us there at various points. We could hang out in the lobby, in the bar, in the restaurant - and never once did we feel rushed or even lacking in somewhat private space - that is private space that was served exquisitely by every member of the staff. Special call out to Francisco and Alfonso - fabulous concierge's who helped arrange everything - starting month's ahead of time! This is such a gem! We will be back - frequently.

title: A perfect small, boutique treasure!!
text:
An exquisite Boutique hotel in the heart of the theatre district!!
The room was amazingly quiet even though it looked over 44th Street.
Comfortable bed, great bathroom, and a very friendly Butler Woman who brought up a Nespresso coffee machine for me.
Front desk ladies were very friendly and efficient. The bartenders at the comfortable lobby bar were all super friendly, with lots of wonderful stories about the hotel history.
A real theatre and business and family crowd at the restaurant.
I'll be back. It's really quite a find!!

title: Jewel of the Theatre District.
text:
The Chatwell New York City, is an Art Deco boutique hotel that is located just a stones throw from Broadways best theatres in Midtown Manhattan. It's central location 
positions it close to New York City's other big ticket attractions. 

My King Deluxe room was opulent with suede walls, faux leather cabinets designed to resemble classic steamship luggage. It featured all the modern luxury standards but one of the best was the butler service for my room and quality customer service for the hotel throughout. The marble bathrooms had a huge walk-in shower, oversized rainfall showerhead and a TV integrated in the mirrors.  I had a preview of the suites with landscaped terraces, some as large as the rooms, and so beautiful.....but really only useful in the warmer months.

The Lamb's Club at the Chatwell is a bar and grill offering American cuisine. It is spread over 2 floors and is dressed with plush red banquettes and is a neighborhood dining destination. At the advice of my server I enjoyed one of the Lamb's dry aged steaks with
pastrami-spiced fries.

An on site spa provides prestigious wellness treatments and includes a water lounge that encompasses a small lap pool and a 24 hour gym.

So, if you are looking for the best of both worlds: a hotel nestled in the heart of the hustle and bustle of NYC yet is just shielded enough from the nearby clamor to provide a peaceful spot to relax..........then try the ........ Chatwell.......Jewel of the Theatre District.

title: A New Standard for Luxury Stays
text:
As frequent travelers who have stayed in a number of hotels classified as luxury properties, my husband and I came to the Chatwal anticipating a certain level of accommodation and service. I can truly say that the Chatwal not only met our expectations but exceeded them. If there is any way that the Chatwal could improve, neither of us can imagine what that would be.

The hotel itself enjoys excellent location in the heart of midtown, extremely convenient to the theater district without being right in the middle of the Times Square brouhaha. 

The rooms are beautifully appointed, spacious, immaculate, with extremely comfortable beds, copious closet and other storage space, and a host of amenities. The bathroom boasts an awesome walk-in shower, extremely spacious, along with that luxury-you-didn't-know-you-wanted-until-you-had-it, a heated seat toilet/bidet combination.

Another lovely touch was discovering complimentary coffee and tea available in the lobby from super-early in the morning (A blessing for us early risers!) and not only that but complimentary hot cider offered later in the day. Delicious, especially in cold weather.

Now a word about hospitality: Excellent.
 In my opinion, a hotel team can be the make-or-break point of the guest experience. Every single employee at the Chatwal was a shining asset to the establishment. Attentive doormen who warmly greeted and saw us on our way whenever we arrived or departed the hotel. Helpful, efficient bell staff. Fantastic housekeepers who did a splendid job. Reception desk staff, always there to make sure we were well taken care of. Bartenders who were masters of the craft, as well as being sincerely friendly.

What more can I say? Well, maybe this: We have booked our next stay already!

title: Post Marriott, Still a Gem Worth Staying At
text: Less than a week before our arrival Hyatt took over this property. Having Marriott status, I normally would have changed, but glad that I did not. In a world where restaurants and hotels are often inconsistent/short staffed/tired/whatever, our stay was perfect.

title: Crooked billing after my stay
text:
I was charged an extra $100 after my stay. The hotel did not send a receipt until I called three times. Once I had the receipt, I had two charges in error. One charge was for breakfast ($35), but I used a voucher and the waiter said it was all covered and free. The second erroneous charge was for a $65 wine from the room mini bar. We did not consume anything from the bar. I called the hotel to dispute it. They could not provide any evidence that we consumed from the bar. They had lost the notes from the staff but they would not reverse the charges. This is a really annoying headache. 

The hotel was lovely while there, but it is crooked to charge me for things I did not use. I would not recommend it. Find a more reputable hotel with an honest billing department.

title: Luxury and location!
text: The Chatwal is tucked away on a side street off of Times Square, which makes it very convenient to all the theaters (no need to Uber!) while making you feel very safe and away from the chaotic night scene.  The staff wear masks, which I greatly appreciated.  The doormen and reception staff know your name when you arrive and make you feel like family during you stay.  The rooms are beautifully furnished, and the bathrooms are spacious and luxurious.

title: Fantastic Hotel in great quiet location
text: Fabulous on every level. Especially the doormen, they are so helpful. The rooms are well appointed and very quiet considering the area we were staying. Lovely welcoming lobby with nice bar facilities. Could fault our stay.

title: Excellent one night stay.
text:
I have had the opportunity to stay at several high end hotels in New York, but the Chatwal may be my favorite. The front desk staff is very attentive and friendly, they learned our names and recognized us. We went to the bar one evening and both the atmosphere and the staff were excellent. 

The hotel was well maintained and clean. Times Square is busy and noisy. Even though the hotel is just off Times Square you feel far enough off that it does not negatively affect your stay. 

We come to NYC every year and after our time at the Chatwal we knew we would want to stay here again next year.

title: Orange County in NY
text:
Excellent Hotel, location and Service. 
The attention to detail and service is fantastic.  Breakfast, we enjoyed every morning with delicious croissants and 
Eggs Benedict and Cappuccinos. 

The bed was really comfortable and roomy.  Walking distance to everything. 
Oh and they have a delicious bar with great drinks. We will be back next year.

title: Great stay for my family of 4
text: I’m a Marriott platinum member and I stay in a hotel almost 100 days a year. I’m also a former resident of New York and I thought this place was exceptional. One block off of Times Square but still quiet and elegant.  We came down as a family to enjoy the Macy’s day parade and we were able to guarantee connecting rooms just a month or so in advance.  Room, amenities, cleanliness, and service were all five stars.

title: Fantastic Service All Around
text: The Chatwal hotel continued to impress. It is right on the Theatre District and walking distance to the Bryant Park Christmas markets. This is our 2nd trip back. Excellent service all around from the doorperson/porter, housekeeping to the front desk. The staff were all so nice and friendly. Roxy at the front desk was amazing. It was great to be welcomed back to the hotel again. Roxy made every effort to help us celebrate my birthday and a huge thank you for making it so memorable.

title: A calm oasis with incredible service
text:
This is a terrific hotel nestled right in the hustle and bustle of the theatre district and Times Square. The Chatwal is a gem and offers an oasis from all the things that stress me out about New York!

We arrived just after 4pm and we’re told that the person occupying our room had a late check out and so it wasn’t ready. We were in town to help our son with a show and so we couldn’t wait any longer to enjoy the complimentary drink and snacks that were offered until the room could be cleaned by 530pm. The lady at the front desk (Roxy I think??) understood and offered us a complimentary dinner when we returned to the hotel at 10pm. We had a great dinner and wine compliments of the hotel and felt that they had more than compensated for not being able to meet the 4pm check in. 

Our room was pretty good but the best part was the spacious balcony that had room for a decent sized table and 4 chairs. I thought that was great and wished that we could have enjoyed our morning coffee  on it but alas we had to get to the airport. 

In summary, if this is the area you want to stay in when visiting New York, you cannot do better. I find this area very overwhelming and wouldn’t choose to stay here unless I was in town for a weekend of broadway shows, but it was a pretty special place amidst chaos.

title: Un hâve de paix au centre de Manhattan.
text:
Nous avons passé 5 jours merveilleux au Chatwal hôtel Manhattan.
Points positifs:
- La situation, très centrale, dans une rue calme , pourvue en restaurants et commerces variés.
- Petit hôtel accueillant 
- Chambre confortable, grands rangements, SDB luxueuse abondamment pourvue en amenities (y compris démaquillant).
- Service du soir, bouteilles d’eau et chocolats offerts.
-Personnel nombreux, aimable, compétent ( 3 employés à 6 h du matin pour s’occuper de notre départ)
- café, thé offerts dans le hall
-Petit- déjeuner raffiné .

Points négatifs:
- Pas de chauffage dans la SDB.
- Prix un peu élevé du petit- déjeuner continental.

Bilan très largement positif. Je recommande vivement cet hôtel. Je choisirai sans hésiter le Chatwal lorsque nous reviendrons à NY.

-

title: They don’t make hotels like this anymore!
text:
This place is incredible. The rooms are absolutely wonderful. It’s like a trip back in time when customer service and quality were priorities. The place is clean and well designed. The staff couldn’t be more helpful. The restaurant and lobby bar are great as well. The price tag is steep but worth it for the experience you are getting. 

It’s also a great option if you are coming in for a show due to the proximity to the theatres. 

Only downside is there seems to be some snobby clientele. While we were checking in I watched in horror as a nasty, self-important woman dressed down a member of the staff because her room wasn’t ready. To her credit, the staff member smiled through the abuse and continued to try and offer the woman options. Not many people would have put up with that. It just goes to show you how great these folks are and what a wonderful establishment they are running.

I would 110% stay again!

title: Fun Long Weekend Trip/Sightseeing Plus!
text:
Went with my brother to experience New York for fun. We are adventurous and older. Retired and Just going back to see the City again. Stayed at The Chatwal which is just a five minute walk from Times Square. It is a Boutique Hotel so smaller and nestled away so that you can't hear a peep from the City till you step outside the door. The Staff are truly wonderful. Every one of them...Doormen, housekeeping, wait staff and the Concierge staff (Hello Francisco). The Breakfasts were great as well as the rooms and especially the Bathroom, which is an Art Deco Dream. We felt truly looked after. I cannot say enough good things. The Chatwal is one of the great pleasures of a trip back to the City. Close to Everything...but quiet as can be inside. A sweet and delightful stay. Highly Recommend. 
Gina and Steve McCrann

title: Excellent small hotel with great service
text:
The Chatwal is an elegant boutique hotel with outstanding service, in a great location.  The customer care started with a message from the concierge before we arrived, and continued with their prompt steps to address a deficiency in the room. When we left, they went above and beyond to walk us and our luggage to 7th Avenue and hail a cab for us.

Although the hotel is just off Times Square, the immediate area is relatively calm and uncrowded. We stayed in a Grand Deluxe room facing the street, and were not bothered by any noise. It's a short walk to nearby subway stations, both the Times Square and the 42nd St/Bryant Park stops, which provides great access for getting around.  There's an excellent in-house restaurant and room service available, unlike many hotels that have not reopened their restaurants yet.  

We stayed in a Grand Deluxe room. It was quiet, comfortable and well-appointed, with plenty of closet and drawer space, good lighting and bedding.  They have added electrical outlets to each bedside table. However, the piece was missing from one table in our room.  I brought it to their attention and within hours it had been replaced.

The bathroom featured a dual vanity, Toto bidet toilet, and a spacious dual-head shower that does not leak water onto the floor, all good things. The one negative was the vanity unit, which features strange designer sinks that are a nightmare if you wear contact lenses (good luck if you drop one) or if you want to fill the sink with water (not possible, no stopper), and a bottom shelf comprised of useless wide-spaced rungs so you can't easily store anything there.  

We really enjoyed our stay at the Chatwal, it's one of the best of the NY hotels we've experienced.

title: Elegant, Relaxing, Well located , Excellent Service....The Chatwal
text:
We were pampered and helped royally for seven great days at the Chatwal Hotel recently.  The hotel is beautiful, serene and has impeccable service from everyone we contacted.  We ate  all breakfasts and several dinners  in the Lambs Club and got to know several of the helpful and excellent wait staff.  Our large room with terrace was totally comfortable with a bed that was so good we asked where we could buy that mattress.  Inside the Chatwal, everything is calm and quiet with attentive staff at every turn, who  remember your name. There is the excitement of the Theater District outside, but stepping inside this lovely hotel, all is calm, gracious and elegant.  We were impressed with the wonderful attention to any concerns we had and total response to requests for a different room at one point.  The front desk, concierge, and doormen helped us daily.  We  got excellent assistance with tour and show advice and help flagging down taxis.  We did a lot in seven memorial days and needed rest between excursions.  We felt very comfortable, relaxing for a few hours in our room.  Thanks to the entire  staff who made us feel welcome  and comfortable for a long stay at the Chatwal.  
From, Byron & Harriet Lee

title: Elegant; Nice; Not Amazing
text: The hotel is elegant and harkens back to bygone eras of luxury.  I was in an entry level room, which was spacious enough for what was advertised.  The room lacked natural light and had only a small window.  There was a functional desk and a chair, which made working easy enough.  The bathroom was excellent -- extremely spacious relative to the size of the room with a wonderful shower and many premium toiletries and amenities.  The carpets were a little old and worse for wear.  Many of the fixtures were tired in general.  Given the room rates, it was disappointing that the rooms lack many of the more standard products in other luxury hotels (such as espresso makers, etc.).  The staff were generally friendly and helpful enough when asked for help.  The hotel is nice and the level of service good, but neither is spectacular.

title: Horrible Manager.... otherwise okay and even maybe good
text:
The hotel location and rooms are good. It is overpriced but not totally unreasonable. The guys at the front door are phenomenal. The breakfast is extremely good but a little slow. 

The manager is a rude piece of work. We had a dispute about damage in the room and he treated us like criminals. Beyond disgusting behavior. This boiled down to our word vs his. He didn't even have the guts to discuss the final outcome before we left and chose to bill us after we checked out. We asked for a bill and were told no, just a sorry for the inconvenience and we will email the bill. If you stay there (and you should not) take the manager to the room at check in and inspect EVERYTHING. Video tape the room inspection.

If he is removed, then this is probably a GREAT place to stay.

title: Extremely polite and helpful staff!!
text: From the moment we arrived, we were waited on hand and foot! The doorman was very helpful with our bags, they were rather heavy and he didn't break a sweat! The front desk attendant was very polite, I asked if we could get a higher room, and she accommodated and handed each of us a little Chatwal water bottle as the bellhop loaded our bags and showed us to the elevator. Once we got to the room, he showed us the MANY features of the room! Wonderful chase lounge, huge windows that opened, towel warmer, TWO rain showers, a jacuzzi bathtub, and double vanity. After he left we started putting our clothes away in the four available closets and he came back to drop off the complimentary truffles, water (multiple types), and snacks. We went down to the concierge and he called us an uber and told us where we should go for a great evening! Same experience when we checked out, we had our bags stored for the day since we didn't fly out until the evening, they loaded them up and packed them into the car for us. Could not have had a better stay!! This hotel is truly unique with the decor, and the staff is amazing!!

title: Rude and dismissive front desk employees
text: I made the reservations with my credit card and called the hotel to inform them I would not be there and my wife would be check in. They noted her name and said it would not be a problem. On the day of check-in, the hotel would not let my wife check in because she wasn’t on the reservation. Front desk employees very rude and dismissive. There are much better hotels options for $1,200 a night. I’ll never book this hotel again.

title: Mediocrity in Midtown
text: Picked this place for an overnight stay on a weekend.  Room was blah - clean but not worth the 1200 after taxes and fees etc etc.  No spa and no pool at the time - supposed to open soon though.  Very close to craziness of Times Square.  Staff was helpful but not what you expect at a top tier hotel.  Booked thru Amex fine hotels - no upgrade even though I know nicer rooms were available.  In addition room key was reset at 11am even though they were informed I was utilizing 4pm late checkout requiring.  Felt passive aggressive.  Underwhelming.

title: Another wonderful stay
text:
We stayed at The Chatwal, New York this past week and it was, as usual, wonderful. The property is beautiful and luxurious. The entire Chatwal team are friendly, gracious, and professional, including the front desk team (Manpreet and Roxy) and the Welcome Ambassadors (including Ali and Peter). Everyone remembers us during our visit and between our visits, welcoming us “home”, which is a wonderful touch.

The accommodations are extremely comfortable and very well maintained. We enjoy dining at The Lambs Club at The Chatwal (breakfast, dinner) and cocktails with the professional bar staff at The Lambs Club.

We always look forward to our stays at The Chatwal.

title: Unforgettable Birthday Weekend
text:
The Chatwal is nestled in the heart of the Theater District and has an old world New York charm and sophistication.

We were celebrating my wife’s birthday and the staff at the Chatwal made it an amazing and memorable weekend. A huge Thank You to Vivanna and Sandra for going above and beyond. You exceeded our expectations and made this an unforgettable and memorable birthday. Concierge had also helped us secure dinner reservations at The Lamb’s Club in the hotel. Everything all came together and it was truly a wonderful experience overall.

Our Garden Suite was simply magical – a quiet, relaxing retreat full of greenery amidst this concrete jungle. Our butler and any service requests from shoe shine to additional bath amenities could be seamlessly accessed via the Chatwal configured iPads in the room. Service across the board from house-keeping, our butler and the check-in and check-out process was first class – personalized, respectful and efficient.

Gym – the gym was well equipped including a Peloton bike. It is a little small and any more than 2 people would feel cramped. Unfortunately the pool was not open at the time we were there – it would have been great to escape the sweltering NY temperatures. 

We hope to be back again, this time for my birthday celebration. Thank You again.

title: Worth It!
text: Imagine being on the fifth floor of a hotel facing West 44th Stree in the theater district and not hearing any street sounds.  That's the Chatwell.  A delightful find in every respect.  While not for the budget conscious, it is worth every penny.  The room was spacious, well appointed and spotless.  The bed and pillows particularly comfortable.  And the service was perfect; what one should expect from door man to check in to bellman to bartender to breakfast waiter. If you feel you need to choose a hotel in the theater district, you can't go wrong picking the Chatwell.

title: Great location, not First Class
text:
I was looking for a luxury hotel in NYC close to meetings I was in town for. The Chatwal is a very well located however it really misses the mark in terms of high end luxury hotels.
The rooms are tiny, even by NYC standards. I was in room w/ a cute outside terrace. However you could not pass between the bed and the desk chair as the space was so tight.
There are some nice touches such as a thorough amenity kit. However the lack of space, of room service, and the outdated furnishings and decor really were surprising to me at this price point. 
Next time I will choose differently. Definitely not as first class as they advertise and no where near worth the cost.

title: Great location very attentive staff
text:
