The hotel stays in a great location, near good stores , and in a walking distance of many others
Offers a good restaurant, with delicious food and very attentive staff
The bedroom was spacious (1004) and the bathroom was marvelous!!!!
 I don’t know if all the bedrooms are as spacious

title: Amazing Service at The Chatwal!
text:
The Chatwal is now our go to hotel when we visit  NYC. The staff are always friendly, gracious and will go out of their way to help. Mr. Manpreet Kochar made our most recent visit on July 4th weekend very special with an early check-in to a Junior suite. He is always very gracious during our visits.
The Lambs Club is a wonderful restaurant with outstanding food and service.
Highly recommend staying at this beautiful Art Deco gem.

title: First Class Hotel!
text: This was our first time in New York City and this hotel was perfect!  It was beautiful and the service was first class!!  The location was perfect for us to walk around and so close to Times Square!  Thank you Chatwal for a wonderful experience and we will most definitely be back again!

title: Very disappointing
text:
The Chatwal NYC is an iconic hotel in the City but left much to be desired. The property is dated. As other guests have noted, the carpet is not only worn but severely stained and leaves you with a sense of uncleanliness. The wall paneling is marked throughout showing age and damage. The bathrooms look recently remodeled and are the highlight of the rooms. 

The Chatwal NYC lacks the luster and polish you would expect of a hotel of its class.

title: Quiet excellence in every way
text: Small boutique hotel in a great super-quiet location just off of Times Square and all its craziness. Great luxury everywhere you look in the room. Huge closets, tons of hangers, soft-closing dressers, luxury bathroom and near-instant butler service. I was a little dismayed by the lack of an iron, but I saw that the complimentary butler service provide free pressing. So I called and she arrived within minutes and ironed my shirts and returned with them in a short amount of time. Hotel staff at the desk recognized us everytime we returned to the hotel. We didn't use the pool or eat onsite so can't comment about those items. We thought everything about the hotel was top notch.

title: Greta hotel!
text: We had a wonderful stay! Anggie checked us in AND out and was so friendly and helpful! Ryan in the bar was awesome!! He makes a great cocktail! The room was clean and comfortable! Great bedding! Great shower! Will definitely be back!! It’s a great respite from all the activity outside!

title: Beautiful Classy Downtown Broadway Hotel
text: The Chatwal is an 87 room boutique Hotel adjoined to the Lambs Club Restaurant and Bar. Doormen were plentiful and helpful.  My wife, sister and I had the Library Suite. We were given an early entry by the courteous and professional front desk personnel.  We were met with fresh flowers and wine in the room. The room easily accommodated all 3 of us, separated by a door that gave privacy to each party. 2 bathrooms beautifully done. One king bed and one Murphy bed.   The room was beautiful and the butler service from Sonam was extraordinary.  We had 2 great meals at the Lamb's Club (suggest the Risotto and best oysters on the half-shell ever) with the lovely and personable Ava as our waitress. And 2 Bars actually, very nice.  The best place we have ever stayed in NYC, and one of the top ten ever.

title: I can’t get anyone with whom to address an existing reservation
text: I have two separate nights booked for 5/17-18. These nights were booked separately because the original plan was to visit NYC and take in a show before flying to a cruise into St Petersburg the next day.   Those plans were cancelled. Since we had Broadway tickets already we decided to stay a second night. Long preface to the issue. I simply want to connect the two reservations before arriving to eliminate confusion. I have tried calling twice. Both times the phone rang for 14 and 15 times before a very hurried woman answered. I asked to be transferred to registration. Upon transfer I was welcomed to the luxury collection and provided a key prompt to speak with a live person.  Press one. I did. I was again asked to press one for a live person. I did. Nothing until the automatic disconnect. Never giving up  on the first try, I called again. Same woman who put me on hold. When she returned I explained the disconnect. She said something and transferred me again.  Same drill. Welcome to the luxury collection. To speak with a live person….  Tried twice again. And again, auto disconnect.  So, if you are hoping for a special stay at what is otherwise a architecturally significant beauty, better manage your expectations  for customer service.

title: Heated toilet seats!!!
text:
NOT NORMAL 
They are still forcing staff to mask. I don’t like that. It’s abuse. But overall good experience minus that ( let your staff breathe). Luxury abounds here. The gym was small but clean. I thought it would be real strict with Covid rules, but wasn’t bad. They had to unlock the gym to let me in because of rules. Rooms are nice. They are small, but that’s expected in NYC. THE TOILET SEATS ARE HEATED!!!  That’s pretty fantastic. Staff was very attentive and offered 5 star service.

title: Business Travel-meets all expectations and then some
text:
I can’t say enough good things about this place! For someone that’s quite particular in hotels, this seems to hit all the marks. First of all, staying in Manhattan can be tough on noise factor since it’s such a great city that rarely sleeps. Chatwal does a great job of drowning it all and is quite the peaceful escape. Don’t worry about the other reviews, you will not hear any noise whatsoever from the streets regardless of floor you’re on. 
The service is always wonderful and consistent, from the friendly bellmans, room service team, housekeeping and front desk team (Anggela and Isabella thank you) it makes this feel like my home away from home when in NYC. Rooms are updated, comfortable and linens top notch. All other amenities are wonderful if you have time. 
It’s the little touches that go far, including the little treats they leave for me ;) 

My only constructive feedback is that the rooms are rather small, I’ve had three different types of rooms and all are quite small even for Ny standards. Haven’t experienced their suites yet, never any upgrades available when I travel. And something minor , but since I’m usually there on business travels a small breakfast pop up would be great. Pastries, fruit, something quick and easy for us on the go. 

Thank you Chatwal for the great memories each time!

title: Staff went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable
text:
I booked the Sanctuary Suite with the intention to propose to my girlfriend on the terrace (a very rare suite amenity in NYC).

Tashi, Steven, and the entire front office and concierge team did an incredible job. They helped me with logistics for the big night and arranged for the suite to be decorated with rose petals and candles upon our return from dinner that evening. Everything went perfectly and I couldn't be more grateful to them.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: This was our first stay at the Chatwal and we are already planning a return trip soon. Every aspect of our stay was excellent. The staff, the space, the servers in the restaurant and bar were all top notch. The hotel itself is so well taken care of and the King Deluxe room was so comfortable we didn’t want to leave. The design of the closures and cabinets are perfect. The Lamb’s Club serves delicious food.

title: Quiet elegance 1 block from noisyTimes Square.
text:
I arrived here early for check in, however I was given access to the hotel and used the very clean small gym for a nice work out.
The texted me when room was ready and the bellman automatically had my luggage in my room when I arrived. That’s service.
This is a very manageable hotel as I’m used to the Marriott Marquis, but I wanted to try this as our play and restaurant were directly across the street from the hotel.
The bed was very comfortable and the room had enough outlets for your electronics.
The bathroom is luxurious and had everything you needed.
The staff can’t do enough for you.
After our play my friend needed a cab and walked out in the cold rain and got us one…from a block away!
I’ll definitely be back.

title: Classic New York City Luxury
text: The staff is unbelievable at The Chatwal and a big factor in rating the overall experience. Regardless of the time of day OR which staff member we encountered, we were embraced with a warm and enthusiastic greeting.  Many of the staff engaged us in conversation without being obtrusive.  This made our stay feel as though we were in a friendly neighborhood building vs a hotel near Times Square.  The room (608) was spacious, quiet even as it faced W 44th, well equipped (even though a coffee maker would be appreciated), huge bathroom with an older Toto bidet, and the king bed was so comfortable.  The carpet and wall paper is getting a little worn, yet we appreciated the modern furniture that was spotless and comfortable.  The location was fantastic for walking to all the places we were going, and near the beginning of the St. Patrick's Day parade. We appreciated the free coffee in the lobby that began at 6am as we are early birds!   We also ate breakfast and dinner at The Lamb's Club restaurant in the hotel.  The food offered a great variety and was so good, and again the service was impeccable.   We had a great stay with a late 1pm checkout.  The doorman asked for the information about our car service, and came to get us and our bags as soon as the car arrived.  Exceptional!  We also enjoyed the 3rd night free special making this stay very affordable.

title: Great stay at the very clean “The Chatwal”
text:
Great stay at The Chatwal!
Very pleasant stay at the Chatwal, which offers very nice rooms very close to Times Square.
Having travelled all over the world, at many luxury hotels, we were impressed by the general very high level cleanliness of the hotel.
Friendly staff and nice facilities. Definitely worth a visit!

title: A Gorgeous Hotel, But Not 5-Star
text:
As a loyal Marriott fan, choosing a hotel in NYC for my birthday trip was a bit of a challenge, as there are so many amazing hotels. I ended up choosing The Chatwal, due to the fact that I really enjoy The Luxury Collection brand. Overall, this was a very nice stay. Would I be back? Maybe.

The Chatwal is in a gorgeous Art Deco style. I love how the hotel is an intimate, boutique property. It was so easy to navigate and I really got to know the staff. By the second day, one of the doormen said, "Welcome back! It's good to see you again." The staff were all absolutely lovely. Oddly, we had a welcome card in our room from the butler, but whenever we contacted him, we were told he wasn't on duty. It was very strange and pointless to offer that service. However, the staff were all very quick to take care of any needs we had. 

The room was stunningly appointed, with elegant furnishings and rich colors. The bed was comfortable, but had very bad staining on the side. There was nothing in the minibar and turndown service was not offered. It wasn't a huge deal, but not offering these things knocks the hotel down from being a true luxury property. We absolutely loved the huge bathroom, with the walk in shower. It felt so luxurious with the Asprey toiletries and warm brown tones in the bathroom. If you are a light sleeper, note that sound between rooms is very apparent. There is also quite a bit of street noise. 

Currently (as of February 2022), room service is offered until 10pm and the restaurant is open to hotel guests. I never ate in the restaurant, but it looked lovely. There is a very small fitness center that's open 24 hours. You do need proof of vaccination to use it. It's a nice gym with all of the basics, but isn't suitable for anyone needing a lot of equipment for an extensive routine. Also, the spa and pool are currently closed.

I would possibly return to the Chatwal, but I would like to try other luxury properties in the city first. Maybe this hotel can be 5-star again when it reinstates some lost services.

title: Great location - Art Deco styled
text:
This is a nice hotel that is located very close to Tines Square and just off 6th. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the area. The hotel has a nice restaurant and does a great breakfast. 

The gym is very very small. The bedroom (suite) was decent size and well appointed. 

Recommended.

title: Stay away!!!
text:
The Chatwal is the only hotel in the luxury collection that I highly discourage.
The rooms are extremely gloomy, dark and with very small windows. Nevertheless, you sleep well and the bathrooms are large and comfortable.
The hotel facility is of a good standard, as is the restaurant and bar. The breakfast at The Lamb Club is also excellent, both the service and the dishes.
Unfortunately, the positives end there. I had booked a rate with breakfast included (and I'm also Bonvoy Platinum so I get free breakfast) but I received vouchers for the continental breakfast (which includes only coffee, a juice, some fruit or cereal and two croissants). If you want the American breakfast (with eggs and bacon) or a second orange juice you have to pay extra... Also, at check out I found out that you have to pay for water (brought by default to the waiter and costing $10 + tax per day - more than a quarter of the value of the breakfast that cost $36 on the menu). Honestly I find this policy really outrageous, a real scam. I would like to tell you about the other amenities such as pool, spa, gym, evening turndown service and house car but I could not use them because they were not available. Not even the room service is H24 (closes at 10am), the minibar is empty and there is no coffee machine in the room. At checkout I pointed out that paying $10 for water in a breakfast that should be included is outrageous and received a rude response from the manager who denied that my rate included breakfast and said that he was just doing me a favor to include it. After I showed him the confirmation email, he cancelled the bill with an annoyed look and didn't even bother to apologize for the bad impression. I have toured several hotels in the USA and around the world and this is the one that left me with the worst memory. Asking the full price and cheating guests at breakfast, not including the evening turndown service and not giving any compensation (not even a drink) for all the unavailable services disqualifies the whole hotel and the manager, who - in my opinion - should be ashamed and change his job. Even the latest reviews on the web confirm my bad experience and lead me to advise anyone against staying here. The Chatwal may have been a grand hotel, now it is more like a 3 star hotel both in terms of services and how you are treated. I find it unworthy that it is included in the Luxury Collection (there is nothing Luxury about it). Stay away!

title: Wow!  A New York gem.
text:
We had amazing stay at the Chatwal.  Everything was incredible, but it’s really the service that puts it over the top.  Everyone from the doorman to the front desk to housekeeping (especially housekeeping!) were friendly and helpful and went beyond the call of duty to provide service to our family.  The service was far better than my recent stay at the Ritz Central Park.  
We stayed in the Hollywood Suite and it is perfect for a family.  It has a king bedroom connected to a second room with a Murphy bed, where our kids slept.  There were two full bathrooms.  The suite was huge for NY standards.  The decor was very unique and definitely part of the appeal of this boutique hotel.
The hotel is a block away from Times Square, but it is very quiet.  I’m not sure if the hotel had special soundproof windows, but you couldn’t hear any street noise.  The hotel is located close to the Broadway theatres, which was very convenient.
I cannot wait to return.  Apparently there is a small pool at the hotel, but it is currently closed due to COVID.  I’ll have to check it out on my next visit.

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: Hotel is 1/2 block to Broadway so a lot of street activity. We had a suite on the 7th floor with a large outdoor veranda. We heard absolutely no street noise or noise of any kind at night. The bath had a heated toilet seat and electric bidet. Great for the cool weather. And in spite of the cold we enjoyed the veranda. Front desk were extremely helpful organizing our travel to and from the airport. We had dinner one night at the restaurant which was okay but that’s about it. May be Covid related as it was a limited menu open only to hotel patrons so I didn’t rate the hotel down for that. Would stay here again.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: We spent 5 nights at the Chatwal enjoying all of New York.  The hotel is lovely and the staff is very accommodating.  All covid policies were followed by both the staff and the guests. The rooms are lovely and so clean.  We enjoyed breakfast there every morning and it was delicious. The hotel is in a perfect spot to enjoy Broadway and all that glitters.  Thank you Chatwal for such and enjoyable trip.

title: Great hotel, location , staff, food
text:
Executive suite
Could not have been better .
Great location. Some theaters on or across the street.
Restaurant fantastic!!! Upstairs bar: wonderful. Met friends before show.
Art Deco fun! Love the hotel. Love the location. Love the staff.
Yet: very intimate and private. Agree, an oasis.

title: Great location
text: Clean rooms.  Using best quality towels, sheets from FRETTE and bathroom amenities from Aspre.  Rooms are little small but this is the NYC standard.   Loby and entrance not so impressive like other bigger hotels.  Overall, I felt the room was very comfprtable and toilet had very good and up to date fittings.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: If you are looking for an intimate feel instead of a larger hotel we would highly recommend booking your NYC stay here. You will not be disappointed. The bedding and bathroom top notch. Dinner at the Lambs Club outstanding. Thanks to Natalie, Sakura and the entire staff for making our stay a special one. We truly appreciate it! Looking forward to our next stay.

title: Forthcoming staff
text:
Excellent staff - will serve impeccable breakfast, open the swimming pool outside regular hours and offer rides in the hotel car. 
The chemistry of service refrains the attention to detail of the interior design. Red is for blood and vitality and it’s easy to fall in love with the color in the heart of this busy city.
The gym and pool are tiny, but nothing beats taking your breakfast by the fireplace.

title: Back again
text: Our 4th stay here. More expensive that the neighbors but well worth it. Good sized rooms, comfy beds, great amenities. Super quiet despite being a few feet from Time Square. Restaurant here has a great breakfast and an Iron Chef. Service can be more than a bit slow but great food.

title: Amazing Service
text: This was my first time staying at The Chatwal. The property has a great location and gorgeous Art Deco design, but what really sets it apart is the team. They are warm, capable, and engaging. A special mention to Concierge, Kyle Royce. As I was about to take off I realized I had left a very special piece of jewelry on the vanity in my “safe spot” so I would never leave it anywhere. I placed a panicked call to the hotel. By the time I landed the front desk, Natalia, and Kyle had secured my item and quickly facilitated a FedEx. They were so courteous and easy to communicate with. I appreciate their warmth and attention to detail. Can’t wait to return!

title: At home, away from home
text:
Nestled close to the hustle and bustle of one of NY most busiest areas, this property is a hidden gem and I am not talking only about the hotel - very stylish with some truly cozy details - but its people, definitely the sixth stars to the five this midtown hotel definitely deserves.

From the very first moment I did not only felt welcome but truly taken in good care. Every staff member recognized me by name (a rarity nowadays, especially in busy destinations).

A very special praise for giving me on each of the five nights spent there the sense of being surrounded by a comforting home feeling, goes to the Front Office - especially the night manager - the Bellboy staff and the concierge. 

In a nutshell, happy of having found a true home away from home! Congratulations to the entire staff and thank you, agai.

title: Fantastic Stay
text: Everything about this hotel was perfect.  Luxurious accommodations, amazing and friendly staff, amazing food.  The room was spacious and the bathroom was huge.  My kids loved the pool.  This is a vacation we will remember forever!

title: Great service, but not my favorite hotel
text:
I stayed 5 nights here for a business trip.
Pros: excellent service, spotless rooms, restaurant food pretty good.
Cons: location (very close to times square), no upgrade as Titanium, tiny gym, 
not good for business hotel.

title: Lovely staff and property for our overnight stay
text: We spent an overnight at The Chatwal for my husband’s birthday.  Ideally located in the heart of midtown for sightseeing and theater-going.  Staff is lovely—courteous, friendly and helpful.  Art Deco design throughout the hotel is on point, and the room was very well-appointed.  We had the deluxe king with terrace and it was very spacious.  Enjoyed our breakfast at The Lamb’s Club as well.  Will definitely recommend to others, and would stay here again without question.

title: 매우 추천!
text: 저번에 이곳에서 너무 좋았기 때문에 이번에도 이곳에서 묵었는 데 묵길 잘한 듯. 너무 좋았습니다. 위치적으로는 말할 것도 없이 좋고 서비스는 끝내주게 좋습니다. 진짜 친절함의 끝! 먼지 알러지가 있어서 약간 청소상태가 별로면 간지럽고 그런데 이곳에서는 먼지 하나도 없었고 너무 좋았습니다. 룸 컨디션, 위치, 서비스 전체적으로 매우 만족스러웠던 곳!

title: perche questo hotel non è ancora stato buttatto fuori dalla  Luxury Collection ?
text:
che dire questo hotel è stato una vera delusione. per i prezzo pagato e perchè  
 è l'unico hotel DI NY all'interno della  Luxury Collection le nostre aspettative erano alte.invece la nostra camera era sporca.. vi  sedereste su delle poltrone tutte macchiate chissa da che cosa :( le sedie davanti al Consierge a pian terreno sono sfandate, i camerierI servono con le giacche bianche tutte sporche e macchiate sia a colazione che a cena. che effetto vi farebbe essere serviti da un cameriete con una giacca bianca tutta tapezzata.!!!!!  ma questo sarebbe uno degli alberghi più belli di NY? una vergogna , una truffa  come direbbero a Roma una sola.. o meglio un solone.
a NY ci sono tanti alberghi carini EVITATE QUESTO HOTEL

title: Nicest Hotel in the Theater District
text: I spent three nights here in January and was absolutely wowed by the property, which is the nicest I've stayed in in New York.  It's a small hotel, just half a block off of Times Square (yet somehow peaceful and serene), with amazing service. They give you an ipad on which to make requests- each time I did so the request was answered immediately. When we ordered room service for breakfast it arrived in 15 minutes. The only other place I've had that happen is at Four Seasons properties. The gym is very small- three people in there was a crowd, but the adjoining spa is fabulous. The room was spacious and quiet. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom over the top. I can't recommend this property enough.

title: Nothing but a smug smile
text: These guys canceled on me the last minute. Had a spa appointment, walked through the freezing winter cold, then they called me saying that they forgot to book someone else. Absolute joke. Manpreet Kochar couldn’t help me with anything. Just said to reschedule.

title: Wonderful Family Weekend!!!
text: Our family thoroughly enjoyed our weekend stay at the Chatwal .... the employees were friendly and courteous ... our rooms were clean and comfortable ... the bar and restaurants were first class ... the location is convenient to the theater district ... would recommend for all.

title: Lujo en time square
text:
Excelente hotel.
Muy lujoso y cómodo.
Todo es impecable.
La atención, la habitación, la limpieza, etc... todo de primer nivel.
Mención especial para Joan, Christine, y el conserje.
Vale la pena cada billete q se gasta en la estadía.
Muy bien atendidos.
Volveremos sin dudarlo

title: A Special Stay
text:
My wife and I took her parents to New York for two nights, and while we are used to staying in mid-range hotels, this was a special treat that lived up to the billing and was worth the price.  The staff were incredible on all fronts.  From the moment we checked in, through drinks and dining, to the butler service (yes some rooms have butler service,) we felt an even, but non-intrusive helping hand. When we arrived, our rooms were not yet ready, but the door men, and front desk hopped into action, taking our bags, offering lunch ideas, and even water and umbrellas for our exploration.  

 Even though the property is only a block from Broadway, which we avoid like the plague, the location as surprisingly quiet and allowed easy access to the hub-bub but also to quitter locales to the east like Bryant Park, etc.  The lobby was beautiful and comfy with amazing people watching especially right before the theatre and had coffee available until late morning.  There was also a lobby bar with friendly staff and incredible drinks (Bloody Mary ice cubes anyone?!) There’s also some dining options, including a second floor restaurant with live jazz in the evenings and another bar.   I don’t normally suggest hotel food in New York, but this was one offered one of the best meals I’ve had in a long time.  Order the cod with stuffed calamari and relax with an excellent cocktail while listening to the jazz.  Honestly, it’s dumb to say in NYC, but you don’t have to leave the hotel to have a great visit and that’s what makes this spot so fulfilling.  That said, the location was perfect for exploring, either on foot or by metro, especially given it’s relative quiet and calm so close to Times Square.  

Now for the room itself, I should mention we were upgraded one level from a standard to a junior suite, but even in NYC that label can lead to a room where you can barely walk around the bed.  That was definitively not the case here, the room was practically palatial and extremely comfortable to-boot.  The bed itself offered an excellent sleep with tons of pillows, a nightly turn-down service, and excellent black-out curtains that combined with the double-paned windows to provide for excellent relaxation.  I didn’t work from the room, but the couch and desk were both large and near lots of plugs.  The bathroom was gigantic with rainfall showers, heated toilet seats, double sinks and bidets.  However, when you go to pay the rate, you may say “for this, I expect over-the-top amenities.  Well, those were there too.  The rooms came with an iPad from where you could control lighting, set wake-up calls, play music, and even order up a shoe-shine, laundry, and shirt pressing while sipping your in-room Nespresso.

Again, generally I use my NYC room as a launching point to other things, and no more than a place to put your feet up and lay your head.  The Chatwal goes so much further in every area, form service to food to relaxation and a feeling of quiet home.  If you have the means, this is a special spot.

title: BEWARE
text:
While all of the people who worked there were kind and accommodating, the hotel is a disaster. Here's a sampling
1. I saw three different repairmen. Day one, the toilet wouldn't flush. Day two I had to take a COLD SHOWER because the hot water nozzle was broken. Day three I had to shower standing in dirty water because the tub stopper was stuck closed.
2. The automatic shades wouldn't open and you couldn't really do it manually. The room was so dark that you couldn't see what was in your suitcase. 
The good news is that the very nice people who work there gave me a discount because of all the problems. 
3. To the extent I could see, the walls were scuffed and the carpet had stains. 
4. The elevator buttons worked only sporadically. Usually you had to press five times, wait, and then press a bunch more. 
5. One day the coffee in the lobby was so weak it was like colored water. The next day it was cold..
6. On the first day, my daughter's room was not ready until after 6 p.m!!!

title: Never wanted to leave
text: We stay in a lot of hotels and this gem was warm, quiet welcoming with a comfortable bed and swanky decor which really made me feel like a 1920’s Hollywood starlet.  Great job staff for smoothing over glitches.  Housekeeping staff was tardy both days and messed up our schedule sadly, but otherwise perfect.  Bar has amazing fresh cocktails and live jazz twice a week

title: best place to stay in NYC
text: i spent two nights at  the chatwal, and it was my best stay ever in the city. from the moment you stepped into the property. breakfast was amazing at the restaurant, they had the best omelet.  staffs there were top notch, and service we received there  were first class service. the hotel is in the prime location and only a block away from time square. the size of the room is spacious, and has world class amenities. AC/lighting/curtains can all be control by the Ipad inside the room.  The Chatwal is definitely on my to go place when i am in new york city  next time.  thank you for giving us a unforgettable stay.

title: Superb
text: Always a great place to stay or visit. Bar is fantastic, restaurant is exceptional for breakfast. Rooms are wonderful and the location can’t be beat.   Wonderful place to stay if you are seeing any broadway productions.

title: Wonderful 4 days at The Chatwal
text: My wife and stayed at The Chatwal December 3rd-7th and stayed in room 410. The check-in went very smoothly. Our room was quite large by NYC standards. The bed was very comfortable, and provided a good night's sleep. I was surprised at how quiet the neighborhood was, being in NYC. Our room overlooked west 44th street, but there was very little street noise. The bathroom was fantastic, as it has 2 sinks, a huge shower, and heated toilet seats. The mirror even had a TV built into the glass. We ate breakfast there every morning, as it is our largest meal of the day. The offerings were very nice, and varied. The food was prepared perfectly.  The Captain (in white coat with close-cropped beard) was very professional, friendly and helpful. The wait staff were also very professional and helpful. Eduardo, on the bell staff, was most helpful. He assisted us in getting rides to the Met and Natural History Museum. Eduardo was always friendly and greeted us every morning. The housekeeping staff always did a great job in keeping our room neat, clean and tidy. We had drinks and food a couple of nights at the Lambs Club which was very nice. It was nicely atmospheric. One piece of advice-get restaurant reservations if you plan to eat in neighborhood restaurants. You will be in the theatre district with folks wanting to eat before the show, and on Wednesdays, after the matinee. We will stay here on our next trip to NYC.

title: Magical Christmas at The Chatwal
text: I often stay at the Chatwal for business trips, and it’s been nothing short of delightful, comforting and decadent. Last week, however, I brought my children with me for a mixture of work and play. From the moment I made my reservations, The Chatwal concierge service reached out to help me plan my stay. They (Kristina Haug, in particular) went above & beyond to make this the most magical, memorable and special stay I and my children have ever experienced! They were attentive to the smallest of details with their own personal, loving touches. To boot, they arranged for the most spectacular experiences my children could ever dream of. I would be remiss if I didn’t mention the Producer Suite (also adorned with personal touches specifically for us) that was out of this world. They created magic beyond my wildest expectations, and we all have memories that will last a lifetime. I will forever be grateful to Kristina and the entire Chatwal family for their kindness, efforts and true class.

title: Nice older hotel with a fun unique feel
text: Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted.  It was our Anniversary and we were excited.  We had chosen this Marriott as we have stayed in so many of the others, The Edition being one of our favorites but we thought we'd try something new.  What name is the reservation under we were asked? After telling him the name and our lobby attendant looking for a moment and looked up to reply that he couldn't find us.  He then looked me in the eye and asked if we were sure we were in the right place.  I got a bit worried and scrambled and found our reservation and asked if he needed the confirmation number. He then glanced up and said "you didn't tell me you had done a mobile check in." I guess it was my fault but you took our moment of being excited to feeling extremely awkward and never apologized.  Reminded me of a Courtyard I stayed in Detroit last month to be honest.  After witnessing a busboy either start to OD or have a seizure the next night at the bar with nobody caring to monitor him to realizing that most that stayed there were over the age of 70, we headed into Soho where we belonged.  It was a truly beautiful hotel, small rooms, big Vegas bathrooms were fun and location...there is nothing better.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Loved the design of this hotel.   Little bit old and new giving you an unique experience.  Found all the employees personable and accommodating. The bedding was very comfortable and soft.  I would say this a hidden gem of a hotel.

title: WOW!
text: I visited The Chatwal & it’s restaurant this evening for a private business event and I’d like to commend everyone at the establishment. I entered in from the hotel entrance and looked around, bewildered and was greeted by a lobby of smiling faces. There was one person in particular that really stood out to me was, Sharice at the front desk and was just the sweetest. She directed me to where the event was, offered to have my coat checked and even inquired if I was a guest to have my bags brought up to my room. She was just very available. I’ll say that I took her business card and will absolutely recommend the hotel to my friends and family. Maybe even a staycation for myself. I can see a lot of care has gone into the selection of the team there and can’t wait to be a guest.

title: Birthday Trip
text: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel in October to celebrate her birthday. I booked this through Platinum American express. One of the advantages  was an early check in. We arrived around noon and were not allowed to check in until after 4:00! I was not happy. Then they put us in a room so small (although it was a suite) we had no room to move. After several conversations we were moved to a more spacious suite. Thanks to Manpreet Kochar. The other person at the desk was Michael who was anything but helpful! The location of this hotel is great! The food was great! I think they need the front desk personnel to be more customer service oriented.

title: AMAZING hotel
text: I stayed her for Thanksgiving, and besides being the perfect spot, the staff was incredible.  Anyone who stays at hotels a lot knows the staff can make or break a hotel.  They are friendly and welcoming.  the rooms are really nice, and well decorated.  The rooms with balconies are really special.  I was sitting outside at a fire pit, enjoying the night - right in downtown Manhattan. This has become one of my favorite hotels of all time

title: Great visit
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my 3 nite stay starting with assistance from the valet to greeting at the front desk. The suite 806 was spacious and the details very luxurious. I found all of the associates helpful including the doorman who saw me enter with my hands full and followed me to the elevator to enter my floor for me.

title: Review of Mynd Spa of Chatwal
text:
*This review is exclusively for the Mynd spa on the basement level of the Chatwal hotel. It’s not for the hotel experience. 

I visited the Mynd spa on Dec 1 and made the reservation the night before. The website for booking the reservation is very easy to use. Very glad that there was availability given the short notice. 

I had a mini facial and a regular body massage. I had my own private room for shower and change the whole time. Kim, who was my facial therapist, was communicative and attentive. She examined my skin type and made recommendations accordingly. Her service was professional and comfortable. I would recommend anyone to her service. 

Overall the experience was nice but not overwhelmingly remarkable. I have visited many hotel spa locations in New York City and elsewhere and the Mynd spa gave me what I needed but I wouldn’t say it’s excitingly exceeded my expectations, for the space is relatively small (meaning you can hear chatting noises from the common area during your treatment).

title: Great Stay at The Chatwal
text: My wife and I come in usually once a year to NYC and this time stayed at The Chatwal,  a boutique luxury hotel affiliated with Marriott Bonvoy. Fantastic location - 2 to 3 minutes walking to both our Broadway plays . Their hotel  car took us to Per Se for dinner which was also close by. The room was very comfortable, cozy and well appointed with nice storage, amenities and washroom. Service was excellent. The restaurant attached to the hotel was The Lambs Club which was excellent- great food and   service. Usually we don’t eat at out hotel except breakfast but we had two lunches and one dinner there. The gym was small but well appointed with a Peleton bike. They also have a small dipping pool and hot tub. Our maid service was amazing. The bell desk was excellent. They even comped me cuff links and a tie  pin as I needed one for dinner, due to some confusion. Highly recommend this hotel and we will return. Thank you!

title: Need to up their game on the service side
text: Overall the hotel is elegant and the rooms are lovely. They clearly want to be considered a luxury hotel but they cant seem to pull it off on the service side. While the staff is nice I feel like they underestimate their customer's intelligence. I was there twice in the last month and both times the room was not ready at 4. You need to climb stairs to get into the hotel and the first time I checked in no one was at the door. I thought I was paying $18 for yogurt delivered to the room, it was $30. They cleaned my room late in the day. They are close to be a very fine property but need to get the little things right or its just not a good value.

title: Disappointing
text: Booked the hotel for a night for my 30th anniversary with my wife. Heard great things about the hotel from this site, as well as 2 travel mags that I read and respect. At check in, no one took my heavy bag to the room. Asked for ice and had to call again to get it. Had no idea there was a butler there to explain everything in the room. Not what I expect for $800/night. On the plus side, the room and lobby were lovely

title: Just a great hotel with friendly staff
text: This hotel is really nice. Nice rooms, nice food, nice staff. Carol, the concierge, is kind and very service oriented. I really enjoyed my stay. The location is great too with Bryant Park on one side and Times Square on the other side.

title: Fantastic Stay
text:
Hotel is obviously in a great location. The room - while not very big - was comfortable and practical. I had access to a patio which was nice since I visited in June. The bathroom was a little dated with way too many mirrors, but the built-in TV in the bathroom was pretty neat - probably convenient if you take a bath. I did get a room upgrade, so I'm pretty sure the rooms in that hotel aren't the biggest since it's a old building.

The staff at the hotel was extremely friendly, they even ironed my dress shirt for free. 

Breakfast was very crowded but good. I did not take a look at the gym since I had a bad cold and wasn’t feeling great. I had a great experience overall and would definitely stay there again.

Additional Info: I needed to stay one night in NYC for a business trip but wasn’t able to find any decent hotels at a reasonable rate and decided to utilize the Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts site to book a night there. Those hotels are usually in a higher category and more expensive, but I figured I’d rather spend $100 more for a good hotel than spend $250 for a mediocre one. I was lucky to get a free room upgrade and a few other perks.

title: Great find
text: This hotel is a hidden gem in plain sight! We stayed Labor Day weekend and had a terrific visit. The hotel is really well located - just around the corner from Bryant Park - but the service takes it over the top. Super friendly and very helpful.  We would certainly return again!

title: My new Favorite New York Hotel
text: The Chatwal is a hidden gem - only half a block from Time Square but completely quiet . Spacious rooms, exceptional staff with personalized service, great restaurant and bar - simply the best in New York.  Far better than hotels that are twice the price.  The spa is excellent and the gym is small but well-equipped.  Every staff member, from the people at the door to the people who help with luggage to the front desk - all completely professional and friendly. The Chatwal will defy every stereotype you have of grumpy New York service - these people are great!!!

title: Superb again
text: We stay at the Chatwal if we spend time together in New York. And it is always special, very special. The staff is super friendly and very service minded. From the guys at the door, the people behind reception, the cleaning ladies, room service, in the restaurant. Truly, every time, a superb experience. Thanks again. We will be back!

title: Perfect luxury experience
text: The location is very central. An easy 5 min walk to Time Square. Amazing shopping and restaurants all around. But the best part was the service at this hotel! The Lamb’s Club offer the most wonderful breakfast. Our room was very European and had a cool tub, (not so fond of the bathroom sink). Roxy at the reception is an absolute delight! Indeed a short vacation, Thank you for the memories Chatwal!

title: What a hotel!
text: I stayed at the Chatwal with my sister to attend the US Open for my 50th Birthday. What a hotel! The staff were friendly and helpful. They reworked our reservation to provide connecting rooms creating a suite. While we checked in we were served complimentary champagne to mark the occasion. Our accommodations were beyond my expectations. Beautiful decor, amenities and views. I highly recommend the Chatwal. It’s in an ideal location near Times Square. However it’s a surprisingly quiet and relaxing spot. Our room service for breakfast was delicious. Great dining in walking distance, too.

title: Schlecht, schlechter, Chatwal
text:
Das Hotel ist leider eine einzige Enttäuschung! Wir sind mit großen Erwartungen angereist, da wir bisher ausnahmslos gute Erfahrungen mit Hotels der Luxury Collection gemacht haben (z.B Schlosshotel Fuschl am See, Nakha Island Phuket, Laguna Beach Bali, etc). Diese Erwartungen wurden leider im Chatwal auf ganzer Linie enttäuscht.
Fangen wir mit den wenigen positiven Aspekten an, die leider sehr schnell aufgezählt sind: Die Lage des Hotels direkt am Timesquare ist sehr gut, so dass man viele Sehenswürdigkeiten in NYC zu Fuß erreichen kann. Zudem ist das Concierge-Team sehr bemüht und hat uns bei allen Restaurant-Reservierungen sehr gut unterstützt. Das war es aber auch schon an positiven Dingen, die man im Chatwal erleben darf.
Insgesamt war der Aufenthalt leider sehr enttäuschend. Anlässlich meines 40. Geburtstags haben wir uns für ingesamt 7 Nächte im Chatwal eingebucht, was im Vergleich zu anderen Gästen eine überproportional lange Dauer darstellte. Trotz des besonderen Anlasses, über den meine Frau das Hotel mehrmals informiert hatte, gab uns das Chatwal ein „Zimmer“ das maximal als bessere Besenkammer durchgeht. Weniger als 20 qm groß, mit einem einzigen kleinen Fenster zum Innenhof, so dass das Zimmer über faktisch kein Tageslicht verfügte und mehr an eine Gefängniszelle erinnerte. Die Klimatisierung im Zimmer war nur von eiskalt bis tropisch -warm steuerbar. Und dies alles für knapp EUR 600,00 die Nacht. Der Gipfel war dann bei der Ankunft im Zimmer, dass sich nach erstmaliger Benutzung und anschließenden Verlassens des Badezimmers die Badezimmertür von außen nicht mehr öffnen ließ. Ein toller Start, nachdem man gerade mehr als 9 Stunden Flug in den Knochen hatte und man sich für das Abendessen frisch machen wollte. Ein Techniker versuchte sich dann knapp 2 Stunden an dem Öffnen der Tür. Ein Frischmachen war für uns nicht möglich, da sich sämtliche Kosmetikartikel bereits in dem verschlossenen Badezimmer befanden. Letztlich musste der Techniker die veraltete Badezimmertür gewaltsam aufbrechen. Dies hatte zur Folge, dass sich die Badezimmertür nicht mehr schließen ließ und die Tür sperrangelweit offen stand.
Nachdem wir die Rezeption über diesen Missstand informierten und um ein anderes Zimmer baten, hieß es, dass das Hotel angeblich vollkommen ausgebucht sei und ein Zimmerwechsel nicht möglich wäre.Als Gegenleistung bot man uns ein freies Frühstück für den Folgetag an. Das Zimmer mit der aufgebrochenen Badezimmertür sollten wir behalten. Nachdem wir darauf hingewiesen haben, dass wir für den stolzen Preis von fast EUR 600,00 die Nacht ein solches Zimmer nicht akzeptieren werden und obendrein durch meinen runden Geburtstag ein besonderes Anlass ansteht, war auf einmal das Hotel nicht mehr voll ausgebucht , wie es noch vor wenigen Minuten hieß. Man bot uns dann ein „Upgrade“ auf ein anderes Zimmer an, was allerdings mit Zusatzkosten von knapp EUR 200,00 pro Nacht verbunden gewesen wäre. Die reinste Abzocke! Als wir dies ablehnten und das Hotel langsam merkte, dass wir die Geduld verlieren, war dann auf einmal doch ein Zimmer der gleichen Kategorie und ohne Aufpreis frei, was wir nach langem Hin und Her bekamen. Ein solches Verhalten habe ich in einem Luxushotel noch nie erlebt. Nachdem wir dann vom Abendessen gegen Mitternacht zurück kamen, klingelte unmittelbar nach unserer Ankunft im Zimmer das Telefon. Der Rezeptionist fragte allen Ernstes um Mitternacht bei uns nach, ob wir nun doch nicht das Upgrade für EUR 200,00 die Nacht nehmen wollten? Das kostenlose Frühstück wurde nicht mehr angeboten. Stil und Klasse, wie man es von einem Luxushotel erwarten dürfte, absolute Fehlanzeige!
Leider setzten sich die negativen Erfahrungen auch während des restlichen Aufenthalts fort. Obwohl sich die Rezeptionsmitarbeiter für die Erfahrung am ersten Tag entschuldigten und immer wieder darauf verwiesen, dass ich doch ein paar Tage später in Ihrem
Hotel einen tollen Geburtstag feiern soll, gab es am Geburtstag selbst keinerlei kleine Aufmerksamkeit nicht mal eine Geburtstagskarte. Unpersönlicher geht es wohl nicht mehr.
Insgesamt ist das Chatwal in vielen Punkten äußert kleinlich, was für ein Luxushotel unwürdig ist. Man hat den Eindruck, man will viele Leistungen nur auf dem Papier anbieten, tatsächlich sollen die Gäste die Leistungen aber nicht in Anspruch nehmen. So wirbt das Hotel mit einem kleinen Indoor-Pool, der nach einem anstrengenden Sightseeing-Tag durchaus für Entspannung sorgen kann. Nur wie soll man den Pool nutzen, wenn die Öffnungszeiten des Poolbereichs nur zwischen 10 Uhr und 18 Uhr liegen. Zu dieser Zeit will man doch gerade NYC kennenlernen! Dann erscheint es auch in Ordnung, dass es im Zimmer zwar keine Kaffeemaschine gibt, man sich aber in der Lobby kostenlos einen Kaffee holen kann. Dies bringt allerdings auch nicht sehr viel, wenn die kostenlose Kaffee-Bar nur in der Zeit von 8:00 bis 9:00 Uhr „geöffnet“ hat. Nett klingt es auch, dass das Hotel einen kostenlosen Fahrservice anbietet, der einen abends in Restaurants fahren soll. Kleinlich ist es allerdings, wenn einem der Fahrservice verweigert wird, da er nur für 20 Blocks gilt und unser Restaurant blöderweise aber 22 Blocks entfernt ist. Bezeichnenderweise empfiehlt das Hotel selbst meist nur Restaurants, die außerhalb von 20 Blocks liegen. Die Beispiele sind hier nicht abschließend. Da ist jede Jugendherberge kulanter und großzügiger.
Insgesamt leider ein sehr enttäuschender Aufenthalt. Wir kommen definitiv nicht wieder!

title: Family Vacation
text: Our checkin was great, Michael the doorman was awesome! Our room was setup perfectly to our likening . Th Murphy has always setup. We had an outdoor terrace which was amazing.  The house car driver Kyle was awesome. Everybody knew us by name and wanted us to have a great stay. We felt welcome and wanted.

title: Majestic stay!
text: Went to attend my husband’s 60th reunion.  Our accommodation was lovely. Everything was clean and the staff was amazing and beyond helpful especially Roxy. She’s fantastic and very friendly! The restaurant Lambs Club was everything. Chatwal, we will be coming back.

title: The Beautiful Chatwal in NYC
text: Wonderful hotel, perfect location, very accommodating Staff!  Located right at Times Square, but not in the middle of the crazy!!  Rooms were extremely  clean, very nice, and extremely comfortable. Fresh bedding and towels each day.......Bottled Water provided daily, so  much appreciated!!  Felt very safe in this Hotel, and appreciated the personalized attention.  Beautiful interiors and decor!  Easy on the eyes.  Close to theaters and restaurants.  24hour room service....very happy with the Chatwal!

title: Everything you could wish for in New York
text: Warm reception, friendly service, excellent housekeeping services, beautiful decor. And also a terrific restaurant that served the best meal we had in New York. We had a lovely visit. We will definitely plan to stay there on our next trip.

title: Excellent Pre-honeymoon Stay
text: What an amazing stay at a friendly and lux hotel in Midtown Manhattan. Excellent service, friendly staff, and cozy hotel room. Great food for the room service and easily accessible across midtown manhattan!

title: A REFUGE ONLY ONE BLOCK FROM TIMES SQUARE
text: I really recommend this wonderful hotel. It's quiet, small, with a friendly staff. Every amenity is available and my room was full of surprises - current magazines, backgammon were just a few. It was hard to believe I was just steps away from Times Square - the hotel is quiet and peaceful. The decor really set off this historic Stanford White building. I look forward to my next visit. Thank you for a terrific stay.

title: Great location
text: Everything was perfect from arrival to departure.  The staff was very pleasant and remembered who you were.  The common area was nice and the room was very luxurious.  The location is unbeatable, just a short walk to Time Square and all of the theatres.

title: THIS IS NOT A LUXURY HOTEL!!
text: The hotel is on a busy street, and inside it does not offer any "luxury" or qualify for a 5 star hotel rating. I stayed several nights and cut my trip short. The rooms are very old and average, the service is not great (the staff, while some were nice, were not trained well). They do not go out of their way to make you feel welcome. The food options were so limited - there is literally one fancy restaurant and nothing else. I would rather stay at another hotel in the area or anywhere else. It's a dumpy hotel overall. I wish I had read more accurate reviews.

title: I'm Gushing!!!  Just an Exceptional Stay!
text: We were booked months ahead and looking forward to the City...and then our life changed dramatically.  My husband needed two back surgeries two weeks before our trip!  We had purchased airfares, play tickets and now with limited mobility what to do?  The Chatwal arranged for us to have a wheelchair delivered to the hotel as well as upgraded us to a Junior Suite with a walk in shower.  Everyone...and I mean every person from Manager to Chambermaid...was as pleasant, helpful and genuine in making our stay not only doable, but wonderful.  We could not have attempted NYC without their exceptional attentions.  The room was positively comfortable--bed, bath, sofa--beautifully appointed and very clean.  The Lamb's Club restaurant was lovely with a variety of entree selections including a delicious Heirloom Tomato Salad.  The hotel location is perfect for Times Square and convenient for plays.  But it was the gracious Staff that made our time so Special.  Many thanks to Sakura and Vita as well as all the other professionals at this Classy and Beautiful Hotel.  We have stayed at many noteworthy hotels around the world, but your hospitality and warmth will always touch us!

title: Perfect!
text: Conde Naste 2018 Travel Reader's Choice Awards puts the Chatwal at #1 as far as New York hotels so my wive and I had to give it a try during a weekend in which we came to see Jeff Daniels in To Kill a Mocking Bird on Broadway (...which was amazing!!!). It's located steps away from the theaters and Time Square so everything is within walking distance, but it can get a bit hectic too. Nevertheless, the hotel was always a quiet luxurious refuge from the madness of midtown. We were always greeted by name and with kind smiles. Waters were offered upon returning form our run in Central Park, which was a nice touch. The spa and gym are small but stylish and our massage was fantastic. The bar in the lobby and on the second floor were equally posh and of course, the hotel is home to Iron Chef Zakarian's Lamb's Club. Room service comes from the Lamb's Club too, so when we ordered a burger at midnight, it was indeed epic. We stayed in the Heritage suite, which is actually two rooms combined together (901/902). It seems a little odd at first, but it was nice to have two full bathrooms so that we didn't feel cramped and we also had a separate seating area that was so comfortable that I took a nap in the middle of the day. The room also has this funny little closet with a microwave, sink and stovetop! Interesting use of space but pure New York in my opinion. It's a pricey stay but what can I say? I liked it a lot and there isn't anything else I could have asked for.

title: Beautiful hotel
text: The hotel is designed well, clean, excellent service and comfortable beds.  The pool was the only disappointing thing.  It was small, not fit for playing with kids.  It's meant for exercise as its a current pool.

title: Trying to be too exclusive
text: In NYC for business, a family member informed me and colleagues that she was staying in this hotel and to contact her there. When I called, they would not put me through, informed me there is no no voicemail and they take no phone messages on the premise that taking a message acknowledges that the person requested is staying at the hotel. REALLY ?  This pretension of hyper-exclusivity puts this hotel at the bottom of my choices / recommendations to other business travelers.

title: NYC with 3 kids
text: We loved the Chatwal. The room was great. We had the garden suite. Never had a terrace in NY before. The service was great and all employees very welcoming and helpful. The bed was comfortable and the kids loved the fancy toilets and the TV mirror in the bathroom. On the day of our departure, the bellman walked us a few blocks helping us with our luggage and to meet our Uber. He really went out of his way. I believe his name was Michael...from Queens. We will definitely go back to this hotel.

title: Dad and husband
text: The hotel was great! The service was wonderful. Manpreet Kochar, the front office manager, was especially helpful. Further the location was within walking distance of the theater district but was able from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.

title: Segunda y muy satisfactoria estadía!!!!
text: Fue nuestra segunda estadía, fueron 2 semanas que nos sentimos muy a gusto. Todo el personal super amable (Judith Dilone, especialmente), muy confortables las habitaciones con detalles de agua cada noche, las toallas de baño son amplias (es muy importante para mi). las dimensiones de la habitaciones, los sillones, etc. La ubicación es genial para nosotros porque nos gusta Time Square. Seguro el próximo año volveremos en nuestras vacaciones de invierno. Habrá una tercera seguramente. Sonia y Eugenio Goldfarb.

title: Nice
text:
The hotel was nice.  I can here for my
Birthday on August 3rd with my husband.  The pictures sow very well. But in person the hotel is ok .  I love going to the sos and in the pictures it shows a nice pool and jacuzzi.  It is so small like very tiny!  The spa is nothing to talk about but the wait man I had fir my facial was great.  The front desk girl didn’t know much at all.  Not very helpful.  Overall is was ok

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: My friends and I really appreciated the great service, location and amenities. The bar is club-like and a perfect size. They offer luxe, intimate accommodations and the hotel size is just right. We will definitely book here again.

title: Great location and room!
text: Great experience at the Chatwal!! Location was spectacular in NYC. Everything was local to the hotel. Check-in was a breeze. Staff was extremely helpful. Especially Michael and Ali at the front door. They were so attentive and made the visit even better than it could have been. The room was excellent. Very very clean. Nicely furnished. Spacious. The gym was small, but still nicely equipped.

title: Bad Night's Sleep
text:
Lovely hotel and warm, smiling staff, but various problems with the facility shouldn't happen at hotels in this class and price range.

Shower flooded the bathroom floor and beyond, bad combo of poorly located rainforest head, leaky caulking and open shower.  Called to tell the staff.  They were willing to come bring more towels and mop up; but otherwise, no solution, no offer to switch rooms.  We cleaned up the floor ourselves after each shower with a pile of soaking wet towels.  Yet at 100 degrees outside in NYC, we needed the shower multiple times.  What a mess!

Only 1 of 2 elevators working.  When the "good" one got stuck, waited 15 mins, finally got directed to the service elevator.

Poor sound insulation.  You can hear almost everything next door, especially through the vents and bathroom.  Tons of hair dryer noise.  Awakened by noisy neighbors at 4:30 in the morning.  Then at 7AM by an alarm from the next room that kept beeping for over 30 mins; had to call the front desk.  (They then dealt with it quickly.) You'll need quiet neighbors here.  Ours weren't and a bad night's sleep for this reason is a dealbreaker...

At checkout, the staff finally seemed to realize this was a bad stay. They offered to comp breakfast, but breakfast was already included in our room rate.  They then decided to offer a room upgrade for our next stay, and promised to follow-up by e-mail, which 36 hours later still hasn't arrived.  Frankly, we were eligible for an upgrade THIS stay (Amex FHR), but they didn't offer anything, even after all the problems with the shower.  

The staff was very kind, but I must admit it's kind of annoying when they fumble around to find compensation that costs them nothing and requires us to come back and spend a lot more money -- and then just fails to follow-up anyway.  Better to have just said "sorry," and left it alone.

I did, however, receive an unsigned e-mail from the Chatwal with my folio and a request to write a Trip Advisor review, which I don't do too often.  I e-mailed them back asking if they really wanted a review, but they didn't reply.  Another fumble...

Bottom line: the hotel is a calm, elegant spot in the Theater District.  But we spent a lot: $950 (w/tax) for a night in a loud, wet, <300 square foot room.  My bad judgment in trying someplace new; this rate would have bought a larger space and better view at the Mandarin, Ritz Carlton Central Park, Park Hyatt, St. Regis, and many other top spots.  So even for NYC, sorry guys, you made this feel like a really bad deal.

title: Very nice hotel, but not Marriott friendly
text: My wife and I stayed here three nights over the July 4th holidays on Marriott points. The hotel itself is located very well, right in the middle of all of the action(maybe to close). Rooms where very nicely appointed and the bed was very comfy. There is a slight since of pretentious from the staff and we felt that was a very intentional atmosphere they were trying to create.They choose not to honor my request for a suite upgrade even though the had suites available. Once again a nice hotel, but probably not for us.

title: FAVORITE HOTEL IN NYC
text: Fantastic boutique hotel tucked in on a side street just off of Times Square. Amazing rooms with exquisite finishes from the furniture, to the bed, to the wall coverings, to the toilet! UPSCALE in every aspect.  Great location. Great service. Great 5 star look and feel.

title: Mrs.
text: The staff was excellent and accommodating! The rooms are clean and comfortable. The restaurant staff and food was great! The location in the theater district is so convenient. I really enjoy this hotel!

title: Good hotel if you have the money
text: The Chatwal is a good hotel with excellent amenities.  The staff are very friendly.  Be advised that it is expensive.  Also, the pool is quite small.  If you are interested in Times Square, this hotel is only a block from there.

title: Chatwal - Chat With The Wall
text:
The Chatwal, centrefold NY, is nestled 2 blocks from Times Square and is a short jaunt to the Broadway theatres. This is a high-end hotel prestigiously encased in a landmark building interiorly marked by majestic Art Deco fashion. In former years, The Chatwal was the haunt of the rich and famous and the royalty of the greatest stars on Broadway. It is rich with their shenanigans and tales and uses this notoriety as a drawing card in the hotel's marketing strategy.The Chatwal has endured iterations of remodels, renovations and remastering to get to the fervour of luxury it portrays today. It is a fusion of  old-school Art Deco design with a spectrum of modern glam.

The facade of The Chatwal is majestic. When viewed from across the street, at night, it looks like a gigantic alter dotted with appropriately sized candles, sanctuary-like....almost saintly. The componentry of the lobby makes use of reds, browns and warm lighting that ensures a welcoming vibe for guests. The Chatwal offers a comprehensive repertoire of suites (suite oriented hotel), some include spacious furnished terraces.The suites are all meticulously curated with built in cabinets veneered with faux leather which morphs them into classic luggage pieces from yesteryear. The walls are fabricated in suede and spacious baths are plastered in stripes of tinted mirror and doused with an abundance of decadent toiletries and when you throw in complimentary butler service you now have the basic standard of all rooms, a very high hoteliery bar indeed. The "Chatwal Crowns", a collection of 10 suites, each having a unique distinctive theme, are the real accommodation stars of this hotel production.

I was in a Tinseltown mood, so I booked the Hollywood suite. The suite was ornamented, of course, along Hollywood lines with movie art and cinematographic memorabilia arranged throughout. The bath was an eye-popper, like walking into the "House of Mirrors" at Coney Island, with glistening black marble floors, mirrored walls that encased a shower cubicle bigger than most NYC apartments, and a vanity area complete with a behind the mirror television. I could brush my teeth and watch "Good Morning America" at the same time...more multi-tasking. But beware, the toilet seat comes hot....a bit of luxe over-kill I suspect.

I'm not usually a spa person, but after my harrowing trip into the city, I needed something relaxing. I tripped down to the Red Door Spa where I engaged in the signature "Stress Melt Ritual". I felt like I was in suspended animation.

After the spa, all topped-up with exhilaration, I moseyed on to the Lambs Club restaurant which featured a floor-to-ceiling stone fireplace, chrome light fixtures, hand crafted leather seating. Black and white photos of broadway and Hollywood stars grace the walls, like the TCM screening room, with portraits the likes of Katherine Hepburn, Spencer Tracy, Charlie Chaplin, W.C. Fields amongst others. They are arranged in such a position and fashion that they seemed to be talking to one another. This bonanza of pictures is so enticing that one is inclined to chat with the wall as if you are part of the imaginary conversation.

Since this restaurant is called the Lamb's Club, I ordered Colorado Lamb Chops from the heftier part of the menu (sumptuous) paired with a cocktail called "Surprise Me" (artistically handsome and delicious) and warm Rhubarb Shortcake (a taste of heaven).

All hotel staff were attentive, experienced in their craft and were amped up to anticipate and execute your every wish. Keep in mind that the Chatwal is a fully loaded luxury hotel and it is advisable to come with a heavy wallet and a strong credit card(s).....not withstanding...the Chatwal embraces an "all-in" NYC hotel experience........so when luxury, location and comprehensive facilities and service are your requirements for tackling NYC..........then try The Chatwal..........Chat With The Wall.

title: Excellent Service, Great Location for Shows, Mediocre Restaurant
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights in June 2019.

This hotel has some incredible strengths and just a few weaknesses but overall, it's a real quiet peaceful refuge in the middle of a busy crazy city. Inside, you would never know you are in NYC Times Square show district.

My entire stay was hosted as part of a week long engagement.  This is not the place to stay if you are concerned about prices.  A full breakfast here is $40 per person so $100 a couple with tax and tip.

What I loved:

The toilet hands down was the best part of my room. It was electronic and had a butt cleaning spray that must have had a laser because it was accurate every time.  It would shoot hot water directly into the right spot at first shot and the hot water would continue for at least a minute.  Felt so good, and got you clean like you need to be.  If all toilets had that, the world would be a better place.  It also has a front sprayer for women. When you are done with the water, you tap the hot dryer button and it drys you down there--perfect!  Plus the toilet seat was always heated.  If my schedule was not so busy I would have spent more time here.

The rain shower was excellent--as good as it gets in shower technology, although sometimes the temp control did not hold the temp and needed adjusting during the shower.

I loved that they covered the bed headboard with a sheet. All hotels should do that.

You know how you hate closing hotel double curtains with your hand before bed or opening them in the morning--who knows how dirty/dusty they are--Not here:  They have remote controlled curtains--Channel 1 for the outer and Channel 2 for the inner.  They were the best and fun to use.  It was one of my favorite things to do everyday. Everyone should get them--perfect opening and closing every time.

The bed was very comfortable.

The service from the front door and desk staff was impeccable.  Immediate response for everything.

The King bed standard room was tight for 2 people--I had to keep pushing in the desk chair to get by and two people can't pass one another in the room. These are small rooms like on a ship.

Our room faced the back--an old rent controlled apartment building (see pic), but with the double pain high quality windows closed and not facing street side you could hear a pin drop at all times it was so quiet and peaceful.

Location is perfect if you are in town to see shows--you will be able to walk to all of them. It's also close to the E train that takes you right into 1 World Trade Center.  I took it and it's the fastest way--20 minutes--E train's last stop.

A constant annoyance both at night and each morning was not having a refrigerator in the room.  It's a problem with no solution because as I looked around the room, there is no room to put one.  We had no place to put the great dinner leftovers, cakes, or some yogurt or hard boiled eggs for the morning to get us going. Food went to waste.  No place to keep bottles of water cool.  Sure the staff would come up and take care of that for us--but you know--it gets old keep calling them for help. Like at home, you just want some things right there immediately.

The other weak spot was the hotel restaurant.  Because it is a small low volume operation, even though it carries a high end menu with high end  prices, it does not result in quality and efficiency.  They can't afford to have an executive chef and professional manager there full time.  One morning our order was forgotten and we had to go through 3 people to get it out.  At dinner, a request for the salmon to be cooked medium came out sushi raw after I cut into it.  When I told the waiter, instead of remaking it, they gathered all the bits and put it back in the oven and re-delivered the pieces to us.  I was not expecting that.

I would like to see a breakfast menu that lends itself toward efficiency like an Omelet with a choice of egg whites and a clear list of add-in's to choose from. How about Yogurts from Fage or Chobani and some grain cereals. Freshly cut and cooked potatoes. Freshly squeezed OJ and Grapefuit juice for their sophisticated clientele.

Their lounge is an excellent environment for pleasure or business and I am sure they can mix any concoction you desire.

They have the best complementary Mercedes car service from 2 PM to 10 PM that will drop you off within a 20 block radius.  The will also complementary press your clothes and shine your shoes.  Their towels and sheets are top quality and housekeeping is excellent.

Overrall, this is a fine small personalized hotel to stay if your budget can handle it, with the limitations I outlined above that may not be a concern for your stay.

title: LUXURY IS AN UNDERSTATEMENT!
text:
The hotel is top notch!!! The staff, the rooms, the service, the lobby, the car service, the concierge are all 10 star! 

I booked a sister weekend to celebrate her birthday and the front desk professional had a small chocolate cake, card and assorted chocolates waiting her room when we returned from dinner. I thought that was the sweetest gesture. Every night with the turn down service, the butler would spray something in the room that was heavenly. I love this hotel and will be back again soon!

title: Quite nice
text:
Stayed at The Chatwal after it first opened – nine or so years ago. At the time I was a Starwood Platinum member and got a nice upgrade to a junior suite. I always looked forward to coming back and was delighted to schedule a three-night stay. The hotel is very much the same – even though it is in a busy street going west to loud Times Square, it is very quiet and tranquil inside. Going east from the door, it is mid-town with less tourist traffic.

Staff is invariably delightful. Special mention to Ali at the front door and Kyle with the car. My wife said Pilar at the spa was great. The room is a mixture of Orient Express and technology. Very nicely appointed. The Lavazza espresso machine produced delicious coffee. Towels are fluffy, robes are soft, and Asprey toiletries, while a bit parfumy for me, are very nice. The fitness room is small, but serviceable.

Just three relatively minor gripes: One: the climate control was a bit glitchy and we had to set it up again every time we returned to the room. Two: I am now a Marriott BonVoy lifetime platinum member and wanted to have a nice upgrade for the rare stay with my wife. I was upgraded to exactly the same junior suite, which would have been nice if I hadn’t used 3 of the 5 suite upgrades I had earned for this year. I probably would not have used them if that was the case. I made several calls in advance and got conflicting answers. Reached out twice to Judith Dilone as I saw she answered reviews on tripadvisor to discuss, but she never called back. The last one is breakfast. Last time a full breakfast was included because of frequent guest program status. This time, I chose the breakfast amenity and it is a “continental breakfast.” The issue is that there is no protein offered whatsoever. The coffee was delicious, the two pastries excellent and the parfait or fruit salad good too… but there was no choice with eggs. In my experience with many Luxury Collection hotels, a full breakfast is offered to those of us who earned high status through years of loyalty. It was fine, but somewhat disappointing.

I will come back if - like this time - the location is convenient for our activities.

title: One of the nicest hotels in Manhattan
text: The Chatwal is situated on a quiet street just close enough to all Times Square has to offer without being too near the hustle and bustle. Rockefeller Plaza, Bryant Park and Central Park are just a short walk away.  The staff was lovely, the decor is elegant and the rooms were clean and neat with just the right amount of glamour.  We will stay there again!

title: Chatwal Hotel
text: Really nice hotel with beautiful rooms and a truly outstanding staff.   May very well be the friendliest hotel staff we have come across.  Great location with super short walks to Times Square and the theaters.   Would definitely go back.

title: Elegant boutique - style hotel close to the theater district
text: The Chatwal hotel is an elegant mire boutique -style hotel with a warm contemporary decor very close to Times Square. The staff are very friendly and helpful, very good rooms with a larger bathroom, great Red Door Spa within the hotel and a great American - European cuisine restaurant with the Lambs Clubs. Overall, I can recommend this hotel.

title: perfect quiet place to stay in Manhattan
text: The Chatwal is perfectly located right by all the action but in quiet side street. It is a boutique hotel with nicely contemporary designed rooms of a good size for Manhattan too & super large bathroom & very well equipped.

title: Went for luxury treat, received budget messy treatment
text:
Book 2 rooms, also reconfirmed with reservation, also reserved airport shuttle service, hoping for a welcome after the transfer and seamless check in experience, but nope, we were denied a room, only 1 room is reserved according to the front desk and they quickly jumped into conclusion to charge us for the 2nd room. Afterwards we contacted our travel assistant to sort this out. Turned out the front dest was careless and did not bother to spend a few more seconds searching for the 2nd room in their computer.

The hotel refunded our charges for the 2nd room but keep in mind we're tourise and we are still charged foreign exchange fees that the hotel was unable to refund as well.

Now,  think about it, what's the point of 5 star hotel if their service is alike of a budget hotel? Their staff is untrained? We usually takes Uber Black for airport transfer but we think for seamless experience let's reserve hotel private shuttle, hoping when we arrive everything will be set up.. But nope, looks like there is a walled garden between concierge, reservation, and operations.

The check in experience ruined the whole mood for all of us. We are also charged $250 for the airport shuttle.. what a joke. Our stay costs $20,000. A luxury hotel should give this as a complementary service, especially considering the mess they did during check in, and the fx fee they are unable to take away.

This hotel is a pretender 5 star luxury, while in fact their staff and service are budget hotel level

Oh also the rooms and facilities are meh.. really disappointed and wished we did not stay here.

title: Booked online, reconfirmed via email, no room
text:
For a 5 star hotel costing us $20k this hotel needs a wake up call. Booked online, reconfirmed via email, however when we tried to check in, no room for us. We even reserved for hotel private airport shuttle and listed our rooms and names. And yet they couldn’t coordinate for seamless check-in.

We have 2 bookings: 1 under my father name, 1 under by brother’s name, same last name, the reception kept insisting only 1 room reserved, and then told us to pay for the 2nd room. What a joke. We had to call the travel agents to explain the whole mess caused by this untrained unprofessional hotel. Ruined the whole trip experience

Oh btw, the hotel is damn overrated. The room is mediocre, small. They charge for a measly $250 airport shuttle even if we paid $20k for the stay. Anybody who knows service should waive the shuttle fee. $250k is a measly 1% of the amount we paid for the rooms. 

What a joke.. Will flag this hotel to my personal “AVOID Bucket list”. Hope readers of this unbiased unpaid review will see my point and do the same.

title: Went There for Pleasure After Business
text:
The Chatwal was a wonderful hotel and first rate in everything. When you're going to NYC, you're going to pay a lot to stay there so you might as well pay some extra and stay at the Chatwal; first class all the way. The location is excellent; right in the middle of Manhattan with easy access to everything.  Times Square and Broadway are just around the corner as is Bryant Park and other attractions.  Very centrally located.

Personnel there were courteous, professional, personable and friendly; it's truly a top notch property and well worth it.

Our room was rather large for an NYC property and there was very minimal (if any) street noise.

Always DO keep in mind hotel pricing in NYC as listed does not include the NYC hotel taxes, which are substantial; but that applies to all properties whether a budget or high end property.

title: Wonderful stay at the Chatwal!
text: My daughter and I stayed at The Chatwal for four nights in May to celebrate her 21st birthday.  Though it is a block from Times Square the minute you enter the doors you are in your own little oasis.    From the doormen, to the front desk staff, to the wonderful and helpful concierges, Carol and Juan, everyone we dealt with was so helpful and nice.  Our room was great, very quiet and calm.  The location is walking distance to many sites and the subway is only two blocks away to get everywhere else one needs to go.  I look forward to staying here again next year when my husband and I visit NYC for our 30th anniversary.

title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location
text: My wife and I visited NYC for the first time last week and couldn't have picked a better hotel than The Chatwal.  Excellent location, wonderful service, helpful and attentive staff.  Bed was extra comfy and the decor of the room was lovely.  Juan and Carol at the concierge desk were especially friendly and helpful.  Valet staff was super helpful.

title: Boutique Hôtel proche de Times Square
text: Il est difficile de noter sur TripAdvisor car le choix de note (de 1 a 5) ne permet pas de donner une nuance. Selon mes standards, je noterai cet hôtel 14/20 ce qui est pas si mal pour NY ou l’offre hôtelière est très deceptive. L’hôtel est plutôt petit avec du charme, très proche de Times Square ( on aime ou pas ce quartier bruyant et très lumineux ). La décoration du lobby est réussie, tout comme le bar à l’étage.
