Le service est vraiment Très Bien ( soigné, discret , plutôt 5* ), l’hôtel est équipé d’un spa, d’une ( très ) petite piscine ( sans intérêt ) et d’une petite salle de sport. Côté chambre, les Deluxe sont très bien équipées, belle salle de bain, confortables. En revanche, la vue est inexistante ( normale dans ce quartier ) , pas de lumière du jour, bref on ne reste pas dans la chambre pour le plaisir. Elles peuvent être bruyantes car comme souvent à NY, la porte d’entrée est équipée d’un groom qui fait qu’elle «  claque » fortement des qu’elle se ferme. Et donc les autres portes des autres chambres peuvent faire un vacarme qui vous réveillera. A 555$ la nuit, ça fait un peu juste mais c’est NY , une ville surprenante par son rapport qualité prix. Le restaurant est très bon ( dîner ) , le petit déjeuner l’est en revanche nettement moins à 36$ le continental ( très basic ) , il est préférable de le prendre ailleurs.

title: All in at the Chatwal
text:
This is a 10 story pocket hotel tucked in between theaters and office buildings just blocks from the melee on Times Square. 

It is a perfect Midtown location close to almost everything that drew you to New York in the first place. Buy it, try it, see it and eat it all within a few easy blocks on foot. 

The hotel is sophisticated and elegant offering first cabin service including an unadvertised free shuttle to anywhere within 20 blocks of your room. 

The Lambs Club Restaurant in the lobby opens at 7:00 with a large comfy Bar on the 2nd floor. And...there is free coffee is available at dawn by the elevator.

Need a Business Center, Free WiFi, a Spa, indoor Pool? It's all waiting for you here. 

Room 611 was spacious and made efficient use of the space. There was a large flat screen TV, King Bed, plenty of lighting that all worked as opposed to the usual 25 watt bulbs that flicker. 

The Bathroom was very cool. Chrome, glass and an Onxy counter with two sinks. A true Toto johnnie is there to greet you with a heated seat. (How civilized is that?) There was a Rain Shower large enough for three, in case you make friends. 

Housekeeping kept everything spotless, fresh, crisp and replenished as needed.  

The rest of Staff couldn't do enough without being asked. 

Chatwal truly made for a wonderful long weekend in the City.

title: Absolutely Outstanding!!
text:
The Chatwal is a MUST STAY!  Fantastic location in Midtown, near Times Square, walking distance to theatre, Central Park, Roc Centre, great restaurants....
I cannot say enough about the staff here...fantastic!  And the rooms are incredibly designed in Art Deco style...breathtaking.   We will definitely be back!  Thank you to everyone, especially the concierge staff who really go above and beyond.

title: Classic Luxury
text: While the rooms are fairly tight, much like all of NYCs old-school luxury hotels, they are well appointed. That restaurant was amazing! Perfect for our anniversary dinner. The sea-salted yellowtail crudo was insane.

title: Excellent Service!
text: We recently stayed at the Chatwal knowing it’s central location in Manhattan. This is a boutique type hotel however provided the best service we’ve experienced in NYC. The room is comfortable and had one of the Best showers ever!  The hotel is very convenient for Times Square, Broadway, Shopping, and easy walking to most attractions. We will definitely return.

title: Sweet Gem
text: First time staying at the Chatwal and enjoyed every minute.  The location is amazing - just minutes off Broadway - but away from the craziness.  The hotel is elegant and beautiful, the staff was welcoming and the room had fantastic amenities and was very comfortable.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Disappointed
text:
Not worth it although location is really good if you want to be close to TS. Issues throughout our 9 day stay, TV not working properly, Air conditioning unstable, Breakfast with a price tag that did not relate with the product delivered. To finalize on top of the extra charges (which I agreed) they wanted to push another $500 for a missing Alpaca throw that I had no idea about it. 
Pity

title: Loved it!  Old Hollywood Glam!
text: Love this hotel!  It was our first time staying here and we really loved it.  It is just a few blocks from Times Square.  We came into town to see a show, so this was walking distance to the theatre.  The hotel is kind of art deco and Hollywood glam.  We had a suite with an outdoor balcony which was great for sipping a cocktail before the show. The service was amazing.  Only downside is they have "butler" service -- which is fine. But this means there is no iron in the room if you just want to touch up your shirt. You have to use the butler service.  But not a big deal.  The property is smaller, I think only 4 or 5 floors.  So, it doesn't feel like a mob scene like many big NY hotels can feel.  Definitely try this place out.  It was alot of fun!

title: Excellent
text:
We were delighted to stay for the first time for a long weekend at the Chatwal these past several days. I cannot say enough about the staff and level of personalized service from the moment we arrived until our departure.  Travelling with children can be a hassle and trying for all involved.  The staff was considerate, anticipated our needs and did so with a huge smile.
 
The rooms were spacious for New York, the amenities luxurious and for being just a block away from Times Square, we had the convenience of location with absolutely zero noise.
 
I especially want to recognize Sileni Rodriguez, who made sure we booked the most appropriate room for our party and was incredibly inattentive throughout our stay.  She is a great asset and Ambassador for your hotel.

title: Every base covered.
text: Even though we only spent one night at The Chatwal, it was a memorable and unique experience.  Every individual working at this hotel - the front desk staff, the valets, housekeepers, managers - is so incredibly friendly and accommodating.  And the hotel  offers all those great little touches that make your stay feel elegant and luxurious: TV behind the bathroom mirror, fancy "smart" toilets, iPad controlled room system automation, and so many other little extras that add to the experience.  The in-house restaurant and bars are also elegant and inviting (and staffed with terrific people).  Enjoy a happy hour cocktail in the second floor lounge with live jazz or relax with a drink in the lobby bar/lounge area.  The Chatwal has every base covered.  Looks like rain as you're heading out to dinner?  The doorman hands you an umbrella.  Waiting for an Uber to arrive?  The valet will keep an eye out for the car while the doorman gives you a five-minute history of the hotel.  Every aspect of this hotel is centered around luxury, comfort and service.  I have a feeling The Chatwal is our new go-to location for weekend getaways in mid-town.

title: Wonderful
text: Truly a beautiful experience in the middle of Times Square. Elegant environment with remarkable service. Jazz music for brunch, Dining in excellence and the Lamb Club restaurant is first class. Quiet subdued New York at its finest

title: Hidden gem !
text: This was our second stay at The Chatwal and we are happy we found it. Michael, the doorman, is the perfect greeter and very helpful.  In fact, every staff member with whom we've had contact has been friendly and professional. Our room, a junior suite, was lovely and we appreciated the double sinks and excellent shower in the bathroom. Breakfast in the Lamb's Club is the best hotel breakfast we've experienced in NY.  This time we had pre-theater dinner there as well and it did not disappoint. We didn't use the hotel car service but that is a nice option.  You can't beat the location for Broadway theater.  It's an easy walk to most area theaters and takes the stress out of trying to find cabs.  We booked through Marriot bonvoy.  We will stay at The Chatwal even when not going to theater.  The walk from the hotel to Fifth Avenue is easy.

title: keeps getting better for us!
text: This is our 4th stay at the hotel and every time we enjoy it more! we had a terrific room 906 which was great for our week long stay as it felt quite spacious with a sep. seating area. The check in was effortless and very welcoming. the ladies that helped keep the room clean were excellent. We had a very nice  young man from the door take up the luggage to our room and we talked his ear off about anything and everything! I think his name was Amir- apologies if thats not correct.

title: Ain’t too proud
text:
Awesome show!
The life and times of the Temptation!
Must put on your calendar to do list in New York City 
Show was Sold Out !
Love the music and living the memories!
The show ROCKED!!!! 
Only one person alive today out of the group.

title: A hidden gem in the heart of broadway
text: What a classy and beautiful hotel - every detail is high end. I booked a wkd night for my husband's birthday via bonvoy. Service was attentive and friendly at every turn (they even brought a small candle in dessert after I casually mentioned it @after theatre drinks and dessert...). We were upgraded to a Jr. Suite, arrived with a note from staff thanking us for our stay. Had a very minor noise issue (air in pipes) which we told front desk on way out to show. Came back - fixed, AND a note/split of wine as an apology! The room was quiet, spacious (rare in NYC), and bathroom amenities best quality I've seen, even compared to some resort hotels. We'll go back again for sure, next trip to see a show in the city.

title: Top notch
text: Hotel is the best in NYC. Customer service is unbeatable. Rooms are clean and classy. Awesome location, right next to timessquare center and the hunt and fish club across the street is phenomenal. Breakfast is ok.

title: Dont expect any soecial treatment especially if booking through mariott bon voy
text: Booked a room at this hotel for our wedding night, we asked for a upgraded room and were told that although it cant be guaranteed but miss yina javier and her staff emailed me that they would do their utmost best, however once they realized that i booked this through mariott bon voy points they did not bother to even respond to my emails anymore.  3 emails sent to ms javier and the rest of management staff and neither of them (besides for mr ashish verma but he wasn’t the person we tried reaching out too) even bothered responding once they saw this is a points reservation, also worth noting is that that basic superior rooms in this hotel are smaller than most nyc hotels we have visited in the past.  I would not recommend booking a superior room and if u book points and want recognition for status i suggest find another hotel as this one wont look at your side (p.s. we overheard another elderly couple at check out when asked if they would come back they said they dont feel mariott treats loyal members properly and they are disgusted by it)

title: Best hotel I have stayed at in NYC!
text: I am a frequent traveler and value customer service, a beautiful hotel, quiet rooms and comfortable beds! The Chatwal exceeded all of my expectations-- the staff is amazing and went above and beyond in customer service. The location is right in the theater district so it is so convenient! The restaurant is lovely with great food. The hotel is magnificent with a gorgeous art deco motif!! This is now my hotel of choice whenever I visit NYC!

title: First class!
text:
Stunning and lovely hotel in the perfect spot for Times Square & theater district.  Let’s start with the good
Stunning decor, 1st class service from bell boy to front desk.  Location was so easy but street off busy time square.  The size is nice, a boutique hotel that’s beautiful inside.  
Ok- a couple things to work on! So we had an issue 1st night with no hot water, unfortunately we waited til 11pm to take shower from day and disappointment set in as no hot water.  The staff was quick to jump on it, but it was not resolved until later, after our bedtime.  We had hot showers the rest of the trip and we were compensated with a hotel credit but it was a bit of bummer.  Again service was top notch!  
2nd item.  It’s minor but important to me, no in room coffee.  Not sure why and they do have coffee in lobby for short time in morning.   But I missed coffee in my robe in my room. 
Also, bell hop arranged a car for airport on last day which was wonderful. Enjoyed it and will be back because of service and location, plus quiet rooms and comfy beds!

title: Expensive, outstanding service!
text:
We had the pleasure of staying here 1 night before a Rangers game.  The hotel itself is very posh, the staff is overwhelmingly amazing, from the valet to the front desk, to the attendant that offered to push the inside elevator buttons for me because my hands were full. The Bar upstairs was amazing. Best Espresso Martini ever!!!

The room was small but extremely well appointed. The bathroom was amazing: heated seat, awesome bidet, fantastic rainfall shower, hidden TV behind the mirror—very luxurious!

When the Rangers game went into overtime, the front desk was nice enough to bend the rules a bit regarding my parking since I extended past 24 hours. 

I will definitely stay here again when I’m back in town. Impeccable service.  Well done everyone!!!

title: AMAZING!
text: Absolutely stunning hotel. The service was amazing, the room was so comfortable, perfect location, lovely bar and food. Anything and everything old school New York glamour and service that's this place wrapped in a modern / contemporary style. I can't wait to go back here.

title: Beautiful hotel, excellent service
text:
On our now fourth visit to the Chatwal we continue to love the beautiful art deco style, comfortable spacious bedrooms and fantastic service that the hotel provide.  On top of it all the location right next to Times Square is just ideal for getting out and about.
We are such fans of the hotel that I even decided it would be the best place to propose to my fiancee, and we are sure to continue coming back for our NYC mini-breaks.

Particular thanks to Elizabeth from the front desk who ensure we had a room that ticked all our favorite boxes about the hotel, making the proposal over in-room breakfast that bit more special.

We'll be back, and already can't wait for it!

title: Perfect NYC Luxury Stay
text: Really modern and luxurious room, great decor, great service. Even better than the St Regis in some ways. Very nice amenities including indoor pool and hot tub, able to use nice Mercedes house car, good breakfast!

title: Inoperable Toilet
text:
We booked the Chatwal for three nights on account of the statement that Conde Nast readers rated it the #1 hotel in NYC.  I would not do the same.  

Our toilet failed to flush properly the first morning we were there, but by flushing it repeatedly over a dozen times I was able to get most of what was in it down.  I reported it to engineering, via their digital system for reporting such things. When we returned from having been out for several hours, I received a message back that it had been fixed while we were out, but it was not.  We reported that to the front desk and left to go to dinner and a show.  When we returned, we had received another message that it was repaired, but we could tell it hadn't been by flushing the toilet and seeing how poorly it operated, even with nothing more than a sheet of toilet paper in it.  The next morning, we attempted to flush the toilet repeatedly after using it, and it was really inoperable and created quite a smell.  We left to go out to lunch and a matinee show and made it clear at the front desk that they had better fix it or change our room.  When we returned we went up to our room and it had been fixed, but no-one should have to report a broken toilet three times and spend two full days in a room with it.  

I might add that after the toilet had finally been repaired on our third day there, the people at the front desk chose to change the code on our locks.  Why they did that I have no idea, because the reservation was always for three nights.   I discovered this only when we were leaving to go to a Valentine's Day dinner reservation and the Cher Show, but forgot our tickets to the show and had to run up to the room to get the tickets.  As a result, while an Uber car was waiting and charging me for being late, I had to go to the front desk and ask them for new keys.  At that time, the people at the front desk wanted to discuss the fact the toilet had been repaired, but the time they took to do this was costing me money as the Uber driver was charging me for being late.

The room was fine and other than the items above, the service was generally good, but I cannot give this hotel more than a "poor" rating under the above described circumstances.  Their "engineering" staff is obviously not capable and the management obviously does not do sufficient supervision of them.  It doesn't take a genius to put a piece of toilet paper in a toilet and see if it goes down.

title: Every box checked at the Chatwal
text: The Chatwal is a perfect jewel of a hotel. The lobby is an Art Deco dream  The hotel room  and amenities indulgent ( spa like bathroom). The staff very helpful and guest focused.  Would definitely plan a return stay

title: 1 is the Lowest I am allowed to rate this by TripAdvisor -  New Year's Eve
text:
New Year's Eve - Times Square - see The Ball Drop  
**What a Complete Joke** More like being robbed....oooooh it was memorable. 

******* BE WARNED, I have surprised that I am the first to review this point ******

Pay $1,000 to see Count Down - False
See the ball drop - False
Kids all they can eat popcorn & soda - False (2 bags for 3 kids - do the math)
Yes we have other kids there - False
Hotel escort to Times Square - Big Fat Lie
Lamb's Club - is a Joke, more of the same
Stand in the street, FOR FREE!!!

5-star of False promises.
5-Star for arguing over $17* difference between my confirmation & their computer screen. 
5-star for failing to have use of House Car
5-star management in need of a performance review 

Location is handy to Times Square. 

Don't listen to sales spiels - we must have been part of 30-50 people who didn't get what was promised. Only the hotel manager & his 3 friend got through the police barriers.

title: Fabulous hospitality at The Chatwal
text: My husband & I just returned from a wonderful stay at The Chatwal. Every single member of staff addressed us by name each time we were coming & going. It was our anniversary & Adrian left a bottle of wine & chocolates for us in our room with a note of congratulations. The room was spacious & extremely comfortable & in a fabulous location. Highly recommend staying in The Chatwal, quiet & relaxing in the busy city. We will certainly return again. Congratulations to all the staff on a job well done.

title: World Class Stay
text: We have a lot of great hotels in NYC, and I have had the privilege of staying in many really good ones. This Hotel is a great one! Located on 44th just on the edge of the insanity of Times Square. a peaceful oasis with great multi level cocktail lounge & Jeffrey Zakarian Lambs Club resturant, no need to venture too far for food & drink. The room is packed with high end amenities, and the staff was friendly & helpful. A World Class weekend stay...HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

title: Luxury
text: When I think of customer service I think of natish the manager.  He was unbelievable. Cocktail hour was filled with professionals and business people. For being a younger couple in more casual close we still felt like family and was introduced to more of the higher position people. The room was to die for.  Again this hotel is  LUXURY and we enjoyed our stay would recommend 100%.

title: Great Luxury Hotel
text: We stayed here before seeing Billy Joel at MSG.  It was a great place, and everyone working there was more then willing to do anything they could to ensure our stay was a great experience.  Very central to everything you could want in NYC.

title: Quiet Refuge in the City
text: This was our second stay at the Chatwal and we will return again. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are well-appointed, luxurious and clean, but our main reason for our return is the quiet. We must travel often to NYC on business and have stayed in many beautiful hotels, but no matter how fabulous they may be, if outside noises from traffic or garbage trucks or inside noises from other guests keep us from sleeping, no amount of luxury can make up for that. We want to be well-rested to meet the tasks of the day and the Chatwel allows for that.

title: Excellent Bar!
text: It's been some years since we stayed at the Chatwal but we stopped in at the bar on a recent stay and must say the magic of the place is still there. The lobby area is gorgeous. We were there just for drinks. I love the intimate bar and attention to detail the bartender took to make our drinks which were delicious. It may be time to reconsider the Chatwal to stay. It's proximity to Times Square was generally a negative for us but in all other aspects it is a lovely place.

title: さくらさん
text:
リッツカールトンがあまりにもひどくセキャリティにネクタイさせてマネージャーに仕立て上げ名刺すらない2メートルもある黒人に客を恫喝させられた後なので日本人スタッフさくらさんに助けられました
悪い点はベルがドアを開けないと自力の開閉ができないほどドアが重い
プラチナアメニティの朝食があまりにもひどく驚くレベル、レセプションやコンシェルジュの対応は非常に良いがレストランスタッフは別のホテルかと思うほど態度が悪い

title: Everything Is Done Precisely & Very Well
text: While a block from Times Square, it is like another world. Quiet, relaxed and everything just perfect.Welcoming check in, a great lobby bar and a perfect room. Our special requests were welcomed and the hotel is small enough that you get  recognized. None of the chaos of he other larger hotels, and so easy to get in and out of.

title: 好立地、おしゃれな小さなホテル
text:
タイムズスクエアからすぐ近くで、地下鉄やバスに乗るのも楽です。映画がテーマのようで、館内のインテリアやリネンはとてもおしゃれで、快適でした。
地下に、スパ、フィットネスセンター、小さな小さなプール(お子様の水遊びにはちょうどよいです)とジャグジーもあります。
朝にはコーヒー紅茶、夕方にはアップルサイダーが、エレベーターホールに置かれており、自由に取ってよいようになっていました。そのせいか？部屋にはコーヒーなどはなかったです。
フロントの人やドアマンはとても丁寧かつ親切で、(こちらの前に泊まったホテルのカジュアル&フレンドリーな感じと対照的なので)驚きました。到着した時に部屋が用意できていなかったのですが、携帯の番号を伝えておいたら、メッセージで用意ができたことを教えてくれました。
昼間と夜に部屋の清掃が入りました。
アメニティはロンドンのアスプレイです。

title: Returned again  ... great location and fabulous staff ...
text: This is our second stay at the Chatwal.  We come to NYC between Christmas and New Years to take in a few Broadway shows.  Chatwal offers the ideal location ... quick walk to any theaters off Times Square but hotel feels tucked away and quieter than most in midtown.  Staff are incredibly nice and helpful.  Rooms are generous size for NYC.   We had a suite looking over 44th.  Bright and good view.   The deco decor has a cool vibe but feels a bit dark and dated.  I’d say closer to a four star than five but priced quite reasonably for this category. (Not that we spent much time in the room but the most immediate upgrade needed in the rooms are the technology like TV’s, etc - seemed like the remote was from the 90’s and didn’t work.)

title: Comfort, elegance, convenience
text: I had a seamless visit at The Chatwal.  Lovely room, walking distance from plays and restaurants.  Good Morning America is right down the street!  And the bar makes and excellent Manhattan!  The Chatwal is relaxation in the middle of the city!

title: Amazing Christmas Weekend
text: We chose the Chatwal for our Christmas weekend getaway. Upon arrival the staff quickly got us checked in. Hotel was decorated so beautifully for the holiday. We had room service which arrived quickly. The burger was absolutely amazing, the fries were some of the best I've had recently! Breakfast at the Lambs Club was over the top amazing, highly recommend the stuffed french toast. Loved everything about this hotel, hot chocolate was in the lobby one afternoon when we returned, delecious! They also serve coke from glass bottles vs fountain, which is my personal favorite! Our room was perfect. Carpet was worn but everything else was excellent.

title: No regrets
text:
My wife and I have visited NYC many times and are used to the relatively small hotel rooms compared to..say the rest of the U.S. The Chatwal is no exeption. We booked a 3 night stay using Starwood.Marriot points and were given room 303. I have Gold status with Starwood and Marriot.

First of all, the hotel is located just steps from Time Square. However it is not directly facing Times Square so it is relatively quiet! We flew in to Newark, took the train to Penn Station, and then walked about 10 blocks to get to the hotel since we had difficulty finding a cab.. If you know New York, 10 blocks is nothing.

Doormen were nice. Check-in was smooth. I used the Marriot app to check in after I landed, and the room was ready when I got there at 3:45 pm.

Our room was tiny with a window (probably purposely) obstructed by difficult to move curtains revealing a view of a wall. Our bathoom was disproportionately huge and awesome. We had a nice rainshower with good pressure.  There was a  nice TV in the bathroom. The toilet had a heated seat and bedet function. My wife and I laughed when we saw the room and then said to each other "Yep we are in New York." We love NYC....and I think most people come to this city to experience the city...not to spend too much time in the room. So the small room didn't bother us.

We didn't try the restaurant downstairs, the pool, or any other facilities. I did like that there was fresh coffee by the elevator every morning. The cleaning staff was excellent. I also met a butler each morning in the lobby but never found the need to use him. There was a cool little bar and restaurant downstairs as well as a larger bar and restaurant on the second floor. The menus looked great. For breakfast, there was a great French place across the street...and I also liked eating at the Flame (simple diner food) which was half a block east just across 6th ave.

The hotel also has a car that can take you within a 15-20 block radius. We used it once and the driver was nice, but the car is on a first come basis and never seemed to be around.

Upon check-out they gave us chocolate which was a nice touch,

Overall I liked this hotel and would stay here again. I'm not sure having status with Starwood or Marriot is important with this hotel. I used points, and I got.....a free room..not much else. Everybody was nice here, but unlike other reviews, I was not routinely addressed by name. Maybe that would have been different had I actually paid for the room.

title: Lovely Hotel and walking distance to everywhere!
text: Our room was beautiful and very clean!!  Staff was very accommodating and the concierge Juan was most helpful in his dining recommendations, and we enjoyed the restaurants!!! We appreciated when our party was invited to the lighting of the holiday tree in the hotel lobby!!!  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Chatwal and will come back in the spring.

title: Perfect location for theaters
text: This is the first hotel I would recommend in the theater district.  We took a chance on the Chatwal and were pleasantly surprised.  We've stayed at the Peninsula, the Ritz Carlton and others in the city,but given the weather, wanted to be within walking distance to the theater and reasonably close to Penn Station. Our first impression was of the small, very contemporary lobby and it was packed with people waiting for their rooms to be ready. Rooms are guaranteed to be ready by 4 PM.  Ours was available around 3:30.  The desk staff do their best to expedite things but don't count on an early check-in. Check your bags and head out to explore the city.  Our room was well appointed, with technology that was easy to operate.  The shower had great water pressure with a rainfall shower head. The bed was very comfortable.  Breakfast in the hotel's Lamb's Club was excellent. Try the Dutch Baby pancake with apples and creme fraiche and there is still no bagel better than a NY one !  Michael , the bell/doorman is a gem.  He is welcoming and very helpful.  Next time we come to town for theater, the Chatwal will be our first choice.

title: Don’t do it!
text: They lure you in with a 5 star status, we have no idea how they got the status.  It has gone from bad to the worst it can get.  The lobby is ok, but way too bright to sit and enjoy.  The room is the worst we have ever stayed in and we are Platinum members.  We paid for an upgrade to a “Grand Deluxe”, I cannot even imagine what a regular Deluxe would be.  We have a view of a wall and can barely turn around.  I cannot wait to leave, that’s all I can say.  The staff is very indifferent and you may as well have never stayed in a Starwood for the way they treat you and we have been such loyal customers, enough that we are Platinum.  We did not get an upgrade because they say they are sold out even though when we get online we clearly see they have rooms they could upgrade us to.  This is so disappointing and we will never stay here again, not sure I can make it through the 3 nights we have here.

title: Pleasantly surprised !  W'ell Be Back !
text:
What a great hotel !  Before this trip, I had never heard of The Chatwal. We usually stay at the Ritz Carlton by the Park.  The Chatwal popped up on the AMEX Fine Hotels and Resorts option, and since we planned to see some shows, it was in a great location.  

The staff was warm and friendly when we arrived, and gave us a brief summary about the hotel amenities.  We grabbed a cocktail at the bar, and went to the room.

The room was on the third floor and it was awesome.  Closet space was abundant, and well-organized.  The bed was spectacular, and the bathroom was spacious.  Three words that I never thought I'd say:  "Heated toilet seat."  Wow !

Breakfast and dinner at the Lamb's Club was fantastic. Food and service was excellent!

Checkout was simple and pleasant.  

Overall, this was a great surprise and I am so happy we found The Chatwal.  We will definitely return.

title: Great choice if you want Times Square area.
text:
Location, location, location.  If you are looking for a boutique upscale hotel in the Times Square area of NYC this is your property.  Lots to like about this hotel but it comes with some clear issues.

Service is better than average.  Everyone is very nice and friendly starting with the doormen and client relations staff and includes the bartenders and staff at the lobby bar and lamb's club restaurant.  The art deco design is cool and you feel the moment you enter the hotel that this place is different but in a good way!

Our original room was one of the smallest rooms I have slept in.  It is efficiently laid out with a very attractive bathroom, storage area, and a really comfortable bed. However,  it was almost impossible to have two adults get showered and dressed in the room at the same time without running into each other.  The GM was able to get us into a larger room (junior suite king) on a lower floor the next day and that room was what I would expect for $1000+ a night.  The hotel is mid block on 44th so rooms are dark with no real views (not an issue for us just trying to be descriptive).

If you don't need/want to be around Times Square there are other options alternatives that should be looked at.  If you want to be close to the action and broadway than feel free to check this place out.  Keep in mind standard rooms are very small (i mean very) and upgrades may not be available. Service is very welcoming and everyone is invested in making sure your stay is a great experience!

title: GREAT HOTEL!
text:
Upon arrival we were escorted by the bellmen to the lobby. My kids and I loved the doormen and their politeness.

Elizabeth was great in checking us in, very professional, good humor. We all felt at home. The kids loved the lollipops she gave them. She informed us of our amenities and kept on greeting us each time we saw her by our names. We enjoyed the Lambs club restaurant and the spa!

We will definitely return to this hotel when we are next in the city! highly recommend this hotel!

title: ゆっくりできました
text: フロントに日本人の方がいたので、夜遅い時間でしたがスムーズにチェックインできました。タイムズスクエアに近いのに、とても静かで、ホテルに帰るとその日の疲れがとれてゆっくりできました。お風呂にバスタブはなかったですが、レインシャワーだったので満足できました。あと、嬉しかったのは、ウォシュレットがついていたこと。ホテルの方はみんな親切で居心地良かったです。また、行きたいホテルでした。

title: Heart of Midtown Tucked into a Quiet Street
text: If you've previously visited NY, you most likely want to stay away from the busy and loud Midtown scene. BUT, if you are looking for a very centrally located beautiful hotel near the theater district. Chatwal is a hidden treasure! Once you cross the threshold, you have stepped back into a time of glamor and service. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that had a murphy-bed. Perfect for my husband, myself and our teen daughter. The hotel offers a car service that can take you to restaurants and theaters in a 3 mile radius. The rooms are nice and have everything you need. Even items you didn't realize you needed, (like dark washcloths provided specifically to take off make-up). The bar and lobby is cozy and lovely with a 40's deco vibe. The bartender takes pride in making your drink to perfection, which was lovely to come in from a long day of sightseeing in the city and stop in the lobby bar before getting ready for a night out. We really did walk EVERYWHERE when we were there - even on drizzly days- which they provided us with an umbrella. The Chatwel knows that creating a luxury experience requires hiring professional staff that can maintain that concept throughout. Which they do. From the doormen and drivers to housekeeping and front desk, they all work together to create a seamless, high-quality experience. It was perfect.

title: We LOVE this hotel. They are SO welcoming, and this visit was as great as always.
text:
Whenever we come to New York City to bring our grandchildren to see a Broadway show we love to stay in this hotel. This last trip was as great as always. prior to our arrival I had corresponded with Elizaveta Morozova of guest relations. When we arrived, the doorman greeted our granddaughter by name. She was thrilled and fell in love with the hotel. When we arrived at the suite, there was a handwritten note to our granddaughter welcoming her. The note was tucked into the arms of a Lion King stuffed animal placed on the bed for her. There was plate of cookies and a box of artisan chocolates for her as well. 

     The doormen, especially Ali Abde, and the front desk staff all greeted us like old friends every time we came back from dinner or a show, When we bumped into the housekeeper on the second day, she told our granddaughter how happy she was to have prepared the room for her arrival. The suites are a perfect  size for grandparents and one or two children and are amazingly quiet considering the theater district location.

title: A better-than-average hotel that delivers high-end service.
text: Service is the Chatwal's strong suit. With a minor exception or two (doormen too busy chatting each other up to operate doors), every member of the Chatwal's team that we encountered was professional and polite. Beyond service, though, there were disappointments. This is not to say that the Chatwal is a bad hotel, or even an average one. It is a luxury property outfitted with the bells and whistles that make luxury hotels great--in-room espresso machines, remote control blinds, butler service for pressing and shoe shines, and daily newspaper delivery. Even considering these perks, the Chatwal comes in, when compared to the city's other luxury stalwarts, as only better-than-average. The hotel's overall design is elegant, but certain elements are cheesy (cheap-looking stock photos of New York in guest rooms) or discordant (mid-century Noguchi coffee tables that seem otherwise inconsistent with the hotel's design vibe). More noteworthy is the fact that the hotel's "bones" simply aren't that great. We were upgraded to a junior suite that was plenty large but was laid out as a large rectangular box. The hallway-hotel-room effect was not made better by the fact that rooms on the 5th floor have small windows that let in relatively little light, making even the large-ish room feel dark and claustrophobic, especially during the day. For the money (and we paid for only a standard room), there are more luxurious options in the city. And (for me anyway) the other options have the added bonus of being farther away from the crush of Times Square. Having said all this, I'd be remiss if I didn't point out that bathroom lovers might swoon for Chatwal. The bathroom in our suite was a spacious stunner of a jewel box, all mirrors and chrome and dominated by a huge rainfall shower. It was the bright spot in our otherwise better-than-average room.

title: A blast from the past
text: The Chatwal is a clear attempt to evoke the feel of the classic hotel of old! The staff are particularly warm, friendly & helpful. Unfortunately, for the price, the rooms are rather small. However, if you must stay around times square, then it's one of your best choices.

title: Chatwal is a great hotel but sometimes not as much.
text:
A luxury property needs to be just that. No question/ no excuses/great staff and exemplary service. But on our last visit unfortunately that wasn’t the case. The entire staff needs to know how to act as a luxury property. 
St Regis punta Mita is a luxury property and although one is a resort and the other a downtown hotel - service should be the same. 
San Sebastián/marquis de riscal. Take it to another level. 
While I love the Chatwal, the service and staff attitude just needs to be improved.

title: Not worth the money
text: Let me start with, the desk staff, bell staff, and bartender were FANTASTIC. Super friendly, helpful, polite, engaging. One of the best hotel staffs I have met. However, for the cost of the room I’d expect to be able to get the shower warmer than luke warm and made the mistake of looking at the edge of the tub. Large amounts of mildew that I was able to wipe off with a Kleenex. Would have been fine at $200 a night. Unacceptable for $600.

title: Wonderful summer stay at the Chatwal!
text:
We had a special mom and son trip at the Chatwal over the summer.  The staff was attentive to him - which was lost on him, but appreciated by mom!  The hotel is beautiful in its art deco style and the location was great for us as we like to roam around Times Square.  

We are locals who like to have nice hotel-based stays once in a while.  We like to take advantage of in-room amenities and to play tourist in the neighborhood.  My son got a kick out of the television in the bathroom.  I was disappointed that there was no tub, but the shower was roomy with multiple showerheads.  I saw pictures of a tub on their website, so if this is important to you, I would check in advance when booking.  My son loved the modern touches - especially being able to control room features from the tablet: dimming lights, opening curtains, ordering extra pillows, etc.  He had a blast!

Be warned the pool is very small.  We requested the resistance feature which makes it a lap pool - and my son loved it.  We did not go at a busy time, so we were always the only ones in there, but I could not imagine this pool during a busier time and having to share the space with others.  I think maximum capacity was 5.  

Everything was wonderful, my son loved his stay, which is most important to me.  Thank you, Chatwal.

title: Great location, cool vibe but service variable
text: Well appointed hotel right in the heart of the theatre district. The hotel is well appointed and has a lovely art deco jazz vibe. Service was very variable with some absent minded servers forgetting things or not knowing what Marmalade is. Also the room card keys demagnetise real easy so we had to get them remagnetised 4 times in 3 days.

title: Muy bueno, pero...
text: Es mi segunda vez en este hotel, me sigue pareciendo magnifico, me hospede en la hermosa “producer suite” que es espectacular, estar en su terraza es una forma muy especial de vivir NY, las atenciones del Sr. Manpreet fueron memorables… pero el resto del staff es frio, falta ese paso que convierte el servicio en algo inolvidable y este hotel no lo tiene, una lástima…

title: Amazing
text: Upon checking into the Chatwal I was amazed.  Everyone was so nice! I wasn’t feeling well and as soon as I checked in, the fro t desk staff brought 2 pots of tea for my sister and I.   We loved the room and the terrace was fantastic.  Being a gold member, I would have liked an upgrade, but the room, although small, was perfect and I ended up spending lots of time on the beautiful balcony.  We had a late dinner at the Lambs club bar upstairs and everything was delicious.   Went to bed that night, and for the first time in a long time, actually slept through the night.  The bed was very comfortable and the dark shades worked like a charm.  I was visiting NYC to celebrate my sisters 50th birthday and to see my Dr at Columbia.  After a fabulous night sleep and morning coffee and paper on the terrace, I took a fantastic shower in the amazing bathroom.  Unfortunately, while in the shower, my sister walked in and said my dad fell ill.  I had to get on the first flight back to Florida, cancel the Dr and all the amazing plans we had.  The staff at the Chatwal was amazing.  They didn’t charge my for the nights I was going to miss.  They went above and beyond to comfort me during the worst day of my life.  They had a car waiting for us to take us to the airport immediately. The support from the team went above and beyond what can be expected.  Not only that, one of the mangers contacted my travel agent to make sure all was okay a day later.  My sister and I made it back to Florida in time to say goodbye to my father, who passed just after we arrived to the hospital in Florida. I can’t thank the staff enough for all you have done for me.  Although I didn’t get to enjoy more than 15 hours at your hotel, I will definitely be back when I see my Dr.   You made me like family and for that, I am forever grateful.   Thank you to all who helped me.  I was in a state of shock and don’t remember any names.  But the impression you left on me will Last a lifetime.   See you soon. Thank you

title: A Welcome Respite near Times Square
text: The Chatwal is a top-of-the-line New York hotel that is not “stuffy.”  Every member of staff that I dealt with was pleasant and gracious, delivering excellent customer service no matter the situation. The Lamb’s Club meals are among my favorites in NYC. The dining room is well orchestrated by management and the wait staff are attentive and helpful. The rooms are up-to-date and well appointed. In sum, I got very good value for a higher-than-average price paid.

title: Pure Luxury
text: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Chatwa at the beginning of Octoberl. We were welcomed back with open arms from Michael, the doorman, who remembered us from our last visit! Sakura, the receptionist, was equally as friendly and warm. The impeccable service, luxurious amenities, great vibe, food and drink and the people make the Chatwal our New York City destination away from home. We, in fact, are always treated like family! Juan Espinal, the concierge at the Chatwal always greets us with wide, open arms and super service for Broadway show tickets, restaurant reservations and any information we need to make our stay very entertaining and pleasant. The location of the Chatwal is wonderful for Broadway shows and restaurants and close to Fifth Avenue for shopping. We met Mr. Ashish Verma, Vice President of the Luxury Division of the Dream Hotel Group. The entire hotel, from Michael, Peter, and Edward, the bellmen, to Sakura at the reception and Juan at the concierge desk, reflect his charm  and sincere interest in the guests. We look forward to our next visit to the Chatwal!

title: NYC Boutique at its Best
text:
Located on 44th street in the heart of midtown the location is great for theater, shopping and dining.  Hotel interior is very Art Deco and nicely done.  Gives off an intimate vibe which is something that's often times lost in NYC hotels.  

Rooms are small, but nothing unusual for NYC.  Room decor maintains the Art Deco feel, but have a lot of closet space that's hidden behind fabric walls.  Bed very comfortable.  Bathroom had a wow factor with very large walk-in shower and marble/tile everywhere.

Food at the hotel was pricey, but well done and bar service was great.

Upstairs bar (above lobby) is comfortable and stylish.  Only negative comment is that in the evening they have a DJ that can make it a bit loud for conversation.

Our room faced South which meant that it faced another building so was very dark.  I would stay again, but would ask for a North facing room for more nature light.

title: I did not feel "luxurious" here
text:
** I gave one star because this hotel is one of SPG luxury collections..so my expectation was higher than the regular 5 star hotels **

My husband and I booked this hotel to celebrate my birthday. We were of course so excited to stay this boutique hotel in middle of NYC. However, it ended up a very disappointed night here. We actually canceled the second night to make sure my birthday trip not to become a miserable one. 

The room
 we stayed was very small. There are a king size bed and desk...and no space left. They "upgraded" the room to the one with terrace but all you see is next building wall and all you hear is mechanical noise from air conditioners. Unless you are a smoker, I don't think you need this terrace. I just did not like the tired carpet with black stains...that itself made me feel not luxurious any more. We didn't enjoy staying in this room at all. It was far below our expectation.

The services
People working here are very polite and friendly. We never felt rude or anything at all. They actually sent a little birthday cake to our room which I really appreciated and loved it. But there is definitely lack of communication between staffs. I had to call twice all the time to get something I need (bags brought to the room after checked in, request for in-room water bottles (there were no water provided in the room), etc.). It seems they just simply forgot...because after a second call, they brought whatever I requested immediately. To cancel the second night, the SPG rep told us that the hotel manager requested us to give him some feedback when we check out. We agreed so we mentioned it during the checkout procedure but the lay at the front desk looked no idea what we were talking about so we just left rather than tting bothered to explain further... (I believe that was your idea, manager ?)

Oh it seems you can stay with pet at this hotel. It seems someone left a dog in his room at night and the lonely puppy barking and screaming probably for 3 hours. The front desk said they were trying to reach to the owner...but just couldn't...I understand it is not their fault but it just shouln't happen at this level of hotel...

部屋はとても狭くキングサイズベッドとデスクでいっぱいという感じでした。
カーペットは古くシミがあり、ラグジャリーな感覚は得られませんでした。

title: The room was so dirty
text: We didn’t stay long. We dropped our luggage with the bell staff and went to museums since our room wasn’t ready. When we got back to the hotel we were handed our keys and told our luggage was in our room. We went up and opened the door. The carpet was covered in stains and I didn’t even want my suitcases in this room let alone me and my husband! There were piles of dirt in every corner and the room was like a tiny dark dirty coffin. No luxury here!! We called our travel advisor at American Express and changed hotels immediately. The staff was rude coming and going. When I explained the room was dirty they said well that’s the only room we have available. It was shameful.

title: Nice Property
text: I stayed here for two nights.  The staff was gracious and helpful and the room was clean.  It’s a good location but a bit too close to Times Square.  This would have been a 5 star rating but for the wait staff in the bar, who were not as knowledgeable and attentive as the staff in the rest of the hotel.

title: A great stay at a great hotel
text: This is an excellent hotel great location and service is always with a smile. The restaurant is outstanding. We had breakfast included every day and the food was delicious and there was a lot of food to enjoy.

title: A Very Special Luxury Boutique
text:
Our stay at the Chatwal was a wonderful surprise in the heart of the theatre district. One block away from the chaos, crowds and lights of Broadway, the Chatwal is an oasis of sophisticated modern art deco design, luxury , staff attentiveness ( thank you concierge Carol) and attention to detail  often missing in today’s over-priced “luxury” hotels. 

The many five star trip advisor reviews,  for the most part, accurately describe the positive Chatwal experience.

title: 1 Bedroom King Suite "Library Suite"
text:
My husband and I stayed in a 1 bedroom King Suite for 10 nights - our assigned room at check-in was the "Library Suite".  We payed for our room with SPG points (a high number in order to get the suite).  This room featured two full bathrooms, a bedroom (with desk/chair/armchair) and a sitting room (with desk/chair/sofa/coffee table).  There is a Murphy bed in the wall which I assume can be opened if you need to stay in the room with children.  This could be a nice option because there are two full bathrooms.   The Retro style decor was fitting for a dark room with very little natural light (views of close-by brick buildings and no sunshine ever directly enters the rooms so after 10 days we were really missing the light.)  

The bed was comfortable and we were glad there were 2 bathrooms because we used them as him/hers because the countertops were way too small to share one bathroom comfortably.  Excellent rainshowers with good water pressure, toilets are Totto with integrated bidets. Housekeeping was kind and friendly but the finishings were starting to feel tired and heavily used (carpet was quite worn).   Room was right off of the elevator and we had a neighbor a few rooms down the hall with a yapping dog for a couple of nights.  

Although the room was sufficiently spacious, there was not actually a real closet - the only real closet was full of the mini-bar/safe/extra bed linens/coffee maker and they had installed a separate wardrobe, which was fairly small and low-hanging.  This won't be a big deal if you're only staying 2 days but for a 10 day stay or if you're bringing kids we were short on hanging space (though there was plenty of dresser space - one in each room so my husband and I each had our own.)  

There were ipads and other techie things in the room that didn't really do much - or at least nothing useful - we still had to go around the room shutting off lamps and lights one by one each night.  Additionally, our cable TV didn't work for much of the stay - they finally fixed it the last couple of days but without apology (On Demand movies are $20).  Also, the free wifi is nice, but it bumps you off constantly without telling you and my husband and I both burned through our data plans because we didn't realize that their wifi system had kicked us out - I highly recommend checking you're on each time before you start navigating.

Upside to this hotel is that you can catch just about any subway train to anywhere in Manhattan within a few blocks (I'm not a big Times Square person, but certainly, it's a convenient location for seeing shows or catching subway trains and it's just far enough off the main drag of Times Square such that it's not noisy.) 

The hotel restaurant is fantastic - we ate there repeatedly at breakfast, lunch and dinner.  The lunchtime pastrami sandwich in particular is truly special and they have fantastic cocktails.  I can see this being a convenient spot for a business lunch.  And as far as Manhattan hotel restaurant prices go, it wasn't a rip-off - the restaurant was actually full for most meals, likely because the food is truly great.  Service a bit slow, so don't expect to have a quick bite - but if you have the time, it's a nice benefit.

The free use of the red Chatwal Mercedes with driver was really nice - if he's around he'll take you anywhere within a 20 blocks radius (give or take).  Lobby staff was also friendly and helpful (they capably helped me with a few package related issues).  Late at night there's no doorman and I struggled to open the heavy lobby door myself with my heavy suitcases in tow and for anyone with mobility issues you should know that there are about 8 unavoidable steps up/down to get in/out of the building.  During the day, doormen were helpful and friendly.

In the last 9 months alone, we've stayed in 3 different 5 star hotels in Manhattan in the  (and two non-five star properties) and this one is on par with the other two five star hotels -each having their pros/cons.  This one isn't my favorite and I'm not sure I would make an effort to return (would prefer to keep trying different places) but we had an overall very positive experience and as fas as NY goes, this is a safe bet.

title: Hidden Gem in the Theater District
text: Usually stay at the St Regis, but Starwood concierge convinced me to give The Chatwal a try. Nice, small, boutique hotel with a lot of charm and a rated restaurant in the lobby.  They pressed my suit at 10 pm on a Sunday night—definitely one mark of a great hotel.

title: Nice Spot in Times Square
text: I avoid Times Sq. but had to stay for a short trip for logistics. Nice hotel - friendly staff. No room upgrade for a gold elite member - rooms are small and a little dated, but all things considered it’s not a bad option for Times Sq.

title: A treasure in the theater district
text: We just spent the weekend in New York and fell in love with this hotel. The rooms are very nice size for a New York hotel, and the bathrooms are particularly large. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. The lounge on the second floor is a real treat and welcome addition to the area. The hotel was only a half a block away from Times Square, but is just far enough away to be extremely quiet and one of the few hotels are I literally heard no noise at night.

title: Extraordinary service
text: I arrived in New York on a rainy afternoon, feeling a little under the weather. I asked if the room I had booked had a bathtub. They informed me that it did not, but that they would see what they could do. After a few minutes, they found me a room with a tub and immediately sent me hot tea up to my room as well to help me feel better. Everyone at the hotel was attentive and friendly from the doorman to the maids. The bathroom offered excellent bath amenities, and the beds were extremely comfortable. They offered turn down service and complimentary waters as well. It was also in a central location and was just two blocks from Times Square. Compared to other hotels near Times Square that I have stayed at, this hotel was quiet and clean, with great service. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Hidden Gem
text: We frequent New York City often for weekend gets and usually stay at the Mandarin Oriental and decided to change it up for a last minute trip. We decided to try The Chatwal as we’ve passed by it many times. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was and the kindness of the staff. The room was very comfortable and had many of the amenities that the Mandarin offers. Will definitely come back again.

title: Akmed and a private rooftop terrace
text:
We stayed a few nights in a suite, and then decided that we loved the location and hotel so much we would extend and moved to a beautiful suite with a private terrace along our room, as well as a private rooftop terrace.  
The Chatwal is by Time Square, but yet still feels off the beaten path.  It's a great location that doesn't require you to be front and center. 
I cannot say enough about Akmed.  I apologize to our butler, but Akmed was the epitome of class and service.  I pretty much assumed he was our butler, and wouldn't have wanted it any other way.  
The Chatwal is a discrete oasis in the city, while still being centrally located.  Perhaps they are too polite to treat you any differently if you show up in jean shorts, a tank top and flip flops, but I felt welcomed and taken care of.  
Do make sure to take a dip in the saltwater pool.  There is a lifeguard on duty to make sure there are no mishaps in the 4' pool...but it is incredibly relaxing. 
I have been to NYC more times than I can count, that's how I can say with certainty that this a place you won't regret adding to your travel plans.

title: A Very Wise Choice - The Chatwal West 44th Street
text: We already had a number of SPG points and were looking to book accommodation for our first trip to New York. Manhattan was our selected location and beyond that we had no information. The luxury hotels were a bit more expensive but provided excellent value for money. We booked 5 nights on SPG points and another 5 nights at the prepaid rate. After one day of exploration we realised how central and how peaceful this hotel was. The breakfasts were 20% more expensive than the surrounding breakfasts but the quality was twice as good, we found this out a bit too late and would recommend including breakfast in your booking. The restaurant food and the bar food were of excellent quality, the only criticism is the wine selection was poor. The accommodation was of a very high standard and spacious. We would definitely stay in the Chatwal again. Easy walking distance to Bryant Park, Central Park was reachable if you paced yourself. and all of the best shops. Avoid Macy's such a disappointment. Manhattan is kept very clean as are the shops, congratulations New York.

title: WOW...what a truly amazing hotel!
text:
On West 44th street, forget you are yards away from the chaos that is Times Square, this is a wonderful place to stay in NYC! A true home from home. Outside the hotel frankly is uninspiring to say the least, but once you enter, go up the steps to the lobby, you are transported to a world of the very best in inn keeping! Charm, grace, beauty and history! This is truly a beautiful property, an art deco transformation, so very well done on all counts and in all areas. Customer care and service is of the highest level, and each and every staff member cannot do enough for you! The rooms are sublime, we had 'The Chatwal Suite', a beautiful one bedroom, two bathroom suite with a large outside patio full of plants, flowers and lovely comfortable patio furniture to sit on. We had morning coffee out there and pre dinner drinks each evening, blissful!
Absolutely flawless in every way! Special thanks to Carol the Concierge, Sukara on reception, Benjamin in the restaurant, Michael at the door, and our Butler whose name I have unfortunately forgotten, apologies for this. Truly a 6* experience, our new home in the big apple!

title: Great Location
text: Fantastic location. Great staff .Felt very welcome. Loved the terrace of our room, we enjoyed a few drinks there and the noise was paramount to the ambience of the situation.  Weather was very hot but room and hotel amenities well air -conditioned.

title: Our New Home in New York City......
text:
Over the years we’ve stayed in many hotels in NYC, and while some, The Ritz, The Plaza, The Waldorf offered nice stays, it never felt like “our Place”... I just wrote it off as NY is too Big, to Bustling... to know you... not at The Chatwal. We felt like family and like we were home right from the start and remained feeling 
like that as we hugged our Doorman goodbye and got in our Car Service to leave. 
This is not an overwhelming property, but rather a chic, eclectic boutique that captures Art Deco days from the past. Indeed you think the elevator will open and Clark Gable or Humphrey Bogart will emerge. 
It’s a hip place and makes you feel hip just being there. 
We reserved The Producer suite with an adjoining Deluxe room and it was really special. While not cheap by any means, it was fair compared to what you become accustomed to paying in NY. 
This Suite is beautifully appointed and has two Terraces,  one on the main floor and one up a Spiral Staircase that leads to the roof and has terrific outdoor furnishings. Breakfast or an evening nightcap surrounded by New York and the glow of Broadway is truly unique to this property and this room. 

But, our adjoining was a Deluxe King room, and it was wonderful if you are just taking a normal space. It was larger by NY standards and the rooms are terrifically decorated, with rain show

Even though you are only steps away from Times Sq, the hotel is a quiet escape from the bustle and is totally soundproof to the bustle all around you. 

Everyone is terrific and obviously well trained at the Chatwal, but the bell staff and the front desk team truly stand out as stellar. Petro, one of the desk managers took the time to personally walk us up to our room to start our visit and the terrific service from the entire team continued from there. Most of the staff greeted us by name when we passed them. 

Also of note are some special touches that we really enjoyed. 
- a Red (hotel theme color) Mercedes availible on request as a house car
- Chocolate and champagne upon arrival
- a black “Make-up removal cloth” which my wife just thought was wonderful
- beautiful robes
- oversized towels
- fresh flowers in the room
- daily replentished bottled water and Crystal “Chatwal” embossed drinking glasses

and I’m sure I’ve forgotten some things that made us smile during the stay. I’ve certainly enjoyed most of these at some great properties, but The Chatwal forgot nothing. 

The Chatwal is our families new home in New York. The location, the facility, and, maybe most importantly the service combine with a personal touch that can only be achieved in a hotel of this size for a truly special experience. 

My highest recommendation. Great luxury and in the middle of Broadway.....

title: 2nd time NOT a charm...
text:
This is my second time at this hotel. The first visit was flawless, raved about it to all our friends..was even planning a group trip here in October. I have to say we have had nothing but problems since we arrived. It is currently 9:49pm and after a long day of walking and sightseeing we are sitting in our room #505 waiting for our room to be serviced. Our breakfast dishes still sitting in the middle of the room. Not happy. 
My daughter and I came into the city for a little getaway. We are SPG members and my husband booked a room for us here as a special treat. We arrived at the hotel to be told we were awarded the smallest bed in the smallest room they had, despite our SPG status. Too late to change hotels and after much fuss we were given a nice suite for one night as long as we were out the next morning but no room available til 4pm. Not exactly accomodating. At that time my daughter begged to stay another night and as I figured there would be no further issues we decided to stay. In the middle of a museum trip the manager from the hotel called to offer me a king bed room for the next 2 nights. I was good with that. We arrived back at the hotel to find luggage brought to room and had a nice night. 
Well..the following day my husband was called by the front desk (while we were in the middle of lunch) wondering why we had not checked out?? Say what?? What a disorganized mess. So I called the front desk AGAIN and was told they had no idea I was staying another night. Like seriously. The staff is courteous but definitely feel there is a great lack of communication here and huge problem with organization. These issues have really made this trip very stressful and we will NOT be returning to the Chatwal.

title: Great Stay at the Chatwal
text: Booked a room through American Express Platinum Fine Hotels program. Hotel accomadated the upgrade and the 100$ credit and the free breakfast the next morning at the Lambs Club Restaurant. The rooms were small but gorgeous and well appointed. The small attached veranda was a welcome delight. Fantastic rain forest shower head in a very modern bathroom. I would return to the Chatwal again when visiting NYC. Outstanding and convenient location most importantly.

title: Exceptional
text: Excellent friendly staff that’s always smiling and helpful. Perfect location for Broadway shows. Nice size suites, incredible modern bathroom, clean, quiet and courteous maid service. I would recommend this hotel!

title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel, Amazing Service, Outstanding Restaurant
text: I was just at this hotel this past weekend and had a great experience. I have previously dined at this hotel before but this is the first time that I stayed at The Chatwal.  The room is beautifully decorated and very spacious a NYC Hotel.  The staff was very attentive making sure everything was perfect from check in to check out. The Lambs Club is located at this hotel. If you are a fan of Geoffrey Zakarian you have the opportunity to enjoy some incredible food for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  I will definitely return to this hotel when I am in NYC  need to be near the theater district/ Times Square.

title: Great Hotel
text: An easy 2 min walk to Times Square show how close this gem is to the action. However inside the rooms are dulled to the sound of the streets outside. The staff are amazingly friendly and informative. The rooms are well appointed spacious and comfortable. Recommend a stay

title: Excellent Hotel!
text:
I can't recommend this hotel enough.  Felt thoroughly looked after and pampered the entire stay.  We were upgraded to a suite on arrival which was gorgeous.  Very spacious and fab amenities. Turn down service, providing bottled water and make-up wipes.

The hotel is in a great location just off Times Square and within walking distance of lots of sightseeing/attractions etc. There is a doorman always at the door who took the time to get to know our kids names and chat and make us feel very welcome and answer any queries we had about directions etc.  There is a red Mercedes car available for complimentary use, which we did once, again the driver was very kind, helpful and friendly.    

The hotel has a lovely relaxing ambiance and it would have been so easy to stay in our suite/hotel but obviously being in NYC we wanted to get out and about most of the time.

We didn't eat there but did spend a few hours at the bar one afternoon - bar service was excellent and the Manager seemed quite a character, very chatty and friendly and great at making/suggesting cocktails/drinks.

We were given a small chocolate gift each on check-out which our kids loved - it really is the small things that count sometimes.  The hotel thought of everything - bottled water, make up-wipes, umbrellas at the door, drinks/tea & coffee in the lobby.  We felt like VIP's and would definitely stay at the Chatwal again and highly recommend.  We have been to NYC four times now and this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in.

title: Fabulous Boutique Midtown Hotel
text: This hotel is one of my favorite places to stay in the city.  The rooms are lovely and the service is top notch. The restaurant is excellent.  And it is conveniently located.  All in all the hotel is well worth a visit.

title: Lovely private jewel of a hotel
text:
Recent “girls trip” to NYC for theatre and food.  This hotel is right in the middle of theatre
 District so you are able to walk to the theatres and restaurants.  Staff is well trained and friendly.  Small hotel so no conventioneers to manouver around.  Lambs bar was fun
For drinks and snacks.  Highly recommend.

title: Great stay despite early snag
text:
We booked a Superior King room- our bad.  We walked in and swiftly decided that room would be way too small for us.  If the closet door was left open at night, you ran the risk of running straight into it in the dark.  We quickly called back down to the front desk and we were able to upgrade to a junior suite- oh so much better.  Our friends, who checked in a few hours after us, had the same experience and ended up upgrading to a one bedroom king suite.  Very nice room indeed.  Now we know!

The rooms themselves have everything you need for a wonderful stay.  The bathroom is large and absolutely spectacular.  The staff, from the doormen to the front desk to manager himself, could not have been nicer.  

Would return again... and book the junior suite!

title: Meraviglioso!
text: Super hotel davvero a 5 stelle, ubicato in un edificio d’epoca , niente grattacielo dunque , ma grande classe e charme. Ineccepibile la cura nel dettaglio, dalla hall alle camere, queste ultime molto ampie , elegantemente arredate, incredibilmente , visto la posizione (43esima, che vuol dire Times Square), silenziosissime. Super consigliato.

title: おお、いいね！
text: タイムズスクエアの喧騒から小さいエントランスから入ると別世界が広がっています。アメリカのホテルはお金を出しても、汚くて古いものが多いですが、ここは内装もお洒落で、アメリカにいる事を忘れさせてくれます。しかしながら、歯ブラシはありません。スリッパ、バスロブ、シャンプー・リンス(ASPREY)   SPG PL

title: Excellent
text: Excellent rooms and services. Staff is also very kind. Excellent location in 44th W street between 6th avenue and Broadway Avenue in Times Square. Restaurant and breakfast are very good with Room Service.

title: Very stylish and excellent location
text: We stayed at the Chatwal for 3 nights. The hotel is incredibly stylish and the rooms are tremendous. We had a good deal through Expedia so it was quite reasonable for New York. There were great touches like coffee, ice tea or lemonade available throughout the day. There was a great car service that took you to locations within 20 blocks of the hotel (though the very accommodating driver took us further). There is a tiny pool and a hot tub in a stylish spa (unfortunately the hot tub was not working when we were there). The restaurant served really good food and the cocktails were great. The reason for 4 rather than 5 stars was the rather off-putting and aggressive attempt at persuading us to upgrade to a balcony room on arrival.

title: Hotel 5 * no coração de Times Square
text: O Hotel Chatwal realmente merece suas estrelas, desde a recepção no check in, o apartamento até o check out. Tudo muito limpo e lindo! Embora situado na rua 44, em Times Square, não se ouve o barulho da rua à noite, e em todo o hotel, há sempre uma atmosfera especial, muito silêncio e tranquilidade.  A recepção no apartamento inclui inúmeras garrafas de de água e uma carta de boas vindas. Há também um spa e uma piscina, que poderia ser maior, além de uma academia. Enfim, é um hotel caro, mas super bem situado e oferece todas as regalias de um 5*.

title: NOT a business hotel
text:
Although there are plenty of good things to say about this property, I have to give it two stars because some very unpleasant things happened during a recent stay. This is NOT — let me repeat — NOT a hotel for business travelers. This is a tourist, party-people loud and boisterous hotel. I travel to Manhattan about once a month for business. I booked the Chatwal because all of my favorite Starwood properties were booked. Never again. 

My top priority for a hotel stay is a serene sleeping experience. I need eight hours of uninterrupted sleep in order to effectively do my job. During my two-night stay, I was rudely awoken both nights by different disturbances. On the first night, the electric window shades went haywire in the middle of the night — opening and closing like they were possessed by demonic forces. And speaking of demons, the party people next door woke me up the second night smoking and drinking on their terrace until 5 am. I literally slept for a mere a four hours that night. The cigarette smoke was spewing in my window and the noise was unbearable. I asked them to quiet down but they did not comply. 

The think the worst part of this experience was management’s lack of response. The manager offered me 5,000 Starwood points to compensate me for a miserable experience. This never happened. No points. I’m sure he forgot. 

Listen, it’s not a bad hotel if you’re coming to NYC to party. The rooms are plush and the staff is super friendly. But you’re a half-block away from Times Square, the tourist capital of the US.

title: Perfektes Hotel in top location
text:
Das Chatwal war für uns die perfekte Wahl. Die Lage geht kaum besser, praktisch direkt am Times Square, aber ruhig in einer Seitenstrasse gelegen. OK, die Zimmer sind nicht groß und unseres war zum Hinterhof raus gelegen, insofern recht dunkel. Aber die Einrichtung sehr stylisch und großzügiges Bad mit dem hier oftmals beschriebenen und in der Tat ultracoolen beheizbaren WC. Man konnte das Fenster zum Hinterhof öffnen und lüften, was ich in den großen Hotels in NYC noch nie erlebt habe. Wir haben uns wie in einem Familienhotel mit persönlichem Touch gefühlt. Gerade in New York mit den großen Hotelketten wie Marriott, Hilton etc. war das sehr, sehr wohltuend. Nettes, hilfsbereites Personal. Der absolute Hit war jedoch das Frühstück. Tolles Restaurant-Design und fantastische hausgemachte Speisen. Die selbstgemachten Scones vermisse ich jeden Tag, die besten Rühreier mit Speck, frische Früchte, sogar der US-Kaffee war sehr gut. Und das alles ohne (blödes) Buffet, sondern am Tisch serviert. So lässt es sich entspannt in den Urlaubstag starten.
Fazit: Ja das Hotel ist nicht günstig, aber hatte alles, was ich mir von einem Hotel wünsche. Ich würde sofort wieder buchen!

title: Gem of a hotel
text: We went to New York to see several plays. The Chatwal is so convenient, yet it feels far removed from the craziness of the Theater district and Times Square. We chose it for the location and because we frequent Starwood properties. The room was modern, quiet, and large for New York. Helpful and cheerful staff. Highly recommend for an upscale hotel close to theaters.

title: Sweet.
text:
My wife and I decided to be a tourist in our own city and break the routine. 
The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of time square, near all. 
Upon our arrival we were greeted and welcomed. It felt like home. 
Ali the gentlemen who helped with our bags to the room was super nice. He showed where every thing was and asked to be call on if we needed any thing else.
The staff (front desk, housekeeping, concierge and doormen) were so friendly, attentive and helpful.
The small, boutique atmosphere are a true treasure in the middle of busy Times Square!
Room was made very specious, all you needed was in there. 
I could not have asked for a better choice, i have stayed in a lot of different hotels in my life time and this was one of the best. 
I cannot recommend this beautiful hotel more!

title: Broken AC in the NYC Summer
text:
Horrible experience! The hotel is beautiful with impeccable decor but its had to appreciate this when the AC is broken and your room goes from 78 to 81 degrees. We were forced to move hotels and had to pay an additional $1,400, In addition to the extra costs of taxis because we were further than we should have been. The hotel consistently lies and makes promises they cannot keep. 

Someone else from the hotel was going to contact me with some significant compensation due to the number of issues but never did. Not what you would expect from a Luxury Collection Five start hotel.

title: Quite Luxurious
text: Conveniently located to the theater district. Lots of modern touches, although I wasn't sure how some of them worked, like the high tech toilet. Very high quality amenities. Staff was quite friendly and efficient.

title: Stylish retreat in the middle of
text:
We traveled to NYC to see the play, "Harry Potter and the Cursed Child." I chose this hotel because it's part of SPG and we were able to use points and it is very close to the theater.  We were absolutely delighted with The Chatwal.  The small, boutique atmosphere are a true treasure in the middle of busy Times Square!  The staff were amazing from the moment we arrived until we departed on our 5th day.  I traveled with my 75-year-old mother and my 9 and 7 year old children and we all loved it.  They upgraded our room to a very spacious suite and it was extremely comfortable.  The towels are soft and the toiletries are lovely.  The staff (front desk, housekeeping, concierge and doormen) were so friendly, attentive and helpful.  The "welcome ambassadors", Michael and Sherman were especially amazing and made us feel like royalty.  My kids loved it so much, they made pictures for the staff and are already talking about when we will return.  I cannot recommend this beautiful hotel more!

The restaurant has a great atmosphere, but was very expensive.  The food was good, but not amazing and the service was not as friendly as it was in the hotel, so we only dined there once.

title: Beautiful and Great Staff
text: Beautiful Art Deco style Hotel. Large, renovated rooms with ever amenity and comfortable furniture and beds. Beautiful bathrooms with Toto toilets, large rain head showers with plenty of water pressure. Highlight is extremely helpful staff who will go out of their way for you. Restaurant very good - pricey for dinner but bargain for weekend brunch.

title: Restaurant and Romance NYC
text:
Well, we had a concert to attend in NYC at the Garden. We decided to stay overnight at The Chatwal and stopped in the Lambs Club at The Chatwal for a cocktail before the concert.  We already had dinner reservations at another restaurant for a steak dinner!

The waitress that greeted us was so welcoming- we ordered drinks and their “homemade” pretzel appetizers. She offered us a dinner menu- but we explained that we had other reservations.

Well, the pretzel appetizer was superb-the cocktails were made with finesse...so we decided to take s look at the dinner menu.  The rest is history- as they say. We stayed- the steaks were superb- the entire dinner was an experience.

We attended a fabulous MSG concert by Imagine Dragons and returned for a nightcap at the upstairs bar. Excellent personable bartender!

Our next trip to NYC will include a stay and dinner at The Chatwal.

title: We had a great time
text:
Every few years, my wife and I like to spend 3-4 days in Manhattan, seeing shows, visiting museums and eating. During those trips, we like to stay in the theater district (places like the Algonquin, the Millennium, and the Premier – all on 44th street). These places are without frills, but offer quiet, safe sleeping within walking distance of all theaters. On our recent trip, we decided to splurge for an upscale hotel in the same neighborhood for 4 weekday nights, taking advantage of a special which included a daily full American breakfast, and was priced as 4 nights for the price of 3 (total price was 2-3 times what the other hotels would charge for room only).

This was our first stay at the Chatwal, which is a small, boutique hotel on 44th street. Outstanding features included a wonderful staff, a one-time gift of nuts and chocolates, daily gifts of bottled water, a large, comfortable, quiet, room with good seating, a comfortable king bed, computerized lighting, and good temperature regulation.  The bathroom was very unique.  We had a late model Toto toilet (heated seats, wash and dry “down there”, and reliable flush), a spacious rain-like shower which included hand held spray and plenty of very nice towels. The only problem was the sink. It was beautiful and modern, but not very functional. The sink opening itself was small, as much of the sink area was composed of a slanting metal cover which did not reach the water. You could not rinse anything out in a sink of this design.
