Even worse, there was insufficient counter space for two people with the usual things the airlines force us to put in plastic bags. While the bedroom had plenty of electrical outlets, the bathroom only had one electrical outlet – a problem for recharging toothbrushes and shavers. Breakfast, in the Lambs Club restaurant was fantastic.

So was it worth it? Yes. I really enjoyed my stay. I will likely return. Just be aware that it’s a splurge, and that the sink didn’t sink my fun.

title: Hidden Jewel
text: Love NYC traveled for a long weekend.  Found this jewel of a hotel while my go to hotel is closed for renovations.  However this will be my new go to Hotel.  In the heart of everything.  Close to all main attractions in NYC.  Beautiful hotel, very friendly staff, beautiful rooms.  Arrived on the red eye room was not ready for check in however they upgraded me to a beautiful one bedroom suite with a garden terrace.  While they were preparing my room  they had offered me a room in the spa to freshen up.  I chose to wait in lobby where they gave me bottled water, a newspaper and then a morning Mimosa.  Highly recommend this hidden jewel you will not be disappointed.

title: Wonderful accommodations for a family
text:
We have stayed at The Chatwal on a number of visits to NYC - with and without our kids. The staff is wonderful! Michael - one of the bellmen - even remembered our sons’ names between visits! The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. (Our boys particularly love the heated toilet seats and cleansers. 😄) The hotel would receive 5 stars but for the restaurant. The service is INCREDIBLY slow. The servers are very kind but not the most attentive or speedy. 

Overall, the location and accommodations make this a wonderful hotel in the heart of Manhattan.

title: Two Nights on Broadway
text: We traveled up from Florida for a graduation.  Read about AC issues so called the day prior and desk said it was working.  It was going to be hot in NYC so we were a bit concerned.  Arrived and asked again and they said it was working, and it was. Perfectly.  We were on the 9th floor off the street  No view, but very quite.  Small room, but redone and beautiful.  No coffee maker, but free coffee in AM downstairs.  Wife has some mobility issues following cancer treatment (successful), so location was critical.  Walked to The Algonquin for a Martini in the afternoon then to Carmines for dinner one night and walked to Hello Dolly the second night.   Easy.  Somewhat difficult to get a cab on the street, so we used a private car the doorman had at the ready. Used a car service for back and forth to Newark Airport.  After the show, had a Martini made at the small downstairs bar to take up to room.  $27 with tip, but he made it perfectly:)  There is a larger bar on the second floor with music, but we missed that.  Front desk staff was very friendly and always helpful.  Butler service was nice surprise.  Invited for free drink one evening but did not make it. Headed to show instead.  All in all a fine stay and would do so again if a show was on our agenda. Oh, yes.  The bathtub with shower is an interesting design, beautiful, but very difficult to enter and exit.  Careful if mobility issues and ask for another room.

title: Top-notch Boutique Hotel in the Heart of the Action
text:
Beautiful jewel of a hotel a block away from Times Square in the heart of the Theater District. Beautiful design, excellent service, and terrific food & beverage programming.

We had an issue with the size of our initial room, and it was promptly and effectively addressed by management. We are very thankful for this.

In addition, Michael the Bartender is among the best we’ve ever encountered. Polish, enthusiasm, and talent to match.

Looking forward to returning later this year.

title: Great Overnight Stay
text:
We booked our stay last minute, literally !!!!   When we arrived at the hotel we knew it was going to be a great overnight getaway.  Our room wasn’t ready so the assistant front office manager brought us to their bar for some cocktails on them until they were getting our room ready. We had a great time speaking to the bartender. 
We were brought up to our room (I had booked) so we thought, they were kind enough to upgrade us to their Garden Suite!!!!!  I don’t have words to describe that suite except beautiful, from the decor, the bathrooms with rainshower heads, heated/bidet toilet seats and then the terrace, what a beautiful way to have a night cap and breakfast the next day.  Thank you to all the staff for making our overnight stay a Great One!!
We are definitely coming back with our children.

title: A hidden gem
text: The perfect small hotel in the middle of a large city.  Our room was extremely comfortable and for the first time when visiting N.Y., neither of us needed earplugs!  We loved the staff who were always greeting us with authentic smiles and engaging conversation.  We can’t wait to return.

title: Earns every star
text: Beautiful find. Conveniently located in the heart of the theater district, 1/2 block off of Time Square. The decor is Art Deco in style, the rooms richly appointed with an eye for luxury. From the linens to the towels, vanity table, it’s all comfort driven with an elegant flair. The staff is attentive and welcoming. We highly recommend the Chatwal.

title: Moderate
text:
If you look at the website of The Chatwal NY, you see a wonderful entrance, so you directly think:”WoW, this hotel looks great”
In reality, the entrance is not wonderful at all. It looks very shabby with plastic entrance (also the doorman is  often too late to open the door when you arrive)
We arrived at Sunday around 6pm and were longing for a drink at the great bar on the 1st Floor. However despite some other guests, the bar on the 1st Floor was closed (never saw this before in similar luxury hotel; oké you can expect this in a 2 or 3 star hotel but not in this hotel)
Normally when you order your cocktail or beer, you get some peanuts or olives to accompany but not here, here you have to order them apart. Not very service-minded as the drinks are quite expensive. 
The rooms may be nice but if you book a room for 2 persons with a queensize bed, you will regret this, as the room is so small you fall over your suitcase; beside the fact that you do not have enough space to hang your clothes in the closet.
Also the carpet looked filthy and run down. The bathroom however looked great and brand new.
The swimmingpool was so small, you d better say a plunge pool or jacuzzi.
One positive remark is the very friendly ladies of the reception.
It is a pity, we expected so much of this luxury hotel, unfortunately we will not return.

title: Another great stay!
text: Again staff absolutely make the place. So busy just a few blocks away but we felt so relaxed and well removed from the hurly burly of the city. We had a great room and the ladies that serviced our room were phenomenal. Michael who manned the door and took the luggage was wonderful- always with a smile on his face. The only small issues we noticed was that the last 2 days of our stay our room didn't get below 77 which was uncomfortable when we tried to sleep. Also with the turn down service if we were not there they only gave us 1 water on the bed side table and only my side light of the bed was on so I am not sure why this happened as there were clearly 2 people staying as they had seen us the times we were there when they came. Anyway not a deal breaker just puzzling.

title: 4 and a half stars, great stay!
text:
Service was a five star, room was a 4 star. As soon as we arrived we were treated amazingly from the top to bottom. Bell hops and doormen were super effecient and nice. And front desk reception was spectacular (Sakura was her name, I forget the names of the doormen but they were all awesome and helped with bags when we had any). One small complaint, I tried to order room service one night around midnight and the phone was busy for over twenty minutes, so I gave up and ordered delivery. Wasn’t a deal breaker for me and I ended up with some great pizza. 

Hotel room was a 4 star. We had a terrace suite, specifically the “Topaz Suite” bathroom tv was awesome toilet seat warmer was awesome, waterfall shower was awesome although it got the bathroom soaked every time we showered, terrace was amazing (no view but didn’t expect one) was nice to relax with a coffee or drink or magazine in the robes and slippers provided after a heavy day of walking. Window curtains were cool, iPad room control was a little much but it worked and was pretty neat. Bed was decent, pillows are extremely soft I would of brought my own (I prefer a more stiff pillow), furniture was a bit dated with some small rips here and there but was all clean and did the job. Also room was directly next to elevator and also hotel bar is near by, I couldn’t hear anything but we were out and about during the bars prime hours so wouldn’t know about that time. 

Over all great experience. 4.5 stars.

title: Redemption
text: Following the review left by Wendy, we went back to the Chatwal the following day.  They were very apologetic and provided us with room upgrade and a gift. The three nights we were there they couldn’t do enough for us.  We had Brandon the butler and the car at our disposal.  Fabulously decadent rooms, great location and really wonderful service from all of the staff.  We will stay there again even after the first nights problem.

title: Amazing hotel in a great location
text: Great 4 nights in this lovely hotel.  Well equipped rooms with ample sockets and fast wi-fi. wonderful staff who could never do enough for you and all very pleasant.  Location is ideal for Manhattan and wider NY.

title: Nice Hotel and Amenities
text: The hotel was nice with good service. The staff was helpful and very accommodating. The pool is a small swim in place lap pool, but nice. The rooms are small too. The washroom is nice. It was comfortable and quiet.

title: Great Hotel in New York City
text:
Have stayed at the Chatwal a few times in the last couple of years....beautiful, clean and close to theaters.
Nice pool and spa to rest in after your walk throughout the city and Central Park.
Always friendly and helpful staff....professionals!

title: Wonderfull Hôtel
text:
Very good location in Time Square . I love the Boutique Hotel feeling of the property
The staff was amazing and very helpful. 
I recommend to try the bar and the restaurant. The ambiance is amazing. 
I can't wait to come back for my next journey in New York

title: Quiet oasis near Time Square and Theaters
text: The Zen Suite for four days was a wonderful experience. Within walking distance of the frenetic activity of Time Square and the theater district, this luxury property was a pleasant surprise. While maintaining a consistent, wonderful art deco theme throughout, the tranquil, serene environment was mesmerizing. My wife and I are sensitive to noise and we had nothing to bother use while in our suite, or even on the terrace outside. I highly recommend it. We will certainly stay here in the future when visiting New York.

title: A great hotel in the perfect location if you're going to see something on Broadway!
text: Had the best one nighter here with my daughter, her best friend, and her amazing mother. We took our girls to see Harry Potter and the Cursed Child and walked to the hotel from Penn Station. Didn't need a taxi/uber to get to the theater or any great restaurants. We were thrilled to get an upgrade to a beautiful garden suite with an outdoor patio and sitting area. Everything was excellent (the comfort of the bed, cleanliness, amenities...including chocolates, and wonderful staff). Surprisingly quiet for being so close to Times Square. Would highly recommend.

title: Excellent Hotel in Theater District
text: My wife and I stayed for 1 night in the "Director's Suite" - and we loved it! Mr. Manpreet Kochar and his staff provided excellent service and the room was spectacular.  It was a short walk through Times Square to the theater.

title: The BEST
text: Our four day stay at the Chattel could not have been more pleasant. From our greeting by the bellman, our registration at the front desk, the friendly housekeeping staff...every member of the Chatwal team accommodated  our every need. The location is absolutely unbeatable for Broadway theatre since every theatre is in easy walking distance. The food in the Lamb's Club was fabulous---we ate there every night. If you want a luxury experience in the theater district this has to be your only choice. Jean and Jordan Nerenberg

title: Interesting
text:
Located in a relatively quiet street off Times Square, the entrance is low key and up many steps.  Check-in is casual and that sets the tone for the whole place.  Decorated in Art Deco style, there’s a lot of chrome and low lighting.  

Our room up on the 8th floor was very comfortable and large with plenty of hanging space.  It’s the bathroom that proved rather perplexing.  We’re used to Japanese lavatories having spent time travelling in Japan, but this one (and God knows why it was thought a good idea to adopt them in this hotel) seemed to have puzzled the plumbers who did the installation.  The seat was infernally hot, the jets of water needle sharp and when the blower sprang into action it was with alarming ferocity.  To cap all this off, the hand basins were of a design that made absolutely no sense at all.  Some sort of stainless steel shallow rectangular box, the first half of which was a slightly tilted shelf which the water did not reach and the back part so lacking in depth that it was impossible to really wash.  Most peculiar.  Style over substance in every way.

We ate twice in the dining room and the food was delicious.  Great menu.

title: Luxury Hotel At It's Finest
text: We stayed here for 4 days/3 nights. Not one single complaint. The staff and management were superb: friendly, accommodating, efficient and professional. The food at The Lambs Club was perfect at every service. We felt very much at ease and relaxed no matter where we went at The Chatwal. We also enjoyed a lovely manicure from Monique at the Red Door Spa. The receptionist, Reno, at the Red Door was also friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here whenever we are in MidTown Manhattan. Perfect location and a stay that was divine! Shout out to the doormen. You guys are awesome!

title: What a pleasure
text:
Just returned home following a 6 night stay  at this hotel in New York. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel very welcome. All the staff were friendly and approachable. The concierge recommended a lovely Italian Restaurant and even booked the table for us.We were offered hot apple juice on our way to the room by the doorman which was very welcome as it was a cold day. (In the morning there would be tea and coffee, see further down)
We booked a junior suit which was on the 3rd floor and looked out over the front of the hotel and opposite the Hudson Theatre. Fear not, it was not noisy in anyway. The room was very spacious and well equipped. Lots of storage and drawers so everything could be hung up or put away. The usual mini bar -well stocked plus an array of nibbles and snacks. Complimentary coffee from a snazzy little machine was included but no tea. (Remedied this by freeing a couple of tea bags from reception and using the hot water from the coffee machine.)The bed was large and comfortable with lovely cotton sheets. I have left the bathroom until last - this was the size of bedroom in some NY hotels. All glass and crome. Amusingly there was a TV screen in the mirror and of course a toilet that washed and blow dried your nether regions. What a lark! Finally the shower big enough for a whole family at once! Nice products Asprey of London. Worth mentioning too was the fact that the rooms were kept spotlessly clean. 
Our board basis included the American breakfast and this was served in the lovely Lambs restaurant. It was not explained what this actually entitled us to so we found on some days we had to pay a supplement which obviously then meant adding a service charge. We then found out that service charge was included so we ended up paying this twice. Also where we did have to pay extra instead of just being charged the extra where I presume we had chosen outside of our plan we were charged for the whole item. For example we were entitled to a juice. So we chose beet. It transpires that beet is not included. On the menu orange is $12 (which we were allowed to have) and beet is $15. So instead of being asked to pay difference we were charged full price. A very small point but nevertheless irksome. Incidentally the oatmeal and seasonal berries are a must! I miss it already.

title: Excelente
text:
Hotel muito moderno, a suite era enorme com dois quartos e uma sala e dois wc com sanitas aquecidas.Perto dos espectáculos da Broadway  mesmo no centro de NY.
O pessoal da recepção foi muito prestável tínhamos um engano n reserva que eles prontamente resolveram. A repetir

title: A wonderful hidden gem in midtown
text: We just returned from three nights at The Chatwal. What a pleasant surprise to find such a quiet oasis in the city.  The location was superb and the junior suite that they gave us was the perfect balance between understated luxury and comfort.   There were fresh flowers in the room which really added a nice touch.  The staff was attentive without being intrusive and it was just a nice relaxing few days which is exactly what we were looking for. We will most certainly be back again.  Thank you.

title: Very nice hotel with miserable restaurant service and food
text: The Chatwal has been redone recently and rooms are nice, hotel is quite quiet even though it's just off Broadway.  Service other than the restaurant is fine.  The restaurant has had consistently poor service, under- and over-cooked food, long waits for no reason, etc.  This was our go-to hotel in NYC but after staying there for New Year's Eve we've switched to the London.  New Year's Eve dinner was a five course dinner with wine pairings that started at 9.  I imagined a leisurely two hour dinner with my wife.  By 9:30, 3 courses had been served as well as all 5 wines being stacked up on the table.  Service was brusque and the goal seemed to be to finish as rapidly as possible.  At $450/person the dinner was a total disappointment.  Food was generally greasy although the filet was nice.

title: Great Visit at the Chatwa;
text: I loved my birthday visit at the Chatwal. It is an oasis of a hotel right in the heart of midtown. The service is excellent. The grand lobby is cozy and well designed to create a soothing environment just steps away fron the Times Square frenzy. The hotel staff is gracious, warm and friendlly. My spacious junior suite was perfect and well appointed. The hotel has less than 80 rooms making it intimate, cozy and upscale. It was really a perfect place to celebrate a birthday or spend the night on the town.

title: My daughters first visit to New York
text: I took my young daughter to New York for two nights to see the Lion King and chose to stay at The Chatwal because of its proximity to the theatre district.  We had a beautiful suite (Hollywood Suite) and it was a lovely and spacious room - two full bathrooms and a sitting room that has a Murphy bed.  I cannot say enough about the staff.  They made my daughter feel like a little princess.  Every time we entered or left the hotel the staff at the desk greeted her by her name and spoke to her.  A++ experience and thanks to the wonderful staff for making our visit special.

title: The Perfect Stay
text:
Amazing hotel near Times Square and walking distance of everything.   The rooms are very comfortable, very clean, and luxurious.   The decor of the whole hotel is fabulous.  

The staff is what really made our stay the very best.  Mr.  Manpreet Singh greeted us when we checked in and then by our names every time we met thereafter.  When he learned it was my birthday, a small treat and a birthday card awaited me on my return to the room.  

If you are going to NYC for a weekend getaway or for a business trip, you won't regret staying at The Chatwal!

title: Really nice hotel in midtown manhattan - excellent stay
text:
My wife and I stayed for 4 days over Christmas.  We mainly chose this hotel for being part of the SPG group and for the understated luxury. Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised by the location being so close to Times Square and the Theatre District. It's not far from the subway either.

Check-in and lobby services were excellent with the front desk staff being very friendly and recognizing our SPG Platinum status. The doormen and bell staff were also very proactive though we did not require help with our bags. In that respect, our immediate first impression was a good one, espcially in the art-deco lobby, which while small, is very tasteful. On top of it all, near the elevators, there was always hot coffee, tea and and hot apple cider after coming in from the cold. A very nice touch. 

The room itself was not overly large but was comfortable with hues of black and red. 
Thankfully in the room, there are many plugs, outlets and other, enough to charge all your devices, phones, portable wear... I was very pleased with how well our room was soundproofed as I barely heard any noise despite being on the street side.
 
The bathroom was a highlight being large for the size of the overall room and with japanese bidet. The large mirrors and black marble finishing give it a nice touch.

We never ran into the maid service once, with them magically sprucing up our room, everytime we were out. The staff was also very helpful in with a missing clothing item that got lost in one of the clean-ups. 

While this is not a review on the Lamb's Club, the hotel restaurant, we did eat there a few times for dinner, x-mas brunch and breakfasts. I won't go into detail here, but the food was quite good, though the service was a little cold, albeit professional and perfunctory.

A small caveat that is not really a fault of the hotel.  We found catching a cab or Uber in front of the hotel could be difficult due to it being on a one way street.  Cabs/Ubers need to go through the pedestrian traffic of nearby Times Square before reaching the hotel, so plan accordingly.

Overall I was really impressed with the Chatwal. The location is excellent being close to the popular tourist areas by foot. The hotel service was top-notch. It's definitely a more upscale hotel, so the price matches but it was well worth it.

title: Great boutique hotel
text: This is a small boutique hotel, so don't expect to be greeted at the door by a team of people ready to help you like at the Plaza.  Given that, it's pretty darn great.  We stayed in the Zen Suite, which was just incredible.  Service at the front desk was exceptional and our room was one of the best I have ever stayed in.  I would definitely consider staying here again.

title: Midtown, with some style
text:
The Chatwal is a boutique hotel, but stretching the category to a larger property. It has great qualities, including a very attentive and helpful staff. It has drawbacks, including a small and uncongenial lobby. We've stayed here twice before. Large rooms and the service quality have brought us back. Breakfast is also good.

You will find below that I've said the hotel is good with families. Actually in the usual sense, i'm not sure. They were very nice to our daughter, but she's 35. They were also impressively nice to our little dog. They brought him biscuits and asked if we had enough food. He thought the Chatwall was great.

title: Lovely stay
text:
I really loved it here. So close to Times Square we were right in with all the action. Walking distance to many things including Top of the Rock and Empire State.
In the midst of the busy city it was nice to be able to escape it all in the hotel. Really nice decor, friendly staff, beautiful room!!
Will stay again

title: 위치는 최고,,그러나,,방사이즈가,
text: 타임스퀘어에 있는 부티크 호텔,,골목에서,,백미터 정도만 내려오면,,ㅎㅎ 타임스퀘어,,위치하난,,정말 예술이다,,물론,,센트럴 팤에 있는 호텔급은 아니고,,그러나 휼륭한,,욕실,,정말,,유리화면에 티비 나오는 건 대박이고,,어맨니티를 슈트케이스 같은 데 담아 놓은거,,정말 아이디어 짱이다,,세련되고,,그러나,,대형 5성급만 다녀서 그런지,,왠지,,소박하다는 느낌,,숙박하는 동안,,비가 한번와서,,객실에서 가지고 나간,,빨간,,우산,,고급지다,,ㅋ

title: GREAT STAY!
text: My family and I stayed at this beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of times square from DEC 23-29. It was perfectly situated next to Broadway and 44th st, right where all the action is happening. Although it was very cold at that time, we had a great stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant had amazing breakfast food every morning. The housekeeping.turndown service was fast. we stepped out for 10 minutes and everything was made again. the gentleman at the concierge desk helped us find something to do every day and provided tickets to all the shows we wanted to see each night. The managing butler, Brandon Short, found out that I liked the warm apple cider they served in the lobby, and he made sure to bring me a thermos of it while we were packing before checkout. It felt like they really knew and cared about us during our stay. I would definitely book here again! thanks to the people at the Chatwal for making our stay so great!

title: Excellent hotel with excellent service.
text: I highly recommend anyone travelling to New York to stay in this beautiful hotel. Within walking distance to the theatre district, great restaurants.......if you are going to NYC to catch a Broadway Show.....stay at the Chatwal!

title: Déçu
text:
L’hôtel est judicieusement placé (Time square 2min) cependant la vue de la chambre (903) est pas terrible.
La piscine est minuscule (la photo de leur site est trompeuse).
Je m’attendais à un autre standing pour un hôtel 5***** luxury collection.
Je demande un lit double dans ma
Chambre pas possible plus une chambre avec lit double sauf si paiement de
350$ de plus par nuit.
Bref dans les hôtels de cette catégorie d’habitude le client est un petit peu plus roi...

title: Beyond Superb
text: My daughter and I have stayed at the Chatwal a couple of times now, it never disappoints!   From the exceptional service at the front desk to the wonderful maid checking in on my sick daughter.  I hardly give reviews of the places that we stay but when you are blown away by the beautiful rooms, delicious breakfast and knowledgeable concierge staff, it forces us to appreciate what a vacation should be! Even freezing temperatures and daughter getting sick couldn’t ruin our trip.  We were a quick 5 minute walk to Anastasia and Evan Hansen show.  I think the one word to describe the staff here is that they make you feel “special.”  We will be back again and again!!

title: Great hotel, terrific location ...
text: Stayed at The Chatwal for a night during a quick visit to NYC to take in a few shows.  Location is perfect, especially if your focus is Broadway.  Centrally located to tour other hot spots as well: quick walk to Central Park, shops on Madison Ave, Bryant Park, etc.  We took the train in to Penn Station and walked to/from hotel.  Hotel has a funky, art deco decor.  We stayed in a suite with terrace which was right against another building, with another adjoining room’s terrace right next to it.  No privacy so not sure it’s worth the upgrade (was there between Xmas and New Years and they still had pumpkins displayed on terrace so guess not regularly used).  Room itself was nicely appointed, clean, and quiet.  Room service and hotel restaurant were very good. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful.  Red Door Spa was also very good. All in all, wonderful hotel.  Will be back.

title: Hotel lovely. Rooms small and oppressively dark.
text: The rooms are black and red with little to no floor space to maneuver around. The bathrooms are black marble. Pinpoint lighting. Borderline depressing space. Admittedly, I found the beds comfortable. Did not enjoy spending time in the room. Hotel itself gorgeous, without a doubt. Service hit and miss. Sometimes we were just stared at by lobby staff. Other times, greeted and asked if we needed anything. Sat at lobby bar for fifteen minutes..after my order was taken by someone...until a manager came over and explained that lobby bar was closed and I should try the second floor bar. Bizarre exchange. Chose location based on search of Midtown hotels. This hotel is closer to Times Square than I would have chosen. Misleading.

title: Nice hotel
text: First of all, the location, if you want to walk around the Times Square area, is fantastic. A small boutique hotel with celebrity sightings during my stay. The staff is friendly, very helpful and professional. My only problem was that my room on the second floor was very noise because of the bar on the same floor. If you want a nice and quiet night, ask for a room on the different floors. I did complain during my check out and I received some credit on my bill. Overall, very nice stay!

title: 便利で快適
text:
タイムズスクエアから近く便利な場所にありますが、部屋はとても静かでした。
スタッフも親切で快適な滞在ができました。
宿泊したデラックスキングはそれほど広くはありませんでしたが清潔で快適でした。
部屋の設備は、ジェットバス付のバスタブとウォシュレット、ベッドルームにはBlu-rayプレーヤーがありました。
備え付けのiPadで基本的なリクエストやルームサービスができるので英語に自信がない私にはよかったです。
機会があればまた利用したいです。

補足ですが、古い建物なので入り口に階段があり、車椅子では注意が必要です。

title: Outstanding unique boutique luxury hotel!
text:
I've traveled the world lived in Europe, UK, Singapore etc.  This is the best hotel I've ever stayed.  Full stop.  The big hotel chains cannot do what this boutique luxury hotel can.  They know who you are and remember your name.  Security is excellent but not overbearing.  Staff are warm and friendly.  Food and drink are par excellence.

Location is perfect.  Just steps away from Times Square and Broadway.

Rooms are high tech state of the art.

I highly recommend it.  Only place I will stay in NYC.

title: Enjoying the Holidays in NYC from November 27th to 29th, 2017
text:
One word to describe my experience at The Chatwal: Awesome!  I've been coming with family to NYC during the holidays for over 20 years. Usually, we would stay at another hotel in Times Square; however, this year we decided we needed a venue that was out of the hustle and bustle of the craziness, but still in the heart of Times Square. The Chatwal went beyond our expectations. Starting with the bellman service, the front desk agents to the concierges, this hotel is all about customer service. In addition, our room was tastefully decorated and very clean. The one and only drawback was the restaurant in the hotel as the breakfasts were a bit pricey. Other than that, my family and I intend to make it a point to stay at The Chatwal on all future holiday visits to NYC.  

A Very Satisfied Guest!

E. Jones
Jacksonville, FL

title: Nice hotel but very expensive -- not a great value proposition
text:
Stayed here in December 2017. Had some business a block away so the location, half a block from the middle of Times Square, was great. 

The hotel is nice, but it was really expensive (I get that room rates fluctuate in NYC, but my rate was $600+) and the room is frankly pretty cramped, it felt a lot like a room in Tokyo, small to the point of being annoying (you accidentally bump into stuff, etc). Bed was very firm, I wish they'd just get those Westin mattresses. The room had a terrace but not exactly something I was going to use in December and you're basically looking up into an alleyway. 

In any case, the hotel is fine, has a lot of style, but I found the value proposition to be low. I'd probably not want to stay here with two people.

title: Review
text: I have stayed here three times and I've had good experiences each time.  Location is great and staff is excellent but rooms are very small for this price-point and since Hotel is not very large, kinda noisy with really no view.  Restaurant (Lambs Club) is pretty mediocre but lobby bar is nice and atmosphere is quiet and welcoming.  I like boutique hotels and will try and stay at Starwood places where possible but they would not give me Starwood points since I booked on hotels.com, which is the first time I have not received points when booking this way.  A nice place but I would expect a little more for $700+ per night.

title: PERFECT PLACE IN THE THEATER DISTRICT
text: No hotel in the theater district of New York could be more wonderful than the Chatwal.  Everything about it, from the outstanding staff to the lovely, spacious rooms exemplifies a unique boutique hotel with the outstanding features of the top hotel chains.  The location for theater goers is ideal, and the restaurant associated with the hotel (The Lambs Club) is outstanding for breakfast and dinner.  I've stayed before and I will be thrilled to stay again.

title: Great Location! Great Staff! Great Amenities!
text:
This hotel is great! My husband and I went on a short 3-day trip over Labor Day.

The location is right where we wanted it; near the Broadway shows and the park. From the amazing staff to terrific accommodations, this was a great find! As a Starwood Platinum Member, we also got great perks, especially for breakfast. 

On the breakfast note, I am not sure if they were short staffed for those days, but service seemed noticeably slow. And that is highly perceived when you contrast that against the city’s fast pace.

The room was great! Perfect size for a couple and the amenities were well taken care of.

If you need to do some business, internet speed was steady, reaching 15Mb of speed at times.

We also utilized their spa. I had a facial done before our flight back home and it was extremely pleasant and the staff was extremely polite and accommodating. My husband had a pedicure and said it was one of the best he has ever had!
The only word of caution is the noise level. We stayed on the upper levels facing the street. And while the scenery was nice, there were lots of loud noises coming from the street on Saturday night. Which made it quite hard to get a restful night sleep.

We will definitely consider going there again on our next NYC trip.

title: A gem in Times Square
text: If you’re coming to NYC to see theater this is your hotel...Beautifully appointed with tremendous attention to detail and a quiet oasis in Times Square short blocks to the theaters.  The staff couldn’t have been more welcoming and attentive and they genuinely from  the housekeeper to room service to front desk to doorman looked like they were happy to be there and worked as a team.

title: Elegant Surroundings in a Boutique Hotel
text:
Rooms are well appointed. You can tell the attention to detail they take in the preparation for the guests.

I had a room on the 7th floor which appears that all the rooms on this floor have a private terrace with it (I do not think the others floors have terraces). Mine was a suite so the terrace was quite large. For Midtown Manhattan it was very large. See photos (in panorama).

Bathroom was similarly well equipped. It had the Japanese style commode with heated seat etc.  Glass walls with a hidden TV for those that spend lots of time on the throne!

Hotel has 9 floors so it is not big. Lobby had a strong perfume smell that I found out of place. Otherwise great stay.

title: This is a wonderful hotel - and a great location if you’re coming for a show
text: Came to the city to see Bruce on Broadway.  We wanted to be close to the venue as we were trying to avoid the cost of cabs.   This was our first stay at The Chatwal.  We arrived early but the hotel gladly found us a room - and an upgraded one at that.  The room was good size and very well equipped.  The hotel lobby bar is fun, but don’t miss the hotel-related bar at the Lambs Club.  The hotel is about half a block off Time Square- which I was concerned about when I booked. My concerns were entirely unfounded as 44th St is quiet and I heard no street noise or any Time Square issues.  Nice Irish Bar a few doors down was a welcome find.  The mattress in our room needed to be changed out - and that is the only negative to an otherwise great hotel.  The staff is welcoming and available.   On this trip the weather was warm and we walked up and down town. From Joe’s Pizza to the Plaza.  No cabs as this hotel is perfectly located. We have already booked a second stay for our Feb., 2018 NYC visit

title: Delightful 2 Nights in NYC
text: A beautiful gem of a boutique hotel in midtown Manhattan. Spacious room full of great features, convenient location to both midTown and the theater district, a fine restaurant, helpful staff, quiet rooms.  A fine, intimate retreat from the hustle and bustle.

title: loved our stay once again!
text: We were repeat visitors to the hotel and again everything was perfect! The biggest plus for this hotel isn't the location(which is very good right in the thick of things)-its the staff! From the gentleman who opened our taxi door when arriving to the ladies who serviced our room to the front desk staff- all deserve gold for their genuine warmth and helpful attitudes.

title: Beyond excellent
text: The Chatwal is the best!  We were visiting NYC to see Hamilton and to celebrate my mother's birthday.  Everyone including the doormen, people working at the front desk, concierge, housekeeping, and people working in the restaurant were so kind, helpful, respectful, and really just personalized our experience.  The hotel is located near Times Square but is very quiet.  It really is a true luxury hotel!  I would highly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

title: Average
text: Not a luxury experience. The front desk was quite rude upon check in.  We asked a question about receiving our SPG points and the front desk had no time for us. The room was nothing special, but maid service was excellent. They advertise a house car... every time we requested the use of the car it was nowhere to be found. The lambs club restaurant in the hotel was fabulous, and the best part of our stay.

title: Doing the little things well -
text: The Lamb’s Club, and the bar and its Old Fashioneds lived up to the hype.  The rooms and service and amenities were great.  But I hadn’t read much about the breakfast and coffee, which were as good as you get in NYC and will bring me back.

title: Incredible Service and an Excellent Property
text: We rarely write reviews but this was a must to comment on. If you are reading this, don’t hesitate just book it, you won’t be sorry. The service is implacable, and we are spoiled coming from Dubai! Every member of the staff is pleasant, and do everything to make your stay feel warm and welcoming. The team did an amazing job accommodating a last minute request to extend a night the when the the hotel was fully booked. It is our hotel of choice now in NYC! Ask for the director’s suite, it’s the room you WANT! Thanks again guys, you were terrific. See you in our next trip!

title: Luxury.
text:
Steps to theater and every luxury and superb cuisine.  Rooms innovative and superb decor.  I stay here several times a year.  Have many favorite rooms.  MUST eat in Lamb's Club restaurant as much as you can.  Elizabeth
 Arden spa on the premises is wonderful.

title: Very Small Room for Its Price Range
text:
The Chatwal charges almost 4 figures a night. For this you get a room whose claimed floor area is 400 sq ft but feels much smaller. There wasn't even space for an easy chair in the room, while the bathroom felt cramped. I felt that I had wasted a lot of money, considering I could have had a similar room in any of several nearby 5-star hotels at half the price.

The service did not compensate. One morning, the fancy electric toilet broke down and wouldn't flush, with contents in the bowl. I reported this to the front desk clerk, who assured me it would be fixed immediately. But when I returned after breakfast, it was untouched. When I re-reported the problem to the same clerk, she wasn't even apologetic. Finally someone else came out from the back and told me the repairman doesn't get in until 8:30. (What would happen if you had a breakdown of whatever nature at 10 pm?) He didn't actually get to my room until 9 am.

The fancy Illy coffee maker broke down (water kept coming out); had I not been alert and unplugged it in time, it would have spilled all over the carpet.

title: Luxury or Not
text: Very nice hotel. Good service. We booked a deluxe king and were disappointed in the size. Hotel is in the theater district. If you go west 100 yards you are in Times Square, controlled chaos with some overflow on your street. Not a five star. Better bet to stay at Palace, London NYC or Kitano.

title: Luxurious without any pretense.
text: First, the staff was amazing.  Everyone was so friendly.  There was a small hiccup at the check in but the guest service manager was most apologetic and took care of things promptly.  The breakfast was outstanding.  We had a Junior Suite, which was plenty spacious with the automation that draws the blinds and order in-room amenities on an iPad.  I absolutely fell in love with the Seura in mirror tv so much so that I am having one put in my master bath at home in my upcoming remodel.  It was such a wonderful stay.  We will come back and bring our little dog with us.  Thank you for taking such good care of us.

title: Service outshone St Regis NYC signifucantly
text:
The staff at breakfast really looked after me so well, I really have to mention them first. 

Platinum SPG status honored with an upgrade to junior suite. 

Staff here were consistently gracious. The St Regis team should attend whatever training these guys go on to get up to standard. 

Hard product is decent with good quality finish and linens. 

Spa was of a pricing level to be expected and my massage was correspondingly good. 

A good all round stay and luxurious treat.

title: A Truly First Class, Deluxe Hotel!
text: We recently spent 5 nights at The Chatwal Hotel in a Deluxe King room. It is one block from Time's Square and all the craziness but when you walk through the doors into the stunning Art Deco Lobby, you feel  a tremendous sense of calm and comfort. It is almost as though you have been transported back in time to a more elegant era. The staff is delightful, the rooms gorgeous, and the restaurant divine! We loved the Lobby Bar, The Lamb's Club Bar, and being huge Geoffrey Zacharian fans, had to try the Lamb's Club Restaurant. We were not disappointed! Food was fabulous and service impeccable, but not overbearing! We will be returning next year.

title: First class luxury hotel
text:
This was my first visit to New York and had picked to stay at the Chatwal hotel. I am so pleased that I had. 

From the moment we arrived to the moment we left all the staff was so friendly and helpful with first class service being provided.

The hotel architecture and design was fantastic and was very impressed with the way it was done.

The room we had was amazing on the 10th floor.  

The location of the hotel being so close to Time Square made it an ideal location for any tourist to the city with great bars and restaurants only short walk away. 

I am sure I will return to New York at some other point and I would definitely choose to stay at The Chatwal before any others.

title: A swimming pool in NYC??
text: This is the first time we stayed in a hotel that had a swimming pool in Manhattan. Great hotel, fantastic team, superb service. Location is great if you want to be near the times square. Ineday we had breakfast in the room, one day in the breakfast room and another day at the Bryant Park. I personally liked Bryant Park since it was only a five minute walk away. Breakfast at hotel was also good but the breakfast room was very very cold which made it a little uncomfortable. SPA and gym were very good.

title: Overall Excellent but it Could/Should be better
text:
The hotel is very nice - excellent location for example.  Yet it could be better. I am SPG Platinum and I was not given an upgrade even though rooms were available.  Front desk indicated that no platinums were getting upgrades. Really? this violates the SPG TOS.

There is no club level...disgraceful for a 5 Star.  Room was nice but small...no bathtub....

title: Surpreendente, voltarei sempre!
text: Este hotel me surpreendeu muito! A localização excelente, há meia quadra da broadway e times square! Você anda 1 quilômetro e está no Central Park! O custo beneficio muito bom! O quarto que ficamos era muito limpo, ar condicionado maravilhoso, cama mega confortável, travesseiros macios! O banheiro um espetáculo à parte, assento do vaso aquecido e com ducha higiênica, televisão no espelho, duas pias, chuveiro grande, tudo muito moderno! Com exceção de algumas poucas buzinas pela manhã, o quarto era silencioso! A equipe sempre bem humorada e disposta a ajudar! O quarto que ficamos foi o King Grand Deluxe, 512.

title: Excelente
text:
Um hotel maravilhoso. Se você estiver passando em frente, não acredita no quão bom é este hotel.
Cama muito confortável, funcionários educados, um quarto super moderno com IPad para você ver o cardápio e outras coisas. 
Banheiro muito bom. Excelente banho, piso aquecido, televisão no espelho do banheiro (veja na foto), privada de última geração e tudo maravilhoso.
O ar condicionado do quarto é ótimo e o serviço de quarto foi a única coisa que deixou a desejar um pouquinho, mas nada que não me faça voltar.
Espero voltar em breve.
Localização ótima também.
Enfim. Recomendo!

title: Very nice
text: One of the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Staff was Awesome. The massage I had was fantastic. The rooms were Beautiful especially the bathroom. Best tub and shower I've ever been in. Would definitely recommend.

title: Wonderful weekend
text: The hotel is beautiful and the service was great from the minute I walked through the door.  Every staff encounter was wonderful, but Bellman Michael and Bartender Chris both went above-and-beyond.  Rooms are not large, but are well-appointed.  An unexpected oasis in the Times Square area-- the Chatwal is worth every penny.

title: Lovely place
text: It's physically much smaller than I anticipated. Small building, small lobby but it's a 1st class hotel. It's in a different league than most of the Starwoods in NYC and the price reflects it. Besides the amenities and service I just like how it's tucked away like a little refuge.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
I stayed at The Chatwal for eight nights and the entire staff made my stay feel like home.  From the moment I walked in each manager (Nitish, Manpreet, Tammy and Alec) took the time to personally introduce themselves to me and offer anything I needed to make my stay feel like home.  I had special requests and all were accommodated with a smile.
Every time I walked in to the hotel I was personally greeted by name and asked how my day was by the wonderful and friendly front desk personnel (Sileni, Salcura, Judith, sorry if I'm forgetting someone).  
The bell man was wonderful, SO helpful with anything I needed.
The car service chauffeur was great.
The room was clean and nicely appointed.  The bathroom was large and the rain shower was great. 
The room was surprisingly quiet given its location right in the middle of midtown hustle.
Hotel location is great.
Thank you all for making my stay comfortable and memorable and for making me feel right at home.  I look forward to staying at the Chatwal in the future.
If you're looking to feel special at a luxury hotel with professional and personal attention to detail definitely stay at The Chatwal.

title: Fantastico!!!
text: Posizione strategica nel cuore di Manhattan. In un palazzo del 1905 (la facciata è ancora quella di un secolo fa) disegnato da Stanford White, l'albergo ha un'atmosfera molto intima: l'atrio degli ascensori è un raccolto salottino, le grandi suite sono di un lusso discreto (abbiamo chiesto di vederne una!).

title: Six Star Stay!
text:
I'll premise this by saying that I travel about 150 nights every year so I'd like to think I know hotels.

The Chatwal is a knock your socks off hotel and this magical property is nestled behind perhaps the smallest and most understated entrance door in NYC.

The service is incredible, the type of service you don't have to ask for since the staff seems to know what you'll want and when before you will. The hotel rooms design and amenities are incredibly well thought out and tasteful. You might want to create a replica of the hotel shower in your house given it is perfectly designed!

Food, location, clean...I can keep going but in short my advice is, if you can you should! Thank you for an amazing family stay and can't wait for my next visit in NYC!

title: An oasis in the jungle of Times Square
text: First class attention from everyone on the staff. Modern rooms in a historic building. The lamb's club restaurant is also part of the hotel as well as a red door spa. Again, everyone associated with this hotel is professional personal and warm.  We will definitely come back! The only negative is the kitchen can be a little slow.

title: Like Cheers, it's a place where they know your name.
text: What a wonderful getaway in the heart of the theater district.  The butler took note of my preferences and I never had to ask for a thing.  The staff are mindreaders.  Room was a king looking to the front of the hotel but not at all noisy.  Amenities galore for a small, boutique hotel.  Starwood Platinum breakfast award was outstanding here.  Best Starwood breakfast going.

title: Great stay
text: We stayed at chatwal for one night. The receptionist asked what was the reason of the visit and we thought it was really nice that they had a letter saying happy birthday since we told them a month before it was my birthday. Another thing that really made us love this place is that when we told them we had a baby coming with us, they went our their way bought a baby bath tub so we could bath our baby. They treated us very nice. I recommend you stay here if you want to feel special.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: From the time that we arrived until the time that we left, the staff was friendly, helpful and very attentive.  It makes such a difference!  The room was large by New York standards with lots of modern amenities.   The lobby bar served very good appetizers and the hotel restaurant was surprisingly very good as well.  I highly recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.

title: Terrific staff, great hotel
text: Arrived very early in the morning after a red-eye flight, night manager found me a great suite.  Large terrace with a patio table.  Staff couldn't have been nicer, extremely accommodating.  Overall a fabulous hotel.

title: Quiet with Great Service
text: For a hotel that is so centrally located in the heart of Times Square, the Chatwal manages to be a quiet and peaceful oasis.  Larger rooms, attentive staff, and an intimate feel make this hotel a great escape from the madness.   Small things like TV in the bathroom mirror, heated toilet seat, and lemonade upon arrival make this place special.   You can even get Butler service if you really want to be spoiled!

title: Perfection in all level
text: Stayed there for a recent family trip to the big city. Great location. If you get tired of the all the craziness of Time Square, the hotel is a short walk into a quiet street where you can relax in the super comfortable rooms or play by the small pool. They tried hard to make you feel welcome unlike some other luxury hotels. The rainforest shower is one of my favorite. It makes you not want to leave the shower. Excellent breakfast at the Lambs Clubs. Will stay there again next time I visit.

title: Wonderful Staff, Great Location and Terrific Accomodations
text:
The Chatwal is great in everyway.  The staff: valet, doorman, bell men, front desk, bar, maids, servers at the Lambs Club restaurant were all polite, helpful and friendly.  I especially liked how they recognized and treated my wife and me as a Starwood Platinum member....get the breakfast as it is excellent and will save you big $s.  I've stayed at 100s of Sheratons, 4 Pts, A-Lofts over the years....using my staus and points at The Chatwal helps make the road warrior traveling worth it.

We were given the Ruby suite, #206.  The room was large by NY standards, all ammenities worked well and everything was top shelf...loved the bathroom.  Had a nice, albeit noisy (due to fans) patio.

The bar tenders are the real deal, mixologists.  Cocktails were excellent, although expensive even for NY standards.

We had dinner and then breakfast at the Lambs Club.  The food, service and ambiance were all excellent.  They can easily accomodate a quick meal prior to a show, or in our case, a nice romantic leisurely meal too.

This is truly a small gem quitely set in the center of Times Square area.

We can't wait to stay there again on our annual trip to NYC.

title: Who knew?
text: A very special hotel. The staff couldn't have been nicer, the room well appointed and surprisingly quiet. Fantastic location. You should have no reservations about making a reservation at the Chatwal. They made our 30th wedding anniversary extra special.

title: Nice Luxury Alternative to Big Time Square hotels
text: Once a year I need to stay in TIme square for a conference, and I have been tiring of the larger hotels right in the middle of the madness such as the W or Marriott Marquis.    I decided on the Chatwal based on its close location to time square but also being a smaller luxury property slight off of the busy streets and bright lights.   The hotel had really nice decor and very helpful staff. It has the feel of a smaller boutique hotel given the lack of crowds in the lobby or common areas of the hotel.    The rooms were also very comfortable with an amazing bathroom that included the Japanese style super toilets.  I also spent some time relaxing in the lobby and enjoyed some nice cocktails.  I will look to stay here next year when in NY for same conference.

title: Wonderful stay, great staff and super location
text: This was our second stay at the Chatwal, again during NYC restaurant week.  The staff is very attentive and service impeccable with a personal touch.  They recognise their guests and greet by name, which is a nice detail.   Location is excellent for venturing to the big museums, central park etc. but also good for a quiet rest at night.  Rooms are good size for NYC and very well laid out with all amenities.  Loved it and hope to be back some time.

title: Anniversary
text: The staff was extremely nice and attentive. You pay for service at a great hotel in the price of the room, and it was worth it. We splurged on a junior suite for 3 nights. A great location for anyone planning Broadway shows.

title: Wow!
text: Ho soggiornato in questo splendido hotel con la mia ragazza in viaggio di nozze. Accoglienza molto gentile e personale professionale. Stanze mooooolto belle!!!!!!!!! SPA, palestra davvero belli e puliti. Lo consiglio

title: Donovan
text: Did a lay over coming from Paris in April. Had such a great time we went back just for the chatwal/home. Everyone was great four our three day visit. From all of the front door men Michel to saliana at the front desk as well as all others.  Thank you carol that packed and ship of all of my wife's treasures.  Thanks to all. Greg

title: 5 star, great location
text: This one is interesting because from the outside it is pretty unassuming and unless you are headed there by design well, frankly, you would likely pass it right by. It is a block or two off of Times Square (which I typically avoid as my NYC stays are for business and I'm not typically interested in fighting the tourists in Times Square).  Having said that, because it is slightly off the main area you really can avoid the crowds if you want to - but, equally, if you are here for vacation you are right in the thick of it in a few minutes time.  The hotel itself is stunning and unique - has a bit of a very high end 1920's feel to it.  The rooms are upscale and modern.  There are two bars, both fairly low key. One is in the lobby itself but I recommend heading up one flight to the more private setting.   Food and beverages are top notch.  Service is exceptional.  This is a real 'hidden' gem (and Starwoods property if points are part of your equation.  If you want to treat your spouse and/or family to something world class you can't go wrong with this one.

title: Beauty in the details
text: This is a wonderful hotel, but you really have to appreciate the small things to get the full sense of exactly how wonderful it is. First as a heads up, the rooms are New York-sized. We were upgraded to a King room and it would still be considered small in any other part of the country. But hey, welcome to New York. We didn't mind. It's the small touches that make a difference. The theme is contemporary art deco, with touches of chrome and leather. Leather straps serve as doorknobs and drawer pulls. Shower amenities are displayed in a leather suitcase. And then there are the gadgets. A bedside iPad controls the lighting, temperature and music in the room. And the toilet is sure to be a big hit with Japanese tourists - it's got several features including a heated seat, several rinse cycles and a dryer. Beyond the room, the staff is accommodating and there is a great restaurant, the Lambs Club in the hotel as well as two very nice bars. Hang out on the second level bar for a sighting of Broadway actors after their show. All in all, I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Gem in the middle of NYC
text: This hotel is wonderful. I recently stayed there for 5 nights and then returned for 3 nights. The first time we had a lovely junior suite - with a large sitting area and huge bathroom. The second time I had a terrace room. The bedroom is average size and I enjoyed the terrace greatly. A lovely place to sit on a summer evening. Everyone who works at the hotel goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. Daily housekeeping and turndown service complement the incredibly comfortable beds and luxe amenities, cheerful doormen greet you and welcome you back each time you enter, and there is a fabulous butler service run by Brandon who is charming and gracious. The front desk was very helpful and accommodating when I needed to shuffle my dates. The location is near Times square and right in the middle of the theatre district. I can't wait to return

title: New York Hotel
text:
my wife an I recently spent 6 nights at the Chatwal New York Hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is well located on 44th between 6th and 7th Streets. We found our room to be beautifully appointed,  spacious, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom large enough for 2, free wifi and other amenities are greatly appreciated.  But most important the staff were fantastic, there were no exceptions.  My wife was ill for one day and they could not do enough for her. I don't remember all the names but Tammy from guest relations, Juan who was at the concierge desk and Manpreet from front office 
were among the exceptional whenever they were asked for assistance or advice.

title: New York Fun
text: Hotel was magnificent.  Staff was exceptional & very helpful.   Rooms were small but very clean.  Bathroom was amazing with excellent toiletries.    Awesome location for Times Square fun! Would definitely steady again.

title: A star in time square
text: Spent a long weekend at the hotel with my daughter to celebrate her birthday.  From the staff, to the location and hotel itself it was weekend.  We were on the 10th floors and could not hear any noise from Time Square.  Easy access home after the shows.  This will be my new home base in NY.

title: SUPERBE HOTEL LUXUEUX A COTE DE TIME SQUARE
text:
Magnifique hôtel très luxueux, personnel très chaleureux et très attentif. Restaurant gastronomique de grande qualité. je vous conseille de choisir une chambre donnant sur la 44ème rue car lumineuse et sans bruit car double vitrage. Les chambres sont très spacieuses et les salles de bain magnifiques avec jacuzzi.
Tout est mis en place pour le confort des clients.
Il a un emplacement idéale pour les visites : à deux pas de time square, à 4minutes de Bryan park,  8 minutes de l'Empire state building et de Rockfeller center, 10 minutes de central park....
Le seul inconvénient c'est qu'il n'y a pas de vraie piscine car elle a la grandeur d'une grande baignoire.

title: Quite and luxury just steps away from Time Square
text: Who knew you could be so close to Times Square and yet feel like your miles away ensconced in luxury and privacy?  From the moment we arrived looking a little worse for wear after many many hours of travel we were treated to exemplary service.  Not overbearing but quite confident service that comes from a well run hotel with great staff.  It's the small touches that make luxury hotels stand out.  The ever helpful doormen who greeted us warmly and remembered us. The  fresh brewed ice tea in the lobby was a welcome sight in the afternoon when we returned to the hotel after a day of shopping and exploring.   Pre-dinner drinks at the bar were expertly mixed and the experience was only amplified by the glorious art deco setting.  Hotel security was discreet but visible. The room was a good size with a well appointed bathroom- loved the Frette linens!  In the past I've stayed at the St. Regis and I will say their rooms/bathrooms are definitely larger.   If you're looking for a private, quite and understated luxury hotel close to the action (Times Square, Broadway shows, shopping on 5th Ave) The Chatwal is a great option.

title: Best time in Time Square
text:
I hated staying in Time Square last time, and Chatwal totally changed my experience. The hotel was upscale and quiet even thought it is a block away from Time square. The street was quiet as well. The room was very comfortable, and the staff is so nice and helpful. Our concierge Juan helped us get tickets to a show last minute and made sure we got there on time.

High recommend this hotel looking for the action yet want to make sure they can sleep at night as well.

title: A small but luxury hotel
text:
We stayed in the hotel over Easter holiday for 3 nights. I wouldn't have known this hotel if it was not on the Amex fine hotels list. I have yet to experience a bad surprise whenever we go with the Amex fine hotel selection (as much as it sounds like a marketing for Amex, it is true) so I decided to give it a try and I did not regret it one bit:

1. The room was very spacious given its central location in New York City. We had an upgrade by Amex so our room came with a sitting and study area.

2. The bathroom was incredible: spacious and tastefully designed. It uses one of those smart Japanese toilets.

3. Service was top-notch. Staff were polite and professional. We were particularly impressed with the doorman who always greeted us with a smile and provided any help we needed (many of the luxury hotels have doormen that just stood for the purpose of the hotel image). The concierge was very efficient in recommending and booking us a decent steakhouse within a short notice.

4. Breakfast was amazing. I have noticed the staff would always seat their guests in different zones to allow privacy. Of course in a busy morning it might get filled up eventually, but from my observation every morning: they do their best in optimising the privacy. I am impressed with this given it is only a small hotel and arranging seating this way will mean they need to have more waiters/waitress covering different zones (which may be deemed not economically optimised by some hotels). Another great example of its attention to details.

5. The hotel logo was skillfully embedded in the design. For examples, the complimentary bottles of water are branded with their own logo. A very small thing but by the end of my 3-night stay, I have grown to really like its hotel logo and start linking it to fine hotels.

Thank you for a pleasant stay.

title: Wonderfully, Luxurious hotel, with the kindest staff
text: I will always want to stay at this hotel. I am not sure anything will compare after staying at this exceptional hotel.  The service was extraordinary even before I walked in.  I had help immediately over the phone from Sakura and Kristen and then with follow up emails. So great that the first person I met at the hotel upon arriving was Sakura!  Manpreet (so kind to us and my mom), Sakura, Alex and Kristen and our butler were all so wonderful - so kind, so caring, and so helpful.  I also loved the Lambs Club and the ambiance of the lobby.  The doormen were so nice - always helping and so kind.  Spa was wonderful too.  Truly a 5 star hotel - A+. And we loved our room.  And so close to theater - I cannot wait to go back to the Chatwal!

title: World class
text: Yes, it is an amazing hotel.  Lots of detailed crafted aspects of design and service.  Most importantly, the service was genuine.  Nice people. Attentive.  This is what a world class boutique hotel is supposed to offer.  Try the private balcony rooms!

title: Luxury with warm hosts
text:
This is an oasis in the midst of Times Square and high energy NYC.  I was completely impresssed with every detail of my stay.

RECEPTION--Judith was cordial and helpful; she made us feel comfortable and made a great first impression of what was to come.  Jhoan at the door provided friendly, helpful assistance and cold water when we needed it most!

ROOM--Our Deluxe King was well appointed and comfortable.  It was so incredibly quiet, it was hard to believe I was a block from Broadway!  The bathroom was absolutely amazing!  It had a huge walk in rainfall shower with luxury amenities.

LOBBY--Carol, the concierge, was bubbly, charming and very knowledgable.  The restaurants she reconmended were outstanding.  Service at the bar was excellent.

LAMBS CLUB--I only had a snack & wine and was impressed with the preparation and quality.  Next time I need to dine there!

This lovely botique hotel did everything to make one feel comfortable, it is truly a special hotel.

title: As it says : a Luxury collection hotel
text: you will experience the difference between between a standard 5 stars hotel and a luxury hotel right on time square. I had booked it on a 3rd party reservation platform at a good rate. Lots of small things that make the difference: iPad controlled room (AC, lighting..), silent AC ( not a single decibel), a bathroom  you want to live in, with a shower toilet for those who enjoy it. large shower. helpfull staff, more than a standard 5 stars. Quiet room with fantastic bedding.  went for a facial at the spa: professional team as well there with quality products.

title: En plein cœur de l'action
text: Un accueil de très grande qualité et personnalisé; le service est identique. La localisation est plus que parfaite si vous souhaitez découvrir Time square. La décoration des chambres est soignée, la salle de bain est spacieuse et très bien équipée. seul Gros bémol, la chambre manque cruellement de luminosité et de vue, ce qui apparemment n'est pas le cas des suites.

title: Wow!  First time and was impressed!
text: I recently spent a few nights here on business and though I spend a lot of time in Times Squarer I had not stayed here before.  Very nice hotel.  High end service, nice rooms that are well appointed and also very quiet.  Overall a great couple of days and the reality is you can not beat the location.

title: Outstanding hotel in the theatre district!
text: The Chatwal is an outstanding property steps from Broadway! Well-appointed, fantastic service creates a comfortable vacation experience. The Art Deco theme is well done and has true ambience. Check out this lovely hotel.

title: 4th time visiting...eh, not as great as earlier visits
text: each of my previous visits, i was upgraded, ok, i can handle not being upgraded! my balcony room was ok, but very small, first time having that type of room. wud never book it again. balcony was very bland. added nothing to my stay, especially n poor weather. room was very dark. ipad technology is a nice new touch, very helpful. staff was very friendly, as always.

title: complete disappointment
text:
very bad service 
disappointment from the entry, no one to help you in the luggage
cheating in the published rates and forced me to pay too much extra to get a basic upgrade 
very narrow entrance and doesn't deserve to be category6 SPG
only advantage is the location

title: Amazing Stay
text:
My wife and I stayed in the Chatwal Suite for one night and it was amazing.  The large terrace was beautifully decorated with real flowers, bushes, fountains.  Even though it was only 7 stories up, the terrace was still quiet.  The customer service at the hotel was world class, including our butler, and room service which we received 30 mins after ordering.  

We were also late checking in because of going to a matinee show and needed clothes pressed for dinner...again those were done within 30 mins of us calling.

The location to Times Square, theaters, dinners....was perfect

The room was the cleanest and most well decorated we have stayed in!  

Can't wait to come back

title: Quiet Oasis in the Center of NYC
text:
My family and I chose the Chatwal for a quick weekend getaway to NYC.  
Despite being in the center of everything (steps to Times square, Rockefeller Center, MOMA etc.), once you step inside the hotel you are removed from the hustle and bustle and transported to a quiet oasis.  
The staff is excellent, with everyone from the front desk, bell service, housekeeping all striving to make the stay as exceptional as possible.  
With 4 people, we needed some extra room, which our junior suite provided.  With a single king, a comfortable couch and a roll-a-way bed, we were all sleeping comfortably, with enough room to not feel cramped.  
Overall, we had a great stay and a great weekend overall.  Thanks to the staff for making it so.

title: First Time
text: From the moment we entered we were treated as very special guest. The entrance was very welcoming as when coming off the street it was nice to come into such a beautiful space. The aroma of fresh flowers and the friendly staff. We were celebrating our anniversary and I had asked for an upgrade. Yana was very helpful and gave me the option to check the room to help make our decision.We wanted a room with a terrace and its a boutique Hotel so the options are few. Yana expressed our concerns to  Mr. Manpreet Kochar The FD office manager and he generously offered the Ruby sweet as an upgrade. And on top of that since we had to wait for the room to be ready he offered us a glass of champaign. So impressed with his kindness and willing to make our stay special. I can't tell you enough about the fantastic visit that we had. We did not leave the room except to see a play and have dinner at The Lambs Club adjacent to the Hotel. It seem like the entire staff new it was our anniversary. Will visit again soon. Also Tammy Yu was very pleasant and helpful above checking out. Awesome customer service from entire staff.

title: Great Doormen, HOT red house car and FAB dinner at The Lambs Club
text:
Haven't stopped by the hotel for a while, I was on my way to dinner at the Lambs Club. What a great idea for a RED Benz with Camel leather interior a perfect compliment to this trendy hotel. 
Irfan the driver was very informative when asked about the vehicle. 
Doormen Ali and Steven were all smiles and provided a warm welcome and conversation. 
Dinner at the Lambs Club was fantastic thanks to manager Tim and our waiter. Made for a WONDERFUL wedding anniversary memory. 

I will recommend to my high end clients to experience this gem of a hotel in the city.

title: Segunda experiencia en NY
text:
Hotel boutique muy bien ubicado y perfecto para visitar la ciudad. Ideal tener 📺 en el espejo del cuarto de baño de tu habitación. Segundo viaje a NY después de 14 años y he notado el elevado nivel de vida y precios $$. 
Recomendable: Si no quieres o no puedes gastar mucho dinero en visitas, una de estas dos opciones, son las mas recomendables para hacer fotos de la ciudad, desde lo alto

OneWorldTrideCenter Este edificio ha sido construido en el mismo lugar donde estaban situadas las dos torres gemelas. La visita a este edificio desde el OBSERVATORY, es inolvidable, no solo por el entorno que conmemora la caída de las torres en el atentado de 2001, si no por su fabulosa visita a lo alto de la torre (protegida con cristales), donde podrás ver toda la ciudad. Recomendable realizar la visita antes de la puesta del sol, para que la luz sea mágica. Tienes posibilidad de adquirir diferentes tipos de pase VIP, Standard Pass, pase libre durante la semana, etc.. al final todos te dan acceso a las plantas 101, 102 y 103, por lo que el Standar Pass es el mas ventajoso

 

Rockefeller Center en el Midtown entre la 5th y la 6th avenida

La visita a lo alto de la torre Rockefeller, será otra gran elección para ver desde lo alto el esplendor de Manhattan. Te ofrecen un ticket para visitar el TopoftheRock en lo mas alto del Edificio Rockefeller, y adicionalmente dedicar una mañana para visitar el MOMA museum y sus fabulosas tiendas de recuerdos, donde encontrarás cosas muy muy originales y curiosas

Desde aquí podrás aprovechar para pasar por la Radio City Music Hall, donde según el calendario programado, algunos actores empiezan a dar sus primeros pasos, participando en audiciones en busca de futuros contratos

Otra opción es subir a lo alto del  Empire State Building. Evidentemente, otra gran visita, pero teniendo en cuenta que lo mas emblemático de las fotos que te lleves de NY, es que salga siempre este edificio, será bueno tengas en cuenta que tal vez no merezca la pena gastar tu dinero en subir y visitarlo.

En su lugar y para que puedas hacer unas muy buenas fotos del Empire, te recomiendo subir a la terraza Lunch bar de la 230 5th Avenue, es gratuito, con poco turismo y es un buen lugar para tomarte una copa al aire libre mientras disfrutas del entorno gigantesco de Manhattan

title: Fantastic!! Only thing better is coming back and staying a second time !!
text:
We planned a trip to take our granddaughter to New York City to see the Lion King. 
We have previously stayed at the Chatwal and really enjoyed it. We booked a one bedroom deluxe suite and told them we were returning guests. They really rose to the occasion !! When we arrived with our granddaughter, there were gifts for her in the room and all sorts of special personal touches welcoming us. They couldn't have been more accommodating. At one point, our granddaughter got a paper cut and told the gentleman who brought our breakfast in the morning. The next thing we know, there was a knock on the door and the hotel manager was there with Mickey Mouse bandaids to make her feel better. A special shout out to Tammy Yu and her associates for service above and beyond. Great job

title: A gem of a hotel near Broadway
text: One of the best stays we have had in NYC.  Wonderful staff, rooms are impeccable, and location is superb - a simple walk to the shows on Broadway.  We love the charm of this hotel - sort of a mix of Art Deco and 1920's flair - but all modern and in perfect condition.  Hotel has the latest technology - behind-glass TV in the bathroom, master light controls, rainforest shower, etc.  Loved the leather trim throughout the room, the tactile wallpaper, the charm of the decor, and the quality of the sheets.  Could not have been happier.  We had both late night drinks/food and breakfast at the hotel, and both were great.  Definite winner.

title: This is the place to stay if you are coming to NY for a show.
text: The hotel is fantastic; with comfortable rooms, a good bar, hip vibe, etc. But the location is amazing if you are coming to town for the theater. You can walk everywhere, and don't have the hassle of needing a cab, unless you want to travel far, which really isn't necessary.

title: 5 star service
text:
From the moment that you arrive until you check out the staff are all wonderful. They go out of there way to help you with anything that you need. The hotel is clean and has a nice restaurant and a bar on a separate floor. I would give the room itself 2 stars. A little small, extremely dark walls that look like construction paper. The bed was slightly lower than most hotels, it was a platform bed and also a little firm. There was a good size flat screen as well as a well stocked mini bar. The bathroom looked very inviting with its shiny floors, but they were extremely slippery. There was a heated toilet seat which I loved! The shower had a rain shower head with good water pressure and a hand held that wasn't on a bar to use as an alternative. Thankfully the shower was big enough to get yourself out of the stream of water to lather yourself. I am not a big fan of this type of shower. I was very pleased with the towels and the fact that they were big and thicker than most hotels I've been in lately. 
The hotel is within walking distance to Times Square and Broadway shows, but because of that proximity getting transportation in and out of the hotel was a nightmare. Due to the fact that we like to use car transportation we will not be staying here in the future.

title: A great hidden gem in New York!
text:
What a wonderful hotel in the heart of the theatre district.  From the moment you walk in the front door, to the smell of fresh flowers, you know you have found the perfect place.  The staff at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful.  Thank you Manpreet for all of your help.  The bartending staff was great as well as the housekeeping staff (I don't believe we waited for more than 10 minutes for anything we requested).  
The rooms were amazing.  We stayed in a junior suite that was so nice and comfortable, it almost made it hard for us to leave during the day.  All of our expectations were exceeded.  
This was the absolute best way to spend my birthday.  I could not have asked for more.  I wish we could have spent more time there and would love the opportunity to return.  Anyone looking for a luxury hotel that has a personal touch to it, I would strongly recommend The Chatwal.

title: Best hotel in NY
text: I travel to NY often and try to stay at the Chatwal whenever I can. Whenever I stay at a different hotel I am reminded of why I love the Chatwal.  My last trip I stayed elsewhere as the Chatwal was booked and ended up in a hotel with mediocre rooms and disinterested staff.  This trip I was back at the Chatwal!  So much better! The rooms are lovely (and recently upgraded), and the staff is the best in NY.  They are so nice and go out of their way to be helpful!

title: World-Class True 5 Star Hotel
text: I've stayed at many of the "best hotels in the world" and the service at The Chatwal exceeds most of them. Everyone, from doorman to maid to manager to front desk is professional and seems genuinely happy. The rooms are stunning - not easy to create a new and higher-quality feel and yet they have. The custom designed furniture and fittings are very creative and create the feel of a modern classic. Technology is everywhere, but discreetly hidden. The TV is framed so if it's off, you don't notice it. Power and multiple USB ports are tucked on the back of the nightstand - unobtrusive and extremely useful. The room is controlled using an iPad mounted on the nightstand - could have been annoying but it's been made simple and pleasant to use, including butler service, menus, lighting, ac, alarm, etc. Beautiful bathrooms with huge rainfall showers and top-tier amenities and who doesn't love a heated Japanese toilet if they're being honest?
