Food seems limited, then you taste it and realize it's fantastic. On my first stay, there was a mess-up with the booking service, not their fault. Yet they took responsibility for it and handled it superbly. I was immediately happier than if all had gone right in the first place. They universally requested that I return so they could show me how great the experience really is. For me they already had. I did return and they went way beyond anything required to make my stay exceptional. I was deeply impressed. This simply does not happen anymore, I stay in 20-30 properties each year. In reality, some 5 star hotels should really be high 3's, some if not most are really 4's and some are genuine 5's. The Chatwal is a smaller property off Times Square that I somehow hadn't heard of, all usually disqualifying characteristics for me, and it turns out to be the very definition of what a 5 start hotel really is. In the end, it comes down to service and for me the underlying feeling of whether employees are happy and proud or simply trying hard to present the right image. The Chatwal is a happy place. Goodbye to some very nice Manhattan 5-star hotels - sorry, you don't come close.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel steps from Times Square
text:
This was our second time staying at the Chatwal. We booked a junior suite for a weekend in New York. They upgraded us to a junior suite with a terrace. The terrace was as big as the room. The room is quiet with a nice bathroom. The staff was always ready to do whatever they could to meet our needs. We ate brunch at the Lambs Club which is a Geoffrey Zakarian restaurant at the Chatwal. Neither the hotel or restaurant are inexpensive but the quality of food and service are not a disappointment. 
The hotel is within a 10 minute walk to many theaters and restaurants.  
When I received the folio by email there was a charge for the Spa which we didn't use. I called and they removed it with no questions asked. 
I highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a special place in New York.

title: Could not be better
text: I was in this hotel with my wife for 3 nights. Is it truly the best hotel in NY. And i know because i stayed in many good hotels in NY. Not a huge hotel, so quite intimate. Truly excellent service. Wonderful sound proof rooms. Just simply the best. Thanks to all staff!

title: OUTSTANDING THEATER DISTRICT HOTEL
text: This was a great find for me in New York.  The hotel is so charming with it's Art Deco decor, and the staff was beyond wonderful in my estimation.  They went out of their way to be courteous and helpful in every way possible.  I will be staying at the Chatwal each time I'm in New York.

title: Schickes Haus
text: Das Hotel ist wunderschön. Die Zimmer mit sehr viel Geschmack und Technik ausgestattet. Gutes Restaurant und schicke Bar. Wunderschönen Lobby Bereich. Das Einzige Manko ist, das das Haus sehr tief gekühlt ist. Heftig klimatisiert.

title: 최고의호텔
text: 신혼여행으로 묵었던곳입니다 타임스퀘어와의거리도 가까워 밤에도 이동이좋았습니다. 또방컨디션도훌륭했고^^ 허니문이라와인도선물받았습니다. 정말추천드려요

title: Enjoyed the ambiance and excellent service
text:
If you are looking for a convenient hotel in the Theater District, this is the best.
Located 1/2 block off of Times Square and surrounded by theaters. 
I suggest using the hotel concierge (Juan is very knowledgeable) We called prior to our trip and he booked a luxury sedan (ours was a 750 BMW) with professional drivers. Our driver Steve was holding a sign for us at baggage claim. First time I touched my bag was to unpack. Nice greeting at hotel and pleasant front desk. 
Our room was luxurious, although small. It was nicely decorated with many amenities. Bathroom had a great shower and an awesome bidet toilet seat.
The Lambs Club serves excellent food. We only ate breakfast there but particularly enjoyed the menu and service.

title: Gorgeous hotel, wonderful service, great location
text:
We stayed in a basic room for 8 nights. 

The location was perfect for getting access to Times Square and seeing shows on Broadway. There's subway stations very close by as well for heading out to the other boroughs. 

The staff made us feel really special- they were so friendly, and eager to help us with anything we needed, and so prompt and efficient - anything we asked for we'd have almost instantly. 

The spa downstairs is lovely, and the pool and hot tub were fantastic to refresh after a long day out and about. 

Our room was definitely on the petite side, but that's not a surprise in NYC. The styling and details are beautifully done, and the toiletries really lovely to use. We did some basic rearranging of our room early on to maximize our use of space- the staff were helpful and accommodating with that too. 

Complimentary tea/coffee in the mornings and water/juice/soft drink in the afternoons were great touches also. 

It was wonderful to have such a welcoming home to return to in such an intense city.

title: A gem of a hotel in NYC
text: We stayed here during a recent quick weekend trip to NY to see a play and a concert.  We chose it based on location and online reviews.  What a discovery this little gem of a hotel is!  It was a five minute walk to the theater, and a ten minute walk to the subway to take a twenty minute ride to the concert at Barclays Center.  But even better than it's perfect location was the hotel itself.  We have never had a better nights sleep in NYC.  Our room was on the second floor and had a terrace, but was as quiet a room as we've ever had in NYC.  And we were only a half a block from Times Square!  Amazing!!  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  We highly recommend this hotel, and will stay here again on our next trip to NYC.  The only hiccup during our stay was that our in-room brochure stated that the bar was open until 2am on Friday and Saturday, and that a bar food menu was available.  We arrived around 11:30 on Saturday after our concert and ordered drinks, and told our server we might want to order something to eat a little later.  A little past midnight, we informed our server that we wanted to order something to eat, and were told that the kitchen closed at 11:00, and that it was last call at the bar, even though we had just witnessed a nearby table being delivered a food order. To their credit, our server managed to get us some warm pretzels from the kitchen, but we were confused as to why food had just been served but we were unable to get some.

title: Odd size room
text: We stayed in a junior suite, the room looks like a corridor and is very dark with a tiny window. The bathroom is even stranger, there was jacuzzi bath but no shower. Everything is design to make the odd shape look nice but nothing is practical, no room for toiletries in the bathroom, no drawers for underwear and shirts, the cupboard looks like a trunk that you would find on board of the cruise ship at the beginning of the 20th century, not the most practical for the 21st century! No plugs for charging phone and computer by your bedside. The bar seems nice although I thought the service was on the verge of being arrogant.

title: Bad choice
text:
I have  wrote on my other profile.

Avoid... not worth the money!!
Only near Times Square, but the region is far away of being interesting to eat or walk.
Poor in dining menu, just a few options.
The biggest problem, very noisy rooms, specially doors from the other rooms close 
Dont consider to invite people to meet, because of the small lobby and bar
Usually i dont write, but in this case i have to alert the others to check these important points before coming.

title: A quaint and chic hotel
text: Just a few blocks from Times Square though relative quite street, it was in an ideal location. We arrived before check-in time which was okay as they stored our bags and gave an estimate time with a follow up of a call when the rooms would be ready. The room was a ditsquinshed dark decor with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was elegant and had a standalone shower (rain shower) and seperate bath...very comfortable indeed. As there were many options for meals, we dined outside. You must try the Spa and pool which is downstairs. Highly recommend this hotel for couples for a relaxing stay, but close to what you need in New York and the staff were excellent and friendly.

title: Perfect location, perfect hotel
text: I booked through the Priceline secret hotel offering and was so amazingly surprised.  The staff, the service, the room and the location all was perfect.  Highly recommend it. Bed very comfortable.  Ultra chic and technology connected

title: Visiting family and there for shows
text: A boutique hotel close to Times Square, being an excellently located base for staying in the city. All the staff are so friendly and helpful including Manpreet and Nitish. Our initial room was on the front, which was noisy but they changed it the following day. Lovely bathroom, with heated toilet seat. Excellent breakfast that set you up for the day. The hotel has a real buzz to it, with live music, sometimes, in the bar. Art Deco decorations to the ground floor and bar. Their attention to detail extends to the majority of staff remembering your name when you go in and out of the hotel, welcoming you back each time. They even remember what shows you have been to. Highly recommended and we will return on our next visit to NYC.

title: Loved this hotel!
text:
I just spent a week in NYC,  We were looking for a hotel that had rooms with an outdoor terrace.  OMG!  We had a Jr Suite with terrace, and it was amazing!
The room service breakfast was really good. Make sure you check out the Japanese heated toilet seat....
The housekeeping staff could use a little training....that is the only thing that I could find any fault in!  But not enough to change my 5 star rating.

title: Broadway show trip
text:
The amenities and  staff of The Chatwal are extraordinary, but it's location combined with those that make The Chatwal lovely.  We were able to walk to all the shows we saw.   Our rooms were quiet, making sleep in the middle of Times Square bustle easy. I prefer small hotels with short hallways.  I felt safe and at ease at The Chatwal. 

The rooms are New York small, and for the same price, less luxury and security would make a chain hotel seem like a better deal.  But I got what I paid for at The Chatwal.

title: So close, yet so far
text:
Whatever you do, do not book this hotel through Priceline! We have never before had an issue with a hotel giving us two beds. This hotel graciously offered us a queen for two adults and two children!!!!!!! 
 We slept in a room with a view of a brick building and some soap bottles(as pictured above). Our room was the smallest we have ever stayed in. The front desk female was willing to walk me up to show me a king room for an additional 125$!! Plus 100 for a rollaway(wait what!?) ... the king room was still small. 
 It's disappointing as can be when you feel conned. How difficult is it to give a family two beds? It's sad that as often as we travel, we will never return to this hotel.
 The positives were the attentive bell staff and the location to time square. The area was dirty outside and not an ideal spot. 
 I know it's New York but the valet is 60 plus a night. It's better to uber or taxi it but we had family obligations in New Canaan.
  Safe yourself and stay somewhere else. Unless of course you want to spend the same amount of money as you would at Trump towers for a fraction of the experience. You can't compare in any way! We spent nearly 400$ for a closet size room.

title: Great hotel, very nice rooms, good location, excellent food
text:
+ fabulous bathrooms, very good breakfast (only a la carte), great with the car service starting at 2 PM taking you anywhere in Manhattan in a ratio of 20 blocks, very quiet although close to Times Square, very well equipped mini bar, big wardrobes, free newspaper of guest's choice every morning, nice ambience, friendly staff (although some a bit junior), nice little pool

- not all rooms have a view, actually none of the family rooms (you look into the side wall of the  building next to the hotel), there was nothing extra for the kids (no turn down, no treats, no kids menu etc.) as a matter of fact, it wasn't even possible to get a smaller portion of a regular dish...

title: Luxurious but dark and a bit soulless
text: I was so excited for this hotel and the staff were great throughout the booking, check-in and stay experienced. However, the hotel disappointed and I ended up moving to a different hotel for subsequent stays. I knew the location would suck (right in Times Square), but hoped the hotel would outweigh that. However, while it was quite opulent there just wasn't much personality to it and it was quite dark. The rooms were large - much larger than most hotels in Manhattan - but the space was often poorly used. So in all, this was still a very nice hotel but expensive, super touristy location, and dark.

title: Over promised and under delivered
text:
I was looking forward to staying at this hotel after reading all the reviews i had read on Trip Advisor. Unfortunately it did not live up to the hype. The second we entered the hotel we felt like we were an inconvenience to the staff. We weren't given the attention or service I would expect from a luxury hotel (and I stay in hotels all the time), instead we got rolling eyes when asking requests and staff generally ignoring us when possible. 

Having said that, the room was spacious and clean and well appointed.

At one point the toilet blocked and it took them an hour to come and fix it. Also, at one stage during our stay they were testing the fire alarm system. The alarm was going off intermittently and the light was flashing in our room. Given that there was NO communication that testing would be happening we grabbed our stuff and went downstairs to only then be informed it was a test. 

In  my humble opinion I think you can get more value for your money at other hotels in midtown, there are plenty of them!!

title: What a great find
text: There cannot be enough nice things to say about this fine luxury hotel. Minutes from Broadway, the convenience of not having to shuttle across town before a show was a godsend. The staff were the nicest I have ever met in the city, and I have traveled there quite a bit. The room was spotless, the amenities were off the hook. They really know how to make a stay in the city one to remember. Highly recommend!!

title: Sophisticated  Boutique Hotel
text:
This luxury collection property should be a poster child for Starwood's LC Portfolio.  This is small boutique hotel where the attention to detail has been perfected. The elegant seasonal decor sets the tone as soon as you arrive.  The staffs training is evident as everyone is in sync- all good vibes.  The concierge is amazing, great recommendations and great seats for the theatre. We picked this property because we were on a 4 day theatre trip, the location was perfect for this.  LAVISH bathrooms (didn't want to leave the bathroom).   Well appointed bedrooms.  My husband loved the complimentary show shine/polish,  the boxed delivery is a nice touch.  Nice restaurant and bar.
HIGHLY recommend this property. I look forward to returning in the fall.

title: Hotel exceptionnel a 2 pas de Times Square
text: Excellent hotel a 2 pas de Times Square mais dans une ruelle au calme. Le service est excellent, le bar branché et agréable et les chambres sont spacieuses avec une literie de qualité. Une adresse chic a ne pas manquer.

title: Donovan
text:
This small boutique hotel is like going home in a big city. We have stayed all over the world as well as most hotels in New York.  This hotel came as a big surprise for our short two night lay over on our way back from Paris. We are loyal to Starwood hotels and love the luxury collection hotels.
Every one from the door men/Peter the our private butler/tea where amazing. The most amazing part was when the night before we ask for bagels to take bake to a friend in Florida but we didn't make it clear that we would not be eating them our selfs at the airport. Even though it was six in the morning we left them behind. The next day they over nighted them to us with a very kind letter.  This made us very happy as well as our friend that received the gift. She lived in New York for many years and missed the fresh bagels.  Thank you to everyone and recommend the private car to the airport. All well worth the money.  Greg and Robin.  Thanks.

title: Bet Hotel to stay in New York City
text: The Chatwal totally understand customer service, wow!  From the front desk, bell captain, restaurants, room service, room decor, comfort.... it was an amazing experience.  Love that it is a block East of Times Square, and quieter.  I would recommend it to anyone wishing a Luxery experience.

title: Theatre district hotel
text: Very nice hotel.  We stayed here 4 nights. The location is excellent & the rooms very nice. The bar scene is very noisy in the upstairs bar so we usually had drinks in the first floor bar.  Much less noisy & you can speak easily. They have a small gym to work out & a small salt water pool with water you. swim against.  13-15' long

title: A shimmering gem in New York mid town
text: I recently stayed for 3 nights at the Chatwal in New York. The hotel is located next Time Square in a prime area. If you are lucky in the morning you can bump into some celebrities walking in from of the ABC studios in the corner. Everything works like a swiss clock at this hotel from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave. Hotel decoration is beautiful and the rooms are warm and larger than the average size in the city. The shower is large and the bath amenities are great. The Spa is also a discovery. The fitness centre is well equipped, there are several treatment rooms and also a pool. The Lambs club restaurant is excellent. A special mention goes to Manpreet, the assistant guest relation manager for his warm hospitality and for arranging to use the SPA facilities to get a shower and get changed before my long haul flight to Italy.

title: とても寛げました。
text:
タイムズスクエアから徒歩数分なのに、大変静かなホテルです。
お部屋もとても素敵で、お掃除も行き届いています。
スタッフの方々は皆さんフレンドリーな上に、対応が素早く、この点について特に驚きました。
子連れ旅行でしたが、大変親切にしていただきました。

ホテル内のレストランの朝食も、とても美味しかったです。
またぜひ宿泊したいです。

title: Excellent Stay in Times Square
text: The Chatwal A Luxury Collection Hotel in New York is an excellent choice for the discerning client who wants to stay at the Times Square area.  It is a perfect hotel for those who will be visiting NYC for Broadway shows.  The rooms are beautiful and luxurious and the bathrooms are pristine!  The staff is very friendly and the restaurant The Lambs Club offers delicious choices for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

title: Another awesome stay!!!
text: What a great place . Second time here and will definitely stay again. Love everything about this place . The location is perfect. We stayed for three nights. Walking distance to everything . Large rooms, luxurious bedding , awesome bathroom. Very clean ! Service is great!

title: Grossartiges kleines Stadthotel
text: Nachdem wir aus dem W-Hotel in der Lexington Ave mangels Qualität "geflüchtet" sind haben wir Bewährtes gewählt. Das Chatwal ist ein kleine Luxus-Hotel im Zentrum von Manhatten. Das Hotel ist maximal gepflegt. Ein Doorman kümmert sich sofort nach Ankunft um das Gepäck. Die öffentlichen Bereiche sind im Art Deco Stil gehalten. Der Empfang ist freundlich und schnell. Das Personal ist exzellent geschult und hat einen Blick für das Detail. Die Zimmer nach hinten sind für New Yorker Verhältnisse geradezu himmlich ruhig. Die Zimmer-Elektronik ist einfach zu verstehen. Das Badezimmer ist luxuriös ausgestattet mit hervoragendem Wasserdruck in der Dusche. Für Geschäftsleute das perfekte Hotel.

title: Perfect Midtown Luxury Hotel
text: After a frosty welcome the experience was very warm and pleasant. Very nice staff, great rooms of a good size, super comfy beds. This is our second stay here and love the central position - just off Times Square - but yet the rooms are quiet. Most family members love the heated WC seats!!

title: Super Lage, sehr sauber, Zimmer etwas zu klein !
text:
Wir waren jetzt zum 2mal hier. Die Lage ist einfach unschlagbar. In einer relativ ruhigen Nebenstraße, direkt am Times Square. 

Alle Broadway Theater sind sehr gut zu Fuß zu erreichen. Am Times Square pulsiert das Leben Tag und Nacht, die Atmosphäre ist super, besonders zur Weihnachtszeit !   

Die Zimmer sind für den Preis etwas zu klein. 

Aber das Hotel ist empfehlenswert !

title: Lovely hotel!
text: Fantastisk fine og store rom og meget god service. Bra spa anlegg. Flott beliggenhet. Fikk hotellskyss til togstasjonen på avreisedag, veldig hyggelig! Kommer svært gjerne tilbake hit ved en senere anledning.

title: Absolutely Awesome
text:
Great place to stay in NY, very well located and friendly staff.
As SPG Platinum, we received an upgrade to a suite vary spacious and amazingly decorated. Bathroom is outstanding!
The Lambs Club is an excellent place to dine and Jazz sessions on Saturday are a must...
Highly recommended.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
This is our first time here.  My daughter and son-in-law have been there five times previously and we were there as she was running the half marathon today.  Pluses- first and most important of all  is the staff.  Cannot possibly say enough.  Everyone we interacted with was superb but the doormen and the Bellmen deserve special mention.  Ali, who escorted us to our room, made it clear that  he was there to help in any way.  Everywhere you went you got smiles.

The room itself was lovely with only one shortcoming.  We had a Junior Suite that I received as a Starwood Platinum - more on that later.  It was roomy and the bathroom was incredible.  Two downsides - we were on the street side on the 6th floor and it was still rather noisy - and the window itself was very cold.  My daughter said they often ask to be placed on the other side of the hotel and it is much quieter.  Second is the lighting - like many other hotels lately, I'm glad I have an iPad to read from because it would be difficult finding enough light anywhere to make reading easy - especially for a 69 year old!

All in all a lovely hotel with the feel of a boutique.  We usually stay further away from the action, mostly the St Regis.  There are certainly pluses and minuses for each location.

The only two issues I had were at check-in.  I knew that the Starwood website had every type of room listed as still available for sale.  As a Platinum (for 10 + years), I am entitled to a suite yet it was not offered.  Some hotels honor the intent of the program and some don't and make you ask or push.  Sure enough, she spoke to the manager who approved it but after all these years, there is simply no excuse for making someone go through hoops to get what they are entitled to. Worse, I was told the Junior Suite was not ready yet but if I wanted, I could occupy a larger suite immediately for a surcharge.  When I asked what it would be, she told me $675!  No thanks. Again, a bad taste.

The other issue was when my daughter and son-in-law checked in.  If I was the owner of the hotel and I had a guest returning for the sixth time, I would be in shock if the front desk agent asked him if this was their first visit to the Chatwal?!  That is not how you make people feel valued.

All that aside, very good chance we'll be back as the hotel was lovely and the staff was simply incredible.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: We stayed here for a week during Thanksgiving holidays (sorry I didn't write a review earlier), but this was the best place I've ever stayed in New York. I hadn't ever heard of it, but when it was recommended my my Amex Travel Agent and being part of the Fine Hotels and Resorts, I was in. We had the entire 10th floor to ourselves. Our butler waited anxiously in the hall waiting for something to do. Or room had 2 bedrooms, a dining room, living room, 3 bathrooms, and it was the Penthouse, so we had a circular glass staircase in the corner of the living room leading up to the roof top terrace. Our terrace off of the dining room/living room was also nice, but the rooftop terrace was much better. Not only was it furnished with sofas, chairs, a bar, grass (fake grass of course), but we had a view of Times Square from up top. Everyone who worked there was very friendly and made you feel comfortable, this hotel only has 90 something rooms, as compared to the Hilton in Columbus Circle, which has over 2000 rooms. So we felt special. Everything was in walking distance, and if we didn't feel like walking, to hotel Mercedes would bring us where we wanted to go, for free. I didn't see any of the other rooms so I can't comment on those, but The Producer Suite? (I think that's what it was called) was excellent.

title: A perfect getaway spot for romance in the city!
text:
If you are looking for a luxury hotel with all of the amenities that bring class and romance to a couple's getaway in NYC, and yet doesn't break the bank as much as other options you're looking at, stop your search and book a Deluxe King room at the Chatwal.

From the moment we walked in to the moment we left, the friendly smiles and top notch service was 100% on point. 

My husband and I live close to the city and used to spend a lot of time there, so we were picky when choosing a midtown spot to stay that would be walking distance from the theatre and other places we wanted to go for our two nights away, and we didn't want to be in the middle of the Times Square craziness. We were taking a break from being parents for a bit, and just  wanted to enjoy being spoiled together. We wanted something perfect!

The Chatwal did NOT disappoint us! The room was high end, clean (housekeeping did a phenomenal job), and big for the city! The bathroom was AMAZING and a jacuzzi tub just wonderful. Bed super comfy and even the robes were cozy. 

The only negatives to consider (that still weren't deal breakers for us) were that the walls are obviously very thin in terms of noise from guests next door, and there wasn't much natural light in our room on the 5th floor. However the blackout curtains let us sleep later than we have since our baby was born! 

The gentlemen handling our car and our bags were just the most friendly guys, and Brandon the chief butler is in love with what he does and it shows! 

We dined and drank wine in the Lambs Club bar late night and it was phenomenal. Definitely recommend for a classy and low key atmosphere. 

Room service for breakfast was delicious and prompt! But everything is expensive, so keep that in mind. 

Anytime we asked for something such as a bucket of ice for champagne or help with working our jacuzzi tub drain (silly oversight on our part), it was delivered and handled within 5 minutes with a smile!

We have fallen in love with the city all over again and we definitely will be back to The Chatwal soon.

title: Perfect spot for New Years
text: We had a wonderful time at the Chatwal, perfectly located.   Service was excellent, and we enjoyed the bars and the restaurants as well.   The rooms are modern and swank, and we had a nice view as well.   Bathrooms are clean and modern and bright.

title: Chatwal Hotel
text:
This hotel has everything you could want in a visit to New York City. It's location is a short walk to Time Square, theaters are across the street and others are in walking distance. An array of dinning options are located nearby if you choose to venture out. If not the hotel, has the Lambs Club, its menu has something for everyone and the bartenders make excellent concoctions!!
  Our room was a Jr suite and included a continental breakfast. It was roomy and had a great view overlooking 44th street. The bed, pillows and other amenities made us feel at home. 
  As great as the hotel facility was, the best asset was the people. The people working here are courteous, kind, helpful and go way beyond what they are paid to do. I am grateful for housekeeping for finding items I left behind and turning them over to the front desk. They packaged them up and returned them to me the next day. 
  I would highly recommend staying at The Chatwal. We look forward to our next stay and visiting New York City in the fall.

title: Love Love Love Brandon the Butler
text: What does a business traveler do in winter when on a long business trip with many stops all of the sudden every button on the warm winter coat has fallen off and the hotel sewing kit just won't cut it?  If you are en route to the Chatwal in NY City the answer is easy. Just call Brandon the head butler.   Sounds a little posh?? Rethink it. This is the kind of service every good hotel should offer and the Chatwal consistently does. Called Brandon before boarding my plane in London and am confident that by the end of my business day in NY, the unfortunate button situation will be all sorted thanks to Brandon and his team.

title: Theatre and Shopping weekend in the city
text: Central locations for theatre and shopping in mid town.  Clean lobby with friendly staff.  Concierge gave us the best recommendation for a special pre show birthday dinner.  Rooms, by NYC standards are roomy with good bath products available. We will return to visit the Chatwal soon.

title: Superb location just off Time Square
text: I opted to stay at the Chatwal based on the reviews I read and the location just off Times Square.. Its a superb location in Mid town that allows you easy access to all the key sites in Manhattan.. It is a welcoming and warm boutique hotel and my request to have 2 connecting rooms was easily arranged.. I had paid for rooms with a terrace but didn't have these as I needed connecting rooms.. I felt a little short changed but it was a concession I had to make.. check in was easy and we had a great welcome gift of chocolates, cookies and a bottle of wine which was well received.. The facilities are great and the only thing I felt missing was a few extras in the bathrooms such as cotton buds etc.. I would recommend the hotel for a place that is luxurious and feels like home.. very comfortable and easy to pop back to when needing to drop your bags off or get a short rest..

title: Favorite NYC hotel
text: I have stayed several times at the Chatwal with both my husband and my daughter. While our experiences have not always been perfect, any comment to the staff regarding a problem is promptly met with an incredible apology and solution. The amenities are amazing and the attention to detail cannot be matched. Although the hotel is incredibly close to Times Square, you cannot hear the noise. I won't stay anywhere else in NYC. The Chatwal is amazing.

title: Great location yet an oasis of calm
text: A trip to New York for Broadway shows and sightseeing was enhanced by this superb hotel. Right near Times Square yet upon entering you feel immediate calm. Lovely library, reading, bar area. Impeccable service. Yes of course it's expensive but the value can't be beat,

title: Great service!
text: I stayed three nights and enjoyed every moment. The service is very personable, the rooms have wonderful modern interiors and the location is fab. It is walking distance to Fifth Avenue, Madison Avenue, Rockefeller Center and you don't feel the craziness of being so close to Times Square. The only thing I regret is not trying The Lambs Club. Hope to do so next time!

title: Chatwal hoel:- Stay in the Heart of New York City
text: This property also has one of the top-rated locations in New York City! Guests are happier about it compared to other properties in the area. A combination of contemporary luxury and old fashioned design, the Chatwal Hotel features on-site spa services at the prestigious Elizabeth Arden Red Door Spa. The well-equipped gym is open 24 hours a day, with personal training available.Times Square is a 3-minute walk from the hotel. Central Park is a 17-minute walk away.  The 5-star hotel has a 42-inch flat-screen TV, personal butler service and free Wi-Fi in every guest room. The property is renowned in the travel industry for their quality customer service and luxury amenities.

title: Chatwal to see a play in Times Square January 2017
text:
My sister and I booked this hotel for an overnight stay in the city to attend the theatre .  The pictures of the rooms and the hotel on line do not do the accomodations justice.  This hotel is in a great location for the theatre district, it is beautifully decorated in red and white.  In our room the color scheme was chocolate brown and chrome ...and it had all the modern high tech amenities one needs.   The food served in the dining hall on the main floor off to the left was superb.  We had butler service and everyone on the staff was sincerely courteous, polite and helpful at all times.  The bathrooms are top of the line with combo heated bidet/ toilet. Shower with 3 types of functions that can be run at the same time.  

The second day we took a cab to battery park to see Ellis island. The doorman took care of that for  us and off we went.  If you are looking for  a comfortable stay in NYC to  do clubs and theatre, this is the. Place to be.  I have stayed in other luxury hotels in New York but I must say I like the homey European feel of the chatwal very much and would stay there again.  

If you choose the  Chatwall, I hope you enjoy your stay as much as my sister and I did!

title: Very nice...boutique hotel
text: I stayed in June 2014 very close to everything.  Stayed in the junior suite.  Very modern, amenities excellent.  Hotel staff very helpful....stayed for our work trip and 2nd time to NYC. TV in the mirror was quite amazing....do not see that everyday :)

title: NYC Vacation
text: We had a wonderful stay in this lovely boutique hotel. The hotel is really nice and the service was over the top tending to all of our needs (with our three kids!). We would definitely stay at The Chatwal Hotel the next time we visit NYC!!! Thanks Manpreet and all the staff.

title: Wonderful stay, great location
text:
Stayed at this wonderful Art Deco style boutique hotel for a long weekend girl's birthday celebration.  The Chatwal was first class from the minute we got there, starting with the doorman and the attentive bellhop to the front desk workers.  The entire staff was so professional.  We arrived early, but only had to wait a short while for our room to be made ready.  We were given an upgrade to a Deluxe room (seemed more like a suite) which was awesome, giving us some extra space to relax in during our stay.  An especially nice touch for my daughter's birthday celebration was a bottle of Cabernet and some chocolates left in our room--thank you so much Brandon!  The room accommodations were excellent.  The bed was so very comfortable, providing a great night's sleep, and I certainly don't say that about all hotel beds.  There was a large walk in closet, as well as a sitting area with couch, and chair.  The bathroom had a nice shower with rainhead, as well as a heated seat bidet toilet.  Also a tv in the mirrored wall.  Housekeeping did an excellent job with the rooms--one of the cleanest I've seen, and that includes places like the Four Seasons.    
My only real complaint about the room would be that there was not an in room coffee maker.  There was coffee available in the lobby.  
As for other hotel amenities, there was a Red Door Spa and workout facilities in the basement which we did not have time to check into.  We did have breakfast in The Lambs Club, the hotel restaurant which is itself famous.  There is also a nice mezzanine level bar, as well as a lower key lobby bar.  As we were seeing two shows while there, the location of the Chatwal was perfect, just off of Sixth Avenue on 44th.  We were on the 8th floor, but street noise was not a problem at all.
Was very happy with our stay, and would definitely recommend it to friends, as well as stay there again.  Thank you Chatwal staff for everything!

title: meticulous attention to detail
text: This Theater District Hotel is expensive and worth it.  The attention to every little detail is exquisite.  Staff are first class and attentive. The rooms are somewhat small [though not out of step with NYC hotels or hotels in places like Paris] but they are decorated and laid out to feel much larger.  The decor is "traveller Chic" with closets and drawers made to look like classic steamer trunks and luggage [see pics].  We particularly loved the sunflower size shower head.  The food and drink are top notch--bartenders honor the classic cocktails...

title: Beautiful rooms
text:
Great customer service
100m from Times Square 
42nd street to the train terminal in just 7mins
Diners on 44th street open till late
5 star boutique hotel with Lovely furnished rooms 
Well appointed bathrooms with glass all around. Tv in the bathroom
The deluxe rooms have more room space and large toilets compared to the standard rooms
Manager concierge and bell boys are all excellent
Very clean and the hotel does it's best to maintain the place

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: Traveled to the Chatwal for my wife's 50th birthday.  One night - Friday to Saturday.  We chose this hotel for its balcony and location.  We had dinner reservations at DB Bistro and tickets to see a play 1/2 block away and they were calling for snow.  Everybody was extremely nice and accommodating.  We were able to get early check-in and late check-out.  They also gifted a bottle of champagne.  Our room was very nice as you would hopefully expect for $800.00/night. One small complaint:  for the price, the hotel should have coffee available later than 10am., especially on the weekend.  They also should have some complimentary snacks/hors d'oeuvres available throughout the day.  As much as I enjoyed the stay, there any a dozen other hotels within two blocks that offer the same accommodations with concierge service (day and evening coffee, snacks and more) for less than 1/2 the price.

title: My new favorite
text:
The Chatwal ... simply lovely.  This hotel has a great location right off Times Square.  In a great location for the theater.  Great location for walking to shops and sites.  

This is a small and intimate hotel.  A few rooms per floor.  Large heavy iron doors greet you upon arrival.  The staff at reception, concierge and the bar were friendly, cordial and pleasant.  They were helpful with directions, plans and ensuring we made the most of our time.  The hotel never felt crowded.  They have live music in the dining arena at times.

The rooms are not large but are adequate in size.  They are well appointed.  There is ample storage.  The bedding was comfortable.  The bathroom has an Asia style toilet (heated, bidet).  There is a TV integrated into the wall in the bathroom.  The room has multiple magazines and books for your reading pleasure.  There are umbrellas in the room for inclement weather.

There is valet parking.  My only problem was that I was charged twice for parking.  I'm sure it will be corrected.  Always important to check your credit cards.  

This will be my hotel of choice upon return to NYC.

title: Chatwal new favorite
text: When going to NYC for Broadway, we've stayed at numerous places. The Chatwal is our new favorite. Everything is new and top shelf. The location couldn't be better. It's was minutes walking to all the shows we went to see. There were fresh flowers in the room every day. The food and bar were top notch. We'll be back.

title: Location great to theatre district
text: Overall ok experience.  The room and bathroom were quiet, clean and well maintained but on the smaller side.  The location of this hotel was its best attribute.  Not my first choice for a luxury hotel in Manhattan.

title: Everything I had hoped for...
text: The location was outstanding! We were able to walk to Time Square, Rockefeller Center, the theater to see Jersey Boys, The Plaza, Trump Tower, and wonderful restaurants and stores. The room was clean and modern. I loved the big bathroom! The room was very quiet. We did not have a view, but it did not matter to us since we were gone most of the day.

title: Great experience and location!
text: Quick one night stay, good location, great service, fresh but small rooms, I would recommend a stay here to my friends. Several nice restaurants near by, did not try the hotel restaurant but probably will next time.

title: Great location. Service not good. Therefore too expensive.
text:
I have been there before and it was always great, but considering the price, it must be great.
This time I arrived at 2 pm. I had announced early arrival. The room was not ready. I had to wait 30 min till the rooms are ready. The argument was "we are booked", "some check-out late" but the best argument has been "Standard check.in is 4 pm". So we waited at the bar till the rooms have been ready. And don't worry, we havnt been invited by the hotel. As the hotel bar only offers 0,7l water, I asked them If they can bring it up when I am checked in. While I was checking in finally a guy from the bar walked over and told me he had to charge me extra to bring the water to my room. Thats what I call great service.

title: Ask for a room away from 44th street
text: I've stayed at the Chatwal several times and the is the first time I've been disappointed.  They upgraded me to a large king-size bedroom and as was very nice but the street noise was horrible.  Jack-hammering sounded like it was dirrectly outside my window at 4:00 am.  The window didn't sound like it was sealed at all.  Disappointed in this stay given how expensive the room was in comparison to other Starwood properties.

title: Awesome Hotel and Location
text: This was our first time in NYC. The location of the hotel was perfect for us. 1/2 of a block off of Times Square. It was very busy around the hotel, but we expected it would be being its Christmas time. The hotel was amazing. The staff is superb. The rooms are kind of small, but it wasn't a factor in our case as we weren't planning on staying in the room much. The beds are on the extra firm side. That would be our only complaint. We plan on making this a yearly trip to NYC and will be using this hotel again.

title: Locked out of my room
text: I stayed at The Chatwal during that holiday season between Thanksgiving and Christmas. My dad booked my room with SPG points and arranged for a late check-out (at 4 PM). Upon returning to my hotel room at around 2 PM on the afternoon of my departure, I was horrified to discover that my key card no longer worked; I was locked out of my room. A hotel employee was present as I struggled to get my key card to work and he suggested that I go to the front desk and have them reassign me a new key card. I did as he advised and I found the receptionist to be rather incompetent. She gave me a new card and yet when I returned to my room, that one did not work as well. The same hotel employee as before saw this and had his manager come let me in. I was quite aggravated and promptly left.

title: 우아하며 현대적인 곳
text: 5등급 호텔이기도 한 더 채트월 호텔은 깔끔하고 직원들은 엄청 친절하다. 지하철 역과 걸어서 몇 분 안걸리기 때문에 이동하기에도 좋다. 24시간 룸서비스도 된다. 그리고 욕실이 다른 곳보다 엄청 좋다. 역시 5등급 호텔이구나 싶다. 좋다.

title: Fabulous Hotel!
text: I had a fabulous stay at The Chatwal over the Thanksgiving weekend. The room size is normal for New York standards but they just seemed to make the small space work. I never felt like it was too cramped. I loved the fact that the curtains were remote controlled, the lights could be switched off all at once and that the toilet seat was heated (I mean who doesn't want a heated toilet seat during fall in NYC)! The staff were great - special shout out to the doorman who ALWAYS greeted me with a smile and opened that heavy front door! The location is perfect proximity to Times Square and Bryant Park for the Christmas market. Thanks again for a wonderful stay! This is my new go to hotel when in NYC!

title: Location is busy
text:
Small rooms. Expensive upgrades. Uncomfortable beds. Terrible breakfast.
Great staff though
Still, don't think that I will stay here again.
Location is super busy, lots of tourists everywhere. Getting around is so difficult as times square is so close.

title: Remarkable place to visit
text:
I'm glad I finally made my trip and visit this boutique hotel two weeks ago. Staffs in Chatwal are quite nice and responsible. They always nicely greet to me when I get in/out. 

Room design is quite impressive, actually beyond my expectation. I have never thought this hotel hiding in Times Square area has such a modern and Homy design...The room looks a little bit small but shinny, fully equipped with great facilities. The bed is so comfortable. The bath room is spacious compared to other great hotels in the city.  I do like the atmosphere created by the interior designer, which will make me an important reason to visit back.

title: Great Hotel!
text: This hotel is great! It's small, but not the rooms, it's in the perfect location, and we can see Times Square from our rooftop terrace. Every evening we get back to the room, our beds have been turned down and we have some wine, desserts, etc to help unwind. They have a car at your disposal to take you anywhere within a 20 block radius. I passed up staying at The Plaza, Waldorf Residences, etc to stay here, and I'm glad we did. Everyone working here is very friendly and always welcomes us back. I feel like moving in.

title: Les 18 ans de nos filles dans un écrin de rêve
text:
L'emplacement est en soi déjà idéal...à 3 minutes de Time Square ou de Broadway! Mais le lieu, la gentillesse de l'accueil, la disponibilité du personnel et des chambres très belles, tout est fait au Chatwal pour vous faire apprécier New York! Un merci chaleureux à l'ensemble du personnel, mais tout particulièrement à M. Manpreet Kochar, de bonne humeur, quel que soit le moment de la journée!

Nous garderons un merveilleux souvenir de ce séjour hors du commun!

title: Terrific service, quiet rooms, modern and elegant
text:
Stayed at the Chatwal on business in mid-November in room 1006 which was an upgraded room and slightly larger than normal. 

The Chatwal is a Starwood property but feels like a boutique hotel. After the Gramercy Park Hotel it is one of my favorite places to stay in Manhattan. In terms of other Starwood properties nearby it is much better than anything other than the St Regis or the GPH as mentioned. For example it is much better than the W Times Square which is nice and the Westin. 

Here are some quick pros of this great place:

- It is a smaller property in term of number of rooms and the staff guest ratio is good. 

- The service is very good with friendly, accommodating and efficient people.  

- They have an overnight dry cleaning and pressing service which is very good -- arrived at 9 pm and had dry cleaned clothes returned before 8 am the next morning. 

- Good and prompt room service. 

- Really nice rainfall shower with high water pressure. 

- The rooms are very modern, comfortable and stylish. It is hard to describe the decor (you can see the pictures) but it has a bit of a yacht type of fee. They have well thought out centralized controls for the lighting, etc. 

- The rooms are very quiet. I have stayed on the lower floors and have minimal noise even when closer to the ground floor (the 10th is the top level). How they manage to sound proof it as well as they did is kind of amazing. 

- Great coffee set out in the morning. 

- A really nice Art Deco interior in the lobby and bar/restaurant and Lambs Club history. 

A few exceedingly minor drawbacks:

- The room designer over did things a bit with mirrored surfaces.  Personal opinion and not a big deal just not a fan of that aspect of this otherwise really beautifully designed notes. 

- The blackout curtains in the room are great but room's electronic controls are really bright and next to the bed to the point where you want to put something over them. 

- If you are going to a show or the like the location is terrific. If you're in town on business and heading over to midtown or otherwise the Times Square traffic and location is not convenient and adds travel time to your day. 

That is about it - love staying at this place.

title: Συμπαθές
text:
Μάλλον είναι στην φιλοσοφία των νέων ξενοδοχείων στην Νέα Υόρκη, δηλαδή πολύ μικρά δωμάτια και εκμεταλλευόμαστε τα πάντα από χώρους.
Τα δωμάτια πάρα πολύ μικρά και καθαρά, αλλά με μοντέρνο σχεδιασμό και πολύ μίνιμαλ σε βαθμό να μην βολεύεσαι. Είχαμε ζητήσει δωμάτιο με θέα και ήσυχο και μας δώσανε δωμάτιο που έβλεπε σε ακάλυπτο χώρο που ήταν δηλαδή το πίσω μέρος όλων των γύρω-γύρω οικοδομημάτων και εκεί που είναι και όλες οι υποδομές των μηχανημάτων τους με αποτέλεσμα να μην είναι ήσυχο και το δωμάτιο από τον θόρυβο των μηχανημάτων. Ο καφές του ξενοδοχείου δεν πινόταν καθόλου. Οι υπηρεσίες του ήταν στο ελάχιστο. Οι concierge από τους μετριότατους και ήταν στο desk μέχρι τις 9.00μμ. Αν ήθελες κάτι μετά δεν μπορούσες να έχεις καμία πληροφορία. Επίσης και πορτιέρης ήταν στη θέση του μέχρι κάποια ώρα και μετά έμπαινες με την κάρτα σου μέσα στο ξενοδοχείο ή χτυπούσες το κουδούνι. Επειδή το ξενοδοχείο είναι στην Times Square θα έπρεπε να είναι μέχρι πολύ αργά και όχι μέχρι τις 10.00μμ. Μας κάνανε επίσης πολλές χρεώσεις στη κάρτα που είχαμε αφήσει για εγγύηση και τους πήραμε τηλέφωνο όταν γυρίσαμε στην Ελλάδα για διορθώσεις τις οποίες και κάνανε. Πάρα πολύ ακριβό για αυτά που προσφέρει και βεβαίως δεν είναι 5* με τίποτα.

title: A bit disapointing
text: We visited this restaurant for a birthday celebration. I'd booked upstairs in the bar area. Service was indifferent and slow. I've been to this bar several times with clients and I have to say it really was an off night. I just hope this isn't a sign of things to come. This used to be a New York hem.

title: Not worth it
text: Stayed for 2 nights over weekend.  Close to Time Square, dingy street, very small rooms, extremely overpriced.  On check-in the lady on the desk was excellent.  Best I ever experienced and absolutely drop-dead gorgeous Japanese woman.  Planning was good with room amentities and furniture but should have checked with architect to know square footage.  No room to turn around in the room - and at nearly $700US, we wished we had booked the Marriot.

title: Very quiet and luxury hotel, rooms are dark
text:
Stayed at this Art Deco hotel in New York for 5 nights to celebrate friend’s birthday. We are all light sleepers so despite a lot of modern hotels in New York we chose to stay here.

Prior to my arrival I had a lot of email communication to clarify the room type as well as change reservation with the hotel.  Emails were dealt with by Adrian and Rigel – both of them couldn’t be more helpful and professional. 

We arrived the hotel in the afternoon. The location of the hotel can’t be any better. It’s so close to the Time Square yet it’s extremely quiet. Check in didn’t take long. The public area of the hotel was very clean and well sought out. We had two deluxe rooms. Both rooms were decent size for New York standard, the handmade furniture was much appreciated.  Wifi worked very well.  Bathroom is large – despite not having a bath tub the shower was great. Great amenity and even a TV in the mirror. 

The bed itself was very comfortable and we all slept well. Good quality of bed linen and towels. 

We also ordered room service in few occasions. It wasn’t cheap but quality was first class. 

Service in the hotel is generally friendly and helpful.

The only minor point of the hotel is the rooms are very dark without sufficient lighting.  It worked out well for us as we prefer quiet rooms and we were out most of the time during the day.

title: Amazing Quiet so close to Times Square
text: Lovely. elegant and refined hotel with excellent bespoke service. I was in NYC on business and spent three nights there on my Starwood Preferred Points (wouldn't have been within my financial reach otherwise!). If you have the chance to stay here, I highly recommend it. You'll feel like royalty :-).

title: Unbelievable hotel
text: Everything about this hotel is wonderful.  The staff are just unbelievable!  I was responsible for a group booking and everyone raved about the rooms, food and service.  It is located right in midtown Manhattan, close to Time Square but you would never know it.  It is extremely quiet.  I can't say enough about The Chatwal.

title: Not Giving a Good Review for This Visit
text:
I have stayed at the Chatwal many times and have always been very satisfied and given it very good reviews.  I am a lifetime Starwood Platinum and on past stays I almost always get room upgrades. I like the staff and always have good interactions. Brandon and his Butler team always go the extra mile so do the other staff. 
I want to be clear that the reason for this poor review has nothing to do with the staff, they are excellent and were on this visit as well. 
My critique is directed at management. 
When I arrived it was late after a very long day and I was tired. At checkin I had a cordial exchange with the night manager, he mentioned something about an upgrade and I didn't think it was anything other than the usual upgrade I get when available so didn't think twice. Then he asked me to sign a piece of paper with 300 dollars written on it. That  should have been a red flag as that has never happened before so shame on me but when you trust people, your guard is down. I thought he was saying I was getting a rate of 300 so just signed it without reading it. I will never make that mistake again. I was shocked when I received my bill that it was a 300  per night add on to my rate of 475 for an upgrade to a terrace room. I was shocked first because I have stayed in the same room and other terrace rooms many times always as a complimentary upgrade,  second because after I contacted the hotel and explained that I had misunderstood since I always get upgrades , they still insisted on charging it noting I had signed the piece of paper.  For such a "luxury" hotel dealing with a very good customer, I was really disappointed. If 1200 is worth losing a good customer, maybe it isn't so luxury after all. I think the staff are great but this one shows very poor judgment on the part of management especially for a Starwood Lifetime Platinum. The best companies shine when things go wrong, that is when brand loyalty is really built. The Chatwal has now lost my loyalty and my trust.

title: A good find
text:
This is a surprisingly good hotel, I really recommend. The staff are extremely helpful. The rooms are delightful and thoughtful. The beds, as you expect are just SO comfortable. The only downside for me is the location, but this would suite a lot op people.
Affordable luxury

title: Chatwal aims high and hits the mark!
text: I had forgotten what the true 5 star hotel experience entailed.  This delightful gem made me feel like I mattered and my wishes mattered to the wonderful staff.  I just stayed a week before at the Ritz Central Park.  Not even the same species.  I found a new go-to hotel in New York.  Feeling smug.

title: Beautiful Hotel. Great Location.
text: This hotel was beautiful, the staff friendly, the location perfect. Our room was small, but that is expected in the city. I requested a quiet room and got just that. All staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The only reason for the "4" rating on the room was the size. It was beautiful and the bathroom georgeous! We had a wonderful stay at The Chatwal.

title: Great hotel - just be careful of room categories
text: We loved our stay here but it got off to a bumpy start. I reserved a Junior Suite with a Terrace. Apparently there are three of them and we were given the smallest by far. It is hardly bigger than the king deluxe with terrace which was $500 a night less. Luckily, another junior suite with terrace freed up half way into our stay and we were moved into it. Gorgeous room with a beautiful terrace overlooking a great old New York building. Service excellent. The location is great if you are seeing a lot of show which we were. The restaurant is nice with an above average (though not spectacular) breakfast. Stay here by all means just be sure to avoid "Ruby" (unless you want an interior, smaller terrace and go for Sanctuary instead!

title: LOVED IT!
text: Small boutique hotel.  Excellent professional staff.  Upgraded our room to a suite.  SPECTACULAR.  We dislike "stuffy" decor.  The Chatwal is Art Deco is a contemporary way.  Wood and mirror well done.  Bed was firm enough without being too much so.  The closet was spectacular.  In the bathroom - excellent amenities AND a basket with extra amenities in case there was need.  Toto toilet seats that are heated, offer deodorizing and bidet washing functions.  The shower was HUGE with body sprays and rainforest heads....and if you are with someone you LIKE to shower with.....The Chatwal will indulge you with room for experimenting in the shower ;-)  Well done!  We WILL be back.

title: Nearby Times Square, but a world away
text: For an excellent boutique hotel experience, come to the Chatwal Hotel near busy Times Square and the theater district. The hotel boast a great dining experience and cozy art deco decor. The rooms are distinctly New York feeling with sophisticated overtones and the expected luxury bath from SPG's luxury collection. The staff are very friendly and helpful with all your needs. There is a mezzanine bar as well as a pleasant intimate lounge area.

title: Tow words " SUPER SPECTACULAR"
text: I never write reviews but I just had to this time. Form the second I stepped out of my car to being greeted by the doorman to the front desk staff that feeling of class embodied you.Where the welcoming attitude of front desk was warm and helpful. I had a very small concern with my room and the manager Mr. Manpreet Kochar stepped in and right away it was pacified. Then the experience of a true luxury property sets in. From arrival to departure I must say it was a really 1st class experience. This will be my go too property in NYC from now on. I already recommended this property to two of my friends that went and had a great experience. Thank you again.

title: Superlative in all respects, we were treated like royalty
text: This was my first stay at the Chatwal and it certainly won't be the last.  I will be back for sure.  The hotel is intimate, classy with a great Art Deco meets modern vibe.  The staff gets to know each guest personally and tries their best to meet your every need.  From the housekeeping services to the butlers and doormen, this hotel was so welcoming.  It felt like our own private pied-a-terre in NYC.  Our room was perfectly sized with a beautiful bathroom which I would love to have in my own home.  The bed was so comfortable and the room was very quiet.  The hotel itself is a refuge in the busiest part of the city.  The butler brought us an espresso machine for your room when we asked for it and pressed my clothes for me, promptly and with a smile.  Thank you Tenzen (not sure of spelling).  The front desk staff, Sakura and Tammy Lu were amazing.  Sakura had our room ready for us over 3 hours before usual check-in time.  I had notified the hotel ahead of time of the request and was happy and surprised they were able to accommodate us with only a short wait.  The wonderful gentlemen who handle baggage, cabs and the doors were the best.  Thanks to Ali, Peter and Michael.  The hotel also worked seamlessly with the restaurant at the Lamb's Club (on the property) to make sure I had gluten free food (I have celiac disease).  Thanks to all the wonderful ladies and gentlemen on the staff of the Chatwal.  You guys are all amazing!  Looking forward to my next visit.

title: Excellent overall for the $600 plus category
text:
The standout its the staff! 97% friendly!  
We were here for an 8 night stay.
It might sound trivial, but being greeted every time you leave and come back to the property with a SMILE does make a difference, well at least for me!!!!
Only real problem is at the Lambs Club with one specific weekend staff.  Not the same level of gracious service as all the other staff, but also not out and out rude, just not the mannerisms for my taste.
B fast, food is pretty darn good overall !!! 
Front desk is the friendliest front desk in a long time!!!!
Room is always clean, but for some reason the dirty glasses were not always collected? Odd!  
Room size is on the smaller end for NYC.  Nice furniturings and decor but surfaces is lacking!!!!!  
I would say overall, it's an excellent luxury collection property.

title: Excellent surprise
text: I usually stay at St Regis but as this was full Starwood recommended the Chatwal. What a superb surprise. This is the boutique hotel concept at its best. From the friendly check in the atmosphere was calm and classy. The room was well equipped, very quiet and the shower excellent. The breakfast was also first rate. I strongly recommend this hotel as a relaxing bolt hole in lively NYC.

title: The BEST hotel in midtown!
text: This hotel is simply superb.  The staff is courteous, welcoming, and attentive to every detail, and the room appointments are fantastic.  It's also quiet -- a huge bonus given its in the heart of midtown and Times Square.  Will always stay here if I can help it.

title: Best hotel in NYNY
text:
I just spent two nights at the Chatwal in the Chatwal Suite.  This is the only property I stay in in NYNY  now.  I like it better than any of the Ritz's 4 Seasons, Mandarin, or the other 5 stars that I previously used.  

After you have been there one time the staff, and I mean all of the staff will know you and will anticipate your needs.  The Resturant is over the top.  It is not cheap, but well worth the price for the level of service and accommodations delivered.

title: Lovely Oasis in a Bustling City
text: From the curbside greeting to the upgraded room, this was a wonderful couple of days, I wished could have been longer. Especially since it is so tech savvy it takes just a bit to get used to. Certainly an over the top, almost fantasy experience of being treated exquisitely by each person you come in contact with from bottom to top. Definitely as good if not better at service than the Ritz.

title: Excellent Hotel near Times Square
text: I enjoyed this hotel and will definitely return. The room was beautifully decorated with ample space. I stayed in a terrace room. I travelled with friends who booked a regular room. Upon arrival, the staff upgraded my friends so that we had adjoining rooms. The staff was warm and inviting. The hotel is situated in the theatre district yet a short walk to Times Square (without all the noise). The room amenities were excellent and the bathroom was spacious as well. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Wonderful mom/daughter trip
text: I can't say enough about the experience my daughter and I had in NYC. The staff at the Chatwal made us feel so welcome. Juan, the concierge got us great tickets to see Beautiful and was so helpful with dinner reservations  the manager, the butlers, the bellmen, doormen, housekeeping,etc were beyond amazing. The location couldn't be better. The Lambs Club restaurant had one of the best pre dinner menus I've ever had. I travel to NYC several times a year. This is the very best hotel ever!!!

title: Spectacular in all regards except the room
text:
My stay at The Chatwal was very much a tale of two halves. The soft product - in terms of the front desk, the doormen and general ambience - is extremely good and very much in keeping with a 5 star experience. The location is great, despite being a block from Times Square (or maybe that's a good thing of course!). The hotel is quiet and I did feel as if I'd stepped outside of the street hubbub into a relaxed place. 

I put a lot of emphasis on first impressions and my check-in experience was great. As a Starwood gold member, I usually get upgraded and I've come to rely on that, which is probably not the best idea and I was tripped up for the first time at The Chatwal. My stay coincided with the UN General Assembly and I was told they were full so there could be no upgrade but they would keep it in mind if availability changed (it did not). I wasn't so bothered, after all this is a 5 star hotel and so I expected the room to be just fine in any case. 

I was wrong. Opening the door to Room 403 was very disappointing. The room is very, very small and dark. I assumed the curtains had been drawn but unfortunately the room faces a brick wall and is incredibly dark as a result. The room contains a queen bed with approximately 2/3 of meter walk space around it. There is a small dining chair jammed in the only available corner and small desk and drawers taking up the rest of the space. No easy chair, no table, no space. 

I ordered room service and the gentlemen was at a loss where to position his wheeled dining table. There simply was no space for it. His best suggestion was for me to perch on the end of the bed and he would bring the table up to me. In the end, he took everything off and put it on the desk. He was outstandingly helpful in a tricky situation. The food was delicious, by the way.

The fittings - the desk, cupboard, minibar etc - are of exceptionally high quality. Leather-surfaces, suede-lined walls. Truly beautiful. A very bizarre juxtapose with the amount of space on offer. The bathroom on the other hand is terrific! Huge. Fantastic shower and some cool technology in there. Great amenities including Asprey's of London toiletries and a leather-bound amenity box.

Within a few minutes of my arrival into the room - peak disappointment phase, of course - the butler arrived with a charming handwritten welcome note, some bottled water and some delicious chocolates. It was another example of a bizarre juxtapose. I had no where to sit and relax in this dark little cupboard of a room, yet here was this delightful 5 star customer service alongside. It confused me. Another thing that confused me was a total lack of tea/coffee making equipment in the room. I rang down to ask where the kettle lived and was told to either order tea from room service ($9 + tax + tray charge etc) or to come down to the lobby in the morning for a coffee urn. No, in a hotel of any class I expect to be able to make a cup of tea in the privacy of my own room.

Another issue was the position of the room right next to the elevator. There was a fair amount of noise from other guests and the ice machine. Usually with Starwood Gold membership, being near the ice machine and elevator on a low floor doesn't really happen, but at the Chatwal I was definitely way down the pecking order.

With hindsight, I should have booked a king rather than a queen. 5 star hotels are all about the experience and mine was severely dented the first time I turned the door handle of my room.

title: Art Deco and loving it.
text:
Staying at the Chatwal is an experience in itself--for better.

You'll be guided through heavy gated doors into a quiet art-deco style lobby. It's not the most impressive part of the hotel but still nice and cozy, especially the warmth from the colors and atmosphere against the blustery winter that New York hosts every year.

Your trip to the elevators is just the beginning of your journey from the bustle of the city streets. It's a short walk from the lobby but with the sitting area and fireplace, you'll start to feel like you're really going home.

There aren't many rooms per floor so you're assured of a quiet stay. 

The rooms themselves are appointed stylishly with something similar to Chanel's caviar leather--but this is plum (hoping that Maestro Lagerfeld will bless us with a caviar leather plum Chanel flap bag one day). The bathrooms are spacious--a must in my book. Give me a small room with a large bathroom and I'll be happier than if it were vice-versa. The bath towels are like beach towels, just how I like them. And very absorbent, not like the low-cotton count ones that most hotels have. 

Some rooms do come with terraces. Don't get your hopes up, they're terraces in Manhattan so you're really looking into someone's window across the way. But it actually does add quite a lot to your feeling of space. A nice cup of coffee with the paper out there in the morning is really pleasant--more so than I would've expected.

The beds. Wow. As a business traveler, I cover at least 50 hotels a year at a minimum. Many of them are the same favorites year after year. This hotel is one of them for many reasons including having fantastically comfortable beds. The sheets are so soft you would swear you were sleeping on your own at home. The pillows (ask for extras) are fluffy and large--perfect for feeling like you're cocooned for the night. 

Turn-down service is lovely, too. Who wouldn't want that. And they are kind enough to tuck in some extra bottles of water and a sweet treat for you. 

The room is well accoutered with magazines like the latest editions of Vogue, GC, Architectural Digest, Virtuoso. Like books? They've stocked some in your room as well--some of the classics.

Don't forget the butler service and the shoe polishing. Not something to overlook but easily done. Need your clothes pressed after some struggles with packing? Call your butler. Need to literally be put together and you're a bit lost on how? Call your butler.

The workout facility is not the height of ideal: two treadmills, one elliptical, one stationary bike, limited free weights, one all-purpose weight machine, and one bench--and all squeezed into the space the size of most of their guest rooms. But this is New York City! That's a lot of real estate as it is! There is a small lap pool that looks quite refreshing--haven't tried it but intend to one day when not rushing between work and play.

The spa (Red Door Spa) is pretty full service. After a reflexology session, I was ready to strap my Jimmy Choos back on and head out for the night. Lifesaver.

Of course everyone talks about the location and rightfully so. It's half a block from Times Square and a block to the Harvard Club (not a member but it's still nice to be close to the Pall Mall of New York) and a couple blocks from the New York Public Library. 

And another great part of this all: Osteria al Doge is two doors down. Want pasta? Go there. Going carb free? Go there (calamari on the main menu (not the appetizer) is grilled and amazing and also the octopus). Want a place to hang out with good wine and an amazing ricotta cheesecake? Go there. Go there. Go there. Go there.

But what makes this place the jewel tucked away into such a crazy city: the people. The staff and caretakers at the Chatwal are the kind of people you want around you to help you bring yourself up to the better version of yourself. That in itself is priceless.

title: A Sanctuary in a busy city
text: The Chatwal is a historic, beautiful art deco hotel!  The location is very convenient; it's close enough to Times Square without being overly crowded.  Stepping into the hotel feels like a sanctuary away from the chaos of New York and Times Square.  The service was professional, friendly and courteous all around from the bell staff to the restaurant staff.  Even though the lobby seems small, the rooms are some of the largest I've experienced in Midtown.  There was some construction in the building next  to the hotel so it got quite noisy after 8am on the weekdays so the hotel upgraded us to a bigger room.  The butler service was wonderful.  All of the amenities and attention to detail in the room was also very nice.  I recommend going to the bar in the late afternoon for drinks and listen to the live jazz music. They've got a fantastic cocktail list.  Having breakfast at the hotel restaurant was also very nice. They have a good selection of items to choose from and a lot of healthy choices.

title: Best hotel i have stayed in NYC
text: Location. WOW. 100M to times square.  All the staff were so courteous and helpful . Even with 2 kids in tow. NYC hotels aren't always kid friendly, but they really took care of us. Had a family suite. No view, bit for the price we paid, we were more than happy. Would stay again for sure.

title: EXCELENTE HOTEL
text:
Hotel muito bom, limpo, lindo demais, excelente localização, atendimento incrível e todos os funcionários são prestativos ao extremo.
Quartos limpos, bem espaçosos e modernos, banheiro surreal.
Ao dormir realmente não parece que você está em NYC, apesar da cidade ser movimentada ao extremo, os quartos são silenciosos demais para uma ótima noite de sono.
Com certeza voltarei a NY e ao The Chatwal.

title: Great Location, Fantastic Service
text:
From the minute we checked in until we checked out we were treated First Class

The Lambs Club Restaurant was also terrific. Manager made sure we had everything we needed.
Location right next to Times Square

title: Boutique Hotel in the Theatre District
text: We had the best time at this hotel on our trip to NYC on Labor Day weekend. Street side greeting was warm and professional and check-in was gracious and straightforward. We had a quiet double queen room on the 4th floor. The room was classy in a masculine way and the bathroom was spacious and well-appointed. The beds were comfortable and the climate control was reasonably quiet. Housekeeping did a great job taking care of our room. We enjoyed the small swimming pool and hot tub in the Spa and we were driven to our restaurant one night in the hotel red Mercedes automobile which was really nice. Doormen Michael and Steven were especially helpful and friendly and went above and beyond in helping me get a taxi a few blocks down from the hotel when Sixth Avenue was closed for an event on Sunday. I loved staying at the Chatwal. It was a serene, classy location in the shadow of all the action of Times Square, with a wonderful, professional staff. I would happily book a return visit to this lovely hotel.

title: Immaculate hotel in central location
text: The Chatwal is a well appointed boutique hotel, with excellent service, immaculate rooms (albeit on the small side) and in a central location only moments walk from the hubbub of Times Square. Despite its location, the hotel was quiet and we were not disrupted by any noise during our stay. The only downside of being in such a location is that getting a taxi at any time was extremely difficult! That is not a fault of the hotel but something you should factor in when travelling around. Would return.

title: Great location and fantastic service
text:
200m from time square, you find wellness & spa appropriate for a short stay. Room little bit small but nice design. The service is outstanding and alway very accurate, the employees provides very good tips. 
We will go back again for sure.

title: 완벽했던 스테이
text: 작년 11월, 뉴욕에 갔을 때 4박 머물렀던 더 챗월 럭셔리 컬렉션.  세련된 인테리어와 고급스러운 서비스 등은 최고급호텔임을 다시금 확인시켜줬네요. 위치도 매우좋아서 타임스퀘어근처의 뮤지컬과 다이닝을 즐기기에도 최고였어요. 호텔1층에 있는 레스토랑인 램스클럽을 못 간 것이 서운하네요 ~  또 뉴욕을 가면 꼭 다시 묵고 싶은 챗월입니다 :-)

title: Cute but not WOW
text:
After hearing about this hotel from T&L top NY hotels, I thought I would try something different.. It's in the heart of Time Square, getting a cab or an UBER is HELL... 
When you walk in to the hotel there is a very bad odor, like a humidity AC sort of smell. Not the type of odor you want to walk into.
Rooms are cute but very small. 
Don't think I would ever come back...

title: The best kept secret in New York City
text:
I stayed there 7 nights in August with my family. This is what a small luxury hotel is all about.

It is in the very center of Manhattan, in the middle of the Theater District, yet it is in a position secluded from the overcrowded Times Square.

The room was large and full of amenities. Room was cleaned at least twice a day.
The staff was kind and attentive. We booked our dinners through the concierge.

One evening we also used their courtesy car (w/driver) , that you can book for free to reach the restaurant (or other destination).

I noticed that the bar is also used for some private events: it is strategically placed in a position in which a hotel guest that just wants to check-in and go the his/her room is not disturbed at all from any confusion/crowd/music....

I'm very satisfied and I do recommend this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel!
text: The Chatwal is a beautiful, boutique hotel in a great location, close to Times Square but not right in the melee.  The staff are fantastic, especially Manpreet Kochar, who always greeted us by name.  The rooms are clean and well appointed.

title: Quiet Oasis in the city.
text: I have stayed here several times, and I am never disappointed.  Rooms are well appointed with every amenity one could need and if you've forgotten anything it magically appears without much effort.   It is a top rate hotel to challenge the St Regis and other high-end properties.

title: Luxury Collection Property nestled amongst the great Skyscrapers of NYC'S Times Square
text: Being an SPG Platinum guest, you come to expect certain amenities when checking into one of their terrific hotels. However the Chatwal is different. The Chatwal is of St. Regis "esq". It s just a fabulous hotel with very modern rooms and GREAT SERVICE. My wife and i stay there twice a year ( 2 nights a piece for each of our Birthdays) and ALWAYS have a great time. Also Breakfast in Jeffery Zacharions restaurant is always amazing.. Great location to Broadway and great shopping as well.

title: Lusso
text: Hotel molto bello a pochi passi da time square , arredamenti curati e pulizia impeccabile, posizione centralissima praticamente a piedi si può visitare da central park , time square , chrysler building , empire, la 5 e tanto altro.. Unica pecca un hotel a 5 stelle non puoi limitarsi a parlare solo l' inglese ......

title: Mostly Good
text:
Just had a 4 night stay here. It was mostly good. As you get here, the front doors are super heavy, and although they have 1-2 doormen, none were ever manning them. None. It was difficult for us women to then carry our own suitcases up the stairs to the front lobby, which is small. Front desk people are very nice and welcoming. 

The rooms are definitely smaller than what the photos show. We had 2 rooms; 1 was a basic and the other had a garden patio. The room with the garden patio was slightly bigger and had a larger bathroom. The bathrooms here are fabulous! TV built into the mirror, bidets with heated seats (surprisingly quite nice!), and very nice toiletries. Large showers. 

The beds were not too comfortable unfortunately. We had to ask housekeeping to bring us a coffee maker for our room, which was a waste because the taste of the coffee was terrible!

Housekeeping did a great job each day. New bottles of water 2x/day; once in morning and once at turn down service. Rooms were always very clean. 

Air conditioning worked great in the room as well. 

Did not eat in the restaurant and did not try any of the other amenities. 

Great location if going to Broadway shows. Deli a few doors down to get breakfast and better coffee.

title: An oasis of quiet luxury in NY.
text: The Chatwal never disappointments. Service is impeccable, rooms are beautiful, tasteful and luxurious. The bathrooms are wonderful. After multiple visits, I expect the Chatwal to lose its lustre but each stay is better than the last. Excellent location near Bryant Park and Public Library, easy walk to MOMA, 5th Avenue shopping and Central Park. Perfect for theater. But the word is out so book early.

title: Excellent Stay
