text: Excellent Hotel right near Times Square. Luxurious room, super attentive staff. Booked last minute on Priceline and I'm glad this is what I got. They did a turn down service, hand written welcome note, complimentary Voss bottled water, and more. Bathroom features a bidet!

title: Più che perfetto
text: Bellissimo il bar, le stanze e la piscina ...indimenticabile la location come il servizio. Vicino al centro e facilmente accessibile. Wi-Fi gratis e funzionante . Molto romantico ma adatto anche alle famiglie

title: Great visit again.
text: That last few times I was in NY the Chatwal had been booked so I stayed elsewhere. I was very happy to be back staying at the Chatwal this time.  The hotel and room are lovely and the staff is fantastic.  They are so friendly and helpful.  The Chatwal is easily my favorite place to stay when I am in NY (and I have stayed at many hotels there!).

title: Theater weekend.
text: Nicest hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC. Will absolutely be staying here again. Outstanding service and amenities. The room was perfect in every way. Staff was extremely pleasant and professional. I wish we'd been able to stay longer.

title: Nice room, wonderful shower, reliable turn down service
text: This is a wonderful hotel with nicely appointed rooms and an accommodating staff.   The breakfast basket in the restaraunt is particularly good. The only issue- and it was a a big one- was the Red Door Spa. Set my alarm and woke early to be timely for my Sunday 10 am massage.  Receptionist showed me to the changing area and told me where to wait for my therapist.  At 10:15 he still hadn't arrived.  Receptionist was apologetic, saying he was usually very reliable and "something terrible must have happened."  Offered to put me in a taxi to another of their locations but that was very unappealing, especially since I had already changed and my family was waiting for me for brunch.  Since we had booked with Am Ex travel  and had two rooms we had 200$ in spa credit that had to go to waste as they would not credit me with the money.  They did provide $100 in products for free but that really didn't make up for the massages my daughter and i never got. One of the reasons we picked this hotel and not another was because of the spa, and the spa credit.

title: Great boutique hotel; Hardworking staff...working on 5th star
text:
I'm SPG LTG with 8 years of Platinum and currently at 100 SPG days YTD. 

Chatwal is a great boutique hotel in heart of Times Square. Despite its half-block proximity to TS the Chatwal is incredibly quiet as a result of fairly low thru traffic on W44th, solid construction and only a handful of rooms per floor (~70+ rooms total). To me it's a fantastic, high-end business hotel that also lends itself well for a family or couples getaway. 

Staff: From the doormen to management I've had an incredible experience with every member of the staff I've met. The doormen, bell staff and reception staff are inviting and responsive and the management I've interacted with have been helpful in addressing any issues that inevitably come up during travel. In particular I am grateful for Kyle one of the night mangers for his responsiveness and attention to detail. 

Dining: Excellent in-room dining for breakfast (I'm sure for lunch and dinner as well though I've never sampled them) as well as restaurants and bars. The signature restaurant, The Lambs Club has solid fare with light pastas, seafood and meats. The property also has a small lobby bar (4 stools) and a large 2nd floor lounge with a large bar. I love the small plates/snack menu and the bar staff make wonderful cocktails and offer an excellent selection of wines by the glass. 

Rooms: The rooms are clubby and well maintained. The beds are comfortable but firm. The bathrooms are generally spacious and either equipped with a large walk-in shower or a tub/shower combo. I find the tub/shower combo  problematic as the tub lip is very wide making it difficult to get in and out of (very challenging for kids and I imagine a disaster for the elderly). That said, the showers and shower heads might be the attributes to the rooms. 

Challenges/Opportunities: while the property, food and rooms are all first rate, the major issue I've experienced of late is with respect to quality assurance of the rooms upon new guest arrival. While the majority of my stays have been perfect/without incident I have had a few recent challenges related to my rooms smelling of cigarettes. I primarily blame the prior, idiotic guests who choose to smoke despite a clear hotel ban and clear penalties for violating policy. I can only hope the hotel enforces the $250 cleaning charge and ultimately raises this fine. I'll admit to being a bit sensitive to the smell of smoke and while I do blame the prior tenants it is ultimately hotel management/room QA that must make the call on the acceptability of offering a guest a "smelly" room. I've had an issue in each of the past 2 weeks related to my room smelling like cigarettes and while in both cases I was immediately moved it is always a bit of aggravation to have to move rooms after checking in. For my part, this bit of room QA is the only factor preventing The Chatwal from being a 5 star hotel in my book.

title: Gem in the theatre district
text:
Chatwal is a great property with exceptional service with the perfect location if you are going to see a show. If you are not going to see a show, or hang out in time square, you may want to look at other options as it is a little chaotic in that area. Service was top notch from the front desk(Yana), bellman(Peter), housekeeping, and bar staff. The bar is top notch as well with some of the best cocktails in the area. Hotel was impeccably clean. Bed and linens very comfortable, bathroom had plenty of mirrors and light.

Out of all the hotels in the madness that is time sq. The Chatwal rises to the top.

title: Beautiful, Classy and Extremely Professional Hotel
text:
My daughter, my mother and I decided to take a last minute quick trip to the city since my daughter (5 and 1/2 yo) want to get away from the plain vanilla burbs of Pennsylvania.  I looked up my SPG account to see if I had enough points for an one night stay.  I have always wanted to stay at the Chatwal.  Finally, I had a reason to visit.  Fortunately, I had enough points for a night.  (30k points for the Chatwal vs 25k points for the Sheraton.  I picked the Chatwal).  What a pleasant surprise!  I cannot think of anything that did not meet expectation.  First, when we first got there, the check-in lady (I think her name is Lana) saw that we have 3 people from 3 different generations, she suggested that the room that I book may be too small.  And she offered an upgrade (for $150).  I hesitated but she said the room will be ready within an hour (btw, we arrived at around 11a).  So I took it.  While we waited, we walked around the hotel a bit and decided to venture onto the street for a few minutes.  I got a call from Lana within an hour.  We went back and the concierge was there ready to take us up to the room.  We were on the 6th floor Room 608.  Even though we are at the heart of Time Square, we could not hear a thing from the street.  

What not to like about the room?  Nothing!!!  The room was huge in Time Squire area hotel standard.  The bed was comfy.  The concierge brought my daughter a junior welcome package (fancy chocolate, animal crackers, 3 big bottles of Voss water).  The bathroom was the fanciest I have seen.  Now i have been to many very nice hotels all over the world, this bathroom probably rank way up there.  The Toto toilet seat was great (don't really see them outside of Japan).  There was also a TV in the bathroom.  I found my daughter sitting on the toilet watching Disney Junior.  :)  The shower was your typical rainshower but it is huge!!!  The whole bathroom was decked out with black marble with silver speckles - my daughter noticed it right away.  

Since the hotel was so nice, we ended up staying in.  Used the pool (small but no body there, so it was very private -  I wonder if guest really know it was there).  My daughter and I were at the pool for over an hour and half and no one ever walked in.  Now, it is small, kind of like a huge bathtub - maybe 10-15 feet long?  The water was salted.  It was actually quite relaxing.  There was a hot tub (very hot) in the corner too.  

We also ended up eating at the Lambs Club.  Pretty good though it is a bit pricey.  We sat upstairs.  Would have been nice to dine in the original downstairs dining room.  Drinks and cocktails were pretty strong.  Overall very good.

The next day we checked out.  The staff remember all of us.  They were all very nice and always have a smile on their face.  That made me want to go back for another time.  Love this hotel.  Will be back!!!

title: من أجمل الفنادق في نيويورك
text: المكان رائع في منتصف تايمز سكوير مما يسهل الفندق للوصول من تيم سكوير اللمتع يتوفر به الكثير من المطاعم و السينما و المقاهي و جميل المشي في هذا لمكان المزدحم و الأشهر عالميا ، و يجب زيارة مطاعم نيويورك الرائعة و الفيفث أفينيو للتسوق

title: 家一样的感觉
text: 我和家人来纽约度假，选择了The Chatwal，办入住时有了意外的惊喜，房间得到了升级，另外还有私人管家服务。酒店的位置，房间舒适程度，酒店的服务都是最棒的！儿子Mike说，这是他全世界旅游住过的，感觉最棒的！

title: A Hidden Gem in a Busy Neighborhood
text:
This was my third stay at The Chatwal, and as always it was a delight.  It is on 44th Street, barely a block off the congestion and noise of Time Square, but once you are inside it is lovely and intimate, with a wonderful deco style.  There are only 76 rooms, and while it is an older hotel the remodel is top notch and luxurious. It is part of the Starwood Luxury Hotel Program. If you are attending the theater this is a great location.

This is not a budget hotel, so don't expect low prices, but it is a good value for what you receive. I booked a junior suite through Amex on their "Fine Hotels" program, and received the fourth night free and a spa credit. My suite was large and wonderful, with a big bathroom (they even have Toto power toilets and a television hidden behind the mirror), and it was very well-equipped. There is butler service, and a very nice small spa and gym.

I have stayed at the St. Regis, The Mandarin, and most of the other uber-luxury hotels in NY, and prefer the intimacy and style of The Chatwal (as long as you are OK with they busy neighborhood - it could be off putting for some people).

I will certainly stay again, and my only suggestions to the hotel:

Lighting is a bit difficult to understand.

Upgrade the radios to include a built-in iPhone charger - it is always a nice touch.

Put a Nespresso coffee maker in the room.

title: 快適でした
text:
タイムズスクエア近くだが、比較的静か、こじんまりとして落ち着いた雰囲気。ミュージカル鑑賞後も徒歩で帰れるロケーション。
チェックインの時はたまたまかもしれませんが日本語対応可のSakuraさんに丁寧な対応をしていただきました。ドアマン、ベルボーイはじめスタッフはフレンドリーでした。バトラー、コンシェルジュ、２４時間可のジムなどがありますが、すでに予定が決まっていたため今回は利用しませんでした。
内装はモダンですが、落ち着いた雰囲気。同行した家族では好みが分かれていました。
朝食はラムズクラブでいただきました。一仕事してあり美味しかったです。
次回はゆっくり滞在したいと思います。

title: GREAT STAY!!!
text:
Recently, my wife & I stayed at The Chatwal for 4 days/3 nights. Every staff member from doorman to the butler service manager were fantastic. Our new friend Tenzin ensured that our stay was as memorable and as accommodating as possible. The customer service alone would be reason enough to return.  However, the hotel itself truly seals it. Beautiful architecture and decor. Fantastic room design & space. All just around the corner from Time Square, Bryant Park & the Theater District.  The Chatwal is not cheap but, remember the old adage "you get what you pay for."  This place is worth the expense especially if your NYC trip is for a special occasion.  We will definitely return!  Thank you to everyone!!!

The Lambs Club restaurant is located inside the hotel. If interested, please see my review of it under restaurants.

title: 位置极佳
text: 一家三口带着不到2岁的宝宝到美国度假，也是我们在纽约入住的第一家酒店，位置绝佳，步行到Times sqare或者到百老汇都非常近，如果愿意也可以步行到梅西百货！从门童到客房服务人员都很赞，细心的工作人员几乎可以记得每一位住客，每天回到酒店老远门童就会为我们打开门等候，并帮助宝宝抬婴儿车！酒店周边也有很多好吃的，不过一定得记得提前预约，否则会等到崩溃的！房间面积在寸土寸金的纽约已经不算小的了，淋浴间的喷头超级棒！此行唯一的遗憾是，酒店的某些楼层似乎在装修，下午的时候会有很大的噪音，好在对于正在倒时差的宝宝来说没有太大影响！总是是一次美好的入住体验，还会再来的！

title: A fantastic stay, warm friendly polite staff and high standard furnished rooms
text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We usually stay at the W Hotel Times Square however the rooms have become too shabby. The view at the W is outstanding where as the Chatwal has none but in every single other way the Chatwal wins hands down.
The rooms are finished to a high standard, there is almost a Gatsby theme to the place with the dark reds, metal and light decor in the communal areas.
The rooms are black/ white/ chrome and the bathroom is also finished to a high standard. You have everything you need minus a coffee machine.
The beds are very hard I couldn't get comfy but that's personal preference.
All the reception staff were always pleasant and helpful.
Only critique is that the door men were always messing about. Always chatting to their mates/ smoking/ walking up and down the street and never there where they should be. 
Would go again fantastic stay!

title: overnight stay in Times Square
text: comfortable and spotlessly clean.  The staf were very friendly and very helpful. We had butle r service and 2 cups of tea cost about $30 Just round the corner from this hotel is a corner shop for food and  ake out hot drinks for just over a $. Hot drins are served in the lobby  first thing in the morning. Would definitely be back here when we re visit New york in April for our Grandaughters birthday

title: Top quality but lacking a few touches
text: High quality and convenient midtown location. Rooms were a tad small for that price point compared to Langham or Pierre, but bathrooms were the real show stopper. Amazing rain shower and first japanese toilet I've seen in a New York hotel. Hotel restaurant is very nice and we loved our room service. You won't get much of a view, if at all, in this hotel. Concierge were very friendly, especially Sakura and Victoria, and were very prompt on all of our requests. One drawback which I thought was close to unacceptable for a five star hotel at this price point was the quality of the porters and doormen. There was no one outside when we entered and he was texting on his phone inside while I struggled to open the heavy door with three bags in tow. He apologized but then didn't offer to carry my bags in or take them to the room and remained at his post. The two other times I left and entered the building the porters were either too busy talking to each other or not there at all. When I left with my 3 bags again they weren't paying attention enough to help me or open the door and I did it myself again. Not a huge deal, but something you'd expect in a 3 star hotel, not a 5, only thing that soured the experience.

title: Probably would have had a better experience if we were not using Points
text:
The Chatwal seems like a very fine hotel.  The door staff, desk staff, concierge and bar staff are all lovely, professional and attentive.

In fairness, I suspect our experience was probably attributed to the fact that we cashed in some travel points for our room reservation.  Room 302.  We were given no upgrade options - which we would have loved to do ... but the exceptional reputation of the hotel made us accept the room we were given.

I admit I was a little surprised.  The room had a queen bed and very little space.  It looked out on a brick wall with a few gloomy windows from a neighboring building.  It had a fancy toilet seat that could do all kinds of washing and drying tricks - unfortunately didn't work.  A clicker in the bathroom indicated that somewhere there was a bathroom TV system ... again, not working.  I even tried the weigh-scales ... and the dreaded ERR (error) appeared on the screen.  These are things that should really not happen.  I was also surprised that there was no coffee machine or coffee making facility in the room.

I understand that as a business it's simply not possible to give award the best room for free to those redeeming points ... but frankly the reason we have the points is because we travel ... and that's exactly why the points should give us a more luxurious experience - because we are more likely to come back and / or recommend as a luxury hotel if we have an exceptional experience.

Must give a shout-out to the amazing bar tender at the upstairs bar/lounge though.  No idea of his name - but he had amazing dreadlocks and looked a little bit like David Ortiz ... he clearly knew his stuff and it was a pleasure to watch him work.

Location to Time Square is great and the road is quiet in comparison to surrounding streets.  Even on the 3rd floor we were not bothered by traffic noise.

title: Our favorite hotel in the theater district!
text: We love this hotel.  It is small and charming, with wonderful warm, friendly, professional service from all levels of staff.  The rooms are comfortable, although "over-electroniced" for our taste.  I really don't mind opening the shades with a pull cord rather than having to figure out which button will open them for me.  And I always unplug the heated toilet seat -- too hot to sit on!  And the toilet's "bidet features" are completely beyond me altogether!  But we love this hotel, and their breakfasts and their lobby bar.  They are conveniently located for theater, which is all-important to us since you can't depend on getting a cab from the East side in time for curtain. And, this is a historic property which used to be the Lambs Club in the old days.   We hope to stay here every year!

title: ラグジュアリーホテル
text:
SPGのメンバーなので宿泊してみました。場所が心配でしたが全く問題はなく、ホテルに一歩入れば落ち着ける空間が至る所にありました。
テラス付きの部屋は寛げましたし、清潔なバスルームは使いやすかったです。
モダンなレストランも何度か利用しましたが、スタッフが親切で居心地が良かったです。
次回宿泊する時は是非スパを体験したいと思いました。

title: A very cute Boutique Hotel
text:
A wonderful experience from beginning to end. Greeted by doorman on arrival, helped with luggage to front desk. Very pleasant, professional, efficient, and quick check in by a wonderful young gentleman (unfortunately don't remember the name). Escorted to the room that was beautiful with all amenities of comfort. Power drapes, lights controlled from each side of the bed, comfortable phone locations, small efficient desk & light, nice arm chair, and a nice television. The bathroom was very comfortable and the shower was superb ( no water shortage like LA). I want to make sure to mention that rooms are New York style, small. Hotel restaurant is awesome and reasonably priced for the food served.
Location was awesome, 5 minutes from broadway, 3 minutes to seventh avenue, and 3 minutes to sixth avenue. Out of the hotel and you are right there in the midst of everything. Two doors to the right from the hotel and you are in a very cute French Bistro, Saju Bistro, with excellent food at extremely reasonable prices (will review separately).
Across the street from the hotel is a french Coffee shop, Cafe Un Deux Trois that is great for a quick breakfast.

title: Excellent hotel in nyc..
text: Well though out high quality design and decor throughout. Clean, good energy, good customer service, and a feeling of going back in time. Rare particularly for this part of town near the hustle bustle of 42nd street / Broadway.

title: Best Hotel Experience Ever!!!
text: This was one of the best ever hotel experiences I have ever had. From pulling up to Valet my vehicle, unloading and having my belongings taken up to my suite...AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! My little black pug, Romeo was greeted by first name, a Butler came to the room within 5 minutes of checking in....with a water and food bowl. Bones were delivered in the evening. Every person, from guest services, concierge, housekeeping, elevator man, valet / door man...one was nicer than the next. I would highly suggest this hotel to anyone looking for luxury at its finest. I had the best experience and can't wait to return with Romeo!!!!! I can't say enough...and truly had the best experience ever!!!!

title: A chic, elegant choice in the theater district
text: Beyond the glitz and glam outside its door, the Chatwal has a hushed, chic luxury that is hard to resist.  Gorgeous rooms - and wait until you see those bathrooms.  They have great packages that change with the season.  During a recent stay, I was given access to a Leica T to photograph my stay - some of the best fun I've ever had with a camera!

title: Like staying at a newly renovated British Club
text: I would give 4.5 stars if an option (below 5 starts for St. Regis, but above 4 for Westin/Renaissance/etc.).  My room (3rd level up) was small, and a bit dark because the window isn't large, but the furnishings feel new, and it has a great sense of style.  Some things were nickel & dimed on (no water in room when arrived, and was $9.50 in mini bar, and also no coffeemaker), but on other hand had nice selection of magazines in room and great Aprey toiletries. The location is convenient to Times Square and Broadway shows and the live jazz flowing from restaurant into the lobby at night is a special touch that enhances the hotel's sense of intimacy and style.

title: Great hotel, service, location
text: So worth it. Came for the weekend to introduce my tween daughter to Broadway and SOHO. I'm a long time SPG member who is always looking for the best properties to use my points. The Chatwal takes the cake. Quiet location despite its location in Times Square. Attentive, friendly service. Size able room by NYC standards with a lovely bath and shower. I will absolutely be back.

title: Good location
text: We enjoyed the stay with a perfect location in Times Square. The hotel is walking distance to Hard Rock Cafe and Times Square subway which connects throughout the entire Manhattan, and the remaining bouroughs. Front Desk staff Yana Volkova was very accommodating and welcoming.

title: Extraordinary accomodations
text: Great location and really exceptional rooms.  The service was fine.  Great location for broadway shows. Walking distance to all theaters.  The room was very clean and very new and fresh.  The front desk was helpful.

title: The staff was very responsive.
text: While I only stayed one night and had a couple of problems, the staff and manager did everything they possibly could have to try to make it right. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever stayed in at a hotel. The room was very small and it wasn't going to work for me and my husband to work in the room and stay there. But, if I had received a larger room or if I were alone I would have been great. The bathroom was a dramatic and comfortable space. Rainfall shower, bidet toilet, sumptuous towels. Pierre, the concierge couldn't have been more helpful arranging a purchase of towels to send home. Tammy, Justine, and the Manager were all lovely. The Lambs Club for breakfast was stellar.

title: Lovely stay
text: A wonderful experience at a boutique hotel which reminded me of the Prince De Galles in Paris. The doorman greeted us each time we came and went and even took our picture under the Chatwal entrance. Fantastic location! Walked to Food Network restaurant such as Butter Midtown and to Phantom of the Opera. We enjoyed listening to music in the lobby in the evening and dining at The Lamb Club which offers a pre-theater menu. It is inconvenient that they do not offer coffee in the room and that you have to go down to the lobby; however, it was available and complimentary each morning. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are sleek. I loved the Asprey products. The flatscreen tv is in a frame on the wall, sit back and enjoy your show in the comfy beds. I also liked the TV in the bathroom mirror. The butler manager was very friendly, greeting us coffee one morning. We were disappointed that we were not informed that the hot tub was closed due to construction. There was also construction at the front desk which made for longer check out lines. The room is very small for two people. Two small suitcases made it hard to walk around the bed.

title: 3rd time & still happy to come back again!
text: still luving everything about this hotel. its intimacy, the breakfast, the room, etc. was a wee bit disappointed that i was not able to get a junior suite with a balcony, despite making my reservation months ago. also i feel the housekeeping has slipped a bit. each day, i found dirty glasses still n my room, no amenities n the bathrm, etc. i called the front desk & they immediately dealt with these small issues. i will still happily come back next year, tho! cannot beat its location!!

title: Loved this hotel
text: Nothing to complain about at this hotel.  Friendly staff, good service, clean and modern accommodations, good attention to detail.  The king suite was a good size with a separate living area and a huge, luxurious bathroom.  Hotel is well situated, close to Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue etc. etc.

title: Boutique or Bust - Amazing Experience!!!
text:
We celebrated my husband's 40th birthday with a trip to New York City to see the ball drop on New Year's Eve.  When we began looking for hotels, we decided early in our planning we were going to avoid the normal hotel chains.  The chains' cancellation policies were rigid and the rooms were unimpressive and expensive. 

We were not naive and understood we were going to pay a pretty penny to stay in this location at the time of year we chose to visit. However, I can honestly say we did not mind paying for this top-notch accommodation.  They offered a super package which included a well-appointed room and breakfast every morning.  When we mentioned our special occasion we received a room upgrade which included a sitting room, balcony and a butler.  In researching this hotel, I had noticed some of the other travelers had been upgraded and didn't expect we would benefit from the hotel's  generosity at one of their busiest times of the year. 

Beyond the hotel's beautiful accommodations, the location could not have been better. We were in the heart of Manhattan.  Shopping, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and Broadway were just minutes away. We walked to all of these places, in December, without discomfort.  On the night of the Ball Drop, we were given instructions about navigating the area during the New Year's festivities.  We went to our party (see my Applebee's review) and made it back to the hotel without any trouble whatsoever.  As we shuffled through the streets back to the hotel, the confetti was still falling on Broadway. We grabbed some out of the air and off of the ground, only to find our balcony covered in the bright circles and squares when we arrived back at The Chatwal.  Truly a peaceful retreat in the bustle of the Big Apple.

title: Perfect Location
text: Really nice hotel. Expensive but worth it. No free parking! if you've got a car, you must find out car park charges around the hotel first! Staff are warm and helpfull. Wifi works very good. Room bar a bit expensive!

title: Lovely, Quiet Boutique Hotel
text: Stayed here for 3 nights in a standard room.  Quite nicely appointed with interesting accents and a spacious bathroom.  Got a good night's sleep with no noise from other rooms or from outside. Loved the decor of the lobby and bar areas.  All the staff were friendly and helpful.  Drinks were a tad slow on what didn't seem like a busy weeknight, but we weren't in a huge hurry anyway.  Wished it were a little closer to a subway stop, but other than that I would definitely stay here again.

title: Serenity in NYC
text:
To provide some background I stayed for one night (Sat-Sun) and as a SPG Platinum member, who spends over 200 nights a year in hotels, I booked the stay on points (30K/night). i arrived at the hotel very early, approximately 8 a.m., and not expecting my room to be available I was pleasantly surprised to find that the room was available. I used a suite night upgrade and was put in the Serenity Suite on the 7th floor. The suite was very well furnished and as other writers have mentioned the rooms are very technologically advanced. The best part of the room was the large terrace which was furnished/decorated beautifully. I honestly believe the Terrace alone makes the room worth it. 

Hotel Differentiators Compared to Other NYC Properties:
- Staff are always smiling, ready to help, and very attentive to detail from the front desk to housekeeping to the Lamb's Club
- Rooms are extremely clean, bathroom products are excellent, technology in the room is the best I have seen in NY
- Furnishings in the hotel as well as in the rooms are meticulously selected and if you are into the history of buildings this edifice is one of a kind
- Noise level is slim to none, for a hotel being in the "belly of the beast" of NYC you would expect a lot of ambient noise but I could not ask for a more blissful night's rest

I would definitely stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat, for anyone looking for a nice Oasis in the middle of the city look no further.

The only minute let down was that in the room there was a wonderful selection of coffee table books that I could not put down. The books indicated they were all available for purchase and when I asked to purchase one of them, "To India With Love," I was told I could not purchase the book. Again, not a big deal in the grand scheme of things and should not deter anyone from staying at this beautiful hotel.

title: Awesome hotel - great location
text: This hotel is own of its best in NYC. Maybe not because of the building - only five floors - but the service is awesome and so many things are thought through. The location is great and the price compared to many other hotels is fair too.

title: Quiet Oasis in the heart of Times Square
text: This unbelievably quiet, spotlessly clean luxury boutique hotel one block from Times Square is a perfect oasis.  Brandon Short, the Director of Butler Services, made sure that we had everything we needed during our stay.  And to top it off, the restaurant was great. We highly recommend The Chatwal and plan to return as soon as possible.

title: Priceline's 5* Express Deal in the Times Square Area
text: I'm glad I got a good deal because the room was small and it looked into the building next door.  The decor is very dark, stylish, but dark.  The bed was comfortable.  The staff was good.  One day, when returning to the room, I found a housekeeper steaming the cotton bedspread.  Wow!   The bathroom was fantastic.  It was very large, with all the modern amenities.  Plus it was beautiful, with it's glittering black granite.  It's only a half block walk to Times Square, but fairly quiet inside.  Grand Central Station is only a few blocks away.  Saju Bistro is a two doors down and has fantastic food, including breakfasts.

title: Good not great hotel
text: The staff is what you expect from high end luxury hotel.   They are responsive to your needs.  They have house car but it can only drive you in a 20 block radius which is nice.  The lobby is small like a boutique hotel which is unexpected.  The Red Door spa is nice and you can get a discount if you book through American Express. Overall, for a luxury hotel, you can find better value, service and ambiance in some of the competitor hotels, Ritz, InterContintental, etc

title: Close to the action but quiet hotel
text: The Chatwal is a boutique luxury hotel close on Times Square on 44th Street.  The service is attentive and rooms are well appointed.  The hotel is close to the shopping, action of Times Square and a short walk to many broadway shows ... but quiet so you can have a good sleep. I would prefer a coffee maker in the room but at 7 am they have complementary coffee service in the lobby.  wifi is free. The room was a bit tight and small and we did have a hard time with the heat.  It took setting the AC to 66 to get a normal temperature in the room.

title: The Chatwal Has Slipped
text:
When The Chatwal first opened a few years ago, I was wowed.  Now I'm not.  It is by no means at the same level it was; sorry to say, I would not return again. While it's pretty inside and convenient to the theater district, it no longer goes the extra mile to make the cost ($900/night for a double) worthwhile.
Upon arrival I realized I had forgotten my phone charger and asked the front desk whether the room had a charging station or if the hotel could lend me a charging cord for the night.  No on both counts -- as to a loaner, I was told "We don't do that."  There was no further effort on the part of the staff, not even to tell me somewhere close by that I could purchase one:  they just didn't care.  Given the common nature of this problem, I was surprised at the lack of help.
I was also sorry that the hotel no longer lends iPads to its guests as it did in the past, and that there are no longer hard-boiled eggs provided at the upstairs bar.  These were nice extra touches that I appreciated on my prior visit.  Finally, though the room was clean and handsome and breakfast was good, some of the staff, particularly the doormen, seemed uninterested in their jobs -- they either chatted with passing tourists instead of opening the doors or helping us with luggage, or were nowhere to be found.  Bottom line:  The Chatwal is now just another hotel, so next time I'll spend my hotel dollars elsewhere.

title: A Gem in the middle of the City
text:
Stayed overnight for a connecting flight and I wish I had more time. Great service all round, lovely room, great food and friendly staff who go out of their way to ensure that their guests enjoy the absolute best service. Like the fact that you have some candy while waiting for the elevator. Will definitely return to this hotel. 
Loved the black face towel to help with washing off make up after a night on the town.

title: Overpriced and Under Deliver
text: The Chawal is a boutique luxury hotel on 44th street just off of Times Square.  Its a very expensive hotel that I found disappointing.  I checked in and asked of a quiet room facing the alley (no view).  To be fair to the front dest clerk, she told me the room was a bit small.  At a price of over $620/night (excluding taxes) it should be pretty nice.  The room was in fact the smallest hotel room I have ever been in.  You couldn't take more than 3 steps before you hit a wall.  They try hard to have a lot of gadgets etc in the room which makes it even smaller and more cluttered.  I found the service in the hotel to be abysmal.  I returned from my meeting at 4:30 in the afternoon and they still hadn't serviced the room.  I had breakfast for 2 in the Lambs club and despite the fact that the restaurant was at best 90% empty the waiter blissfully ignored us until he dropped off our nearly $100 check without saying a word.   I experienced similar feelings of invisibility as we attempted to order a drink in the bar.  I will say that my oatmeal was decent....although for $100 I would hope for something amazing.  NYC has a number of expensive hotels that provide a better value despite the price.  Skip this one.

title: An island of quiet
text:
This is a boutique hotel in the theatre district. Pricey, but worth the cost. Nice restaurant, quiet rooms, and attentive staff. 

I don't usually respond to the reviews from others, but I believe that I must. 

This is a small hotel in Manhattan. It has charm. Small hotels in Manhattan do not have big health clubs and big pools. Sometimes they have soul, a great location, and offer a luxurious experience. The Chatwal provides. 

If you want lots of treadmills or a city view there are plenty of other places. Where they won't remember your name....

title: Great concierge
text:
Pierre, the concierge, was wonderful.  He was very helpful with our pre-arrival planning and suggestions and also with reservations and recommendations after arrival.  He is extremely pleasant.  Pierre really went out of his way to help us when we determined my husband lost his wallet shortly before we were to fly out.  We were very grateful for his efforts and concerns.  The doormen were also full of great suggestions.
The hotel is very lovely and great location.  We had a delicious dinner at The Lambs Club.

title: Best Hotel in NYNY
text: We have a new favorite hotel in NYNY.  I have never seen any property that exceeds expectations like the Chatwal.  Their Resturant, the Lambs Club is so perfect that we eat there at least once daily.  The entire staff at the hotel knows your name and they anticipate your every need.  This is our new go to hotel.  It is smaller than the ones we normally frequent (Ritz Battery and Central, Mandarin, Plaza) and better.  The location is in walking distance to most things we like to do as well.  Pay the extra for a balcony suite, it's worth it.

title: Klein aber fein, sehr fein...
text:
Wir waren im Februar 2016 in diesem Hotel. Zunächst waren wir etwas entäuscht. "Nur" 6 Stockwerke kleine Seitenstraße...Zimmer auf den Hinterhof...
Aber dann:
Ein tolles großes Zimmer, einwandfreie Ausstattung. Z.B. Fernseher im Spiegel im Bad und (nettes Gimik) beheizbarer Toilettensitz. Sauberkeit und Personal absolut 5 Sterne.
Essen war sehr gut und preislich auf New Yorker Niveau.
Lage super nur 1 Gehminute vom Time Square.
Was aber nicht hochgenug hervorgehoben werden kann ist das Personal.
Dazu eine kleine Geschichte: Der Zimmerservice hat den Lieblingskuschelbär unserer Tochter versehentlich mit dem Bettzeug in die Wäsche getan. Die Dame an der Rezeption versprach: "Wenn wir wieder da sind ist der Bär auch wieder da". Wir waren ca. 1h beim Essen. Und tatsächlich der Bär war wieder da. Und nicht nur das. Anbei lag ein Brief, in dem sich der Bär entschuldigt. Er war im Hotel unter wegs und hat "Selfies" gemacht. Diese lagen als Beweis ausgedruckt ebenfalls dabei.
Leider weiß ich nicht wie die Dame hieß aber nochmals auf diesem Weg meine Hochachtung vor soviel Gewitztheit und Charme und vielen Dank für die Selfies. Dank diese Erlebnisses wird das Chatwal immer ein besonders Hotel für uns bleiben!

title: Недоумение
text:
Пробыл в отеле 15 минут и выехал, решив потерять деньги, чем жить там. Забронировал номер делюкс с открытой террасой. 
1. Потолок в номере низкий настолько, что не припомню другого такого отеля (даже во Франции). 
2. В номере отвратительный запах. Видимо раньше в отеле мощно курили и потом пришлось обрабатывать номер. В результате запах табака заменили на запах застарелой ткани и химии. 
3. Терраса оказалась пространством 2 на 2 метра. Слева и справа плотная живая изгородь в 2 метра высотой, а прямо кирпичная стена в 2 метра высотой. Соответственно слева и справа такие же фейковые террасы соседних номеров. Да, посередине стоял стол и стулья. Места на террасе впритык чтобы обойти стол. Конда я въезжал мне сказали - о, вам повезло, на террасе будет замечательно. Это злая шутка. С террасы можно увидеть только небо, а сидеть в этом странном куба и смотреть на стены у своего носа может только маньяк.
В итоге мне стало так неприятно от всех этих прелестей, запаха, низкого потолка и фейковой террасы, что я тут же забронировал другой отель и ушел из отеля пешком. Это фейк отель. Мне сложно за такой номер, запах и состояние дать даже 4*.

title: Lujo y comodidad a un paso de Times Square
text:
Este hotel tiene una excelente ubicación a sólo unos pasos de Times Square, las habitaciones son cómodas, los baños son espaciosos y cuentan con lo último en tecnología. El personal es muy amable.
Para los que preferimos descansar bien se recomienda pedir habitaciones interiores, son mas calmas.

title: Great little hotel
text: This hotel is well located just off time square, staff are very helpful and friendly. The hotel is very clean and has a good bar and restaurant. Reception could not do enough to help and everything I requested was completed swiftly. My only fault on a person preference is there are no tea or coffee facilities in the room.

title: I want to be buried here when I die...
text:
because I want to spend eternity sleeping on that amazing bed.
Quiet, clean, comfortable and the staff is some of the best in the business - efficient, bright, personable and very helpful.
Close to anything you can imagine that you want to do in NYC!!!

title: Boutique Hotel
text:
This is an exceptional hotel. Art Deco motif done very well. We stayed in 809 and photos are shown. This is a large room with a private bath such that you don't wake up your spouse in the middle of the night by turning on a light or flushing the toilet. I have been to several renovated hotels where the bathrooms are made of glass. Hate that! 
Since it is 1/2 block off Broadway, it is very quiet.
Breakfast was excellent as we had their brunch which accompanied by a jazz group.
Truly worthwhile to stay at The Chatwal.

title: most amazing service
text: I went to the Chatwal because my daughter works for Starwood and she got me a room here for my birthday. I was going to see The Book of Mormon with a friend and the location of this little gem of a hotel was perfect. We at at the Lamb which has a 3 course "Theater" menu. Dimitri was a most excellent guide to walk us through what the hotel offered as well as the lamb and it's restaurant. I apologize that I do not know the names of the hotel staff, but EVERYONE was concerned that we have were treated well, had what needed, and WANTED and I couldn't have been happier. I am not a wealthy person, but it did not matter to ANYONE. They all made me feel special, just by being there. The room was well appointed and QUIET. No, I did not have a view, we were an alley room, but being a country person, I had a TERRIFIC nights' sleep because it was so quiet. I di not take advantage of the butler because, frankly, I did not know what to do with the service, but if I had asked, the staff would have been happy to help me. /the woman at the front desk was due to have a baby in July... I hope she has a healthy baby. I can not recommend this hotel enough!! Expensive, yes, but they ALL, from Front Desk to maids, to bell hops to valet, truly cared about how I was treated. Thank you!!!

title: Good location, comfortable and clean.
text:
The hotel is clean, comfortable and quiet (the rooms). It is a small hotel but if you are in NY to visit the town, I guess you don't need more than what is offered.

The location is very good, close to Bryant park and Times Square.

The staff was friendly and polite.

title: A gem in the heart of NYC
text:
The Chatwal is an oasis in one of the busiest paces on earth, Times Square. It's rooms are elegant, the attached restaurant (The Lamb) excellent (save for an oddly arrogant wine steward), the spa and workout facility convenient and well run and the staff superb.

I have made this boutique hotel my home on over ten occasions and have never been disappointed.

title: Classy hotel in a very good location
text: This hotel is in a great place just off Times Square and near lots of bars and restaurants. It has an Art Deco feel to it and the overall effect is pure class. It is a smaller hotel so if you are looking for a chain, then this is probably not for you. I also spotted some stars of the silver screen here too. Staff are attentive, check in was good and although our room was not ready they stored our luggage and we used their safety deposit box for our valuables whilst we went out exploring. Really comfortable beds and spectacular bathrooms, sparkly tiles and this gives the bathroom a very decadent feel. Yes this place is special.

title: Perfect
text: Quite simply, the nicest place I have ever stayed. The service is impeccable and friendly, the rooms are exquisite, and we were treated like VIPs. It's a half a block from Times Square, but just far enough to still be relaxing.

title: 5 Star????
text: My husband and I stayed at the Chatwal to celebrate our 20th Wedding Anniversary.  We stayed for 5 nights,  We booked a Junior Suite with Terrace.  Upon arrival there was a bottle of Champagne, flowers, a fruit platter and a very nice note for our anniversary.  I felt the room was on the small side and can't imagine the size of a regular room.  The terrace was huge and nicely decorated with planters.  We faced 44th street but there was really no view.  Woke up the first morning and phoned the butler to get me coffee.  She told me that I can get it myself in the lobby.  Really?? Ok so I did.  After getting ready for the day I felt that something was off with the bathroom, I specifically remember booking this room for the double sinks.  We only had one sink in the bathroom and it was very small.  I went and checked their website and it stated that with this room category had a bathroom with double sinks.  I brought it to the attention of the front desk and they adjusted my rate to reflect a deluxe king room with a terrace.  They did the right thing but I would have rather had the double sinks than the adjustment.  Asked to use the house car on Sunday evening and was told that the house car doesn't operate on Sunday and Monday. Really??? It should be seven days a week.  Never did get to use the car because everytime we asked it wasn't available.  We order room service for breakfast on the day of our anniversary..made this request prior to arrival.  Room service was delivered quickly and it was to be outside on the terrace.He set it up but never put a table cloth on the table.  Really??  Our room came with free breakfast and on the day they charged us.  Why I don't know.  Need to resolve that.  On our last night we went to the lobby bar where there is only one bartender that serves the restaurant and the lobby bar.  We sat there for ten minutes waiting for a drink.  Here's an idea...have two bartenders.  And  finally on the last night we never received turn down service.  Annoying....Also getting bottled water was always a production.  Sometimes turndown would leave water and other times not.  Had to call to get bottled water.  Really??  I was so excited about staying at this hotel based on TA reviews.  The hotel fell short...Would not stay there again.

title: Great service, beautiful hotel
text: All of the staff were wonderful- from the doorman to the concierge Juan to the butler Brandon to the housekeeper Sonia - everyone was courteous, professional and sweet.  Our junior suite was beautifully appointed and meticulously clean and i love the Art Deco inspired decor.

title: Hotel très luxueux
text:
L’hôtel est magnifique, nous avons attéris dans cet hôtel suite à un surbooking sur un autre hôtel. Et nous n'avons pas été déçu par cet luxueux hôtel
La salle de bain est grande et très propre
La chambre est grande et très belle
Le reste de l’hôtel est aussi magnifique, mais non n'avons pas tester tout par manque de temps

title: An amazing hotel, an amazing stay!
text:
We stayed at the Chatwal last weekend, and I wish we could have stayed longer!  Wow, what a gem in the bustling heart of the city-- great if you want to be close to theater, great if you want easy access to most parts of the city.  The Chatwal is a small luxury boutique hotel with an amazing deco style and attention to detail.  We were upgraded to the jr. suite, and when we got to the room we were in awe - the grey microsuede-like walls with amazing lighting-- leather wrapped door and closet handles everywhere, the all black sparkly bathroom (yes it SPARKLES!) with deep jacuzzi tub and gorgeous amenities. And the biggest surprise, a heated toilet seat with front/back bidet and dryer-- WHAT?? insane!  

The closets were designed steamer trunk style-- with plenty of room and shelving-- definitely worth mentioning. The furniture was gorgeous, the bed was comfortable and the room even came with a private butler. Sadly, we were only there for a night, but it was a truly memorable stay. 

We also had a great jazz brunch at the hotel restaurant called the Lamb's Club, which was delicious.  We are native NY'ers so we don't have a need to stay at a hotel in the city all that often, but next time and every time after that this will be the place.   Finally, ALL of the staff were all true professionals, warm and informative and very helpful!

title: Great Hotel in New York City
text:
New York is full of hotels up to the most luxurious in the world. I prefer the Chatwal for it's size, you're not checking like you're checking in for a flights with 1000's of others. Instead of those mega hotel with thousands of rooms it gives a very personal feel to stay at a very small hotel. The service is very attentative, the restaurant is great. The rooms are very nice. Oh and the rooms are quiet, nice in such a busy city. 

I would only warn people that the pool is the size of about 6 baths and about 1 meter deep. So don't go there if you want to do some good swimming in the morning.

title: Chatwal is the best place to stay in NY
text: I travel to NY regularly and have stayed at many hotels.  The Chatwal is by far the best.  The rooms are lovely.  It is convenient to the theatre.   Most importantly the staff at the hotel is fantastic.  They are so friendly and go out of the way to make your stay the best it can be.  They make you feel at home and welcome and will help with whatever is needed.  I am always disappointed when I can't get into the Chatwal and need to stay somewhere else.

title: Great hotel but beds are hard!
text: I love this hotel. It has beautiful rooms which are a good size for NYC. They have a very attentive staff. The Lamb's club - the restaurant onsite - is fit for foodies. My only complaint is that the beds are extremely firm. They could really use a pillow topper of some sort. Stayed at a mid level Marriott in Michigan two nights later and the beds were much more comfortable. A luxury hotel should have better mattresses.

title: A gem
text: Love, love, love this gem of a hotel.  The staff couldn't have been more helpful.  Tucked away in the very busy theatre district just off Times Square, the rooms are beautifully appointed and quiet.  Alejandro, the Lambs Club restaurant manager was delightful in suggesting some authentic experiences for our first time visit to NYC.

title: Our most miserable hotel experience ever.....
text:
Wouldn't ya think that the Chatwal would have the courtesy and caring to warn one ahead of time, or at least at check in, that there will be a jack hammer operating inches from ones head from early morning until late in the day? Forgetaboutit!!!

Now we understand why the Chatwal offers a steep discount for a non refundable, cash in advance payment. Any idiot would check out as fast as they checked in otherwise.

Other disappointments at the Chatwal for our $1050.00 per night room include: putting us in a 400 sq foot "King Suite"  instead of the 520 sq ft suite as advertised and promised, lack of complimentary fruit plate, comp in room water, and in room coffee maker.
 

Yea the Chatwal will cough up the coffee maker (motel 6 variety), free water, and an orange or two, if you ask nicely, but nothing will stop the incessant and teeth jarring jackhammer being used at the gut renovation happening right behind your headboard.

title: Ideal y Boutique!
text:
Me encanto este hotel! Esta muy bien ubicado! A pasos de Times Square y a pasos de la 5ta avenida! Es tranquilo y se puede dormir en silencio! Gran cosa en NYC
Las habitaciones tienen el tamaño preciso, cómodas y grato diseño.
De todas maneras volvería!
Imperdible en estos momentos la obra Blackbird! Justo al frente del hotel
Muy amables todos también!

title: Excellent boutique hotel in a central location
text: We stayed at the Chatwal for 6 nights and were extremely happy with our choice.  Whilst being in a very central location it is also provided a calm respite from the madness of Times Square!  The hotel was very stylish and everywhere was spotlessly clean. The bar and restaurant were also very pleasant and we particularly enjoyed the live jazz at Sunday brunch. The staff were all very helpful and the complimentary car service for the local area was also an added bonus.

title: Very good !
text: Perfect location. Nice rooms. Thanks for the upgrade for those 6 nights we stayed. At breakfast it would be nice if a checklist would help the daily changing staff to place salt & pepper on the table, without every day having to ask for - specially if your guest is ordering eggs ... Same thing with the jam, some serve you a variety in jars, others don't.

title: Love, Love, Love The Service at the Chatwal
text: The Chatwal is a true gem in the middle of midtown. I come here often and my last visit was near my birthday. When I arrived, the bellman at the door wished me a happy birthday and so did virtually every staff member I saw. I didn't expect that but the attention to personal service was really nice. The rooms are not huge but I love the decor. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms exceptionally clean. My room had a nice big rain shower. It was on the 7th floor and also had a  terrace. What is really exceptional about this hotel is how quiet it is. It is really easy to get a good nights sleep. Tammy, the guest relations manager is part of their success. She really pays attention to detail.

title: Blizzard of 2016.
text: We visited The Chatwal for the first time in January during the weekend of the Blizzard.  It is a beautiful hotel and the room we had was lovely.  I was there with my daughter and she wanted to build a snowman.   I knew that the hotel had some rooms with a terrace and I inquired about a reduced rate for moving to one for our last night so that my daughter could build one.  The manager was wonderful and even supplied us with something to use for eyes and arms.  Can't wait to stay there again this summer.  We have stayed at several hotels in NYC but this is our favorite.

title: Hidden gem in NYC
text:
Just returned from our first ever trip to NYC and had a marvelous stay at the Chatwal. Hubby used his suite night award as part of SPG platinum privileges to upgrade to the Junior suite King room. The room was very spacious and well appointed. Even before our stay began, we already felt very much welcome. This is all thanks to the wonderful Chatwal concierge name Pierre Delgado. I cannot thank him enough in helping me secure tables at highly rated Michelin restaurants (which is hard to come by at the last minute), help me sort out my transportation bookings with other external companies and also help me re-booked the dinner reservations which I mistakenly thought was another day. Pierre also gave us very good suggestions on how to get around NYC and dining options. We are lucky to have met Pierre during our stay, he sure made our stay at NYC memorable. 

As mentioned by other reviewers, Chatwal is a boutique hotel conveniently located steps away from the hustle bustle of Times Square. Yet you are sparred from the noisy streets cause it's located at a smaller street. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC. Strategic location yet very friendly staff. 

P/s: we stayed at Conrad NYC after few nights at Chatwal. Hands down, Chatwal did it better. I guess the dedicated concierge desk made all the difference!

title: Spectacular Midtown Choice
text:
My wife and I stayed at the Chatwal to accommodate a weekend full of events.  Living just outside of NYC, we rarely have a need to stay overnight.  Fortunately, a quick search on SPG produced this wonderful luxury property which was recently added to their portfolio.

Our first impression was certified as exceptional as a result of the immediate, effortless greeting we received at the entrance by the bellman.  This extended to Julie at the front desk who just nailed it!  While we waited for our room (we were early), Javier demonstrated why he is an invaluable asset while doing his magic in the lobby bar.

The room and the spa both exceeded our expectations of luxury property experiences.

Top it off with a courtesy car that will take you anywhere within a 20 block radius and it is hard to think we would select any other hotel in the future.

title: Fantastic in every way!
text:
Just steps from Times Square, the location of the Chatwal cannot be beat. Once you step inside, you're surrounded by an oasis of tranquility. It's like stepping back in time to the 1930's with shiny chrome and smartly dressed staff. Sit at the lobby bar and enjoy a tasty cocktail prepared by the white jacketed bartender, or head to the Red Door spa for a massage. 

The rooms are nicely sized for Manhattan, with leather covered closets and soft, luxurious sheets. Linger under the heavy rain shower head and indulge in the high end amenities. Need something? A quick phone call brings a cheery staff member to your door in minutes to make your experience heaven.

My husband and I go every year to celebrate our anniversary, and every year I am ecstatic with the experience.

title: Exceptional luxury
text: What a perfect hotel for a quick weekend getaway! My husband and I spent a blissful 24 hours here for our 10th anniversary and it couldn't have been better. The service, the decor, the food in The Lamb's Club... everything was perfection. We were so comfortable and catered to, we lacked for nothing and enjoyed every moment of our stay. If this was noisy midtown, we never would have known it, it was so quiet! And what a convenient location. We'll be back!

title: A stylish base in the heart of Midtown
text: What a fantastic, well-located hotel. Nothing was too much trouble, from a welcoming check-in, through to complimentary use of the town car for journeys within a few blocks. Located in the heart of Broadway, it was just a short walk to some of the city's best sights. I have to add: the pillows were perhaps the best I've ever had the pleasure of using!

title: Amazing again
text: 6th visit to the hotel and again it does not fail to impress. Amazing staff that provides 5 star service from the point of entering the hotel. Luxury rooms with refined fabrics, furniture and technology. Walk-in showers with TV screens on each of the bathrooms. Amazing breakfast at the lambs Restaurent. Truly a luxury 5star hotel in the heart of NY. Stone through away from Times Square but secluded on a quiet road which provides the best of NY has to offer.

title: Superb is an understatement!!
text:
Made reservation on a whim. Never hear of the Chatwal. 
Staff: exceptional'
Service: Exceptional
Location: Close to Time Square but ensconced and protected.
Management: Exceptional
Proximity to fine dining, such as Gabriel Kreuther
Rating: 5 stars and beyond
Rather pricey but worth it.

title: Blissful luxury
text: From the front of the house to the back you will not be disappointed.  The staff, the amenities, the food... I could never say enough about the entire experience.  Make sure to set time aside for lunch or dinner at the Lambs club, you will not be disappointed.

title: a good location
text: We stayed here for a night out in nyc.  Location is great and services are friendly.  We got a last minute deal and I think we were put in the smallest and darkest room on the 3rd floor.  We are familiar with how nyc hotel rooms are small but this was hard for 2 people to move around.  Our room also faced the wall of the next building, about 10 feet away.  Amenities and bathroom are very nice.  Not likely to stay here again.

title: Luxury just around the corner from Time Square
text:
The Chatwal is part of the luxury collection for Starwood and they definitely work on pleasing their guests.  It is about a 15 minute walk from New York's Penn Station with pretty much a straight walk up 7th Avenue until 44th Street.  I found it easily when I rounded the corner and saw their red banners hanging from the side of the building.

The doorman greeted me and quickly opened the huge doors to the hotel lobby.  The lobby is clean and elegant and the staff welcoming and pleasant.  I love that the elevator security will only allow you to access the floor that your key is coded.  We were on one of the lower floors and I found the room spacious and nicely laid out.  One thing to note that this is an older building and the street noise from our lower floor was a bit loud during the night.

The bathroom was fantastic - double sink and large shower with a huge rain head shower.  It's decorated with glass and chrome and a hidden TV behind the middle panel.  How cool!  

The turn down service completes your evening with slippers and a mat laid out alongside the bed.  Even though the price at the Chatwal can be on the higher side, for a special evening it is well worth the money to be treated as someone special.

title: Great boutique stay - great location and staff!
text: I got upgraded luckily so I was on the 9th floor with a nice open view.  The staff was really great.  The Lambs Club - do not miss!  Rooms are spacious and comfortable, great amenities - killer shower!    Very attentive service and bellman.

title: Love this place!
text: I stayed here with my husband and was very pleased with the room and the service. The service is impeccable. I'm a nursing mother and needed to store my breastmilk in their freezer. They had no issue and was very accommodating. I forgot dishsoap to clean my breast pump parts and they brought me some from the kitchen. They were very helpful and made us feel extremely welcomed. The rooms were sleek and so comfortable. The mini bar was decked out. The only minor things that I will mention was from our bathroom you can hear conversations from other people in other rooms....I think because of the vent. Also, our shower water went all over the floor because there wasn't a full door. It was one of those half shower glass doors. We just asked for extra towels and solved that issue. But the toilet was also a bidet and the seat was heated...soooo nice! Loved the location as well. I would stay again!

title: Almost flawless
text: If you're looking for an oasis in the midst of crazy times square, this is an elegant, well appointed hotel. Beautiful rooms, (I had a junior king suite) amazing bathroom with everything you need. My only issue is the internet is super slow which is nutty in this day and she. Otherwise, it's a gem.

title: Fabulous New York Hotel
text:
From checkin to checkout -  Perfection.  This Hotel is a very smart boutique hotel close to Times Square.  It is an oasis from hustle and bustle.  Rooms were very comfortable with lovely décor.  Had dinner at the  wonderful Lambs Club.  Pre - theatre dinner was perfect in every way.
Food and wine selection, ambiance and a very caring staff.  The staff is what makes this hotel very special.  Staff is every hotel's biggest asset.
I am a Travel Agent and would happily recommend this hotel to my clients and anyone else that wants to know about a very special property.
Thanks again to the entire staff for a memorable Easter weekend.

title: Un hotel de lujo en Times Square
text: Recomiendo este excelente hotel para estar ubicado en la zona de teatros. Un hotel de lujo con habitaciones muy cómodas, cama excelente y un lujoso baño. Los empleados siempre bien dispuestos. La zona es muy divertida de día y sobre todo de noche con múltiples opciones todas recomendadas, teatros, restaurantes o solo caminar por las calles de las grandes pantallas. A su vez está muy bien ubicado para salir a caminar por la Quinta Avenida hacia el Central Park.

title: Two days, two experiences
text: We arrived on Friday and the service was flawless. From Tashi at the Front Desk to Juan at the Concierge Desk, we were very impressed. We really thought we found a new go-to Hotel when travelling to midtown! We woke up on Saturday, however, to an entirely different caliber of employees. We thought we would keep experiencing the superb service level and eat in rather than venturing out. We approached a 100% empty restaurant and were greeted by the restaurant hostess at breakfast with "room number?" and that was it. She showed us to the table, presented menus, and left us. We asked our server for some recommendations and he responded, "your only options are this or this". We started to understand why the restaurant must be empty and departed without ordering. We approached the Front Desk for an alternate recommendation. There was no empathy or even inquiry for additional details; the man only said that the restaurant is a different department and a lot of guests go to the Hotel next door. The doorman was the most sincere and said he would relay the concern to Management. We passed the desk twice again and nobody uttered a word. I think we spent upwards of $1,100 that night in room revenue (pre tax) and left wondering which department handles guest recognition?

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Very classy, friendly and excellent service. Attention to detail. Quiet and sophisticated. Location is close to Times Square but feels away from the craziness. Lovely afternoon tea in lovely bar area. Excellent breakfast. Interesting cocktails.

title: The best hotel I have stayed at in NYC
text: Convenient located 1/2 a block from Times Square, close to theaters, restaurants, shops, important venues and sight seeing spots of the city, we could do it all just walking. Close to metro stations. Quiet street. Luxurious and spacious room. Amasing ammenities at the bathroom. Very cozy. Swimming pool available and also a spa. Restaurant was a AAA+ experience. Free Wi Fi connection. Overall a wonderful experience at an affordable and just price. Highly recommended !

title: Impressive luxury in Times Square
text: I was pleasantly surprised by the modern, luxurious decor of the Chatwal.  Luxury Collection hotels can sometimes be dated, but the Chatwal exceeded all expectations.  The staff were wonderful and they offered an extremely comfortable, personalized experience.  I do not love staying near Times Square, but aside from the location, the Chatwal is one of the nicest Starwood properties I have stayed at in NYC.

title: Christmastime in the city
text: My family and I spent Christmas in New York, and this hotel was the obvious choice because it offered all the amenities that we were looking for. There was a restaurant, a spa, room service, a personal butler, and THE most luxurious bathroom I've ever seen- marble everywhere, a TV in the mirror, and even a heated toilet! On top of all of that, you can't beat the location. It's within walking distance to all the theatres, Times Square and Radio City. Every single member of the staff held themselves with the utmost kindness and professionalism- they spoke to us, and called us by name whenever they saw us. I found this most impressive. We hugged them when we left, because it felt like we were saying goodbye to new friends.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Stayed at The Chatwal with my husband to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. We had previously stayed here for our 25th and knew we had to return. Our stay was everything we expected and more. The proximity to Broadway shows can't be beat. We were given an upgraded room and a complimentary bottle of champagne with a note from the manager wishing us a splendid stay and happy anniversary. The comfort of the beds and luxurious bathrooms are unparalleled. Dinner at the Lambs Club is a must.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Staff was exceptional, room was on 8th floor and very quite.  Great location in Times Square area.  Wifi was the best I've experienced in a long time and quality was appreciated.  Made it much easier to work.  Drinks in the bar after dinner was nice finish to the evening.  I will certainly stay here again.

title: Great place to stay with proximity to Broadway shows
text: With a short walk to all Broadway theaters, beautiful art deco decor, and excellent service, The Chatwal is a good choice.  The Lamb's Club is located within, a fantastic restaurant with a great brunch.

title: Not a luxury property
text:
The Chatwal was the last upscale SPG property I had yet to try in NYC, so when I saw them running a promo off their normally St. Regis-level rates, I decided to give it a try. Unfortunately, it's incredibly disappointing. Despite being a SPG platinum 100 member, my room was not ready at 3pm check-in. I then did an 8 hour slate of meetings to be treated to the tiniest room I've stayed at in Manhattan (which is saying a lot) that had its desk outlets and phone inoperable. The bed is 3 feet from the curtains, which, after operating the fancy remote control drapes, reveal, wait for it, a wall with a tiny window looking into an alley! The room says it comes with butler-service, but at check in, it was not described how to call a butler or what services they provide, unlike the wonderful service at the St. Regis.

The night front desk manager was very friendly, but foreshadowed how awful the room is by eagerly offering to text me the next day if an upgrade became available. I will also say that the reservations staff was very friendly and graciously shortened my stay when I had my plans change despite booking the non-refundable promo. Nevertheless, unless a shoebox room like this should NEVER be offered at a "luxury" hotel with a normal rate of $650. It's a disgrace and every room I've stayed at numerous visits to the lower status Westin Grand Central has been far nicer.

title: Fantastic stay except for the neighbors
text: Fantastic hotel! As a SPG platinum member got an upgraded room.  Front desk able to accommodate an early arrival.  Breakfast was wonderful.  Egg sandwich sounds blah but was so good calling it a egg sandwich is a great disservice.  Room amenities were well beyond expectations. Service was above any beyond expectations. Location is perfect.  A stones throw from Times Square without any outside noise noticeable from anywhere in the hotel.   Only downside was very noisy people in the next room partying until 2:30 in the morning.  Next time will specifically request no adjoining room.

title: That extra mile!
text:
I am a frequent visitor of this hotel and I have to say that it never fails!!! 
The staff are superb at every level and are truly helpful and professional. 
The rooms are fantastic, the beds so comfortable and the location is ideal. 
The food is also excellent both in the lambs club and room service. 
It's the extra touches that set the chatwal apart.  Upon arrival the duty manager arranged for a late checkout which we are so grateful for. The hotel provides a complimentary limo service to guests between certain times. Our driver was so courteous and made it a great experience.
The doormen are superb.  Jonas, Ali, Micheal and the rest of the boys on the door have made us feel at home. They are always ready to assist us and also provide great advice on local restaurants! 
Well done everyone and see you again !

title: Anniversary Weekend
text: The hotel staff made us feel so special for our get away weekend.  We were welcomed with a nice bottle of wine and some chocolates.  We loved that the hotel interior maintained such an historic feel, yet everything was modern and high-tech too.  Before dinner out we enjoyed drinks in the dramatic upstairs bar.  Also the continental breakfast in the Lamb's club was fantastic.

title: Absolutely stunning
text: We loved every moment of our stay at The Chatwal, it is absolutely stunning and the attention to every detail was amazing. We would throughly recommend it to anybody. We felt very comfortable there and the staff couldn't have been any nicer. Perfect in every way.

title: Quiet little gem
text: Great little hotel in the heart of the action. Service was wonderful and rooms were well appointed. I was really happy with my room on the back of the building as it was very quiet. The downstairs bar was great and had live music while I was there.

title: The Chatwal
text: A truly unique hotel located in the heart of NYC.  The interior design of the hotel is exquisite Art Deco style and the staff are extremely attentive to your every need.  Our room was spacious and extremely quiet amongst the madness of Times Square which is just around the corner.  The Red Door Spa was a fantastic added addition to the hotel and the treatments were amazing.  I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone looking for a relaxing short city break in NYC.

title: Poolside to Broadway...
text: The Chatwal is a great property, in a good location, with an excellent staff. A quick weekend away was needed. My two days were filled with much enjoyment. Saturday, we enjoyed the relaxing peaceful pool in the spa before venturing out into the heart of Manhattan for some shopping. Surrounded around so many theaters we could not miss this opportunity to see a Broadway show. We arrived to the theater in style in The Chatwal's Red Mercedes house car. The next morning while getting ready for brunch I realized my new shirt was wrinkled. But a wrinkled shirt is no problem at The Chatwal. The butler was able to steam and return my shirt before I was even done getting ready. All in all we had a fabulous stay at The Chatwal and will be back!

title: Luxury hotel few steps from Times Square
text: The best about this hotel is location. It's just across Hudson theater, next street are few more, Times square at the corner. The worst thing — is location also. It's the most touristic place in the world. Lot's of people, crowd everywhere, noise. From your window at luxury room you can see the backyard and the wall of neighbor house. If you use to it, no problem, but I would prefer to stay at more relaxing atmosphere. As for the hotel itself, yes it's luxury, service is good for New York but I was always feeling that its huge posh hotel with tiny rooms.

title: Wedding weekend
text: The most perfect weekend for our wedding. Our suite, the entire staff, the service, the spa, the restaurant were exquisite to the finest detail. We have been guests at the Chatwal before and this experience exceeded our highest expectations. We highly recommend this hotel for anyone desiring the most spectacular, most elegant and most sophisticated vacation in NYC.

title: One of the best hotels in the world.
text: The perfect location for our New York city trip, high class, 100% friendliness, Only a few steps away from the main theaters and the most well-known square of the world (Times Square). Difficult or maybe impossible to do better...

title: a five star hotel in every sense
text: I have started going to New York every other week for work, and have made the Chatwal my new home away from home. I arrive late at night after a long day of work and travel and am always received with prompt and courteous service. The Chatwal has everything I look for: comfortable work areas, a great bed, wonderful bathrooms, and perhaps the most important thing: quietness. The Chatwal has all of these things, with stelar  personal service. Great hotel .

title: Home Away from Home
text: I love this hotel!  It's my all time favorite in New York.  The service is personal and impeccable.  They remember and recognize me and remember details about me and my business needs.  The rooms are elegant and comfy.  The restaurants and bars are exquisite.  I love the attention to my tastes and guests.  They treat me like royalty.

title: After more than 40 trips to the big apple I cannot believe I've never stayed at this gem !
text:
From checking in to checking out there was not one thing to complain about 
Every member of staff smiled and greeted you at all times.
Nothing was too much trouble 
The rooms are a fantastic mix of contemporary and 1930s ...stunning 
Amazing bathroom with Frette towels and as prey toiletries 
Good breakfast choice too

title: Redefined Hotel Excellence
text:
My new wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. We wanted a week of excellent NYC food options, evenings of theater, and a lovely place to stay. Boy, did this work out, and in spades.

The team at the Chatwal is a cohesive group of hospitality professionals. At check in, they congratulated us on our wedding, noted our SPG Gold status, and mentioned an upgrade to an incredible room of the street-side of the property.

Bellmen were quick and helpful. The room is a beast of tech and features. Their soft product is to die for. Sheets, towels, robes, slippers. I was in heaven. The room design is thoughtful and catchy. Everything evokes an era of 1920's/30's, while still being luxurious and modern.

Service was top-notch. Our butlers, Brandon and Tinzin, were very rarely needed, but did what they said they would. I found the doormen and bellmen to be a standout, in terms of consistent helpful service.

Onsite F&B is tiny, but well-executed. Dinner at The Lambs Club was quick, painless, and exquisite, despite one awkward moment where our dinner came well before our cocktails. The lobby bar featured incredible drinks, crafted by a stellar team.

The location can't be praised enough. We saw three shows and could stroll back to our hotel within minutes after each. On one occasion, we walked back from The Belasco theater that was literally just across the street.

The biggest downside of this hotel? This is unquestionably where we have to stay whenever we come back to Manhattan. Staying anywhere else will feel like we're cheating.

title: Beautiful Hotel hidden in the Centre of NYC
text: Absolutely faultless the ambiance and decor of art deco period. The staff where more than helpful and the concierge could arrange anything you could wish for. The room was very spacious and had a small balcony bi cold for this when we went! The bathrooms are fabulous with a fancy toilet and a tv in the mirror! The restaurant was very good when we ate there on a couple of occasions. Lovely roaring fire to have a nice mulled cider in the afternoon after a morning sightseeing. Highly recommend. I actually stayed in November 2014.

title: Your home in New York
text:
I love this hotel.  American Express Platinum has a group of hotels that it calls Fine Hotels and Resorts (FHR).  I have always had great experiences at these properties.  FHR includes the Chatwal in New York.  

I had a king room on the 8th floor.  The space was beautifully designed, and the closet was particularly well-laid out.  The bathroom had an amazing shower: just the right size and an enormous rain shower head. 

When I arrived, I called the Butler, who took my shoes to be polished before dinner.  He was great -- like a helpful colleague.  Everyone i met at the hotel was kind and professional.

Ali, the doorman, was typical of everyone at the Chatwal.  He said to me "This is your new home in New York."  I think he's right.

My only complaint is the coupons that they give you for breakfast.  I really hate coupons.  Just take the charge off my bill at the end.  Of course, the first day, i forgot my coupon -- i hadn't had my coffee yet.  The waiter at breakfast asked me for it, and when i didn't have it, he actually wanted me to go to my room to get it.  I am so not doing that.  Later, the headwaiter (I guess) assured me that I could bring it down sometime before 11:30.  I felt like a child who had forgotten his hall pass. Please stop the whole coupon thing.  Nice hotels don't do that.

title: excellent NYC midtown hotel
text:
What a lovely hotel. I have stayed at the Chatwal quite a few times, and every time they look after me. 
Travelling quite a lot, there are many important things to me, and The Chatwal delivers: great shower, quality bed linen and pillows, cleanliness of hotel and rooms, friendliness of staff, attention to detail, and when needed assistance.

title: Beautiful rooms
text: We were on a one night overnight in NY for a conference my husband attended. My goal was to relax in the room, enjoy the pool and do a small bit of shopping. All was accomplished! The rooms are beautiful, very clean -- the bathrooms great.

title: Excelente
text:
