O Hotel Chatwal, é um hotel muito luxuoso, localizado a 50m da Time Square. Os quartos possuem ar condicionado, iluminação automatizados e funciona com um apenas um toque. Possui um maravilhoso café da manhã, restaurante e louge bar.
Adorei!!! Recomendo!!!!

title: Amazing Staff, Central Location
text:
Great high-end fixtures, extremely clean and some of the best staff I've experienced.  Also a great location if you are in midtown for work or vacation.  Also - to make it worth the price take advantage of the butler service.  They were great!

Some of the rooms have a pretty terrible view and connecting rooms as always can be a little loud since you can hear your neighbor.  I wouldn't say it's a downfall of the hotel, it's New York but if you have status might be worth asking for a room on the front side of the hotel.

I would ask for one without a connecting door in the future.  

Also found it to be very quiet given some of the previous reviews but I was on one of the higher floors (although it's only 10 floors)

title: Simply the best
text:
I almost don't want to tell anyone about this absolute gem 
But on the principle that I go to NY like four or five times per year then : it's only fair ! 
Apart from the fantastically convenient location 
From the warm on sidewalk reception to the so efficient and warm greeters through the reception, the bar, the restaurant and even the room cleaners - all of whom somewhat miraculously know your name 
Oh ! And you gotta meet Gary the upstairs (coolest jazz vibe bar) barman but do call him Reg or Reginald as he's the spit of the UK based Georgia born comedian Reginald D Hunter ! 
Incredibly well managed by Mr Verma & his team 
Do it 
Go there 
As they say "Awesome"
Enjoy

title: Nice hotel in central area
text: Loved the hotel because of it's history and nice atmosphere. I personally do not like the Timeshare area (forgot how it was till we booked there) so I would not go there again. However, we did have a wonderful stay and staff were all very helpful and friendly, except for one blond lady at breakfast... But ok not all of the people in your staff can be nice. Would certainly recommend it, but not visit it again myself.

title: Small, quaint, comfortable and convenient
text: The Chatwal offers a comfortable, quiet escape from the lights and noise of Times Square, yet is in such close proximity.  The rooms are great - TVs in the bathroom mirrors, Asprey amenities, tablets to control lighting/temperature and ample, thoughtful space to hang clothing. The junior suite is a nice upgrade - which includes a sofa/sitting area (and much larger room in general).  The staff could not be nicer.  The lobby is very small, so if you're looking for glitz and glamour it is not your scene - but if you want quaint, elegant, historic and timeless, you will enjoy your stay here.

title: Schönes Hotel im oberen Segment (beim Time Square)
text:
Für unsere Woche in New York hatten wir uns dieses Mal für das Chatwal entschieden. Das Hotel lag mit seiner unmittelbaren Nähe zum Time Square für uns sehr geschickt. 
Man kann vieles zu Fuß erreichen (Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Madison Square Garden) oder ist auch in wenigen Minuten bei der Subway-Station.

Das Hotel macht einen sehr gepflegten Eindruck und wir fanden die Zimmer geschmackvoll eingerichtet. Nach etwas probieren hatten wir dann auch die hier schon öfter kommentierte Raumtechnik im Griff. Die Zimmer sind typisch für NY nicht besonders groß. Wir hatten durch die Buchung eines größeren Zimmers dann aber zwei  "zusammengelegte" Zimmer erhalten, von denen eines dann als kleines Wohnzimmer eingerichtet war. Das war ebenso wie die dadurch zur Verfügung stehenden zwei Badezimmer sehr luxuriös. Nur der Blick zur Seite auf das Nachbargebäude lässt einen dann die Gardinen nicht so oft aufziehen. Dafür war es sehr ruhig.
Frühstück hatten wir nicht im Hotel. Hier sind wir (wie schon beim letzten Aufenthalt) immer ins Red Flame, dass 3 Minuten die Straße hoch liegt.   

Der Service für das Zimmer und an der Rezeption waren gut, alle waren freundlich und hilfsbereit, auch wenn der Funke einer "Zu hause"-Atmosphäre dann nicht ganz übergesprungen ist. Der Concierge verdient jedoch ein  besonderes Lob. Auf zwei kurze Fragen erhielten wir dann wenige Stunden später eine lange Mail mit ausführlichen Tips und Hinweisen und auch bei einer Reservierung gelang es dann noch, die gewünschte Uhrzeit zu organisieren. Und als einmal am Abend kein Taxi greifbar war, wurden wir mit dem Hotelwagen zu unserem Ziel gebracht.

Insgesamt ein schöner und gelungener Aufenthalt im Chatwal.

title: Talk about luxury
text:
The Chatwal, is the definition of over-the-top luxury hotel. 
No I didn't win the billion-dollar Powerball jackpot, but I have dreamed of what would I do with all that money. 
And I don't have a deep pocket, but I'm travel enthusiast, and a sucker for luxurious accommodations- as much as I can afford.

At the Chatwal, I had the pleasure to vacation like a star, with almost heavy $500 rate per night.  I made my reservation through Expedia, and as a +gold member, and I received a conformation email regarding a welcome exclusive amenity, free butler service and 2 garment presses per stay. Also, as a +gold member, I was eligible for a room upgrade, if available - unfortunately, there was none- Sigh! Our room was not ready, so the friendly desk clerk gave us another room ( We checked in around 4pm.) I didn't see any complimentary amenity in the room though. WHY?!!! There was a welcoming letter in the room under another person's name, I wonder if it was there by mistake, I still want mine though :(

Enough about the introduction, let's talk about how amazing the 1920s glamorous room really was ...
Besides the high quality bed, the down duvets & pillows, and remote-controlled curtains, the real draw was the TV embedded in the bathroom mirror. Yes ladies, because we all know its not luxury unless we are watching sex and the city while we put on our make-up.

P.S:

I forgot to mention what will make you head spin, the high tech toilet: It had a heated seat, and front & back warm spray ( bidet-like.) Talk about comfort and cleanliness.

P.S.S:

Two minor thing I kinda didn't like about this stunning hotel:
- No coffeemaker in the room.
- No bathtubs.

The location of the Chatwal, is a KILLER!  Right off Times Square. So, if you have money burning a hole in your pocket, this will NOT be a waste.

Five Yelps New Yorkers. 

( Posted in Yelp as well)

title: Disappointed in SPG service!
text: Having stayed at many SPG Category 7 properties using points as an SPG Gold Preferred member, we are used to receiving exceptional service and upgrades. Although The Chatwal upgraded us from the standard queen room to the deluxe King, the room was a major disappointment. It was small, no view, with stained carpet complete with barking dogs in another room on the floor. When we requested a better room, we were informed, like past reviewers, "we are a small, boutique hotel with limited rooms". We were later notified that we could upgrade to a junior suite for an additional $150 - no thank you. We chose The Chatwal for this trip to NY because we really enjoy the brunch at The Lamb's Club located in the Chatwal. Next time, we'll go back to our favorite SPG property located on 5th Avenue and 59th (?) where we are always upgraded to an opulent suite and are made to feel as special as the "paying" guests complete with butler. We never saw a butler at the Chatwal, as advertised. Sorry Chatwal, you missed the mark for us. We may return for brunch, but the hotel left a bad taste.

title: First Class all the way
text: Stayed here over new Years Eve and it was the perfect compliment to an already awesome experience.  Treated like Royalty and at times didn't know what to expect next.  Enjoyed the spa as well and our room was top notch.  Kudos to the staff and for remembering every last detail to make our stay that much more memorable.

title: Wow!
text: This hotel is absolutely stunning. The rooms are packed full of facilities and are really plush. The position of the hotel is brilliant for all sight seeing - just off Times Square. We felt super special staying here - everything about it is brilliant and would highly recommend it.

title: Loved The Chatwal
text: My family and I stayed here over the New Year and loved this hotel. It takes luxury to a new level. There's too many unexpected extras to list. We had a suite on the 9th floor which was super comfortable. The rooms really need to be experienced. The staff are all super friendly and can't do enough for you. The hotel is a 1 minute walk from Times Square therefore in an ideal position for seeing the heart of the city. Being so close to all the action i was surprised how quiet it was through the night in the room, perhaps being on the 9th floor helped though. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel, and i seriously do question the people who mark it down. The only slight disappointment was the view from the room window but it wasn't a problem at all. 1 other thing is i would have liked a choice of pillow as i felt the ones i had were a bit too soft for my liking. We will be back.

title: Amazing Times square Hotel
text:
This hotel is just a half block off Times Square.  Several good restaurants just outside the door.  Our room was a small suite that overlooked the front entrance.  We were on the third floor.  Due to street noise I would recommend a higher floor.

Lots of very nice amenities.  I learned that a heated toilet seat wil scare the heck out of you in the middle of the night.

title: It's boutique hotel with grand interior
text:
I booked this hotel because this hotel is just half block from the time square.
We were stay here to celebrate new year eve. But so unlucky, the second barrier entrance to the time square is in front of this hotel. 

This hotel is a boutique hotel. Small hotel but with nice interior. It's an old historical building. I think that is why it is an expensive small hotel

Check in was simple, they were upgrade me to deluxe room which is bigger then my reservation, standard room.

The room was small and like an alley. It's a long room. The room interior is modern, I like the bathroom, big, clean and modern, compare with the room size is almost 40/60. Just shower no bathtub.

Service was excellent, breakfast is not buffet breakfast but menu.

If you like a big grand hotel, this is not the hotel.

title: calme
text:
excellent accueil avec une équipe attentive
bon emplacement pour rayonner sur midtown
une superbe chambre très confortable
il manque juste un endroit pour se poser sans remonter dans la chambre. le lobby est un peu petit

title: GREAT Hotel and restaurant - Five stars across the board!
text: We came to New York to celebrate my wife's birthday. I called ahead to arrange flowers, wine and dinner at the Lambs Club and the Chatwal team came through with flying colors. The rooms are great. I highly recommend getting a suite. The shower is fantastic and these are the quietest rooms in NYC which is amazing considering the fact that the Chatwal is in the most vibrant part of the city. The soundproofing is amazing. The hotel is in a perfect location for an overnight with a Broadway show and dinner. Everyone who works at the hotel and restaurant are extremely gracious. When we arrived, without any prompting, the very first thing the woman at the front desk did was wish my wife a happy birthday. Then we went to dinner with my brother in law and his spouse at the Lambs Club. We ate and drank everything in there and it was all fantastic. The pasta with black truffles was perfectly cooked al dente and I would specifically recommend the lamb. The sommelier, Dane, is excellent and directed us to a wine I would not otherwise have chosen but which went perfectly with our meal. Special kudos to Tammy Yu at Chatwal for hospitality.

title: The Jewel of Time Square
text: Spent my birthday at The Chatwal Hotel with my fiancé.  It is an exceptional property located in the heart of Times Square.  The staff go above and beyond for each guest from the moment you walk up to the doors and are greeted by the bellmen.  I would recommend the property for all guests and for all occasions.

title: Oasis in the middle of Gotham
text: I just spent New Year's with my family in this beautiful property situated just steps from the heart of Times Square. In short, everything the from the spectacular attitude of the concierge, to the almond breakfast croissants was absolutely memorable. It may not be the largest or most popular luxury property in Manhattan, but the attention to detail, location, and level of service, certainly qualifies it to be on anyone's top five!

title: Below expectations
text:
good location, sound proof rooms, nice interiors. 
staff in restaurant and bar quite unfriendly, sometimes close to arrogant. very poor and uninspired breakfast for 40$ is a joke, but not a good one.
Pool looks much bigger on pictures and is rather a big bathtub. Max 3 people at a time.
Turndown service not regular, by staff who doesn't speak English. Each time we had to ask for a bottle of water for our boy who had to sleep on a very unstable air inflated mattress.
Overall, too expensive for what we got. In our view. not a family hotel either.

title: Stay-cation
text:
Great value for a 5 star hotel. 
Wonderful pool. Awesome Hot tub. Weird steam baths. 
My husband loved the layout of the room. It's just a standard room with an upgrade.
The hotel is convenient to my school. I had a class project that weekend and my husband and son stayed with me. We live in Brooklyn.  The guys had a blast.
The staff are impeccable.  First class, world class employees.
I had to print something out for our class presentation, I called the manager from class. I emailed her the materials and she printed them up. My classmate came and picked them up off of a silver platter. How cool is that?
I highly recommend.  Close to Bryant park carousel, Broadway theatres, Saint Patrick cathedral, Saks, Grand Central, Central Park and near all the subways.  
We had some issues and the front desk manager took care of them right away. 
This is my husband's favorite hotel in the USA.

title: My new favourite NYC Hotel - stunning
text: The service at this hotel is exceptional. It is not huge so they get to know you and are always looking to help. Our rooms were beautiful with the bathrooms being truly stunning. We ate breakfast at the Lambs Inn which is not owned by the Chattel but is inside the hotel The breakfast was lovely while quite expensive. We stay over Christmas and santa sacks with candy were left for all our 3 children.  It's a lovely hotel in a great location - it's 1/2 a block from Times Square but still felt very quiet when you are inside. Can't recommend highly enough!!

title: Didn't value platinum member
text: Received the smallest room on 3rd floor after I requested suite upgrade well in advance and used 30000 points .  They even said I will be upgraded . Been a platinum member for many years . Tried to use my free suite upgrades but again never can use them because availability .  Whatever. .  Still have 10 free suite nights that must be used by end of year .  Over rated and should have saved points and stayed at the Westin .  Very disappointed .

title: Luxury but at a cost.
text: Just finished a 7 night stay here with my husband and 18 year old twins for Christmas, from UK. A fabulous hotel! We wanted somewhere special to spend our first ever Christmas away from home and we found it at the Chatwal! Before ever arriving they always responded to my various email queries very promptly. As it was Christmas I asked for a tree and decorations in our room and they obliged, it was so nice to have our suite decorated for Christmas. We had a two bedroom two bathroom garden suite with balcony. The height of luxury. Comfy beds and fabulous shower rooms! Twice daily room service. Very well stocked mini bars but very expensive so we tended to avoid using them. The whole team of staff were friendly and so willing to provide anything we needed. The hotel was spotless! Lovely decor. The hotel is in the heart of Times Square but the bedrooms are so peaceful it is hard to believe the hustle and bustle outside. There is nothing we can say negatively other than it is luxury and so you pay a luxury price. We had lots of activities organised so we didn't eat at the hotel. Breakfast and dinner seemed very expensive so we tended to eat elsewhere but also as we wanted to try lots of different places. Otherwise I could not fault it at all and we are very grateful for how well we have been looked after and we are so delighted that we chose the Chatwal at this special time of year. We only managed to visit the pool once as we had so much to do, although a small plunge pool and jacuzzi it was beautiful and the shower rooms there pure luxury!  We have no hesitation in recommending this to anyone who wants to visit.......thank you Chatwal Team, each and every one of you ;)

title: Great stay
text: Great location, beautiful hotel, excellent rooms, spacious and comfortable, very clean. Thanks a lot to the butler who brought the Christmas stocking to our son! The only negative was breakfast, service was not to the level of the hotel

title: Luxury everywhere!
text: This is the second time we have stayed here and cannot imagine a better hotel to stay in in New York!  The staff, the service, the incredible location but most of all, luxury everywhere.  Best bathrooms in NY I am sure.

title: A Gem in Times Square
text: My time at the Chatwal was truly an unexpected delight.  The room was lovely, the service attentive and professional.  The restaurant and bar had a very vibrant art deco style; everything was world class.  The location was very convenient, close to Times Square, theaters, Rockefeller Center.  But once you stepped inside, the experience was serene and very personal.  I would highly recommend the hotel.  I will definitely be back.

title: OASIS IN TIMES SQUARE
text:
Without a doubt, our favorite hotel in New York City!  Steps away from the hullabaloo of Times Square sits this quiet gem of art deco old New York.  From the moment their doorman opens the front door,  through the amazingly pleasant check-in process you will know you've chosen well.  Their beautiful lobby feels like (and IS) a gorgeous private club.  Go up in the elevator and into your beautifully appointed room or suite with luxury bedding, incredible  bathrooms,  amazing rain showers and fabulous amenities.  
Can't say enough about their wonderful staff, most of whom have been with them for years!  They actually remember us from visit to visit. 
Try the Chatwal - you'll never want to leave!

title: 2nd Time There, Willing To Return
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Chatwal. Well situated, we were able to get throughout Manhattan without any trouble. The bar is great with one of the best bartenders I have had serve me and good live music. The room is small but very nice. Worked for us because we do not spend much time there.  The only knock I had was the doorman was rarely at the door when we were coming or going. Hard to get a cab. Other than that, the staff was great.

title: Great location and superior service
text:
Easy check in& out,can't ask for better location if you heading to the heart of the action of Times Square.
Staff was friendly and courteous always smiling any time we crossed path with them hands down for them can't see that now days in NYC even in similar category hotels in Manhattan.

title: Small but very elegant
text: This restored private club is a very luxurious hotel. The location is the most central spot in NYC. As always with luxury in the city , comes a large price tag . We stayed in an upgraded king deluxe which was very small . Imagine 750 a night and no bathtub . The room itself was only large enough to accommodate a chair and desk outside the bed . However the amenities were well done and amazing usage of a small floor plan . The bar had nightly jazz and was very tastefully done . Breakfast was great as was the dining room . A few hiccups with room service and ice but overall service was 4 star . I am not sure I would stay again at this price but I certainly believe at the right price I would be back.

title: Classy NOT stuffy - fun, fun, fun!
text: To say we had a wonderful weekend would be an understatement. So often upscale hotels are kind of formal and stuffy, and The Chatwal is not at all - just so vibrant and fun! Everyone we encountered was welcoming. Our room was luxe and comfy. The spa was great - we loved the hot tub, and I ended up having an epic facial which I feel will not be my last there! :) We had a terrific late-night dinner at The Lambs Club (I want to eat chickpea frites all the time). Just flawless - start to finish. Can't wait for our next time.

title: Friendly stylish oasis
text:
We got a good deal on a room at the Chatwal Hotel in October. Stayed in New York for a week and were very happy with this hotel. The room was big and very well appointed with huge cupboard space and very slick cabin trunk appointments. The bathroom was extremely glamorous and large. The staff both front desk, concierge and door staff were almost unfailingly polite and helpful. If you wish to avoid Times Square, a good idea, then turn right at the door. However the subway in Times Square is handy when required.
Very good midtown position and the Bluestone coffee station a block away kept the Australian coffee drinkers happy.

title: Wonderful boutique hotel in Midtown Manhattan.
text: We loved everything about our stay. The room was very quiet, even with the proximity to Times Square. Staff were attentive, polite, and professional. The room and its amenities were very posh. And our meal at The Lambs Club was very fine. Will definitely stay here again!

title: Lindo
text: O hotel  era muito lindo, tinha uma decoraçao extraordinaria, O quarto era bem espacoso e muito aconchegante, o banheiro era cheiroso e limpo, tinha tudo que eu previsava. Adorei o atendimento, todos atenciosos e dedicados.

title: Nice and quiet hotel
text:
I tried many hotel in New York where I go regularly for business. This hotel has the 3 qualities that, for me, are important : a good bed, a good shower, and quietness. It looks obvious but it is not, also amongs 5 stars hotels. Many international hotels, especially in old cities (Paris, London...) are made in old buildings and when they renovate the quietness is not the first thing they have in mind. Insolation is not good enough and you can hear noises from street, from the other rooms or more often from the corridors and the other rooms (classical noise of the waiters or from the doors from the other rooms). Most of the time it would be enough to have a second door (also sliding one is enough) to attenuate the noises... But sorry it is only my problem as I am quite sensible... 
So, as many other guest said before me it is very quiet, even if it is very close to Times Square. The only thing one should argue is that most of the rooms are a little bit too small, especially the bathrooms. Some of them don't have so much light too. I used to go there alone and it was fine, but when I went with my wife I started to have some problems (you know that women need some more space there to put there few things for make up). 
The service is always good, position is very good in midtown. 
Restaurant is nice but overpriced. I use to go outside for breakfast as it is really too expensive there.
Anyway my favourite hotel in New York.

title: Great location for Broadway shows
text: Great service by friendly people. The door man helped us up to the room when a bell man was not available. I detected an error on my final bill, and they immediately corrected. We had no more than a ten minute walk to Broadway shows.

title: A New York Diamond
text:
Love this little hotel.  Unlike a lot of hotels in New York, it is worth the price.  

The art deco theme is cool.  Very well maintained.  Excellent service.  Lovely breakfast in bed.  Outstanding room - really well appointed and designed.  

The gym and swimming pool are not worth writing home about so if that's critical then this probably not for you - you may prefer the Standard in the East Village which has a cool boutique feel and has access to a great gym.

title: One of the best in NYC
text:
I have stayed at several 5-star hotels in NYC, and the Chatwal is now one of my favorites. This was my first time staying at this hotel, and I was very happy with my choice. It's a boutique hotel in a great Midtown location. Some may be turned off by its proximity to Times Square, but don't be. It is not IN Times Square; it's just NEAR Times Square. I had a junior suite facing 44th St. and never heard any noise from Times Square. The street is surprisingly quiet and has very light traffic. I found it really interesting that the hotel feels like it's located in a quiet (albeit Midtown) neighborhood, but if you walk 100 meters down the street, you're in the middle of one of the most visited tourist destinations in the world. I thought that was great. And the location is great if you're in town for Broadway shows, since it's right in the middle of the theater district. I walked to both Book of Mormon and Hamilton in less than 10 minutes. And besides all of the touristy restaurants in Times Square, there are several great "local" restaurants, pubs, coffee shops, etc. right outside the door on 44th St. The Lamb's Club restaurant and bar are in the Chatwal, and both have great food, drinks, and ambiance.
Because it's a boutique hotel, the outside facade, entrance, and lobby are not overwhelming or too grand. Don't get me wrong, they are all nice. But none of them are going to knock your socks off like a few of the other 5-star hotels in NYC do. My most pleasant surprise was my junior suite, which was huge - especially for NYC. It was larger than most studio apartments in NYC. I was a little surprised there was no tub in the bathroom, but the huge rainfall shower, heated toilet seat, and heated tile floors more than made up for the lack of a tub (that I would not have used, anyway). The service is top-notch. Personal butler service comes with some of the rooms (maybe starting at the "suite" level of rooms), which is always nice to have. My only complaint is the price of room service. It is absolutely ridiculous. $8 bowl of cornflakes, $12 glass of orange juice, $25 hamburger, $12 for a side of french fries, etc.. And those prices don't even include the $6 room service charge and the gratuity that are automatically added to every bill. Those prices are CRAZY, even for a 5-star hotel in NYC. All in all, I really like this hotel. I'll stay here again. I'll just eat ANYWHERE except from room service. :)

title: Amazing!!! You have to stay here!!!!
text:
I stumbled upon this hotel having arrived after a 7 hour flight at The Mansfield. Which I was extremely disappointed with, so much so that I checked out after 10 minutes and proceeded to wonder down the street... Where I found The Chatwal, what an absolute gem!

This hotel was absolutely fantastic. Everything from the hotel staff to the decor ooze class. The rooms are gorgeous, spacious with extremely comfortable beds and pillow, they are also equipped with excellent amenities - and possibly the best 'mini' bar I have ever seen.

The location is great, around the corner from time square and 5th avenue. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. 

As previously mentioned, the staff at the hotel are all fantastic, in particular Angela Cortes was extremely hospitable and accommodating given our personal circumstances - thank you for making our stay extra special!

title: An excellent first stay
text: This is an extremely well appointed hotel, conveniently located in the theater district.  Hotel staff couldn't have been more accommodating.  I had lost my wallet and hadn't realized it until check in.  The gentleman at the front desk was very thoughtful and was able to check me in and get me settled.  Room was beautiful.  Will stay there again on future visits.

title: Well located luxury!
text: We recently enjoyed a four night stay in late October at The Chatwal and it was terrific.  The hotel is under 80 rooms and perfectly located for a Broadway show, exciting restaurants and easy access to all of Manhattan.  The entire staff was awesome including the doormen, front desk, butler and maids.  It had a real family feel to it as it was important to the entire staff that our needs were met.  The Concierge arranged transportation  for us from airport and also secured third row seats to a Broadway play for us.  The rooms had been redone and employed the latest in technology.  I would definitely stay at The Chatwal on my next visit to NYC.

title: Unexpected luxury in Times Square/Broadway location
text: Hotel is small and intimate and perfect for a Broadway weekend. Staff was very attentive and Spa, The Lambs Restaurant and bar created a perfect environment for a winter getaway. Will absolutely return!

title: won't stay again
text: This boutique hotel not worth the price. The walls are very thin so that you hear everything from the rooms. Also, if  you stay there,request a room not facing 44th street because of the noise level. The appointments in the bathroom are very good.. Hard to work all the lights.

title: Outstanding hotel, complete luxury
text: We stayed at the Chatwal over Halloween weekend.  We were to be attending events at MSG and seeing Hamilton on Broadway, so the location was perfect.  I had never stayed here before, and didn't know anyone that had, but took a chance.  Our suite, the  Zen suite, was amazing.  Spacious, beautifully decorated with low key but comfortable furniture, and our own large furnished balcony.  A friend who worked nearby stopped for cocktails and was blown away by the property, our room, and the amenities.  Service was outstanding, from our Butler, the invisible but efficient housekeeping, even the lobby bar was great.  Thanks so much for a fabulous weekend.

title: Rotalty
text: There's some negative reviews..and I couldn't disagree more. This place has customer service beyond customer service. The rooms are cozy, clean and the turn down service will blow your mind. Hand written letter, gourmet chocolates, slippers...what a surprise!

title: A step above...
text:
I read some of the negative reviews and couldn't have had a more opposite experience. This hotel is a new level of sophistication. 

Not only are the rooms brilliantly designed, but they are also beautifully appointed. The service is intuitive and always on hand. There are many small details that make all the difference, from turn down services, to butler service. 

Being a small hotel, everything seems more intimate and personal, but it is also possible to have privacy. Staff address you by name, but also sense when you want to be left alone. 

If I had one disappointment, it would be with the gym facilities. It's tiny and only has a small offering but understand the challenge of expensive real estate and the lack of economies of scale, with only 70 odd rooms. 

All up, I am a big fan. Whilst it may be more expensive than other SPG options, it's hot hard to value the difference. Highly recommended

title: Luxury except for beds!
text: Everything about this hotel was top notch: service was phenomenal , high end touches such as bathroom( toilet sprays you clean,huge rain shower head, remote for everything), butler service, TV in bathroom mirror, coffee brought to room in morning...... Loved all that. And then we went to bed. Starwood what are you thinking with these beds? Neither one of us could sleep and we both woke up with back pain, it felt like a twenty year old mattress. Please upgrade beds so I can stay here again!

title: Fabulous, an understatement
text: A fabulous surprise. Immaculate premises. Staff are professional , accommodating and efficient. A boutique hotel with all the amenities. Completely unexpected since the reservation was made "sight unseen". Hard to believe this establishment is ensconced within the theater district. A return visit awaits. Enjoy.

title: Super Bat
text: A really top bar for drinks and cocktails.  Amazing service and a lovely atmosphere - great pre dinner venue.   The wine list is really good with a broad and excellent choice - the bar staff are super knowledgeable as well which helps

title: 40th Birthday
text:
True luxury - a hidden gem - we will be back.
We stayed in jr suite- my husband planned this stay as a relaxing getaway for my 40th. The hotel was in constant contact with him through the planning process. 
It's central to times sq- which being from the tri-state are .. I avoid like the plague... But staying here you don't even know the cross roads of the world is so close! It's there is u want it- but u can escape to the hotel too.
The room is very cool...clean and perfectly set up. The bathroom had very nice luxury amenities  and the closet/mini bar is beautifully designed. And the restaurant brunch was fantastic.

title: The Chatwal was Perfect!
text:
We have always considered staying near Timesquare and finally did at The Chatwal. The service started before we even arrived by sending me all the confirmations and than my wife and I made some upgrade changes and resent new confirmations.  This hotel is luxurious and keeped in perfect condition so everyone enjoys a beautifully keeped room with all the  upgrades to boot. Our point of contact was Manpreet one of the managers who acts more like a proud owner than just an employee, too many bell boys to name but they all were very helpful and respectful too. Our last night was spent eating at The Lamb club restaurant in the hotel and like everthing else it exceeded all our expectations as well.  We'll be back very soon! 
FYI- the rooms with the Terrace are amazing! 

N.lourinho, 
Katy,Tx

title: Good location, service could be better
text: The hotel is conveniently located near Time Square in the theater district.  Room size is on the small side with some of the rooms fit only queen beds.  Bathroom is small too however use top of the line products, from hardware to bathroom accessories.  Service is a tad slow and could use some improvements.

title: Good location close to Times Square
text:
Convenient location with most sights within walking distance.

Excellent concierge, Juan who was extremely helpful.

Only one public room which serves as Foyer, Reception and Bar: not very atmospheric.

Attractive, comfortable and clean, smallish (for America) bedroom. Comfortable beds and good quality sheets.

Attractive bathroom with excellent quality toiletries.

Now the negatives.  The swimming pool is ridiculously small  - room only for ONE person  (yes, you read that correctly!) to swim against a `swim jet`. The photograph on the hotel`s website is very misleading.

Breakfast is served (no buffet, order only from the menu) in the characterless, windowless (literally), dining room.  Waiters were slow and inefficient. The girl on the reception to the dining room has missed her calling as a traffic warden:  she didn`t smile at anyone the whole time we were at the Chatwal! Not the level of service you expect from a 5* hotel.

title: Y aller pour l'emplacement ?
text:
Emplacement à Times Square vraiment parfait! Par contre, attention aux chambres à prix correct sans vue et quasi sans lumière du jour... Et ceci évidemment pas annoncé à la réservation. Lits queen prévus pour 2 trop petits.  Les équipements des chambres dont très bien par contre.Accueil à la réception poli mais froid. Peu de services de leur part, et aucun effort pour comprendre et aider les clients de l'hôtel parlant mal anglais !
Très déçu par tous les "à-côtés"
Pour un petit hôtel, nous avons été surpris du côté impersonnel.

title: Recomendable
text: La ubicación es genial y el servicio excepcional, la limpieza y las amenidades de primera quede encantado con el trato y la atención recibida dese nuestra llegada todos realizan su trabajo y son amables

title: Chatwal: Everything You Expect and More.
text: Chatwal provides luxury rooms in a convenient midtown location. Complete with state of the art accessories the Chatwal offers total safety and comfort. The service was A+. The staff friendly and professional. I recommend it without hesitation.  .

title: Lovely oasis in Times Square
text:
I moved to this hotel from another not far away. The room was a bit more expensive, but it and the whole experience was on a completely different level. I felt welcomed from the moment I arrived and was so pleasantly surprised by all of the luxurious touches. The bathroom was spacious and beautifully appointed. The room itself felt luxurious and modern and well designed. 
The staff is thoughtful and polite and attentive. I enjoyed the restaurant and the bar was lively and fun. And, there's live music ! 
I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: So small!!!
text:
I paid a ridiculous rate, even by NY standards, and received the tiniest room, even by NY standards. I was unable to iron my shirt because I couldn't find a place to fully extend the ironing board. Chocolate bar from the minibar was $15. The desk is strange and the chair is too short - don't plan to do any work here. Wifi wasn't great.

The hotel is luxurious but dated. Front desk staff was okay. Was hoping given the small room I would be WOWed in some other respect but it didn't happen. No extras for my SPG Ambassador status. 

I wouldn't stay here again. Would definitely pick the W Union Square or The Edition NYC if looking for similar level of luxury but much better value overall. I could see this hotel being fancied by Old Money; however, not my cup of tea.

title: Great Hotel
text: Very quaint and quiet European style hotel. First class from the moment you walk in. Five star rating well deserved. Room was immaculate well stocked with beverages and snacks. Bathroom amenities were abundant. Pricey but worth every $$. Will stay again.

title: Wonderful art deco gem
text: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Chatwal.  It is a small luxury hotel in midtown Manhattan and what a find it is.  We were upgraded to the one bedroom suite with large terrace and two bathrooms.  The room is an art deco gem with wonderfully comfortable bed and all the most up to date conveniences.   The staff were all excellent from the doormen, reception desk, housekeepers, bartenders, waiters, and the concierges. I highly recommend this hotel indeed.

title: Fantastic location
text:
Based a few steps from Times Square this boutique hotel offers the serenity and quietness after a long day exploring the hustle and bustle that is New York.
The staff have been great......friendly, attentive, always up for a joke and very helpful when answering questions.
Our room was luxurious and very quiet.
We used both bars, and the restaurant for breakfast and all were very good.
Highly recommended.

title: A hidden gem!
text: Having recently become a SPG member, I was looking for a luxury hotel where I could earn points (also, the Four Seasons was completely booked).  We were upgraded to a junior suite from a regular terrace room because they could not put a roll-away bed in the room I had booked (which I was not advised of when I made the reservation).  The staff were exceptional, the room was amazing, and I want to remodel my bathroom so I can have the same shower features.  The Chatwal is my new favorite NYC hotel, and I have every intention of returning!

title: An EXCELLENT Hotel
text: This was an anniversary trip for us so we needed a good hotel in the right locations. The Chatwal was perfect. It's just a block or two from Times Square so the plays and the action are close; but it's also off to "the side" so-to-speak so there was none of the crowed, noise and hassle that goes with the Times Square action. As for the hotel itself: The employees, every one, were excellent...polite, friendly and competent. The rooms were well appointed and impeccably clean. Quiet, too. The bar was small, but nice and the bartender was great. And breakfast was timely, served hot and delicious. No complaints. Not one.

title: Imagine The Boutique Hotel Of Your Dreams 2 blocks From Times Square- Well This Is It
text: For our 25th wedding anniversary I splurged and rented the Producer's Suite that came with a spiral staircase that led to private roof top terrace. It was as fine a suite as you will find in New York. The bathroom should be mentioned as it did not have a tub but instead a rain shower that proved itself as a refreshing experience and a respite from the humidity of the city. The welcome, which included chocolate, fruit and a bottle of champaign from the hotel was wonderful after the flight in from California. There are great touches like the morning coffee offered at the elevator, which becomes strawberry lemonade in the afternoon. After walking in the city heat the lemonade was much appreciated. The staff is friendly, efficient and genuinely concerned about making your stay memorable. The concierge not only arranged flowers, a dinner at Per Se, a private helicopter tour, but also loaned us his iPhone charger when we found we had brought the wrong one from home. First class suite, first class service, and two blocks from the cross roads of the world, Times Square. An absolutely must stay here place!

title: Quite a hidden gem
text:
This hotel is very much a luxury hotel.  It is nicely placed away from Times Square on 44th, but close enough to theaters and also to offices on 6th Ave.

The quality of the rooms is very very nice.  Service is high, with multiple offers to handle bags, turn down service, show shinning, etc.

The hotel has a very nice restaurant, The Lambs Club.

This is a Starwood property which brought me here, but it can be a bit pricey.  I stay here when I visit New York, only on weeks where the price is down a bit.  Film price is beyond my business budget

title: The perfect location
text:
Questo hotel è a 2 minuti a piedi da Times Square, ma in una zona molto tranquilla.
Hotel certamente di lusso con ottime finiture e staff ECCEZZIONALE.
Il ristorante The Lamb è buona, anche se, sinceramente, mi aspettavo maggior scelta da un così decantato ristirante.
Le stanze pulitissime e il bagno enorme ... con addirittura la TV!!!.
Ancora una volta non posso che ringraziare lo staff dell'Hotel che mi ha aiutato ad organizzare il compleanno di mia moglie.
PERFETTO

title: Best Customer Service EVER!
text: I was absolutely shocked at the superb level of customer service my husband and I received at The Chatwal during our stay from 9/16   - 19, 2015.  My husband likes to go to sleep early and I prefer to stay awake and watch TV.   This is rather difficult if we are both in the same room.  Although we had a junior suite (and a wonderful room with an excellent couch, I might add), the TV was still in the same room.   I had called The Chatwal several days in advance of our stay and asked them if I could connect a special wireless headphone to the room TV so that I could listen to the TV late into the evening while my husband slept.  After checking with the engineer, I was told that their TVs did not accommodate this type of set-up and they apologized.  After our first night at The Chatwal, the front desk personnel told me that they had purchased a wireless headset for our TV, it was all hooked up and was ready for me to use.  Well, you can imagine - I was so shocked when I was given this information that I could barely believe my ears!  Frankly, I never in a million years, expected The Chatwal to go out and purchase the wireless headset and base station.  Actually, I didn't even think the operator who originally took my call would pass the call on to the powers that be, let alone that the hotel would go to the trouble of procuring the device.  I know personally that there are various types of wireless headsets, each one of which only work on certain types of TVs (I know this because I have such a device at my home), so finding one that works is not a simple task.  I did not ask the hotel to purchase such a device for me...I was only inquiring if their TVs would accommodate such a device so that I could use my own headset while I was there.  To actually go to the next step - that is, to purchase the device so that my stay would be excellent in every way, well.... that is another story and certainly, an example of undoubtedly, the best customer service I have ever received from a hotel, let alone from any business.  I have stayed at 5 Star hotels all over the world and The Chatwal provided me with the best customer service I have ever received anywhere.  I would like to add that the front desk personnel, the concierge, doormen and everyone else at the hotel were entirely pleasant and helpful and made our stay the best possible.   We stayed at The Chatwal because we were on a short trip to NYC to see some shows on Broadway and The Chatwal's theatre district location make it entirely convenient - within walking distance to most theatres in NYC.  We will stay here again and will recommend the hotel to our friends, family and business associates travelling to NYC.

title: Great boutique hotel in theatre district
text: Small, fashionable hotel especially well located for attending the theatre. Service is outstanding, rooms well appointed and good sized by NY standards. Very nice spacious bathrooms. On site Lambs Club restaurant and bar are good but pricey. Rooms on higher floors and in the rear portion of the hotel provide quiet from busy 44th street.

title: nice and cozy hotel at Times Square
text:
we had the pleasant surprise to be upgraded to a junior suite which is really excellent (very spacious and confortable ).
we stayed four days  and enjoyed our stay as the hotel location is very convenient to visit many places (museums, theatres etc...).
the personnel is very professional and very helpful. in particular,the concierge service is excellent (thanks to Pierre and Juan).
.

title: My Absolutely Wonderful Stay at the Chatwal, New York
text: My husband and I stayed at The Chatwal on July 6th through the14th, 2015. We were met at the desk by the most courteous personnel. Titus, who met us at the desk, was very friendly and helpful with directions on how to get to Times Square. We were trying to find a nearby drug store and he gave us very specific directions. He also told us about the Lambs Club Restaurant which is on the property. The beautiful Art Deco decor immediately caught our eye. My husband is an architect and I am an interior designer, so this was something which we really appreciated. Once we arrived in our rooms, we felt at home in our beautiful adjoining suite.. We ordered beverages, which were promptly brought to our room. The room service staff was extremely accommodating. We found the food downstairs at The Lambs Head Restaurant to be some of the best that we had during our entire stay in NY. We highly recommend it. One of our reasons for visiting NY was to attend several Broadway shows. The location of The Chatwal is extremely convenient for those wishing to attend Broadway Shows. One of the Shows we attended was "Hedwig and the Angry Inch," which was playing directly across the street. That was very convenient. Most other shows are within a few blocks of The Chatwal. Pierre at the concierge desk was most helpful in finding tickets to the shows we were interested in seeing. One night, I didn't get home from getting my playbill signed at the stage door across the street until after 1:00am and was still able to order an omelet and a salad. I find that to be a big plus to be able to get 24 hour room service. The quality of the room service food is equivalent to the food in the restaurant downstairs. I also want to mention the bar downstairs. It was the best and the bar staff was attentive and on the ball. There is also a restaurant and bar on the second floor which is open late. That is really something we look for in a hotel, especially if we want to attend any Broadway Shows. In all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Chatwal and would highly recommend it if you are planning a trip to New York City. This hotel is close to the theaters and some of the finest stores in NYC. It is a feast for the eyes and has a boutique hotel atmosphere. If you are looking for that personal touch and that feeling that you have found a hotel home in New York City, this is the hotel for you.

title: Nice hotel in time square
text: The hotel was nice and quiet, the rooms are large, the bathrooms was large, the service is quite good. only thing is that we got a room facing the back so no view of any sort, and really small windows, so it was kind of dark...  I guess that is a trade off if you want quite in time square. Definately one of the better hotels i stayed in time square.  We god two rooms, and they gave us ajoining rooms which worked great for us.  Would perfer to get a room with shower instead of tubs next time around.

title: Cozy luxury hotel
text: Small hotel.  Jazz played in the lobby a couple nights per week (Tues and Wed, I think).  Lobby and mezzanine provide intimate relaxation.  Cool fruit flavored water in elevator lobby in afternoons and coffee in the am.  Had a junior suite - very spacious room/sitting area/bathroom.   Everything top end in the room.  Piped in sound to bathroom (nice if you absolutely have to hear the morning news in the shower) and Japanese commode with heated seat and a variety of cleaning and drying options.  Gym very small - only a few machines and not in the best repair.

title: Long weekend for the US Open, theatre, and shopping
text: Convenient to Time Square and subway. Rooms we very small and dark! I'm clostraphobic so this was am issue but we really weren't in the room very much so it was Ok. Drinks are very pricey in the bar. Hunt Fish restaurant across the street is great!

title: Best Spot for An Upscale Theatre Weekend
text: This was our second stay at this luxury boutique hotel in the heart of the NYC theatre district.   The 100 room hotel is small, quiet and luxurious.   Rooms are very well appointed and bathrooms are very nice.  Staff couldn't be more helpful and pleasant.

title: Labor Day weekend getaway
text:
The location cannot be beat. Situated just outside Times Square, you have access to all the tourist attractions, but the hotel is surprisingly quiet.  My boyfriend and I stayed in a Junior Suite and were really blown away by how beautiful and spacious the room was.  The bathroom amenities smelled fabulous, and I really enjoyed a long soak in the tub after a long day of walking through the city.  We honestly did not want to leave the room!  The staff at the hotel was nothing but friendly and accommodating, and I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to be close to Times Square and requesting a modern yet cozy experience.
The only downside is that the beds were a bit uncomfortable.  Other than that, I have no complaints and would feel totally comfortable recommending this hotel to a friend.

title: Great Times Square
text: Small boutique feeling, very swanky rooms.  They gave us an upgrade and the room we got was beautiful.  We loved the retro bar upstairs.  Great location.  Staff was pleasant and very accommodating.  They left us chocolates at night and gave us gifts.

title: my favorite option in the Theater District
text: This is a very refreshing option for the Theater district. the location is great, the staff is friendly and the rooms are quiet and nicely appointed. The smaller size of the property adds to the experience in a positive way. if there was 1 small area to improve it would be the size of the fitness center, it is a titch on the small side. I have just booked another stay at this hotel

title: Bank Holiday trip to NYC
text: We spent 3 nights at the Chatwal over the UK August Bank Holiday. The hotel is perfectly located but the best bit is the hotel itself. The staff couldn't have been more helpful upon arrival and throughout our stay. We stayed in a Grand Deluxe Double Double room which was quite spacious for New York and very luxurious. We particularly liked the bathroom with rain shower & even a heated toilet seat! The only negative was an absence of veggie options on the room service menu but I couldn't fault anything else. We will definitely stay at the Chatwal again - in fact were sad to be leaving!

title: Classic luxury hotel
text: Really nice, old school service in a nicely appointed, kind of quaint hotel.  The service and rooms amenities are what you'd hope for at this level. Couple kind of silly highlights. 1) it's pretty quiet for the neighborhood its in which I appreciated and 2) the bathroom/shower is really great. Maybe the best shower ever. Great little place

title: Luxus fun
text:
Ein unscheinbares Hotel 
Eingerichtet im Art Deco Stil wundervolle Zimmer mit viel Liebe eingerichtet für nen kurzen luxustrip zu empfehlen für NY Verhältnisse das Frühstück ist gut aber zu teuer sehr zentral gelegen 2 min vom Times Square

title: Specia Milestone Spent at a Special Hotel!
text: Returned for a second visit to The Chatwal within a three month time frame, this time in celebration of our 10th wedding anniversary.  Tammy Yu, guest relations manager, went above and beyond to make sure that we were well taken care of.  Special touches included a hand written note from the vice president welcoming us "home", chilled champagne awaiting our return from the best massages ever at the Red Door Spa and let's not forget the chocolates and the nightly turn down service.  I just love the intimacy of this 72 room hotel....an excellent retreat after a busy day exploring the city.  The hotel staff comprises a professional team, helpful and always with a smile.  The Chatwal does not disappoint!  We will be back!!

title: 残念ながら……
text:
2015年1月に予約しました。
特典としてSPAクレジットが付属していたため、希望のスケジュールも1月の時点で伝えていましたが、SPAの予約はまだ受付していないと連絡がありました。
その後、8月に入ってから希望スケジュールでは予約は受け付けないと再度連絡がありました。
数ヶ月前から希望を伝えていたことをコンシェルジュに連絡してみましたが、一度目の連絡には返事がなく、重ねて連絡したところ「SPAに転送した」とだけ返事が。
その後SPAからは希望とは違う日程で確保したと連絡がありました。

このような経緯から、残念ながら宿泊の予約自体をキャンセルしました。

title: Perfect hotel, perfect location, perfect stya
text: I spent three nights at the chateau in August.  First of all the location is top!!  The rooms are great, quite ( for being in the middle of Times Square the are outstanding) and very well appointed.  The bell staff as well as front desk went out of their way to assist in every way.  And the restaurant served great food, especially the breakfast.  I will be back.

title: Great for New York City
text: This hotel has a very boutique-type feel.  You do have access to butler service and quick-to-respond concierge.  The room was very clean, but slight signs of age (chipped furniture, etc - nothing horrible).  Service was excellent.  The location was really great - less than 1 block from Times Sq and the Theater District.  Don't expect a great view from here though - you either look directly onto 44th St. or out the window into the space between buildings - not exactly idyllic, but welcome to New York.  The walls are surprisingly thin - this is by far the most unappealing factor - to the point you can hear your neighbors conversations.  One of the guests also brought a dog that barked for literally HOURS from 5:30 until I left at around 8:30.  Front desk and security evidently did not know what to do, since they visited the room but didn't get the dog to stop barking - turns out the owner seemed to think it would be a good idea to abandon the dog in the room overnight.  Needless to say, the hotel spoke to the guest and there was, thankfully, no barking on night two.

title: The only disappointment was having to leave
text: Stayed one night at the Chatwal for my girlfriend's birthday. After booking I was asked if I was celebrating a special occasion, and Tammy helped ensure a great experience. I was informed that I had been upgraded to a suite with a terrace. The room was beautiful, all interior decor reminiscent of the 1920's. The best part of the stay was the call I received after settling into the room. The butler wished us a happy birthday and offered us a bottle of wine courtesy of the hotel. The customer experience at the Chatwal was nothing short of spectacular and they made our stay unforgettable.

title: Quiet luxury near theater district
text:
Very small intimate luxury hotel. Came here for five nights to see plays and experience other New York highlights. The Chatwal is amazing from the doorman at the front to the quietness of the hotel and the rooms and special terraces that are attached to some of the rooms. Very luxurious. Very cool bar on the second floor with a jazz combo 
Great cocktails and food
A bit of a splurge but well worth

title: Rooms that feel like a prison cell
text:
We checked in at 1 o'clock in the morning after our flight to London got delayed. We booked through hotwire requesting five star hotels in the Times Square area. We were unfortunate to have been allocated this hotel. The room had a tiny window which overlooks the back of the filthy block 

To add insult to injury we found the duty manager required some serious training in dealing with customers when we requested for a better room his response invariably we got the cold corporate response - responding in a mechanical fashion to each response by saying I am sorry to hear about your concerns and I understand this. He was bordering on rudeness. 

Suggest strongly to avoid this hotel. 

There is nothing luxury it's about this hotel when we checked in the lobby had an awful smell of damp stale mop. Enjoy the lovely photographs of this at best 3 star hotel judge for yourself if the luxury element is a con.

title: Location, location, location
text:
Ideally situated in the heart of Time Square, this hotel is very nice.

Pluses:
Very good staff
Nice rooms, modern and well equipped, but on the small side as you would expect in NY.
Small terrace on some rooms (for us smokers...)
Delicious breakfast

Minuses:
Room not ready at 5pm
Nothing works, toilet flush needed maintenance (embarrassing) bath tub not closing...
Terrace super noisy with all the AC machines.

Having said that the maintenance crews is good and efficient and everything has been repaired with 24 hours.

Good hotel altogether

title: couples getaway
text: Upgraded to a Junior Suite upon arrival, entire staff very attentive, helpful, personable, room very modern, great bar with live music, restaurant is outstanding, spa is very small but offers many services. Only complaint is lower level rooms are noisy.

title: Great service
text: I've stayed at the Chatwal a few times on business. I've been trying to find a new hotel replacement for my previous favorite. The hotel has a very cool retro vibe, taking you back to the 1920's or 1930's with their decor. My room was larger than a typical NY hotel room, and the overall rating of the room was a 5. What I've been most impressed with has been the level of high service.  The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. I arrived late, and needed an alteration repair and some pressing. They sent the butler, and it was handled perfectly. I will definitely be back.

title: Family of 4 Trip to NYC
text: I was very pleased with the Chatwal. Our room was exceptionally clean. I am very particular and I felt very comfortable with the bathroom and the bed. They staff was very friendly and accommodating and also paid special attention to my two boys. I would highly recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.

title: Fantastic relaxing retreat in the city that never sleeps
text:
My family and I have recently returned from a stay at the Chatwal whilst spending 4 days in New York at the end of our holiday.

The staff at the hotel were exceptional, and very helpful, from the pre-stay email from the concierge asking if there was anything they could do to assist, to the check in and during our stay. Everyone we came into contact with was helpful and polite.

The room itself was great - we had a one bedroom suite for the 4 of us, and the fact that there were two full bathrooms was great when we all wanted to shower after a long day sightseeing. The amenities were first class, and the rooms were of a large size considering the hotel is on 44th street and about 150 metres from the centre of Times Square. 

We didn't manage to eat at the Lambs club, although we did have a few cocktails and they were enjoyed by all - particularly the alcohol free variety for the children. 

I would definitely stay here again on a return trip to new York - nothing I can think of to fault the stay - the hotel really is an oasis of calm right at the heart of NYC.

title: Very cool
text: Small boutique hotel but rooms were decent size and very cool. Toilet seat was heated and had other features. There was a TV behind the mirror in the bathroom and other cool decor features in the room. Not a cheap hotel but beautiful and cool great location in the theatre district

title: Шик, блеск, красота!
text: Очень стильный отель! Особенно поразили ванные комнаты - все блестит и сияет. Номера просторные, но придется раскошелиться. Оно того стоит. Персонал улыбчив, за чаевые может заказать места в ресторане, куда трудно попасть. Стоит остановиться здесь.

title: Best hotel best location
text:
Located next to Times Square, this is walking distance to the best places in NY.
The place is full of history, luxury and excellent service.
The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. Probably nicer rooms than at the Waldorf Astoria, and bigger.
Signature drink is amazing, and the lambs club is awesome, had a nice dinner there.

title: Oasis of calm in the midst of a busy city
text:
It is a chic well appointed boutique hotel well located nearby Times Square with all the vibrant city life that NYC is known for and yet the street has a good selection of different styles and cuisine tastes to choose from. Very convenient for theatre goers and also a short walk to Rockeffer Centre and upscale shopping. 
Stepping into the hotel lobby through the smart heavy iron doors under the bright red canopy was truly a welcome transistion from the noise and hustle on the street that came with a sigh of relief and gratitude that we had made it back to this tranquil oasis.

title: Possibly the best hotel experience in NY
text: I have stayed at most of the luxury hotels in NY over the years, never had I had a perfect experience, many good ones, but never have I felt as welcome, comfortable, my needs anticipated, a room upgrade and late check-out without asking, friendly and smiling staff, excellent food amenities, awesome room technology that wasn't so spectacular I couldn't figure it out, and perfectly located on 44th in the middle of the theater district.

title: Great experience. We stay there for a week
text:
The location not so much of my style, since it is just too close to Time Square; nevertheless the service was impeccable, the concierge was thoughtful, even he got us into one of the most exclusive bars in town. 

Great food, with the Lamb's Club, and great amenities. 

Definitely a place to stay, Moreover if you want to be close to the theater district.

title: A 5 star hotel next to the theater district!
text: Excellent service and rooms--as you would expect.  It is  built out of the old Lamb's club, and the restaurant is excellent.  It is a relatively small hotel, and so the staff gets to know you quickly.  The lobby is relatively (and unavoidably) small, but it flows into the restaurant which is large.  The location is just wonderful for access to the theater.  We had a wonderful time!

title: 2nd visit, still great!
text: can't say enuf about the great location n times square! breakfast outstanding! room so comfortable! service was outstanding. i had a personal emergency & i was accommodated asap! if i had 1 criticism, is that the room was a bit dark. not enuf lighting for my taste, but a minor issue!!

title: 5 star - NYC (5 nights) in Apri / May 2014...
text:
Room had no view, looked into an alley way but the room itself was awesome and comfy, The bathrooms are amazing the best I have seen!

Second room had a lovely view looking out onto the street!

Location is perfect just of Time Square.

title: Boutique feel in Times Square
text: What a wonderful little hotel.  Rooms are large and comfortable.  This place feels like a Ritz or St Regis.  Staff is great.  Gym is pathetic-one of the worst I've ever seen.  Land Club restaurant onsite is amazing.

title: Not impressed
text: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend after seeing the great reviews. I expected much more from a 5 star hotel. The hotel was dark and unfriendly. The bed is like 5" off the ground and hard as a rock. I knew we were staying a block off of time square, so I knew there would probably be no view. What I didn't expect was a 2 ft window with a view of a black building. We paid for an upgraded room. If this was an upgraded room, I can't imagine a regular room. We requested a bathtub, and they gave us a room with only a shower. Every time we asked the staff die something, it seemed that we were annoying them. Not recommend. The good point is it is close to theaters.

title: "The Audience"
text: We planned a weekend in NYC to see Helen Mirren in the play, "the Audience"!  The Chatwal is on 44th St between 5th and 6th Ave, perfect location for the theatre!  We also planned to see, "Jurassic World" at a IMAX at the AMC theatres in Time Square, too!

title: A first-rate elegant hotel.
text: The Chatwal is a small, very classy hotel. Being just off Times Square, it's perfect for theatre; public transportation all over the City is at hand. The staff is highly professional and attentive. The rooms, elegant. This hotel is well worth the money. Millie at the reception desk is a gem.

title: Intimate and elegant
text:
The hotel, most especially the staff, is first rate. 

Our room was lovely and the bathroom/shower was super nice and comfortable. 

On our next visit to NYC, would certainly return.   

FYI:  The only negative is the location, which is the Times Square area, where pedestrian/auto traffic is .... madness.

title: A great boutique hotel in Midtown
text:
This is a great little hotel in Midtown.  A nice quiet oasis a block off Times Square.  We stumbled on this hotel through the Starwood points program but were very pleasantly surprised.  The staff was excellent.  We stayed in a Jr Suite which was beautiful, with a gorgeous bathroom.  There is an attention to detail in every aspect of the experience.  The hotel is named for the owner, and the quality seems to show that personal touch.  I guess if you are going to put your own name on the place, you want it to be well done.

My only complaint was that the gym is tiny.  Other than that, I would recommend it highly for anyone wanting a high quality boutique experience in Midtown.

title: 45th anniversary weekend
text:
I hope to plan a surprise anniversary weekend for my wife of 45 years. 

The concierge's Pierre and Juan gave me great recommendations and my wife entered the room to a table and room covered in rose pedals, dozen chocolate covered large sweet strawberries, and champagne. 

The whole staff the staff could not have been nicer! The room was modern, elegant and spacious particularly for a NY accommodation. My wife enjoyed their spa services. Location was about half block on time Square and we were on the street side but never heard the traffic.

title: Luxury retreat close to Times Square
text: This is our second visit to the Chatwal and an improvement as we got to know more of the features of the restaurant.  The Red Door spa was pleasant.  The pool is small but very clean and a nice hot tub.  We were invited for a complementary cocktails to meet the general manager and had a good visit.  The room was spacious (unusual in New York), very clean and nicely appointed.  Lots of automation so you need to spend a moment to figure out the drapes, lights and phone.  Missing in the room is complementary coffee maker but there is a fresh pot available on the main level.  The other item is that since the Chatwal is on West 44th Street some taxis do not go into the street and want to drop you at the corner.  So long as the weather is fine that is not a problem.  The doormen work hard to get you a car when needed for business meetings.

title: высокая стоимость
text: Довольно большие номера, но очень скучные и пресные. Ресторан неплохой, отлично расположение отеля. Хорошая веранда на крыше, персонал отлично справляется, но очень долгая регистрация. Стоимость довольно высокая для этого отеля.

title: You will not be dispointed! A must for NYC and the theatre disctric!
text:
From check in to check out everyone we interacted with dedicated their undivided attention to us with a proud smile and can-do attitude. The hotel is one of the best properties I have visited in NYC where boutique does not necessarily imply a compromise in lighting, comfort or amenities. The lobby's art deco feel takes you back in time to dreamier times, with Sinatra often on speakers when life seemed  uncomplicated and luxurious. The guest rooms, bathroom and amenities are top notch. Beds are crisp and comfortable. WiFi is fast. Room service is fast with great wine list. Last minute cloth pressing is fast. I honestly could not find one thing I would change I would change - except the strength of the coffee in the morning.

The hotel is central to everything: theatre district, shopping, Central Park, Bryant Park ....and short walking distance to many of the great sights and sounds around the city.

title: Great stay in theatre district
text:
Had booked deluxe room but got upgraded to suite. Room was large and very comfortable. Loved the boutique nature of the hotel.
Great location for theatre and midtown. Staff was amazing and made you feel very special.

title: Amazing Boutique Hotel!!
text: We always stay at the same hotel when visiting New York but since we were only in the city for one night, we decided to try this hotel. From the moment we arrived, the staff was very friendly and helpful!  The hotel itself was gorgeous and has a very cool, chic feel. We were there with our kids and it was perfectly comfortable. When we got to our room, the accommodations were beautiful and we even had a cute little terrace. The room service in the morning arrived 20 minutes after we ordered!!!  I will  absolutely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to couples, families, singles, anyone!!

title: Very comfortable; amazing bathroom!
text: We spent a week here and it was great. Wonderful bed. Fantastic shower and BIG bathroom. Great location. Friendly staff. The gym is rather tiny and limited, though, if you're keen to get a run or two in during your visit...but perfectly serviceable.  In the end I felt incredibly joyous here as my fiancé proposed on this trip :) happy times!

title: VERY GOOD LOCATION
text:
A very nice, pleasant hotel located a block off Times Square. Restaurants and taverns are all around not to mention a Broadway theater across the street. The staff was great. The room was very nice with one common exception, not enough plugs for recharging.
Weakest, breakfast was overrated and expensive. Continental for two was $68 and the cappuccino and coffee was weak and bitter. There is a coffee house a half a block down the street. Worth the trip.
The doorman was helpful in hailing a cab for dinner, that you expect, but when I had to leave at 4 AM for JFK they we equally willing to help. That counts.

title: Mid Town Hotel that right in the midst of lots of action but its a real oasis when the door open.
text: our check in was easy and friendly. the room which i had researched for a while was exactly as it appeared on the website which is not always the case. Staff everywhere from bar to housekeeping were welcoming but not overbearing. the bar gets loud and crowded most nights before the broadway shows but they seem to keep a few tables free for hotel guests and it is great fun to sit and have a wonderfully weird cocktail and listen to some jazz. Our room faced 44th Street and we were on the 3rd floor and did not hear a sound from the street. since you are surrounded by high bldgs, the room can be dark, the gym was small but clean and functional.We always like a coffee maker in our room before we venture out and this was missing, there are numerous delis so close to grab a quick cup but sometimes its nice to stay in your robe (without room service fee!)

title: Perfect Secret Hotel
text: Great staff, quiet decent sized rooms. Top class restaurant and bar. Moments from Times Square. Perfect for theatres and no need to struggle for a taxi after the show. Everyone there seems to care that you are really looked after. Wonderful bathroom, great bed and linen. A perfect luxury hotel that no one seems to know about.

title: Sparkling little diamond in the heart of NYC
text: This hotel is located in a great location...just few steps away from buzzling Times Square.    Lovely exterior (colonial British) with a cosy lobby, the room is of great luxury with burgundy glittering mable bathroom, full amenities box, velvet wallpaper, leather walldrove with build-in bar and entertainments.   The room is not big but just right for 1-2 travellers.   If you want to expand your space, they have a floor with little balcony (7/F) or you can take the Producer Suite (equivalent to a Presidential Suite) with a build-in staircase going to rooftop.  Their bulter service is rather attentive and they addressed me by name even I was just at the corridor.  The restaurant offers great quality of food, fitness center and pool are located in basement which were  comparatively small but still good as it's a boutique hotel (only 76 rooms).   They also have a SPA by Elizabeth Arden.   Great hotel for business or pleasure !!

title: First Class All The Way
text: We spent the week at The Chatwal Hotel, New York. It was wonderful as always - great service ( especially our "butler Brandon Short), fabulous location for theater goers, fine restaurant etc. It offers all the amenities of a larger luxury hotel, yet has an intimate atmosphere. There is always a personal welcome when you return for the day. I highly recommend the Chatwal for all seasoned travellers. You will not be disappointed.

title: Small Boutique Hotel in Heart of Theater District Needs Some Help
text:
Hyper-expensive but that's what the market will bear because of its location.  Service was not consistent.  The front desk, bell staff, housekeeping, engineering all displayed impeccable concern for our comfort and satisfaction yet the servers in the restaurant and bar leave a lot to be desired.  Drink orders at the Lambs Club took forever and were not correct.  No cocktail napkins, and no follow up.  We had to get up and get what we needed from the bar ourselves.   Service during Sunday brunch was very slow even though the place was almost empty.  Quality of the food was a strong point but again very expensive.

Rooms were very well appointed with all the tech gadgets, multi station control of all lights, hidden TV in the bath, motorized curtains, etc.  Motif is very dark leather, granite and chrome.  Bathroom needs better ventilation. Housekeeping is excellent and almost magically unobtrusive.   Isolation from street noise was outstanding but there is a problem on the lower floors with noise from the bar and function room.  

Valet parking was efficient and priced in line with what you would expect in Times Square area.  The entrance to the lobby is by stairs only with no ramps so the bell staff can't use carts and have to lug your bags in manually, which they do with a smile.  Guests with wheelchairs or walkers will have problems especially after hours when there is no front door person.  

Again, generally inconsistent with mostly really good stuff marred by some annoying stuff.

title: Luxury Getaway
text:
Beautiful hotel. Our room was a standard room, although it featured a fantastic bed, spacious room, and incredible black tiled bathroom. The bathroom was one of the best I've experienced, the rain shower - big enough for two, the heated toilet seat & tv inside the mirror. The hotel is a luxury, 5 star hotel, the customer service was outstanding. We stayed for a portion of our honeymoon, and boy, was it amazing. Went headed next door on the last night of our stay for a celebratory dinner at the Lambs Club. We were served the most exquisite food I have ever eaten, I have never tasted lamb so delicious. Cocktails were great, and service was exquisite. 

If you want to feel like a special star, consider a stay at the Chatwal.

title: Lovely stay for work or play!
text:
Add me to the list of fans of the Chatwal.  Just came from my first stay here and it was delightful.  I came to the city for work and then my husband joined me at the end of the week for a quick getaway, and the entire staff treated us like royalty.  I used Starwood points to pay for the room, which was a standard queen room, and when I arrived they upgraded me to a King suite with a patio (which they totally didn't have to do, because I was paying with points).  The room was lovely, the bathroom luxurious, and that patio was a great place to have our coffee in the morning.

The service, again, was fantastic.  Everyone goes out of their way to help you at every opportunity.  One afternoon I had to work from my room, so I stopped at the bar first to get a glass of wine to bring upstairs...  one of the managers saw me heading towards the elevators with my hands full, and sprinted across the lobby to beat me to the elevators so he could push the button for me.  

I only had a few complaints, and these were minor:
1.  The curtains seemed to be on some sort of timer, so that they opened automatically in the middle of the night to let the sun in at sunrise.  My husband and I are light sleepers, so the sound of the curtains opening on their own startled us awake every night and really freaked us out.  LOL
2.  I understand that minibar costs are higher than what you'd spend outside the hotel, but the minibar charges here made us laugh out loud.  $12 for a small candy bar?  We get that most people who stay here don't have to worry at all about the price of anything, but there's a point when you just have to say "nope".
3.  If you have a bad back, know that the Chatwal beds seem to be on the firm side.  Super comfortable, and I slept well, but they're firm.  Unfortunately for me, the bed and my back didn't get along and I left the hotel on our final morning with a really bad back spasm.  Totally not the fault of the hotel or anything, just good for you to know if you need a bed that's soft.

Oh -- and back to a positive, dinner at The Lambs Club was delightful.  Fantastic meal, even the bread at the start was the best bread I've ever eaten in my life.  :)

I will definitely be back in the future (but will bring a back support to sleep on)...  my new favorite hotel in the city!

title: Hôtel magnifique !!😀😀😀
text:
On a adoré notre chambre:grande ,propre ,cosy,....la salle de bain superbe:baignoire balneo,toilette japonaise,Tv,belles serviettes,peignoirs,aménités de qualité...
