Des intentions très agréables :une bouteille de vin à notre arrivée,une boîte de chocolats...un service en chambre efficace et discret...la réception attentionné,prévenante ...les "valets" prompts à nous faciliter la vie...petites bouteilles d'eau fraîche le jour du départ,facilitateurs pour les transports et valises...
Bref un hôtel qui est un havre de paix et de tranquillité ,de dimension humaine,superbement bien situé dans ce bouillonnant ,bruyant et crowdy Big Apple...
Merci pour cet excellent séjour de 5 jours !!!

title: Depends on what you want.
text: So this hotel had one of the best bathrooms I've every been in. The rooms are designed with a masculine, romantic, modern sensibility. Also the staff was responsive when asked. I wasn't crazy about how small the rooms are but then again it's NYC. There really isn't a comfortable lobby. There is one it's just something you'd wanna spend anytime in. Also the gym is real small. For the price I'm not sure I'd go back again. I paid about $400 a night. I'd go back if it was closer to $300. I recommend it for a romantic get away. I was traveling solo.

title: Sophisticated Getaway
text: The Chatwal is a charming elegant hotel. It hosts the Red Door Spa and The Lambs Club restaurant. We recently stayed at the Chatwal during early May when we travelled for the opening of the Whitney Museum.    The hotel is located centrally within walking distance to Times Square and not too far from MOMA. The front desk staff was superb and upon learning from the restaurant staff our first evening that it was also our anniversary  sent a a compenentary bottle of champaigne to our suite.  This property offers butler service which is always a welcomed ammenity.  Our suite was on the 9th floor which was very quite.  The conceirge was fantastic going out of his way to assist our needs.  I would recommend this property to the seasoned traveler or for those looking for an elegant quiet oasis in the hear of  New York City.

title: Amazing boutique hotel
text:
We were delighted to see the luxury aspect of this wonderful boutique hotel.  The staff are very attentive to the needs, they provided us with an free upgrade based on my request although the hotel was extremely busy during Memorial Day weekend.  The room is well decorated, The bathroom setup is impeccable.
My only Criticism is related to the restaurant inside the hotel: The lambs club: Although the food is excellent which we had for breakfast however the staff were very slow to provide service, not well attentive to the guests needs.  Tried to make large group reservation, it was a disaster to even make the conversation which led me to cancel and broke somewhere else.

title: Oasis of calm
text: After a journey beset with delays checking in here was just bliss. The check in staff treated us like returning guests, the room is amazing with a fabulous terrace. After a quick freshen up we went to eat and take in the atmosphere, hustle and bustle of times square. Getting back to the hotel was like having our own oasis. Oh and the bed and pillows are sooooo comfy, bliss. I will be so sorry to check out.

title: Люксовый отель
text: Отличный отель, с отличным качеством сервиса и обслуживания, не говоря уже о номерах и ресторане! Расположение очень хорошее все основные центровые места в шаговой доступности рядом и парк и театр все что угодно и большой выбор баров и ресторанов! Так  в шаговой доступности музей современного искусства и  отличный не большой парк  где можно посидеть и наплодиться природой в центре города! Хороший был номер! Отличная мебель и отличная техника!

title: Exquisite luxury
text:
What a genuinely lovely hotel! It's located in the heart of Manhattan within easy walking distance of Time Square, Broadway, Rockefeller Center and more. The staff is absolutely perfect, charming and offer impeccable service. The butler service is top notch, and the entire staff strives to take care of your every need before you even notice you need something. When we went to breakfast in the incredibly delicious Lamb's Club dinning room, the maid service had already serviced our room before we came back from breakfast. We were greeted by name from each of the staff each time we came through the lobby, and every person at the hotel was helpful and offered great advice on places to eat, directions to attractions, where to find the subway station, etc. 

The room was sublime! From the heated toilet seat to the turn down service in the evening, no detail is overlooked. The rooms feature leather and suede covered walls and the most decadent bathroom! The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in at a hotel, and the linens are silky soft and don't smell like bleach.

I can't say enough good things about The Chatwal. Do yourself a favor and spoil yourself with a stay in this treasure. It's a perfect hotel and the staff is the most wonderful group of service-minded people, happy to help make your stay a cherished memory.

title: New York Getaway
text: Grand, suburb and beyond expectations!  Upscale and welcoming even if your not a "millionaire".  This hotel is home away from home.  Everyone, yes all the staff, went over and above their duties to accommodate.  The central location (half block off Times Square) and Ease of walking to Theatre, Restaurants, shopping, site-seeing and transportation is paramount.  Oh, yes, this property was very quiet and exhibited all the modern conveniences possible, butler, too.  Complimentary continental breakfast in the Lambs Club bar and restaurant (onsite) was included.

title: Great Hotel
text: Wonderful, small hotel in the heart of the theater district of New York.  Lovely rooms and the service was exceptional.  Everyone there made you feel welcome and that they truly cared about you enjoying your stay.  Rooms were very tastefully done with many ammenities.

title: Wonderful midtown luxury hotel!
text: Really enjoyed my stay. Loved the technology including the TV in the mirrored wall in the bathroom. Turn down service was nice and the makeup removal washcloth was a nice touch. The room was modern but comfortable.

title: Not sure if best in NYC, but really, really good!
text:
I haven't stayed in more than a dozen hotels in the city so I definitely don't feel qualified to say this is the best in NYC, but I can tell you that it is the best I've stayed in!

You know right away that this place is special because the doormen are really sharp, friendly and motivated!  (As an example, one of them actually hiked all the way over to 7th street to flag down a cab, as most of the flag downs ended up stopping at the Millennium before they got to us.)

The front desk staff was friendly and efficient and we are checked in immediately. The lobby is sharp and inviting, with lots of seating.

The rooms are incredible - good size for the price, all new and modern.  Terrific bathrooms with literally every amenity and a great waterfall shower.  I always enjoy the TV's built into the mirror!  All kinds of electronically controlled environmental controls were conveniently next to the bed.  Small and direct reading lights on built in flexible rods made it very easy to get a few pages knocked out before going to sleep. The whole hotel was  very quiet.

We also found a nice backgammon set in the closet.  Luckily there are game instructions in the guest services book :)

The desk included UK adapters, which I didn't need, but it reminded me what a pain this is when I go over there.  I'm sure international guests appreciate this little touch.

If you are a minibar fan - this is the place for you.

The door locks use the newer proximity cards and were super-easy and reliable.  The elevator uses the same cards.  For once I didn't have to go to the desk to get new keys after my phone "demystifies" them.

Turndown service was quietly handled while we were at dinner, and there were even complimentary overnight shoe shine bags on the bed to remind me.

The bar (upstairs) was pretty good.  We ordered a snack and drinks which took slightly (but not annoyingly) longer than we would typically expect.  The Shishoto peppers are excellent. We also had drinks downstairs at the lobby bar, and they were terrific.  The bartender definitely knows his way around a Manhattan.  

Breakfast at Lambs, off the lobby, was included in our rate. We opted for the breakfast parfait and pastries which were both very good.  I am a bacon and eggs man but I admit that the combination of Greek yogurt, granola, honey and plenty of fresh berries hit the spot. Maybe I was lulled by the fact that they serve it in a Martini glass!  The pastries were very fresh and there were more than we could eat. Coffee was worthy (very important!).

I think I will stay here every time I am in the city from now on - its that good. The price was comparable to others I have stayed in l, but I'd call it a good value for the cost.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: I don't want to tell you how wonderful this place is because I don't want people competing with me for the incredible rooms and impeccable service. Old school NYC. The little details that matter 24/7.

title: Best Time Ever in New York
text: Have traveled to New York City many times.  Usually stay in Midtown as we like to go to shows most nights.  Decided to try the Chatwal, a luxury boutique hotel a few steps away from Times Square but with none of the chaos one block away.  The hotel is gorgeous, the staff attentive and excellent in every regard.  When they learned it was our anniversary they gave us a delightful bottle of wine and chocolates.  The bed was so comfortable, the rooms spacious, the restaurant there, The Lamb's Club, delicious and open late.  It was a wonderful week.  We will certainly go back in the future.

title: stands by its title...
text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone... Very good location, very nice staff, quiet beautiful and very clean rooms... Do I need to mention that its a 'luxury collection', it stands by the name! It was a good stay, recommended.

title: Mixed experience
text: Staid here recently for a couple nights. Overall a nice hotel the location is good for the theatre district or time square. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, which is impressive for New York. We liked the room design overall the problem was the room location. They put us on the 2nd floor near the elevator which I would avoid. There were people coming out of the bar and talking on their cell constantly also there was a private room right next to us and a lot of noise till at least 2. Also, very surprised at how bad the mattresses were not a deal breaker but not comfortable. Overall not a horrible experience but it wasn't great either.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We stayed at the Chatwal May 7-11, 2015.  This is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at in NYC.  The attention to detail in the rooms, restaurants, lobby and spa are fantastic.  The bathrooms are huge with the most wonderful toilets, showers, and tubs.  The bath products are spectacular, the food is delicious, service is professional.  It is truly hard to believe you are right off Time Square, the hotel is so quiet.  When we come to NYC we usually like a view, and there is no view at the Chatwal, but it doesn't matter, everything else makes up for it.  We can't say enough good things about this hotel.

title: Amazing experience in a first class hotel
text:
My husband and I stayed with our two year old daughter at the Chatwal in New York City. We were excited for our daughter to experience New York and wanted a hotel that was walking distance to the Big Apple's many attractions. The Chatwal is just a block from Times Square but is a quiet escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. As soon as the doorman opens the doors into the quiet, air conditioned lobby, you are transported to a calm, relaxed atmosphere to unwind from a busy day of meetings and/or sightseeing. The rooms are quite large for NYC, well appointed with exquisite linens, and offer plenty of storage. They are actually silent and can be made very dark with blackout curtains.  The room lights dim with the touch of a button by the bed. Next to each side of the bed is a convenient reading light. The bathrooms are sparkling (literally, the marble has sparkles in it!), the rain shower is spa-like, and the toilet seats are heated! 

But where the Chatwal really shines is with its staff. I can't say enough good things about how accommodating and friendly they are. You are greeted warmly each time you step into the lobby. A big heartfelt thanks to Michael and Manpreet for making friends with our daughter - they made our stay so memorable! We left one of our daughter's stuffed animals in the room when we went out one night and the housekeeping staff tucked him into bed for the night. She was so happy to see that he was taken care of! We will definitely return to this wonderful hotel!

title: Bel hôtel aux prestations haut de gamme
text:
J'avais choisi cet hôtel pour sa proximité de Times square et ses prestations haut de gamme.

L'emplacement était en effet vraiment extraordinaire et les prestations dans l'ensemble plutôt bonnes.

La décoration était tout particulièrement a la hauteur de mes attentes. La chambre qui nous était attribuée était de bonne taille et la salle de bain impressionnante. La vue est un peu limite côté cour, avec en face de l'hôtel sans doute la façade la plus moche de tout Manhattan...

J'avais lu dans plusieurs commentaires que la piscine est vraiment petite! Pas d'erreur, elle est minuscule, mais l'idée de pouvoir faire trempette en toute quiétude en plein milieu de Time square est un vrai luxe!

Côté négatif, J'ai par contre été un peu déçu du service! 
L'accueil est un peu froid, et je n'ai découvert qu'au Checkout qu'une employée parlait français!
Le personnel du restaurant a quant à lui sa propre idée du service, qui se rapproche du jemenfoutisme! Après un petit déjeuné décevant, je me suis résolu à fréquenter les établissements voisins moins chers et plus accueillants!

Dans l'ensemble plutôt satisfait je pense renouveler cette expérience en pensant à réserver une chambre côté rue...!

title: FABULOUS!
text: After much research, I decided on the Chatwal in celebration of my daughter's 30th birthday.  I booked room 401 which is classified as the "executive studio."  Very large room which included two bathrooms, separate living room and bedroom.  Loved the comfortable bed & crisp linens.  Not to mention the mirrored bathroom(s) with heated toilet seat, bidet, waterfall shower and TV!  The studio is located in the rear of the building and very quiet.  Our butler, Manpreet, was awesome and made our visit complete with special touches over our two night stay.  Would recommend the Red Door Spa for pampering as well.  Overall, could not have asked for a better place.....The Chatwal is beautiful, unique, rich in history with staff that do not disappoint.  We will be back!

title: A perfect stay
text: This was my fourth stay at the Chatwal. The stay was perfect in every way. The staff continue to be outstanding in every way-they cannot do enough to assist you to make your stay as memorable as possible.The property is beautifully maintained and the conciege team give expert insider advice on restaurants, shopping and activities.

title: NYC At It's Best😉😉😉
text: Talk about a dream trip for my wonderful daughter in law!!! It was here first visit to the city and I was delighted to share the Chatwal with her!! We had a two room suite decked to the hilt with amenities right down to a heated toilet seat!!!! I can not say one thing bad about this small bouquet hotel!!! The service was wonderful, they were great!!! If you want to have a nice hotel by Time Square, The Chatwal is a perfect fit!!!

title: Beautiful hotel in great location!
text: The staff  are friendly and go beyond expectations to make one's stay perfect.  Everything in the room is electronically by a remote next to the bed. The bed, pillows, and sheets are deliciously comfortable.

title: Excellent experience near Times Square
text:
As a longtime SPG member, I figured I would try this hotel rather than one of the W Hotels in the city for a personal trip. Despite it being just next to Time Square I found the room exceptionally quiet, which made the trip quite relaxing. 

I was impressed by the relatively large size of the room, the available closet space, and the bathroom. The bathroom had double sinks and a wonderful huge rainfall shower head. Overall the room definitely exceeded my expectations.

The staff were all highly accommodating, even going so far as to find a coloring book for my young son. I also liked that it was a smaller hotel, in contrast to the many mega hotels in NYC. I was always greeted warmly and got personal attention when needed - something that's a rare quantity in NYC. 

I would definitely stay here again - highly recommended.

title: Stunning
text:
Chatwal offers a new standard for Times Square.  Brilliant, stunning room (though a bit small like most area properties) with decor to die for, with fine leather trim.  The bathroom however was spacious, with superlative fittings,  Toto washlet, and tastefully fragrant Asprey toiletries.   And the location cannot be beat.  Minutes to Fifth Ave, shows,  and wonderful restaurants.
I was very concerned about a room near the elevator and noise.  No issue at all!  The noise proofing here is an engineering marvel.  Never heard any street noise,  elevator hum, or housekeeping carts.  Looking forward to returning....

title: An Oasis in Times Square
text: We had a wonderful stay at The Chatwal. The rooms are luxurious beyond my wildest expectation. The room had a television in the bathroom which is always great for when you are getting ready in the morning. We even had a large balcony. Now I have stayed in hotels all over NYC and I had never had a room with a balcony in the city before. The hotel was also quite despite its proximity to everything. The staff was wonderful. A level of service that you rarely get outside of Disney. When compared to other NYC hotels on terms of service, friendliness and helpfulness - this place blows the Plaza and the Waldorf out of the water. One last thing, while the hotel is super classy, I was in a printed t-shirt when I got there as I was coming from a school thing. I was very underdressed, but I was never made to feel uncomfortable by anyone. Its probably designed for couples, but I think it is very well suited to families.

title: Brilliant
text: High class hotel with excellent service. No noise at all at night, despite being close to the Times Square. Best breakfast ever! Concierge service was outstanding and very helpful. Not to mention the TV in the bathroom, the cleansing toilet, the well supplied mini bar, and and and

title: Our new favorite NYC hotel
text:
We have stayed at many of the famous big name hotels in NYC over the years. I have to say though that we most enjoyed our recent stay at the Chatwal. From the moment we arrived, the staff was friendly and made us feel like VIP travelers. The building is in a great location, due to it's proximity to Times Square and Bryant Park. We were traveling with our dog, and the staff was very accommodating to her. We stayed in a junior suite which was spacious and very luxurious. The suede walls and the leather covered built in closets were the type of details that make this hotel special. The bathroom was amazing - the jetted tub, the incredible rainfall shower, the TV integrated in the mirror, and the best feature- the Toto toilet, with a heated seat and a built in bidet with heated water was something we never have seen in any hotel. There is also a touchscreen system in the room bedside that can control all the lighting, thermostat, and the motorized drapes. 
Our butler helped us with dinner reservations, getting us a last minute reservation at Nobu that we couldn't get ourselves. Anything we needed was a phone call away. 
If you are looking for a super-classy hotel with an incredible staff that never says no and greet you by name, than this is the place.

title: Excellent
text: We had a wonderful stay at The Chatwal. The rooms were very clean and tasteful. The service was friendly and helpful. We had a large balcony off our room which was a luxury. The location was perfect for us with it's proximity to Times Square and 5th Avenue. We also enjoyed the cafe across the road for breakfast.

title: An Oasis in the Heart of New York
text:
Located on 44th Street just next to Times Square you might expect this hotel to be on the noisy side.  Nothing of the sort.  Enter through a black awning and satisfyingly heavy doors and greeted by the doorman you realise you are somewhere special.  The reception staff are friendly and inviting and the rooms are quite spectacular.

My son and daughter had a twin room and I had a double which were interconnecting essentially making a suite.  On the third floor and to the rear meant that you could not hear a single thing.  The rooms were ensuite with large bathrooms. 

The Chatwal is undoubtedly a luxury small hotel but well worth the money. From 44th you can walk uptown and downtown quite easily.  The subway at Times Square (42nd Street) could get you anywhere in New York.  Theatres, restaurants and well Times Square are all literally on your doorstep.

Perfect.

title: viaggio di nozze
text: che bel ricordo!!!! hotel incantevole, vicinissimo a tutte le strutture. A piedi si arriva dappertutto. Attenti a non consumare nulla all'interno dello stesso in quanto vi pelano vivi...un po' come in tutta la citta se non state attenti. lo shopping di vestiti invece......mi sarei portato dieci valige!!!!

title: Jewel Box
text: The suede-covered walls and rounded corners, dim lighting, and small size of this hotel's bedrooms make the guest feel like a jewel nestled in a case, which is pleasant enough, but can be a bit disorienting.  The Sikh butler on my floor did not greet me but did respond promptly when I needed a toothbrush.  Actually, the fact that no one escorted me to my room or greeted me there was a problem, because the means of controlling the curtains (through the telephone or an unmarked remote stored in a drawer) was not easy to find or figure out -- similar to a problem I had with another Starwood hotel in Vienna, where it took me four days to discover a switch for controlling the electronic shutters in a closet housing a trouser press.  Also the Chatwal room service menu was essentially hidden in a closet and it would have been helpful for someone to show it to me. I was disappointed that room service could not deliver the afternoon tea featured in the hotel restaurant, but when I persisted they were able to substitute with a pot of tea, sandwich, and leftover scones from breakfast, and they offered hot milk with the tea, which most hotels do not do; Delivery was very courteous and astonishingly quick.  The bathroom was large, modern, trendy, and clean, with a huge shower with lovely soaps.  The bed was much too hard for me and I had significant back pain, but I need a softer mattress than most so this is unlikely to be a problem for the majority.  Overnight shoeshine, which was included, was only fair compared with professional shoeshines on the street.  Wireless Internet in the room was sometimes slow, as in other hotels, and was included in the cost of the room without any need for complicated sign-in pages.  After some initial miscommunication, the doorman was able to get a cab for me, even though this required him to go down to the corner.  I was not offered use of the hotel car.  Overall this is an elegant hotel with the potential to make guests feel cared for; the expense is probably worth it for a trip including many business or social activities and cultural events that would allow the guest to take full advantage of the hotel's service; it may be less worth it for a quick overnight stay.

title: Unsurpassed luxury and warmth
text: We stayed at the Chatwal from April 12 - April 15.  We had the most beautiful suite called The Producer's Suite.  Everything about it was beautiful and extremely comfortable.  We enjoyed the 750 sq. ft. rooftop balcony the most and the views were amazing.  I would love to be there for New Year's Eve as you can see the ball drop from there.  What a place for a party!!  We were treated so well by all of the staff.  They make you feel like family - so welcome and they do whatever they can to please you.  I had contact with the concierge service well before our trip about obtaining tickets to shows and Pierre, Juan and Jeff were so helpful and got us the best seats  and are so helpful with whatever we needed such as tickets to the 911 memorial and dinner suggestions and reservations.  Our Butlers, Brandon and Manpreet are wonderful and do such an exceptional job.  The room service is divine and very timely.  The front desk staff, Rigel does a great job and always made us feel so welcome and was so happy to help with whatever our request may be.  The Guest Services Manager, Tammy Yu, was wonderful and made our trip especially wonderful.  She made us feel so welcome and gave us an upgrade which was a great surprise.  We had booked a wonderful suite with a terrace and were upgraded with The Producer's Suite.  The room was so beautiful that we hated to leave the room.  The housekeeping staff does a wonderful job and are very kind.  This is our 3rd year of celebrating our anniversary at The Chatwal and this is our 25th.  We are so happy that we chose The Chatwal and New York City as our destination.  People in New York City are so friendly and welcoming.  We met the warmest people everywhere we went, from the Opera and Play to the 911 Memorial (which is a not to miss - so well done!)  The Chatwal and the staff are representative of what we love about New York City, exciting, limitless possibilities and full of beauty and warmth.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Excelente hotel, com a localização previlegiada, atendimento dos funcionários nota 10, são todos educados, o quarto e banheiro são maravilhosos . Com certeza todas as vezes ficarei neste hotel, considero o melhor hotel de NY.

title: Service that went above and beyond
text: There was miss-communication between our travel agent and the hotel and our reservations were not on file. The front desk staff, and most importantly the manager, worked to resolve the issue. We were happy to hear from the very beginning was "don't worry, we'll work this out." They comped us drinks while the issue was sorted out and then put us into a very nice room. From the doorman to the fitness room attendant we received gracious treatment. Service throughout the stay was excellent. The hotel has all the amenities and services that you would want and is very convenient to the theaters. Highly recommended.

title: Rude Manager: Platinums Beware!!!!
text:
Just finished a several-night stay in the Chatwal's Producer Suite. It's a fine hotel in a nice location--nestled right between Times Square and Sixth Avenue, so both central and quiet. And the service is generally top-notch, as frequent SPG travelers like me (I'm a 100-night Platinum) expect. But my stay was ruined by the proverbial bad apple in the bunch--the incredibly rude night manager at the Chatwal, Daniel.

The Chatwal's rooms are quite small and dark, because the hotel is surrounded by much taller buildings. So after checking in, as an SPG Platinum I asked the front desk to upgrade me to a room with a bit more light. I had the misfortune of being directed to Daniel, who rudely denied me any accommodation, repeatedly calling me "difficult" and "unreasonable." It took just a ten-minute call to the Platinum Concierge to get arranged for an upgrade (several rooms were available), but Daniel's attitude and refusal to accommodate frequent Starwood guests was a bother.

During my stay, I enjoyed the rest of the staff very much, who showed me into the lovely Mezzanine Bar for an Empire-era cocktail and live jazz. I also had a fine breakfast, also over live jazz. And it was easy to avoid the bustle of Times Square. For those looking to avoid the tourist traps there, just make a right out of the Chatwal and grab a taxi going north on Sixth Avenue!

One downside of the Chatwal is the absurdly tiny gym, which is perhaps 300 square feet total. That's mitigated a bit by the Red Door Spa that's available, and the little lap pool they have, but at these rates having only two treadmills in the hotel's gym is really a bit ridiculous. Still, my stay was enjoyable. I stayed long enough to get to know most staff by name, and they kindly helped me throughout a busy week of business appointments.

Unfortunately, upon checkout I was once again confronted by Daniel. He complained that he "would not have accommodated [me] if SPG hadn't made us," and refused to remove several incorrect charges from my folio. I've had to file a lengthy complaint with Starwood about him and my experience. Because SPG is usually so good to its frequent travelers, I expect they will compensate me appropriately, but I hadn't bargained for an hour on the phone with SPG's corporate customer service when I decided to stay at the Chatwal.

Overall, I thought the Chatwal was a unique and lovely boutique hotel, with several nice touches. But to me, for a boutique hotel to be a success, the staff have to be exceptional. Not only did I not have that experience, but Daniel's rude resistance to taking care of SPG's most frequent guests convinced me never to return. There are too many fine hotels in New York--Starwood and otherwise--to put up with that kind of treatment, and I suggest that SPG Platinums stay at the St. Regis, the W, or another hotel where you won't have to tolerate folks like him.

title: Excepcional
text: Melhor hotel de NY inteira, nem pesquiso mais nenhum outro hote, me tornei membro SPG de tão satisfeito que fiquei, todos funcionarios educados e prestativos, todas encomendas que chegaram ao hotel eram colocadas no sistema e entregues na porta do meu quarto.

title: Best hotel in New York
text: We have been staying at more than 20 different hotels in New York but this one is absolutely the best ! Everything from the huge and outstanding equipped bathroom to the design in the bedroom. The personal was always there for you, always with a smile and ready to help you with whatever you wanted. We LOVED this hotel and will absolutely come back for our nest trip. If you want to spoil yourself with a outstanding hotel - go to The Chatwal !

title: Excellent service and opulent setting located minutes from the theaters.
text: The concierge had us set up with theater tickets that were awesome and the staff is so nice and helpful. The room was very nice and the heated toilet seat was very cozy  The staff all called us by name and were anxious the be of assistance

title: A room at the top....
text: Michael, Michael, Michael.....from the moment Michael met me at the door, to explaining about the heated toilet seat and tv that "magically" appears on the bathroom mirror I knew that the Chatwal was going to be a "unique boutique" experience.  All of the personnel were friendly and took the time to answer all my questions.  The room was amazing and the bathroom, well the toilet/bidet was just a hoot.  A block off of Times Square is the location, location, location for everything I did while in NYC.  I will always choose the Chatwal on my NYC visits in the future!

title: In one word:  wonderful!
text:
Perfect location in NYC.  The suite was amazing, so was the service.   The Lambs Club was excellent.  The only thing I could think of that was missing is an espresso machine in the room.
I would gladly recommend, and come again.

title: Calm and comfortable in 5 star style
text: As others have written, this is like a privae club hotel. Appointmets, linens, towls and room equipmet is all modern and luxury class. A hiccup at check in was proptly fixed my manager James. Service and staff wee impeccable throughout the stay. Spa is small but ver nice. Great food in resturants. The bahrooms in this hotel are wonderful.

title: Люкс и шик
text: Люкс и шик  вот эти два фактора данного отеля, он индивидуален! В следующий раз обязательно становлюсь в нем если будет номер и подходящая цена, очень стильный и модный! Хороший персонал, отличный дизайн и простор комнат а так же отличный панорамный вид из окон! Отличные ванные комнаты! есть  хороший ресторан! Отличное место, но Дороговато!

title: Top Tier Professionals in a Stunning Setting
text:
I have stayed at the Chatwal 3 times and have been impressed by every stay. From the bellman the reception staff, the bar vibe, the small gym to the spa, I use the entire facility and EACH staff member is incredibly professional, friendly and at your service.
No detail is overlooked (at least I have found anything overlooked yet!).
The bellman was kind enough to stand with me on the cross street in the pouring rain, shelftering me with an umbrella, while we exchanged stories. The room service staff was kind enough to not get huffy over serving my breakfast in 2 shifts (coffee and milk pre-gym at 5 am and the rest more than an hour later),  the front desk printed out a 30 page document in color and slipped it under my door within minutes of receiving the file via email and not squibbling over charging me for it, etc. I felt taken care of.
You never have to beg.........

title: Very Private - Like Your Own Club in NYC
text:
The Chatwal provides exactly what they intended - "a strong sense of place" in all aspects. Beautifully restored in New York Machine Age style deco, the lobby is an amazing welcome with its oversized clock and polished metal and bright red leather. The rooms are a little more understated but luxurious - in particular the food and wine cupboard (no way can i call this a mini bar as i am sure they would be horrified!) and the writing desk are works of art. The bathroom is all mirrors, polished metal and black stone. A pleasure every time you enter but wouldn't like to have to clean it! 
The privacy and lack of crowds was the most appealing feature for me. It really does feel like your own private escape.  W 44th street is also an excellent location with a range of well priced bistro's (if u like heading out for breakfast), bars and quality restaurants all within 10 mins walk.

title: Quality hotel & service
text: We come here for work every year in December for a week and we love it. My favourite area of NYC is actually Downton but if you're staying Midtown you can't wish for better. The rooms are lovely, big, amazing bathroom (heated toilet seats!), my only gripe is the lack of coffee machine in the room which a lot of big hotels do these days. Our favourite thing about this hotel is the wonderful Brandon and his excellent staff, year on year they look after us so well, anything we require is taken care of in a swift, friendly and professional manner. In fact he's so wonderful he makes notes of our requirements and they are left in our room the following yearn from kettles to ironing boards. The restaurants and bars are great, but as is normal, gets a little slow at very busy times. Food is brilliant, breakfast lunch and dinner. Can't wait to go back in December!

title: Returning guest. Still enjoyable place
text: I reviewed this hotel some time ago. As a returning guest I have to say that everything is still as good as it was last time. Rather small room (what you expect in NY?) but very comfortable. Perfect bed and pillows. The bathroom stands out. Unlike the room it's spacious and superb heated toilet seat. Room for 3 in shower with modern equipment, heavenly rain shower. All very comfortable. Biggest asset: it's quiet. It struck me last time it still is. Definitively a pro in a noisy city. Very helpful reception staff and concierge. One slight neg: it's so brown in the room. Makes an outdated impression. I had constant fight with the touch screen operated lighting and phone. Prefer something more easy to handle. You get excellent quality for this pricy hotel

title: Quiet, comfortable luxury 1 block from Times Square!
text: This hotel is luxury and comfort, but what makes it so great is how quiet it is being less than 1 block from the madness of Times Square.  Very clean and helpful staff.  Walking distance to Central Park, MoMA, theater (obviously) make this a convenient location as well.  The spa is a little small, it is an Elizabeth Arden satellite and you can schedule treatments.  There is a small gym and singles endless pool to swim against current, if so desired.  The pre theater crowd fills up the cool lobby bar for the restaurant (Lamb's Club), but clears out when shows start.  Dining at the Lamb's Club is a treat, but not cheap.  This hotel is a definite find if you want to stay in the middle of it all.

title: Fantastic Experience!
text: I've stayed in many hotels (mainly for business trips) over the past ten years, but this is the first time I feel compelled to write a recommendation. My stay at the Chatwal (2 nights -- February '15) was simply exceptional. Quick & efficient check-in, quiet room, excellent service. Obviously, this hotel is located in Manhattan -- so one shouldn't expect very large rooms or gyms. But compared to other properties (including SPG hotels), the Chatwal is absolutely top-notch.

title: True luxury in the heart of the Theater District!
text: The Chatwal, located in the heart of the Theater District on 44th Street is a true luxury hotel.  We stayed their for 6 nights in February.  The staff is top notch and really get to know you from the moment you check in.  So accommodating and sincere.  The hotel is elegant with a bit of fun mixed in.  Lots of music in the background whether it's Frank Sinatra streaming through or whiffs of a live Jazz Trio coming from the Lamb's Club lounge, it's a lively place that you want to come back to after a day of museums or shopping.  We will stay at the Chatwal for all of our future visits to NYC.  And don't overlook the Lamb's Club.  The food was very good and we really enjoyed the lounge on the second floor.

title: Great service
text: Luxurious hotel in the heart of the theater district.  Rooms somewhat small but that's pretty standard in Manhattan. I was surprised at how quiet the room was considering the hotel is just off Times Square.  Beautiful bathroom.  TV in the mirror.  Bedding very luxurious and comfortable.  Free shoe shine service.  Internet worked well.  Everyone was vey friendly and helpful.  I had a glass of wine at the bar.  Very pricey.  The only real downside to this hotel is the fitness center which is extremely small.  Two treadmills, an elliptical and a bike.  Otherwise a very nice place to stay.

title: Gem near Times Square
text: A very nice property, with an excellent restaurant. Very helpful staff. Extremely clean. Good breakfast nearby, at Saju's, if you don't take it at the hotel. Familiar feeling, not like big, elegant hotels, but rather a small, luxurious one. The lobby was't very cosy and there was no lounge to sit and relax in, which would have been nice. Good wi-fi. A five-star experience, rated 4.5 just because of the price, which isn't cheap, and the lack of a decent lobby.

title: A+ service, good before theater dining spot too
text: Excellent service - all the staff are terrific, rooms are lovely, great bathrooms/shower though the in-mirror TV didnt work.  Four star dining - great food, good for before theater, though plan to pay very very high prices. Location is good if you want to be near theater/times square but not in a big loud impersonal hotel, though not for budget travelers

title: A really nice hotel in a great location
text:
My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Chatwall this past January. We stayed in a junior suite.
The room was really nice with a great bathroom but it could not accommodate more than 3 people. This isn't a hotel for families to visit NY unless the kids are older such as my daughter. The staff was really nice and personable especially the concierge desk. 

My husband and I had lunch in their restaurant that we soon realized was very upscale and quite delicious. It's very easy to access shopping on 5th avenue and Madison Square garden. There are bunch of cute restaurants all along the street.
It was reasonably priced New York Hotel and we had a great experience. I didn't give a 5 simply because it's smaller and doesn't provide all the amenities of hotel like the Palace but none the less I'd stay there in a heartbeat.

title: WOW..for 2nd time
text: This is my second stay at this hotel and it was great. from the outside you hardly know its a hotel but once you step inside you feel most welcome. bell boy was very helpful and check in took quick. we stayed on the 2nd floor which was a avg size room but it had a small balcony. rooms are spotless and great, bathroom is even better with its lovely mirrors designs. shower was as large as bathroom back home.... i would def stay here again

title: In a word...WOW!
text: I cannot say enough good things about our recent stay at the Chatwal.  We decided to celebrate my wife's birthday in NYC.  Every member of the staff was incredible and really went the extra mile to make her feel special on her birthday.  The atmosphere was very 1950's and made it so much fun.  The food was so amazing we ended up cancelling reservations at 2 other places to eat at the hotel(something I never do!!).  The Chatwal is now where we go to celebrate all our special events!

title: Прекрасное месторасположение, замечательный отель
text: Мы останавливались в этом отеле в январе 2015 года и, пожалуй, это просто самое замечательное место для знакомства с этим городом. Сам номер (мы были с взрослым сыном) нам был предоставлен сдвоенный (801 и 802), то есть общая только прихожая, замечательная ванная, есть русский канал. Но,самое главное, это локация. Находясь в центре Нью-Йорка (30 метров от Таймс Сквер) в то же время шум никак не мешал нам отдыхать в номере - все это было составляющими отличного отдыха. Кстати, рядом (направо через дверь) от отеля находится кафе, где мы нашли овсяную кашу на завтрак, что в Америке считается большой редкостью. Стоимость номера, конечно, дороговата, но как и все отели в центре Нью Йорка, но оно того стоит.

title: Amazing boutique hotel
text:
I recently went to Nyc and wanted to be get rid of the big Nyc hotel and find a cosy place . Hidden nearby Times Square the chatwal is  a shelter for all travelers 
Once you step in you feel like the 50s are back and Franck Sinatra could appear say at anytime !
The staff is great and a special thanks to the reception lady Julie who helped me a lot and use her french to help a lost frog in the city
The room is spacious ! The sheets are just a anti jetlag system the bathroom offers a shower cabin really huge with all needed amenities ! 
The restaurant is nice I could enjoy a diner ! It seems a Capra movie ! The red sofa are giving such a cosy place and the fire place invites you to relax 
I could met the Gm Joel always keen to have a tea with you and gives you tips on the city 
I highly recommend this hotel !!!
Didier

title: Luxurious gem in the heart of the city!
text:
My husband and I spent a lovely weekend recently at The Chatwal. The attentive service began with a warm greeting from the doorman, Michael, who also brought up our luggage.Each time we returned to the hotel, Michael asked about our activities, whether we were having a good time, and if there was anything he could do for us. Michael was typical of the friendly staff, including the manager who came to our room to see if he could be of service.
The room was lovely, done in an art-deco style and facing an inner courtyard which assured quiet rest. The bath was spectacular with a deep soaker, jetted tub, a TV hidden in the mirror, and a Toto heated wash and dry toilet.
I highly recommend The Chatwal to anyone who wants a luxurious getaway in the city.

title: Probably one of our best stays in NYC
text:
I was on a short business trip and wanted to treat my wife to a top hotel.  The staff was super nice, the hotel itself was beautiful inside, the drinks were top-notch, and the room/bathroom was everything I hoped for. My wife also enjoyed her massage!

The one and ONLY thing that was a letdown was that the salt-water pool was under construction.  I know this sounds crazy, but I purposely wanted to use this because my wife could have benefited (she has super sensitive skin).  If they had warned us that this was closed, I would have probably found another hotel with this amenity.  I realize that this is kind of a rare case (who looks for a salt-water pool when staying in NYC)... but a heads up would have been nice.  It's not like this place was cheap!

title: Luxury and decadence just steps away from Times Square
text: This fantastic boutique hotel in the heart of broadway and steps away from Times Square was a fantastic way to spend a birthday weekend. The staff was delightful and helped with everything we needed. They were informative and added even more pleasure to the wonderful atmosphere and vibe of the hotel. Our room was street side, but we didn't have a lot of noise and was luxury with a capital L. The bathroom was bigger than most NYC hotel rooms and the rainfall shower head was delightful. Breakfast in the Lambs Club Restaurant was fantastic. The food was amazing and the service was quick and friendly. Drinks were quaint yet NYC expensive in the lobby -- with the only complaint that they stopped serving pretty early in the evening on Sunday. The whole place had great character, great atmosphere and friendly service. Probably my only complaint was that we could hear someone in another room watching tv. I don't know if they were hard of hearing and needed to listen to it very loudly or if the walls were just a bit thin. The spa was also delightful with a amazing service.

title: VIP Girls' Weekend
text: The Chatwal Hotel elevated our girls' weekend to VIP levels. The top-notch service started the moment we walked through the door and continued throughout our weekend. The hotel and rooms are stunning with decor that brings you back into the heart of Old New York glamour. Comforts are second-to-none down to every last detail. Access to the fabulous Lambs Club makes the hotel New York's hottest place to stay.

title: на стиле-)
text:
Очень современный, стильный, модерновый, со своей аурой и атмосферой.
Приятный ресепшн, шустро заселили, в номерах чего только нет в плане технических "примочек")))) Нельзя не отметить сервис- великолепен, улыбчив и вышкален на любом урвоне!!!
Завтраки отличные, разнообразные, стильная подача блюд.
Самое главное- до всего рукой подать-) Очень удачное местоположение!!!!

title: Great boutique hotel with amazing character.
text: The Chatwal, much like many of the classic turn of the century hotels in this area, is like taking a step back in time.  The lobby, the bar, and general common areas exude ambience and set a great atmosphere as you enter the hotel.  The staff is great and very friendly and informative.  The rooms are modern with 30/40's style dark wood accenting and are extremely nice.  The all black bathrooms, which I didn't think I would like at first, were actually very cool and have amenities.  On many nights the upstairs lobby bar has live jazz which adds to the mood of the hotel, and the bartenders and waitresses are fantastic (try the rum Old Fashioned).  Overall this a great boutique hotel just minutes from all of the main attraction in midtown and uptown.

title: Great stay!
text: The hotel has a great location, very comfortable rooms with great bathrooms and service that is both warm and efficient. Good to have a hotel right off Times Square that has real character and personality! Breakfast in the Lambs Club Restaurant was great quality.

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text: The hotel is really nice. It started with an easy Valet parking drop off right in front of the hotel. Check-in was fast. The rooms are amazing. The bathroom ranks as top 3 in all my travels and I've been to some high-end places.  We were in and out in less than 20 hours so I did not experience much else but the lobby bar seemed cool.

title: Nice hotel, great location
text:
I stayed at the Chatwal in late November and booked two rooms.  Reviewing a hotel can be difficult if the stay is uneventful and pleasant, and can be fun and filled with vindication if not.
This will be a quick review.  The hotel is nice and pleasant, and leaves nothing to disappoint.  The inside (lobby, common areas and rooms) are clean, modern and aesthetically pleasing.  The rooms (at least mine) are very nice and clean, and the bathroom was large and filled with high end components (shower head, faucet, toilet…).  There’s also (in the bathroom) a television embedded inside one of the mirrors which you won’t notice until you turn it on; if you’re wondering why the bathroom has a TV remote…that’s why.

The staff is friendly and eager to please, and I didn’t see any fault in this hotel.  It is high end, clean, spacious, and delivers in its promise to provide with a nice and luxurious stay.
Note: The second room I booked (on a separate floor) was for a couple traveling with us, and they had issues with their room; apparently there was a loud party going on next to them, and also the automatic (motorized) curtains started going on and off starting around 5 am.  They called the staff which was responsive and tried to fix the mechanical issue, and in addition satisfactory restitution was made for the loud noise and trouble in general (which was called in several times during the night).  

I bring this up not as a negative (in all fairness, my room was quiet and did not have any issues), but to point out the fact that the hotel was responsive in trying to address the issue for the other room.
I highly recommend this hotel for its service and location.

Pros:
Great location (minutes from Times Square and Broadway theaters).
Modern, clean and updated look and feel.
Helpful and friendly staff.

Cons:
Nothing is perfect, but stayed there only one night and personally could not find any faults.
Rooms are a little pricey though.

Tips:
If this is your first time in Manhattan, especially Times Square, things can get a little overwhelming.  Lots of people, a little chaotic, lots of neon and bright signs and advertisements, street vendors, street performers….  The biggest things to pay attention to are traffic and other people.  In other words, Manhattan drivers have absolutely zero patience behind the wheel (sorry if I offend anyone); watch when and where you cross the street.  Also, look out for pickpockets.

I’ve been to NYC many times, and there are countless things to do.  Some ‘do not miss’ things include visiting the 9/11 memorial, Rockefeller Center, seeing Broadway show, and exploring various districts of Manhattan.

Have fun and be safe!

title: Best Kept Luxury Secret in NYC!
text:
I booked 3 rooms in the fall and wanted a luxury boutique hotel close to the theatre district and times square where my mother was surprised to have my brother meet us there.  Each our our rooms were great and in particular - I had room 706 - which must be one of the best rooms in the hotel.  The room was quite spacious and I had a terrace that overlooked the city.  

The staff:  each person we interacted with was so personable and inquired about anything we might need, ready to assist.  Very well trained staff with high standards for ensuring guest satisfaction.

The location: can't get much better than to be steps away from Times Square and the Theatre district. 

The room: Perfect.  Most rooms in NYC hotels have a fair amount of street noise - but not the Chatwal.  Even with my room facing the city and having a terrace, the room was so quiet and perfect for sleeping.  The sheets are so soft and amazing - they're ironed to the bed.  If you love crisp sheets that are still soft, you'll love the Chatwal sheets.  The bathroom is gorgeous - the lighting is great; the shower is fabulous with a wonderful rainfall shower; and the multi-function toilet with heated seats tops it off.  

The restaurant: The Lambs Club restaurant is outstanding.  Great service / great food.  We ate several meals there.  All great.  

I plan to visit again over Valentines weekend with my husband.  Am hoping to get room 706 again!

title: Lovely little boutique hotel
text: We stayed here for 3 nights and the hotel was really lovely. Our room was cosy, everything we needed, plus an amazing bathroom. Love that shower!! The hotel is perfectly located minutes away from Times Square and walking distance to most places around Manhattan. The staff were really nice too. Our only complaint is that our laundry took about 1.5 days to be done with a few follow ups. We would stay here again though.

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text: I am a frequent visitor to NYC and this hotel is the best by some distance for me.  Key standouts are awesome personal service (remembering room preferences, tea kettles etc), very comfortable and high functioning rooms, excellent location and not too big a hotel.  Highly recommended.  Good room service and Lambs Club is a very nice restaurant also.

title: Downtown luxury
text:
First of all, New York is just not my favorite place.  Dark skyscraper canyons and massive crowds.  Oh well, it is what it is.  I didn't give this the top rating because, while very nice it wasn't spectacular.  The rooms are elegant, expensively furnished, but the decor rather dark, with imitation (not a complaint) leather covering the closets and desks.  It is to evoke luggage, and IS very clever, but still, dark.  The bathrooms are dark as well, but in a more inviting way.  Very beautiful black granite from floor to ceiling and thoughtful, effective lighting.  The bathroom mirror has a hidden TV which is VERY cool.  The toilet seats are heated and the bowl has hygienic washing...a nice touch.   The rooms are SPECTACULARLY clean!  
The lobby is small, nicely appointed, but not knock you socks off luxurious.
The staff is wonderful..everyone..without exception.
The gym-swim-spa area is small, and very nicely done.  The pool and jacuzzi are salt water, which minimizes the chlorine smell found in many hotel pools.  The pool is a lap pool, the kind with automatic current that you swim against, but room for only one swimmer at a time.  The two times I was there, there was no one else in the pool.
The restaurant is understated, and elegant.  It is headed by the famous TV Chef and restaurateur Geoffrey Zakarian, and is everything you would expect of this culinary icon!  Quite simply this is the best hotel food that I have ever had.
The location,  just off Times Square, and opposite the Majestic Theater, where Phantom of the Opera has been playing since 1988 is Broadway convenient. Traffic is nightmarish in the usual NewYork way.  It took over 1/2 hour just to drive the few blocks from the Hudson River to its midtown location on 44th st., but it WAS 2 days before New Year's Eve, so all the hubbub of Times Square getting ready for the crowds exacerbated traffic.
If you want to immerse yourself in all things New York City, this is a great place to do it

title: An Oasis
text:
I booked this hotel as I was looking to have a pool available. What a fantastic experience! From the moment we checked in, we were really looked after by the amazing staff - The room was fantastic, HUGE bathroom and walk in shower - all the amenities you could want. 

The building itself is just stunning. We ate at The Lambs Club as a pre-theatre treat - delicious! 

Location wise you are just off Times Sq, without the hustle and bustle..

Oh and we used the pool once! (very small but nice to take a dip in the jacuzzi!)

title: A hidden gem right in the heart of NYC
text:
Chatwal is a hidden gem. Most people passing by probably have no idea this small classy building is home to an amazing hotel. What’s different you might ask? First, it’s quite small, just 70 rooms, so definitely it doesn’t feel like a huge business corporate hotel. I can’t stand those Hyatt’s or W’s, there is nothing homy about them, just fake everything attitude. Whatever, whenever? Seriously? Not at the Chatwal. This is old school class with a smile. Maybe it’s not hip, no tattoos here. But it’s a great combination of style and friendliness. The crew is not huge, so you remember them all just after one day. A bonus - an amazing general manager, who is genuine and friendly, will respond personally to your emails and questions. A great, great guy. Sure shows how people working here are treating this place. They are lucky - they clearly love their work!
There is a lot of different rooms here, all different somehow. So if you have any specific need - don’t hesitate to contact the hotel. There is one great junior suite with a terrace. Or a couple of larger suites with terraces. Some are not bookable online, so it really makes sense to ask.
All of them are super clean and nice. Classy with modern features. Bathrooms are very modern. Furniture is high end, we even commented how expensive it really is.
Location - well, you are on Times Square. That’s right. Rockefeller Center - 2 minutes. 5th Ave - 5 minutes. Quite a location, right?
I think this is one of the best NYC has. And it’s quite affordable for what it offers. I know, it’s not cheap, but for NYC, it’s quite a bargain IMO. Many hotels which are not close to this quality of everything, are charging twice as much.
Stay here, you will not regret. And have a dinner at the Lambs Club. Quite a place.

title: No vale la pena
text:
Estuve una semana con la familia y nuestra habitación estaba bastante descuidada, la cabecera de la cama manchada y el cristal del baño roto en dos dos puntos. Cuando pedí de cambiarme de habitación porque la cama tan sucia me molestaba bastante, me dijeron que no era posible. Además estábamos en el tercer piso y de la calle subía el olor a frito del restaurante de abajo, el aire era irrespirable. El personal totalmente ausente desde el chico que abre la puerta de la calle que te contesta, cuando esta,  que el taxi es mejor que lo busques tu solo a los de recepción que se esfuman cuando pretendes que te limpien la cama.
Non lo aconsejo, considerando el precio que se paga.

title: best NY in Theatre District
text: We stayed in this area for only the second time.  The hotel's rooms are very comfortable and the breakfast in the Lamb's Club was very good on our two occasions to dine there.  The streets are a bit confusing due to construction, but if you like to use the subway there are two locations close by---Bryant Park and Times Square.  The ice skating rink at Bryant Park had just opened up and was crowded with skaters.  Most of the top plays in New York are a short walk from the hotel and the bar is a popular stop before or after the theatre.

title: Excellent Stay!
text: After thinking "Are we at the right place?" upon approaching the rather small, heavy, landmarked doors of the Chatwal, I quickly realized, that Yes! We are at the right place indeed! Offered drink vouchers upon check in for the lounge bar (maybe due to our SPG status). Great, friendly, out going staff; we had to catch a flight, so we rushed brunch, and they were very accommodating in getting the food out quickly, and the luggage & our driver ready by the time we were done eating. Clean everywhere in hotel from common areas, to restaurant, rooms (spotless Junior suite), how ever the hot tub in basement could use a spot check. But the hotel does actually have a pool and a hot tub which is uncommon. EXTREMELY small hot tub, but I used it on two occasions with no one else in the pool area. Lunch and brunch at the restaurant were excellent. I absolutely loved the Junior suite, so many modern electronics in a classic Manhattan room, beautiful decorating and design surprises all over the room if you're curious enough to look and clever enough to find/figure it out. Love the leather wrapped everything. complimentary wifi and Fiji water. I loved the big shower head, and the Jacuzzi bathtub how ever water ends up all over the floor of the bathroom as there is no full closing door, that wasn't fun. TV behind the bathroom mirror is indeed fun though! The lobby gets crowded before shows because it's a popular spot for theater goers. Great central location if time square & theater district is your thing. Was very fun! But this isn't our favourite location in town, so we would probably return to previous hotel we stayed at Central Park South. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND it tough!!! Amazing stay, classic New York luxury!

title: By far the best hotel in New York
text:
Normally i dont write too much about how good a hotel is. But the service of this hotel was so outstanding that i promised to write a review.

We've stayed in the Chatwal for 3 nights from the 11th till the 14th of december.
It is a small very modern boutique hotel ( it was totally redone 2 years ago ).
The rooms are very clean. Not to big not to small.
But what was the most outstanding from this hotel was the service.
I've never seen a hotel in the US giving so good service.
Everything that i wanted arranged from a driver till tickets where arranged exactly the way they promised.
Because it is a small hotel the guest get all the attention what they need.
If you want a romantic weekend and you want the best experience go to the chatwall.
It is 1 minute walking from timesquare so you are in the heart of New York

title: A wonderful time with Christmas cheer.
text:
Adrian and reception staff were incredibly helpful. 
So gracious and welcoming.  

The cocktails in the bar are amazing and the crowds do gather. I didn't eat in but heard lots of compliments on the food.
The rooms are immaculate. 
It's expensive but most things this close to Time square are.
Probably not my first choice for children only because there's so much to appreciate, and they cater so well to adults . Concierge was very helpful. 

It's easy to walk everywhere in the theater district, catch cabs or the subway from the hotel. Airport transfers are easily arranged through front desk or there are numerous vehicles waiting outside . Will definitely rebook here.

title: One Word.....AMAZING
text: I was here with my boyfriend for 4 nights from 5th of December. We walked into the hotel and our bags carried for us. No questions asked! We arrived in reception and our room wasn't ready. We were offered free drinks and then we were upgraded. Brilliant. The room itself was a bit of class. Large room with plenty of space and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was also out of this world! I wish I could have taken the shower home with me. The staff were excellent, very pleasant and made the effort to speak to you every time we walked by. This place is luxury and they make you feel like a queen. Would return tomorrow if we could! Thank you!

title: Great hotel!
text: I stayed here with my husband for one night while he was in town on business.  I kept asking him why he chose to stay here right near busy Times Square given all the places he could stay in the city.  Wow!  I was impressed.  We stayed in a "suite" which was basically a king room and a studio room with a murphy bed connected together via a small hallway.  It was a little weird but we did have two full bathrooms!!  The room itself was very well constructed.  The walls were incredibly thick and I didn't even hear my husband getting ready in the morning while I was still sleeping.  We had drinks in the lobby after dinner and also were able to buy a whole bottle of room form the bar to bring back to our room.  We weren't able to get into the Lamb's Club for lunch as it was completely booked (on a Wednesday at 11:30/12:00!!) so if you do want to eat there make a reservation in advance.  Cool vibe and luxurious.

title: great hotel, small room
text:
The Chatwal is an amazing hotel! We very much enjoyed the property, the food, the service and the neighborhood. House-keeping did not service our room one of the days, which was weird for a hotel  of this caliber. Our room was cleaned quickly upon calling and all was better.

I would certainly consider this a top hotel in the city and will come back again and again.

title: Luxury near all NY hotspots!
text:
We have really enjoyed our stay at the Chatwal hotel in New York City!
It is close to all hotspots the city can offer and it is, as a consequence, possible to visit a lot of things by foot!
The service is perfect and the personnel, discrete but efficient, pays attention to every little details in order to arrange an amazing stay in NY city! They are polite, fast, with an excellent concierge service at the entrance where you can always find somebody to help you with any question you may have at any time of the day/night... Thanks to their help and kindness (I only remember the name of Juan...), we were able to make bookings in wonderful restaurants we would never have found if we had to look ourselves in guides or on the web. We enjoyed it so much!
Our room was wonderful, very large and quiet despite the view we had on the busy street and the works that were busy... The rooms are well isolated from each other so that you feel alone in an hotel that was fully booked!
The bathroom was just perfect and let you feel like a superstar! :o) the shower is huge and very comfortable and the TV screen in the mirror is just super!!!
The breakfast is quite special, with a "à la carte" formula while we are used to have continental breakfasts when travelling... it was delicious!
We can say it is quite expensive but while estimating the location, services, etc..., you can say that you pay for what you get, so it was not really to consider as overpriced. 
A wonderful and intimate address and we will certainly get back as soon as we can!

title: Para repetir en próximas visitas a NYC
text:
Tiene un diseño fantástico y original art decó de lujo, sin imitaciones. Es un hotel pequeño y acogedor donde el servicio es simplemente estupendo, amable, educado y completamente servicial, desde el personal de limipeza a la recepción. Sin excepciones. 
La habitación, sin ser grande, cuenta con todo para resultar realmente cómoda y acogedora. De nuevo el diseño es estupendo.
Además tiene un pequeño spa, que siempre es de agradecer cuando vuelves agotado de caminar.
¿Un pero? en nuestro caso era la locación, a dos pasos de Times Square, la hace un poco ruidosa y de jaleo.

title: Best located... at Times Square
text:
The best thing about Chatwals is the location... it's right there next to Times Square. Very convenient for people on business. Good, clean rooms and very good service is the hallmark.

Staff was very helpful and it was a great stay for me on business. Wi-fi service at this hotel was free and speed was amazing.

title: Pricey, but worth it
text: This hotel is expensive, but the service, food, care and location are definitely worth it. The location is at Times Square, but to the east, just off of Sixth Avenue, so you avoid the worst of the Times Square traffic. Very much of a European feel to the  hotel, from its small size to its very attentive staff. Restaurant, as well as room service, are excellent. There are also many excellent restaurants nearby. I have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel, and will definitely stay there again, on business or for pleasure. I have stayed here before, and have yet to find any noise issues.

title: Stunning Broadway boutique hotel
text: The Chatwal is stunning 76 room boutique hotel risen out of the ashes of the storied Lamb's Club in mid town Manhattan. Located within a short walk to all Broadway has to offer, the Chatwal is an Art Deco gem lovingly restored and refined with all modern conveniences. The property boasts the Red door spa, a decent work out facility and a beautiful restaurant with an old world full height wood burning fire place. Jazz brunch is a big hit as is the upstairs Bar which oozes charm and good taste. The standard rooms are tiny but the suites are simply magnificent. Not for the budget conscious traveller but a great, quiet alternative to the bustle of the big name mega hotels.

title: Amazing stay in Times Square
text:
This gem of a hotel is located in the middle of Times Square yet has very quiet rooms.  The hotel staff pays attention to every little detail.  You're also provided with complementary butler service, which you can use for things like ironing your clothes, shinning your shoes or running small errands.  The rooms are ultra modern and are impeccably clean.  The restaurant is small but offers an intimate setting for couples.  The chef is none other than Geoffrey  Zakarian, which you may know from the Food Channel shows Chopped and Iron Chef.

This boutique hotel is an ideal choice for those looking for a luxurious stay in Midtown Manhattan

title: Perfect spot for a NYC getaway
text:
I'd absolutely recommend The Chatwal to anyone seeking for a perfect base for a few days (and nights) in town.
To start with, the location is convenient (walking distance to all the theaters, stores - 5th Ave and Times Square are right around the corner), yet rather quiet (try to get a room on the rear of the building).
We loved the style the rooms were appointed - part old fashioned lounge (check out that mini bar!), part contemporary/tech savvy features. Excellent free WiFi.
The bathroom is a highlight in its own right - talk about a high tech tub and Japanese toilet, a generous supply of amenities and towels and plenty of space.
Yet, the very best of the Chatwal are the staff. Everyone we dealt with was absolutely dedicated and genuinely friendly - resulting in some of the best service we enjoyed so far. Juan and James at the concierge desk are real gems who'll get ANYTHING organized for you - even managing to get tickets for totally sold-out Thanksgiving weekend Broadway shows.
Same goes for front-desk staff, bellboys and housekeeping - when we had to reschedule our departure to a day later on very short notice, everyone really made an effort to accomodate us and being all helpful.
If you're planning to visit the Red Door Spa in the hotel, make sure you get your treatments pre-booked at least a week in advance, otherwise there's zero chance of getting an appointment. Travelling on rather short notice, we could not find one vacant slot, which was kind of a drawback - however, this is obviously not the hotel's responsibility.
Long story short - we'll definitely be back!

title: Hidden gem
text: Beautiful Art Deco boutique with gorgeous rooms, great bathrooms, and a wonderful staff. Don't love the location, which is close to Times Square, but it is a top luxury choice in ny.  The hotel is immaculate in the way its kept.  Recommended

title: Wonderful service and wonderful room!
text: This is my 15th trip to NYC this year and my 8th or 9th different hotel (Peninsula, St. Regis, Waldorf Towers, Mandarin, etc.) and the Chatwal is my new favorite.  From the moment I arrived everyone has been helpful and friendly (sometimes you don't get that in NYC).  I booked through AMEX Platinum and am a Starwood frequent stayer and got super upgraded to the most wonderful room (1008) - its too cold to really use the roof of the hotel but the spiral stairs to the deck sure are cool and its a great view from the top.  I also ordered breakfast one day at 2:00 in the afternoon and it was not a problem.  I'm still here and looking forward to a great next two days.

title: Todo bueno
text: Estuvimos una semana desde el 24 al 30 de Septiembre del 2013. Nuestra habitación era muy cómoda con amplios closets, cafetera, revistas y un pequeño estar en la misma habitación que daba hacia la ventana de la 44 Street, donde pudimos disfrutar en la pequeña mesita unas bebidas y galletas que compramos en el comercio del sector y luego mantuvimos en el frigobar de la habitación.  El baño era comodísimo con un maravilloso WC inteligente (de regreso a Chile compramos uno igual para nuestra casa) y un espejo de muro con pantalla de TV en el. Disfrutamos nuestra larga estadía como sí estuviéramos en nuestra casa. Cada día salimos trotando hacia Central Park (a 10 min apróx) y al regreso siempre tomamos desayuno (incluido en la tarifa de la habitación) acompañado de suave música en vivo en el comedor del hotel. La ubicación es céntrica y cercana a todo. El Spa es maravilloso y la decoración de todo el hotel es preciosa con toques Art decó. El personal que atiende nos entregó planos de la ciudad, realizó reservas para restaurantes siempre que les pedimos y nos consiguió taxis a la puerta. Recomiendo este hotel por su buena ubicación, lo agradable de su personal y lo maravilloso de su arquitectura y decoración. Todo de muy buen gusto.

title: Fantastic first trip to New York!!!
text:
Cannot rate this hotel highly enough!!  The whole experience from arriving to leaving was superb!!
The hotel is stylish without being over the top or gaudy, the rooms are elegant and the bathroom we had was gorgeous!!
The staff were friendly, extremely helpful and so so nice.  They helped my partner organise his proposal to me and didn't give the game away while we checked in!!! The location is perfect for Times Square, 5th Avenue and Rockerfeller.  Everything else is a short subway or cab ride away.
We will definitely stay there again when we visit next time.
Highly recommend this hotel!!!

title: Excellent location and beautiful hotel with adequate room size for two, but major disappointment was a leaking toilet.
text: This is a terrific hotel and underrated.  But, for us to return, we would have expected a more serious response to a potentially major issue.  Our toilet was leaking in the morning before we checked out.  We told the front desk, but there was no concern.  It was as if the wrong newspaper was delivered to our room.  A weak apology.  So disappointing because we loved our stay otherwise.  The little things matter and this problem will lead us to look elsewhere for our next visit.

title: Atitude inaceitável
text:
Em relação ao quarto, ok , nada que deixe a desejar, apesar de pequeno, escolhemos o quarto com cama king.

Na primeira manha, fomos até o restaurante do hotel que estava completamente vazio, e pedimos para nos sentar lado a lado, quando a atendente, olhou de forma estranha, como se estivéssemos cometendo um crime e disse que teria que falar com o gerente. Ela retornou e disse que nao seria possível pois tinha muitas reservas!; como se em 20 minutos, tempo que levamos para tomar café atravessando a rua, o restaurante fosse encher!

Nao recomendo este hotel, pelos funcionários; um hotel 5 estrelas deveria tentar fazer de tudo para satisfazer seus hóspedes, este mostrou que nao faz!

title: Excellent séjour à New york
text:
Magnifique hôtel 
Séjour de 5 jours offert par mon ami pour mon anniversaire (juillet 2012)
Belle surprise
Très belle chambre 
Excellente literie
Salle de bain High tech avec baignoire a jets, Tv dans le miroir...
Tout était parfait
Le personnel aux petits soins
Emplacement idéal pour visiter New York

title: Magnifique hôtel ... Mais ....
text:
Cadre incroyable pour cet hôtel, magnifique salle à manger, de belles chambres a la décoration très masculine (cuir, bois, ton fonce), une petite piscine et Jacuzzi.
Salle de bain luxueuse avec les dernières technologies.
La suite que j avais réservé etait  constituée d une chambre et d un bureau. Parfait pour le travail.
Le restaurant propose une carte excellente !

En revanche j ai été déçu par le personnel du petit déjeuner (indifférent) et surtout du room service qui fait des réflexions déplacées. Lors du Check out J en ai fait part, on m a indiqué que l on reviendrais vers moi .... J attend toujours ! 
Enfin pas de chaîne française sur la tv.
Bref j aurais aimé plus d attention en regard du prix.

title: Luxury in the city
text:
A great hotel , with professional staff,meticulously clean, with every,  every modern convenience. (Check out the japanese toilets)
The staff are a wee bit ott for us Irish, but catered for every whim. Great concierge, with good advice on what to see and do in a short visit. 
The rooms are top class, and security perfect. Hard to find something to complain about, except the powerwashing of the street outside. The generator seemed to be on for hours...
Perfect location less than 100m from Times Square

title: Good Times Square Option
text:
First stay, and while I prefer it to the W and Westin nearby, the Chatwal is not exactly a true luxury option. Rooms are relatively small and not quite as plush, but it does have a rare combination of modern rooms (TV in the bathroom!) and old-style service. Lamb's Club / room service is actually edible (if not great) food in an area where the late night options are mediocre at best.

Probably what the Le Meridien would be if the legacy of the Parker didn't exist, so doesn't really make sense when priced in line with the St. Regis, and probably wouldn't stay as a leisure traveler, but when other stuff is sold out or at rack definitely worth a look for an overnight.

Note they aren't really familiar with SPG yet (not asked about amenity, no water in rooms, etc.), think it used be be LHTW.

title: Nice hotel, but seriously overpriced.
text: This was a nice, modern hotel. The room was clean, but the bed was a Murphy bed. Hardly what I call "luxury". The service was excellent. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially the doorman, Ali. Priceline rated this hotel as 4 out of 5 stars, so it was priced as such. Not worth the price. We've stayed at much nicer places in the same area for less. If value is not an issue, I would recommend his hotel.

title: Enjoyable stay at a cozy, thoughtfully appointed hotel.
text: Greeted warmly at check in. Upgraded through AmEx FHR. Very happy with room size and amenities. Great breakfast at Lambs Club. Nice, spacious bar on 2nd level with very attentive staff. I think this is probably a perfect location for folks that want to be in the "middle of the action." Steps away from Times Square and in the Theatre District. Can get a little tricky to catch a cab or private car around show times. Definitely a great stay and positive experience. Cheers!

title: Det bästa hittills i NYC
text: Har varit många gånger i NYC men nu verkligen hittat ett i alla avseenden riktigt bra hotell - The Chatwal på 130 W 44th. Modernt, rent och lyxigt med japansk kvalitet på badrum. Tveklöst långt bättre än det stora, kända och dyra hotellen med halvbra rum och amerikanska badrum. Personalen toppen. This is the Place!!

title: Superbe Hotel près de Times Square
text:
Très bien situé , sur la 6 eme avenue et la 44eme
Et chambre très au calme, malgré la proximité de Times Square.
Wifi gratuite et très bon réseau dans tout l'hôtel et toutes les chambres
Les chambres sont très bien aménagées,  grand confort, la déco tourne autour du thème de la valise et du coffre, valable aussi pour les armoires et garde robe....
la literie est très agréable, la salle de bain bien équipée, serviette spéciale pour se démaquiller, crème "Elizabeth Arden"  de nuit déposée chaque soir....savon gel douche de grande qualité et le top du top, ce sont les tapis de bain "Habidecor" qui rendent cette salle de bain encore plus confortable

title: You'll be treated like royalty
text:
I honestly can not think of anything negative about this beautiful, full service, they-thought-of-everything hotel.  The service is impeccable. The concierge is there to please you with suggestions for things to do and places to go (and I realize that's not very difficult in NYC).
