The butler service is excellent - they are always there to help. The accommodations are spectacular - very clean, incredibly comfortable, and decorated to perfection. The shower is probably the most amazing rain shower I've been in.  While the property is in Times Square, once you enter the property you are in a different world of luxury and quiet. The Lambs Club is an excellent restaurant and bar. The breakfast was exquisite. Dinner was great, too, but there's a lot of competition out there so I've only gone once. 
I truly can't think of anything bad about this hotel at all - well, except maybe that the price is quite high, so you are paying for the incredible service. If you can afford it, it's a gem.

title: Boutique Hotel with a Luxury Feel
text:
My Mom and I stayed here in April 2014 and it exceeded our expectations! We were upgraded from a Grand Deluxe Room to a suite, which was fantastic. The rooms have been recently renovated with a modern design. The bathrooms were clean and there was great attention to detail (including the heated toilet seat!); the beds were comfortable with soft pillows and comforters; and the hotel was quiet despite being close to Times Square.
We were treated to a complimentary cocktail in the bar, which was fabulous. The fresh ginger carrot juice for breakfast was not to be missed and we also had an excellent dinner before the theater in their restaurant. Overall a wonderful experience. It was nice to step off the busy street of The City into a quiet, cozy hotel.

title: NYC Treasure
text: 2nd stay at the Chatwal. Can't beat the location for an ultra special dinner/movie/hotel experience. The service staff is fantastic, the rooms are beautiful (best toilets on the planet), and the fact that you're 200 feet from the heart of Times Square and the Theater District is fantastic.

title: Great tranquil Hotel in the middle of busy Times Square
text:
Me and my wife wanted a quick trip to New York, to catch a good show, enjoy of some good restaurants and just have some fun. I manage Forest Travel Agency, a Luxury Travel Agency based in Miami, so you can assume I have traveled extensively and stayed at some of the world's best hotels, and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to The Chatwal NYC. The hotel has a very cozy Art Deco loby welcoming guests as well as people dining at the very traditional Lambs Club restaurant. The rooms are of good size, and the highlights for me are bathroom, very ample, and modern, with a large bathroom with modern (vidette inclusive) toilet, his and hers sink with a hidden tv in the mirror, and an amazing rain shower. I think its also important to mention the fact that you hear absolutely no noise, and the blackouts provide absolute darkness so you have a very good night sleep, which if you have been to NYC you know its one of the issues at night when you are trying to sleep and all you hear are taxi horns or ambulance sirens, and just a lot of noise.
the only think you must be aware of, is that it is not the hotel you would choose if you want a view of the city... it is not a high-rise building. but is the hotel you choose if you want to be in the middle of the NYC action, and just be pampered and rest after a busy day out.

title: great location and bathroom
text:
I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my mum in November 2014. It was our first trip to NYC and I used trip advisor to help me choose a hotel, so I am now sharing my experience.

We arrived at around 3am and were taken straight to our room. All of our expectations were met in terms of service.

The Chatwal is a great hotel. The room is very comfortable and the location is great. The road the hotel is on was closed for works so the room was fairly quiet despite it's central location.

The bathroom is absolutely stand out in this hotel. The toilets are heated and there is a television in the mirror! It was so comfortable, we almost spent more time in the bathroom than the actual room! Great design, amazing shower and good size bathroom.

The room was good too. I didn't like the headboard design for the bed, I found that once the main lights were off, there were still a lot of bright lights near my head. I did find it a little disturbing when trying to sleep. The room was a bit dusty too, especially near the headboard area of the bed. It looks like one of those beds that folds away into the wall. I had to pull a plug for the light out to charge my phone as I could not find a socket anywhere in the room.

Concierge was very helpful. We had a lot of questions and he was really careful to recommend us suitable places. He took his time and spoke to us at length about NYC which we really enjoyed. Great service.

I would stay in this hotel again just for the bathroom. Service was 5 star too.

In summary - 

PROS: location, staff and service, bathroom (amazing!)
CONS: room felt a bit dusty, was very difficult to find an electrical socket

title: A Jewel
text: I decided to try The Chatwal for a change of pace in NYC.  What a great decision.   I booked one of the suites and it was over the top spectacular.   The staff is attentive but not too attentive and the atmosphere is warm and hospitable.   Very sophisticated vibe.   Will definitely be back.   Hard to catch a taxi out front especially during rush hour but that's not the hotel's fault.

title: Classic New York with amazing service
text: A last minute staycation brought us to the 1 bedroom suite with the most expansive terrace in NYC. Although you are only one block from Times Horror Square , walking into the Chatwal is like walking into on Oasis. The rooms are very quiet despite being on 44th Street,  The 24 hour butler was a real treat as were the amazing bathroom products and linens.   the Chatwal may not be an every day luxury for me but oh I could it would

title: Looking for a small, intimate boutique hotel in Times Square - then this is it
text:
This small boutique hotel, part of SPG's Luxury Collection was just what the Dr. ordered. On 44th, between 6th & Broadway, right around the corner from Times Square. From the front Desk staff, to Brad, the Concierge, they could not have been more accommodating, or pleasant. When I called Brad, the Concierge several days before our arrival to change reservations for Juni (an amazing restaurant), he was able to get them for the day & time we wanted. Also, when we left our valuables locked in the safe when we left NYC, he got them to us the next day - safe & sound.

The only negative (not really - just "different") was when we were meeting friends in the bar on the second floor, and the hostess asked us if we had reservations? I've never been asked that in a bar before. No big deal though!

The rooms are extremely clean & comfortable. They even iron the sheets & comforters. 

Great hotel in the middle of NYC.

title: Loved the front desk staff
text: I screwed up and made my pre-paid reservation for the wrong week. Saed, at the front desk, called to alert me and helped me through the process of getting a full refund and rebooking for the correct time. They exceeded my expectations.

title: une expérience unique et inoubliable
text: Je n'arrive pas à exprimer la beauté et le raffinement de cet hôtel. Tout est fait pour qu'on se sente vraiment à l'aise et qu'on vraiment comme un prince dans un palais. Quand on arrive, on est très bien accueillis et dès qu'on prend possession de la chambre, un majordome d'une extrême gentillesse vous donne la bienvenue. La chambre est extraordinaire et chaque petit détail est soigné. Le lit était d'un grand confort avec des draps de coton égyptien très doux. Sans parler de la salle de bain, avec un écran télé au milieu du miroir. Tout est étudié pour qu'on se sente bien. Tout le monde à partir de la réception jusqu'au jeune homme à l'entrée a été d'une extrême amabilité et très attentionné. De plus, il est placé à côté de Time Square, mais on n'est pas du tout gêné par le bruit car les chambres sont bien isolées.

title: Sublime
text: An exceptional experience in kind and generous service. I was impressed at every turn from the sumptuous Art Deco decor to the concierge handling car service from the airport. The room was perfect. Highly recommended and I will certainly return!

title: Good quality hotel let down by indifferent staff
text: Generally very good but let down by indifferent staff and a lack of attention to detail.  We reported a noise emanating from what we thought was a faulty electrical socket.  This kept occurring every few minutes during our first night.  We were promised that an engineer would be sent up to check on the fault.  Arriving back at about 10:30 on our second evening we immediately noticed that the problem had not been rectified.  We were told that an engineer could not spot any issue.  We arranged for the duty manager to attend the room.  Within 5 minutes he heard the problem and called the duty engineer.  He diagnosed the fault to a problem with the bedside clock and removed it.  The noise was exceedingly irritating and had kept us awake during our first night.  Despite this the hotel offered no reduction in the room rate.  They failed to address the problem when it was first reported and when i reported it again on the second evening they simply said our engineer could not identify an issue.  Interesting that the duty manager heard the problem within 5 minutes of of attending the room!!  During the afternoon on our final day a member of staff simply unlocked the door without even knocking.  So much for privacy.  Finally there was an error on our bill.  We were charged for a private bar usage despite the fact we had not used the bar.  Although the charge has now been refunded there was no apology offered for the incorrect charge.  There appeared to be no concierge on either of the two weekend days and when summoned by the reception staff, they never appeared.  We ended up giving up waiting.  At $ 610 per night i think one can expect better service than this.

title: CHIC and high quality
text: I think the rooms at this hotel are amongst the best in the city in terms of quality and design.  I also want to commend the outstanding housekeeping staff.  They do a tremendous job keeping the hotel fresh.  At the end of the day, the room is the most important aspect of a hotel and these rooms really are special.  Awesome television.  Great bedding.  Spacious bath.  High tech toilet.  And truly inspired design elements.  These are the best closets in the industry.  I also dined at the hotel five times and found the quality of the food excellent (even if the service wasn't always on point).  And speaking of, I did have two different 'trainees' at the front desk during my visit and I felt that I was a bit of a 'guinea pig' so that they could learn on the job.  I don't like a fine hotel with a high rate should be subjecting their guests to this learning curve.  Nonetheless, once I was past the front desk, I was VERY happy to be at this hotel.  I would love to return - would not hesitate to select it again.  Noted that it is currently ranked #39 in New York City and in my estimation it is a Top 20.  The location is outstanding.  Rooms that face 44th Street will have garbage truck noise in the middle of the night.  Welcome to New York.

title: The Best of New York!
text:
Beautiful rooms, perfectly appointed with every attention to detail including memorable heated Japanese toilets. Ideal cental location. A staff that never says "no".
Lambs Club Restaurant the perfect place for business breakfasts and lunches.
A new standard of excellence for New York City.

title: Great Hotel
text:
We spent the weekend in NYC with some friends who were visiting from Canada. Their go to place in NYC is the Four Seasons, but we decided to save a little cash and try The Chatwal.  We had a GREAT experience.  The staff was friendly, the room was very spacious for NYC.  We recently stayed at the W NY in August in a suite and that room was smaller than our Grand Deluxe King at here.  Loved the style of the room and it was SUPER QUIET.  Especially considering Times Square is literally 1/2 a block from the hotel.  The beds are comfortable, not the most comfortable, but we enjoyed good nites sleep.  Turn down service was great.  We used the Butler to steam our shirts both nites before we went out to dinner.  Not sure what other services he does, but that is all we used him for.  Turn down service was excellent and they did it for us even after we left to go to dinner at 8:00!!!!  Also, the room is totally wired, so you can turn on and off lights, open and close the draps, etc. from a control by the bed.  

The hotel location is actually pretty good.  While in Times Square, you are halfway between mid-town and downtown and close to the subway.  We walked a lot while we were there and were able to get down to 31st and up to 57th st from the hotel with no problem.  Plus, while this is Times Square, it really isnt. . .it was a fairly quiet street.   If you are seeing Hedwig and the Angry Inch, the theater is across the street at the other end of the block.

There were two small drawbacks:  1. There was a slight Mildew smell in the bathroom when we first arrived that seemed to permeate and fill the whole room as we stayed.  We checked in on Friday and by Sunday morning, it was the first thing I smelt when I woke up. Not really 5 star.

2.  We had booked a Grand Deluxe King, I am an SPG Gold and I asked about an upgrade. The gentleman at the front desk tried to convince me they had upgraded me.  I had to show him my SPG app on my iPhone which had my reservation and room type.  They apologized and promised that the next time I stay they will ensure an upgrade.  We will go back and stay here so lets see how that goes.

We will stay here again soon!

title: Excelente servicio y mucha comodidad.
text: Muy buena experiencia la estancia de este hotel, el buen servicio destaca gracias al personal empeñado en ayudar.  Me encantó que la mayoría del personal habla español.  Nos ayudaron con buena disposición en todas nuestras necesidades desde conseguir de inmediato un taxi hasta en recomendarnos buenos lugares para escuchar jazz y reservarnos.  Felicidades a todo el personal del hotel.

title: Excellent luxury hotel, central location
text:
Fantastic hotel, very luxurious room and bathroom with all facilities.  Large head shower, jacuzzi bath etc.  Personally I didn't like the heated toielt seat, otherwise no complaints.  The bar on ground floor was a bit like a hall area. Art deco style but a bit OTT.  Bar upstairs was much nicer when open.  Cocktails not the best, but my husband does make his own so is fussy!.  The restaurant food was very nice indeed.  Nice atmosphere, with an old fashioned feel.  However, the waiters were bit abrupt and left you feeling you should not need to ask any questions.  Walked away while we were talking!
Apart from the above, we had a fantastic time here and would definately recomend it.  Door men were very helpful and gave us umberellas on a couple of occasions.

title: Long Weekend at the Chatwal
text:
We choose the Chatwal for a romantic weekend away in Sept 14. We took our time choosing the hotel as we wanted a special location for our engagement. The Hotel is a Boutique style hotel so its small and intimate. The building has a classically designed exterior which envelops an uber stylish and lavish interior with Art Deco signatures perfectly aligned with modern design features. The designers have literally left no detail untouched and every aspect of the Hotel has been thoughtfully woven together to present a truly magnificent interior. If you like old world comfort or sparse minimalism this might not be for you? But this 1920/30's enclave with a modern twist is something to behold. Service was excellent, cocktail bars are decadent and wilfully manned by smart mixologists. The room we had (909) was large for NYC and every detail of the design of the building continues into the rooms in perfect harmony.

We had a memorable stay and I would like to return again. I honestly have nothing negative to say about my time at the Chatwal.

title: Outstanding Hotel!
text: I just returned from a weekend stay at the Chatwal, and my experience was beyond positive.  The hotel itself is beautiful and richly decorated in Art Deco decor.  The service was fantastic from the front desk staff to room service and housekeeping.  I would recommend that you request a room not on the street side, due to some noise at night, but not any fault of the hotel.  The bed was very, very comfortable, and the room and bathroom were pure luxury in an old world style.  I would highly recommend the Chatwal,  and the location is convenient as well.

title: 2nd review of Chatwal--happier experience
text: After my'average' review last year panning the Chatwal as having pretensions of St. Regis-level luxury, the manager invited me to stay again and promised a better experience.  And, yes, the 2nd time around was much improved.  This time my upgraded room really WAS an upgraded room.  Overall there is no doubt the Chatwal is a very good hotel.  Although small, the rooms are luxurious and super quiet.  Great food.  Service was wonderful.   I still think it's too pricey, although most hotels in NYC are.  The location is great for business/tourists, although be aware that taxis can be a problem during rush hour, and you may want to line up Uber.  It's easier to catch a cab if you walk to one of the Avenues.   Not all rooms have bathtubs--make sure to ask if it's important to you

title: Perfect for us!
text:
Perfect because we were looking for a room with balcony ! We Found it ! Not easy to find in New York spécialy that we  needed to be close to Time square were my son perform . The staff very professional and help full .
We plan to return again for x mas.
I Will recomend room 709

title: Elegant Hotel!
text: I've stayed at this hotel a few times for business and each time is an excellent experience.  The rooms are surprisingly luxurious and quiet.  The staff is very professional and Brandon is especially personable.

title: Perfection!
text: This is our fourth stay at The Chatwal, and I wouldn't stay any other place in NYC.  When you walk through the door, you're greeted with the friendliest staff who not only recognize you every time you come through the door but remember your name, and that's a great feeling when you're in such a big city. The rooms aren't huge but are impeccably decorated and couldn't be cleaner or quieter, and the bathroom is probably the best I've ever been in. The location couldn't be better ... a half a block from Times Square on a surprisingly quiet street. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough!

title: Chatwal? Fuhgeddaboudit!
text:
We concur with the other extremely negative recent review of the ChatWal, or as we now call it, the ChatHole. Except we paid $900 per night for absolutely no service. We made our reservations 4 weeks ahead, and emailed & called the concierge to get us theater tickets, since they said, they would do anything to make our stay a good one. Well, no replies from the concierge. When we got to the hotel, we realized the concierge was rarely on-site. So we never got any help from their desk. When we called the front desk, no one answered, and no one responded to vmails.

The fitness center was a complete joke - one bike, 2 treadmills. And the restaurant - the food was ok, but service was awful. We asked to get done in time for the show, and they assured us this would be so. Then we had to wave them down to ask for the bill, and they still hadn't brought dessert @ 7:45. 

The room was nicely furnished with a comfy mattress, but the air conditioning kept blowing right on us while sleeping, wifi was awful. we're never going back!

title: Stunning!
text: What a great stay we had! 5 nights of sheer luxury. The rooms are smaller, but equipped perfectly. The bathrooms, and especially the shower are fantastic and the amenities are perfect. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back!

title: Rolls-Royce RATES, Ford Pinto SERVICE & ACCOMMODATIONS!
text: I've rated this hotel only one star, mainly because it touts itself so highly and our resulting stay was so dismal.  Mind you, if we had received the accommodations and service that we received at The Chatwal, at a Holiday Inn, for maybe ONE FIFTH the price, we would have been fine with it.  The Chatwal would have you believe that you will be treated to the "Ultimate in Luxury," but that is so far off the mark, it isn't even funny.  Our room had a TV and a DVD player.  The only problem was that the DVD player is in the closet disconnected.  We had to have first the bellman and then the "engineer" come to hook it up and it still didn't work.  To make matters worse, the only place for the DVD player to sit was on our ottoman, with wires strung all over the place.  The air conditioning register was aimed squarely at my head when I lie in bed and there was NO WAY to adjust it differently.  I had to climb up and wedge a pillow up there to keep the cold blast of air off of my head.  The bathroom looked amazing, until anyone used the sink or the shower and then the room looked like a disaster with all the chrome and polished stainless steel.  The shower had no dam at the door, so a significant amount of water flowed out into the bathroom.  The shower was big enough to hold a party in, but there was no place where one could rest their foot while washing their feet or, in my wife's case, shave her legs.  In addition, there was SUBSTANTIAL and unsightly MOLD and MILDEW growing in the shower.  I complained the first day about it, but it was NEVER cleaned up during our stay.  The Chatwal advertises that guests will receive the services of a "Personal Butler," but in the five days we were there, we NEVER saw or heard from anyone saying that they were our "butler."  The closets come with trouser hangers, but the closet is designed in such a way, that you cannot hang trousers in there, without them hitting the floor and I'm not that tall.  Upon our arrival, the orchid in our room was wilted and dead.  On the third day of our visit, a woman came to our door and replaced the orchid.  Why wasn't that done BEFORE we arrived?  The exterior door to the hotel is cast bronze and must weigh over 500 pounds.  A good portion of the time, it is NOT manned by a doorman.  Just try getting that door open while carrying a bunch of packages or bags.  It was hard for me and just about impossible for my wife to open with both hands free.  One day when we exited the hotel and a doorman was present, we asked for directions to the Hells Kitchen neighborhood.  He said he had "no idea" where it was at.  As it turns out, the world famous neighborhood is THREE FRIGGING BLOCKS from the hotel.  Shouldn't a doorman at an "Ultra Luxury" hotel know something like that?  One day we rode the hotel elevator with another couple who were raving about the box of cookies that were waiting for them when they checked in.  Their room was smaller than ours, they were staying only two nights and had not booked any special package, and we are Starwood Preferred Guests, but we never got a box of cookies.  The Lambs Club is an absolutely gorgeous restaurant.  Unfortunately, that's where it ends.  We had horrible service, mediocre food and the chairs were some of "THE" most uncomfortable I have ever sat in.  I actually wrote all of this in a letter and included PHOTOS, to the Starwood Hotels C.E.O., Fritz Van Paasschen, but I never received ANY satisfaction from his office or from the flunky he turned the matter over to.  My wife and I have stayed at five star hotels all over the world.  We know "Ultimate Luxury," and I'm telling you, that The Chatwal is all flash and absolutely NO SUBSTANCE.  On top of that, they just don't give a damn.  If you are going to NYC, I highly recommend one of the following "luxury" hotels: The Four Seasons, The Pierre, The Ritz- Carlton Central Park or the Plaza Athenee.  You REALLY don't want to spend the big bucks to stay at The Chatwal.  You'll pay a Rolls-Royce price and get only Ford Pinto service and accommodations.  The Chatwal is a JOKE!

title: Subjectively not for us
text:
My husband and I travel to NYC once a year without our daughters. We always stay in a different luxury hotel (setai now langham last year - awesome). We chose the chatwal for sept 19 3 night weekend. Recent Starwood luxury collection stay was june family trip to Phoenician's canyon suites in Arizona (heavenly). The chatwal is for those who want to stay in a small (76 rooms) luxury boutique hotel AND want to be in Times Square. For us, neither worked. We had an executive studio which was 2 queen rooms joined by a small hall way. Overall 600 sq feet. One had a couch and chair while the other was the bedroom (queen bed). Each room was claustrophobic by our standards and very dark. We were on the 6th floor located on the east side of building. It was very quiet as opposed to being in the front though which was likely somewhat brighter. A larger hotel has very high floors which can give you more light if not a view! Each room had a bathroom which was unnecessary but nice to have. The heated toilet seat with electronic bidet was a novelty but not one I'd pay for. Asprey toiletries were very nice. The maid was still in our room twice when we returned by 2 pm after leaving for the day at 9 am. Not ideal but it happens. We never heard a peep from a personal butler. But we never asked For anything. 

A sole reason for us to not stay here again was the bed. Believe the reviews - it is a HARD short  mattress. Low profile box spring too so very close the floor. Some people like that. I assume the majority do not just like no one wants a super soft mattress. We have a westin heavenly bed at home. We couldn't wait to sleep on it again unlike so many vacations where you want to take the mattress with you. 

Staff were friendly albeit slightly standoffish unless approached. The entrance door is huge and very heavy; there is no one there to open it 50% of the time. This was very odd as an older or disabled person would never get in! We missed the lamb's club as it was closed Sunday after brunch when we wanted a drink. We met a friend in the lobby instead. $80 for 3 cocktails is pricey when you don't get any atmosphere! And there was so much ice in the drinks there were 4 sips with a straw then done! 

Times Square is always very busy and there is construction on 7th and 44th. Also on 44th in front of hotel. Disaster for walking. You can stay at numerous luxury hotels within a few blocks so for us, no need to be literally on top of the craziness. 

We will try luxury collection again, but will not choose the chatwal. For others, it will be just perfect.

title: Simply Superb!
text:
Quite simply one of the best hotels I have stayed at anywhere. The Art Deco- themed surroundings and excellent location (Time Square / theatres ) are surpassed only by the personal service afforded especially by
Mr Andeliz and his concierge team. I make an unqualified recommendation
of them and the hotel.

title: A++ LOCATION, ROOM AND SERVICE
text:
We LOVE the Chatwal.  Firstly, its location is unbeatable if you are visiting New York to see Broadway shows, or if you need to be near Times Square for any other reason.  It was such a nice feeling to walk a half a block off the insanity of Times Square and enter a relaxed, luxurious oasis.

The rooms are beautifully and tastefully decorated.  The entire hotel has the feel of a 1920's luxury art deco cruise ship or transcontinental train from a bygone era. This decor is artistically on display in the hotel restaurant, the Lamb's Club.  In fact, on a previous trip to the city, we stayed at a different hotel and ate at the Lamb's Club Sunday jazz brunch.  I loved the ambiance of the hotel so much we decided to stay here on our next trip to New York, which we did this past June.

Although the hotel is beautiful, luxurious, comfortable, and well-located, I think the best thing about it is the A+++ service, which extends from the management down to the housekeepers.  Everyone we encountered was top notch.  Some specific things that I can mention, I have a lumbar disc herniation in my back and I need a really hard mattress.  I did not think to call ahead and request it, but I often need panels of hard wood placed under the mattress of the bed I sleep in.  On little notice, the hotel tracked down wood panels from another hotel and had them placed under my mattress.

I was extremely impressed that the housekeeping staff somehow magically knew exactly when we left our room and had it cleaned from top to bottom even though our daily schedule varied .... sometimes we were out in the morning but in the room in the afternoon, and sometimes we did not leave the room until the afternoon.  nobody knocked on the door or bothered us to clean the room at a specific time to fit their schedule .... everything happened according to OUR schedule, without us even having to say a word or lift a finger. This hotel truly made is feel carefree and I imagine there was a lot of work behind the scenes to make sure our experience was as pleasant as possible.  

We enjoyed our experience so much, we have actually made reservations to return later this year, and next year in 2015 as well.  Thank you very much to everyone at the Chatwal

title: Just the Best
text: Had high expectations. All exceeded. Have been to NYC many many times.. This was best trip ever and Chatwal a big reason.  Wonderful in every way- people, service, atmosphere, overall experience.  Will return again and again. Enjoyed ourselves so much :)

title: Excellence
text:
We have just returned from a wonderful visit in NYC,  The Chatwal is a wonderful hotel.  Service was excellent,  Everyone was so polite, kind and helpful.  The Lamb's Club and Bar is a welcoming end to an evening.  This hotel is quite and located about a block or two off Time's Square and close to all the shows.  Elegant, outstanding service, and wonderful staff.  Loved every minute of our time there.  Art deco, beautiful bath and shower, closets and beds are great.
We will stay here every time we return to this wonderful city.

title: Lovely oasis in NYC!
text: We love staying at the Chatwal when in NYC specifically to see shows.  The location is great if you want to be near Times Square.  Easy walk anywhere.  It is an elegant and cozy hotel and the service is outstanding!  Titus worked with me ahead of time to get the right room configuration for our four rooms for all my family members who had different preferences.  He is very professional and accommodating, taking care of whatever we needed before and during our stay.  I agree with other reviewers that this is like staying in a lovely left-bank Parisian hotel...without the attitude!  Oh, and definitely dine in the Hotel's restaurant - The Lamb's Club.  It is fabulous!  But a great choice for a fine special meal before or after a show.

title: The last word
text:
Open your mind and imagine Starwood, Westin and that rattling list of properties you would never stay at have nothing to do with this property.  The Chatwal Hotel reminds of a few perfect small hotels I love in Paris like The Montaigne.

Having made the rounds this summer to no less than 17 hotels in Manhattan in the quest for the right one, The Chatwal Hotel now holds the title as reigning champion, for now at least. My #2 is the Greenwich Hotel followed by.. hold it, hold it..... The Andaz 5th Avenue (by Hyatt, believe it or not. Forget everything you dislike about Hyatt and go).

WHAT I LOVED:  

- Sort of art deco/40's/30's style but not kitschy in an historic building

- Bespoke everything.  They invested serious coin in this place.  Serious, like SPG had something to prove.

- The Lamb's Club restaurant and mezzanine bar - smoldering style in red, black and white.  Alive, little jazz singer thing going sometimes.  

-My room was 206, Perfection and I don't toss that around because everyone knows what a pain I am about hotels. Trust me on this I am not going into detail.  OK, a little.  The closet and cabinetry are fashioned after handcrafted luggage, similar to a LV steamer trunk as a concept.  So original, solid. Sets the place apart from the rest.

 - Washroom par excellence.  Toto, massive shower.

- I had the outdoor patio. Looks nice but the sound of the aircon equipment and faux plants make it well, tacky. The only thing I found out of place so don't pay extra for the terrace, I'm my opinion.

- Staff - super attentive without being obsequies.  Cool and reserved in NYC way but friendly.

- Breakast pastries that could put La Duree out of business.

Merci Le Chatwal, je t'aime.  But we are a fickle bunch so please keep it interesting...  ;-)

title: Lovely hotel, centrally located, modern art deco decor
text:
Spent 5 nights here in late August for our first trip to NYC. The hotel is centrally located just off of Times Square but avoids the huge crowds which dominate the tourist area.  You are within a 30 minute walk of all of the main tourist attractions, and could walk to the High Line in approx. 40 mins.

Staff were friendly and helpful and the food is excellent.  

We stayed in a Junior Suite which was a good sized room in a city where small rooms seem to be the norm.

title: The essence of New York
text:
Spent a week's holiday with my girlfriend at this place and it was non stop satisfaction.

The decoration is so good we are thinking of emulating it for when we get our own place, the service was fantastic from start to finish (with the butler ironing the odd shirt for me a wonderful touch!), even on one night when the local works caused water issues they supplied us with us much bottled water as we could need.

If you want to truly experience New York and come home every night to a place that fits in perfectly with the city, couldn't recommend a better spot.

The only thing that disappointed me was that we paid extra to have a room with a terrace and a bath, however when I experienced the terrace the noise of the nearby ventilation units was like a jet engine right next to the terrace, I would have preferred street noise to this (room 702 I think it was)

title: Very nice hotel, great location and nice people working
text:
We stayed between 4 - 8 september 2014. 
We arrived very late due to cancelled flight. The greeting was nice, Everything was set as its supposed to and a "walk-through" in the room with Steven from the hotel to get us settled. The location of the hotel couldnt be better, very Close to times Square and Walking distance to a lot of good restaurants and sightseeing (Lambs club restaurant is actually in the hotel so that couldnt be closer). The staff is very kind and eager to help. Everything from smaller requests to late check out. We stayed in a junior suit which had a large and comfortable bathroom with big shower (rain-shower) TV in the mirror (cool) and a toilet with "special features" (cleaning you for ex.;). The room itself has a special design to it with lots of grey earthy colours and formed almost like a hallway that at first didnt do me anything but when you sit in the other end of the room you get the feeling. I dont agree with a Review i read regarding bad beds cause i thought they were nice. Housekeeping came twice a day, once for cleaning and one more time to prepare the bed for sleeping and changing waterbottles etc. Thanks housekeeping, very satisfied. 
Two requests were not fulfilled.. first we asked for a iphone charger and an adapter cause we couldnt find it in the room. It never came but we found the adapter later that day in one of the drawers. Second request was to fill up the champagne bucket with ice, top score if that had been done. If there was a scale from 1 to 10 Chatwal would receive a 9 but now its 1-5 and its not fair to hand out a 4 so 5 it is. Hope to visit/see u soon again

title: Wonderful hotel and Amazing Location
text: My wife and I stayed at this hotel this past weekend and had a wonderful experience. This hotel is truly five-star. It is within the theater district and incredibly convenient for Midtown Manhattan. We were greeted by virtually every staff person we met and the service was top notch. Titus, the front desk manager, was especially helpful and served us well. We look forward to staying in this hotel again in the future.

title: Impressive Hotel - Exceeded All Expectations
text: We go to NYC 1-2x/year and like to stay near Times Square.  This was our first booking at The Chatwal.  The hotel is beautiful with modern room decor, but what makes it special is the level of service provided by everyone on staff, especially Titus at the front desk and Steven at the door.  They were professional, friendly, engaging in conversation, and interested in how they could make our stay exceptional.  Although the price is more expensive than many others in the area and the service at other hotels is good, this trip has me convinced that all future stays should be at The Chatwal.  Very, very impressive.  - Brian and Jilanne

title: Interesting and hip but not as lavish or classy as I had expected!
text: Very unique property and with a rather usual layout - quite boutique. The rooms were a bit more theatrical than comfortable in tone - particularly the all steel and glass bathroom. Still the service was great and the staff were attentive. Would suit the Broadway/Hollywood crowd and it certainly was not cheap!

title: First Class Oasis Within A Block of Times Square
text: We weren't sure about The Chatwal before our arrival since it was opposite a Broadway Theatre between 6th & 7th Avenue.  The minute we walked inside, however, we realized it was an oasis with superb staff and stellar service.  From the Director of Butler Services, Brandon Short, to the baggage attendant Johan and the front desk agent Titius, there was no weak link.  The rooms were the one word I pine for after the buzz on the street - quiet.  The workout facilities and spa in the lower level were just right.  My wife and I had only one night in Manhattan and she was equally pleased.  If you are looking for a small, quaint hotel in the middle of a big loud city, look no further than The Chatwal.

title: Nicest staff in town
text: There is no better staff at any hotel in NYC, period. Matching charm, graciousness and warmth with superior lodging, I highly recommend the Chatwal for either business or family travel in Midtown. I have no idea why I waited a few years and over 25 visits to post this!

title: Praticamente e' come casa mia extralusso una favola
text: Hotel extralusso con camere  bellissime e ristorante di livello altissimo, personale ultracordiale e competente letti meravigliosi per un sonno eccellente, coccolati in tutto e per tutto, location fantastica praticamente a times square ma in posizione silenziosissima. Il costo alto ma a questi livelli e' inevitabile spendere, lo consiglio nettamente

title: Уютный и технологичный
text: Современный бутик отель.  Просторные номера.  Уборка номеров - безукоризненно. Завтраки вкусные в очень приятной обстановке.  Всякие технологичные "штучки" - начиная от интегрированного в зеркало ванной комнаты телевизора и до - пардон - крышки унитаза с десятком различных функций. Расположение отличное : 300 м до Пятой авеню, 150 м до Таймс Сквер, 15 минут до Центрального парка и около 10 минут до Музея Современного Искусства. Несомненно, рекмендую!

title: Mémorable!
text:
Per chi piace il lusso e vuole spendere per regalarsi un soggiorno al top del confort siete nel posto giusto!
Hotel pulitissimo con servizio e personale impeccabile una pecca, situato in un immobile molto basso rispetto a i grattaceli che lo circondano,la posizione è perfetta per visitare i luoghi d'interesse e vicinissimo alla metro,io è mia moglie abbiamo soggiornato 5 notti per visitare tutta New York e ci è dispiaciuto un po' non approfittare di questo bellissimo hotel visto che rientravamo sempre tardi (a proposito la piscina è davvero piccola, ma molto funzionale devo dire)
Ricapitolando,troppo caro per soggiorni visita medio lunghi perché non si ha più tempo per approfittare pienamente dell'hotel, ma perfetto per weekend o vacanze a l'insegna della tranquillità!!!

title: Nice Hotel; Too Close to Times Square
text:
The Chatwal is a very nice, boutique hotel very (too!) near Times Square.  The immediate area lack common NYC services such as a decent corner deli for coffee and a bagel.  

The staff is very courteous and efficient. 

My room came with "Continental" breakfast.  A side of scrambled eggs was more than $15 extra.  Not a value.

Room cleanliness and service was quite nice.  Again, a bag of potato chips from the minibar was $7.

The pool is small but provides exercise by swimming again a "current".  

The only true negative was the persistent smell of sewer in the bathroom.

title: Class & luxury in midtown
text:
We wanted to stay at Chatwal for a while and finally had the opportunity and an occasion to do so.
Well it was everything and more we hoped for.. The hotel is beautifully decorated with old world charm , but the rooms are very modern with high tech bathrooms & very comfortable beds..
The staff couldn't have been nicer , from the moment we stepped in to the hotel till we left they were absolutely wonderful.. The restaurant in the hotel - famous Lamb club was wonderful , we had Sunday brunch there and it was delicious with a live band to entertain us - real class!!
Highly recommend it.. Can't wait to return...

title: Nice Stay!
text:
My wife and me we stayed at the Chatwal for 9 nights (28jul-6Aug). We arrived at the hotel at around 11am but since the check in time was 4pm and no room was available at the time we left our luggage at the hotel and the concierge offered to message us upon readying our room which was around 3pm.

Pros: The Room is really modern in design and the details are very well thought of. The entire room's controls i.e. lights, blinds, drapes, temperature etc. all can be accessed via the room telephone system. The Room has a nice mini bar and for backgammon fans they have the board game in the room. The in room safe is equipped with a nice jewellery box to use and they also provide a universal plug converter at $35 cost in the drawer.The bathroom is also really amazing with electronic WC in place and a glass TV in the back wall makes it look very modern. The towels and napkins are well folded in a big vanity suitcase under the sink which makes it look very luxurious. 
The hotel is very located, as soon as you get out on your left you have times square and a 3-5 mins walk you are on 5th Ave.
The staff at the hotel was very helpful they offered us all the help we needed with directions, places to go and bus travel schedules. Every night they would provide weather forecast to plan the next day. Infact one of the days while leaving the hotel, doorman offered us a hotel umbrella suggesting it would rain (and it did!).
The hotel also provides a free wifi service which is brilliant.

Cons: The Rooms are very small. We had 5 suitcases with us and once they were all in the room, the room felt even smaller. The room we were given had a view of the backside of another building and the windows did not open (Felt like a brick wall in the face). One of the nights after a point for some reason our room felt really warm and claustrophobic even though the AC was running at full capacity, we asked the housekeeping to check but they said theres nothing that can be done about the cooling and we had to request a table fan in the room, which was a relief!

FYI: I noticed the property is run by some company called the Adams group.

Overall we had a pleasant stay and the location was simply amazing.

title: 50th Birthday Celebration
text:
WOW!
We planned a 50th Birthday celebration for my sister. We chose The Chatwal...from the welcome at the reception desk (Titus and Howard!) to the concierge and house staff our stay was absolutely wonderful. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome . Manpreet helped make the surprise welcome for my sister exceptional. He had small welcome gifts for my sisters two children, The entire staff went out of their way to make our NYC weekend fabulous! We will be back...the terrace on the 7th floor rooms...exceptional!
The Chatwal staff...Job well done!

title: Nice central Times Square location (but the staff needs a reboot -- or just "the boot")
text:
Pros:
- right off of Times Square
- book a suite with an outdoor terrace (for a real feeling of an oasis in the concrete jungle)
- The Lamb's Club restaurant has great food and drinks

Cons:
- The hotel and the rooms feel very "dark"
- Gym was tiny, tiny, tiny
- Expensive
- The staff felt a little self-absorbed and snooty. Sort of like the hourly-wage workers at designer shops who look down their noses at their own customers and put on airs of "wanna-be aristocracy".

title: So excellent I selfishly don;t want the word to get out!  The quintessential New Yorker.
text:
When my wife and I were invited to join a friend for his 40th birthday in New York I suggested my wife find a smaller hotel as we have stayed in many big properties that tend to exacerbate the impersonal rush and crush that is NYC.  So she found The Chatwal on W44th Street from amongst the many Starwood offerings and booked us in.  From the moment we arrived we were blown away by the Art Decor splendour, the warm reception, the attentive personnel from many differnt countries AND the fabulous room.  The attention to authentic detail and furnishings of the room not only looked wonderful, but were functional as well.  When our friends came in to join us for dinner, we showed them our room (showed it off!) and one of them described it as like being inside a Louis Vuitton trunk.  The room was fabulously appointed with plenty of towels and every kind of amenity.  The air worked great as did all the electronics, and the bed was comfy.  It was also pretty quiet give the room fronted the street.  (The electric self-opening curtains were out of action but that didn't matter).
The overtly groovy bathroom was a bit of an exercise in trying too hard at the trade-off of functionality and the vanity didn't work too well as the components lost their edge after use with water droplets, etc. and bench space at a premium  And whomever spec'd the electric opening, self-heating toilet suite has gone ridiculously over the top just for the sake of it.  But that really is just being picky in my part, just needed to be said as the funky reconstituted stone would have worked just as well with traditional cabinetry.
The first night we were in (pure luck) was jazz night in the mezzanine bar.  We chose to have a few drinks there and stayed on to dine-in and the tucker was outstanding.  We learned the chef of the adjoining Lamb's Club Restaurant was a part owner of the property.  (See following restaurant review).  I ordered Chef d'bouff which was cooked to perfection and sensational.  The giant cut of meat could have fed four!.  A terrific selection of wines by the glass is available, and we had much amusement from the antics of the poseur purportedly the sommelier poncing around and splashing wines into the same just emptied glass and then getting titchy when I requested a fresh glass.
Also, I asked the concierge where a restaurant in the neighbourhood we had been to a few years back was, and he had no idea.  I also asked where there was a handy newsstand to purchase some plain wrapping paper.  In both instances he was so totally addicted to Google to find an answer, which is not what you expect in a hotel of this calibre.  Good local knowledge goes a long way.  He couldn't find the restaurant at all, but that's okay.  I did.  It was a few doors just down the same street!
We enjoyed our few days in NYC which I reckon has softened off and gentrified a lot post-9/11.  
The Chatwell was a lovely bolt hole to retreat to after our action filled days or shopping, being tourists, dining and rushing around.  It's in an awesome location, just a block & a half from Times Square, walking distance to Penn station & pretty well everything else.
As reader of my reviews will see, I am a seasoned traveller and don't do budget.  I look for comfort, experience and style and The Chatwell oozes these in spades.  So, I have held off writing this review as I am torn about getting The Chatwal get too popular as I am already looking for a reason to head back to the USA to stay there.

title: Very mixed experience - very comfortable, but it's loud and it's not that cool.
text:
Location - very convenient for touristy stuff but a long way from the "real" New York. You can easily get a subway to Soho, Greenwich etc, but just be aware that you will not be near them, nor walking distance to anything approaching a "nice" deli, coffee shop, or whatever. However Toys R Us is at the end of the road and M&Ms world is just around the corner (!)

Noise - yes it's in the middle of a city however I didn't expect a construction crew digging up the road at 4:30AM on Thursday, Friday and Saturday. I complained on the first morning but the desk staff weren't interested, only commenting that it was out of their control. No alternative room was offered nor an apology.

Bar - Poor. I have been in fantastic cocktail venues in both bars and hotels around the world, and this isn't one. Just massive incompetence. They need a few lessons on how to make drinks properly, including tasting your work before handing it over.

Restaurant - Had a superb brunch on the Sunday morning. Exceptional service, food, and elegant ambiance. Thoroughly recommended.

Rooms - we stayed in a junior suite and it was smallish (as the name would suggest), but very well appointed and exceptionally comfortable.

I would like to single out one employee, Ali, who was working the door and lobby, for exceptional service and attention to detail. He had exactly the attitude to be expected from a 5* hotel and was clearly concerned with us enjoying our stay and being made comfortable.

title: Hotel parfait malgré le quartier trop touristique
text: Je n'aime pas le quartier de Times Square à NY, trop bruyant, trop populaire, trop sale. Mais cet hotel est un havre de paix. Pas de lobby trop grand avec trop de monde, charme élégant et discret, chambres magnifiques, accueil et service raffinés. Je vous le recommande si vous choisissez ce quartier de NY. SPA superbe avec piscine toute petite ( elle parait plus grande sur la photo), mais jacuzzi dispo aussi, et bains à remous dans les chambres....

title: Oasis in Times Square
text:
This was our second stay at the Chatwal.  We decided to spend our wedding anniversary in NYC and have the ultimate culinary experience.  We stayed here last year and were treated so well we wanted to return.  I pulled out all the stops and reserved a one bedroom terrace suite -- yes, a terrace one block off of Times Square.

Our experience started with valet parking which was flawless.  We were greeted in a friendly and efficient manner and escorted to our room.  Several minutes later there was a knock at the door and our butler Manpreet introduced himself and the services he could provide for our convenience.  Kudos to him.  The suite was spectacular.  The terrace was surrounded with tall buildings and a glimpse of the sky but it is Manhattan, after all.  The decor is original and stunning,  The rooms were flawless.  The location could not be improved on.  Service was gracious and attentive.  My wife travels with medication that needs to be refrigerated and they were able to accommodate our needs. I almost ranked the Chatwal 10 out of 10, but a little upset during a departing breakfast lowers them down to a 9.9 out of 10.  Fernando at the front desk assures me that this will be addressed immediately.  I believe him.

All in all, a superb experience that enhanced our anniversary celebration.  I heartily recommend the Chatwal.  We will certainly be returning on our next overnight trip to the City.

title: Art Deco Stunner in Midtown Manhattan
text:
Stepping off bustling 44th Street—through the iron gates of the Chatwal—equates to stepping back in time to the days of a bygone era.  I am far too young to understand what the 20’s or 30’s in New York felt like but, if the Chatwal is any indication, I sincerely hope modern science advances to make time travel a reality.  Indeed, Fitzgerald himself might have chosen to install his iconic protagonist in this hotel had The Great Gatsby been written less than a century later.

The main lobby is small, private, and exquisitely appointed.  From the very first moment one steps into the space, it becomes immediately evident that the owner—Mr. Vikrum Chatwal—spared no expense when restoring this New York icon.  The walls are paneled in birds eye wood; in the corners, iridescent, floor-to-ceiling columns of light are finished with chrome hardware that only enhances the art-deco theme.  The registration desk, concierge podium, and four-seat bar are finished similarly with sleek, chrome wrapped horizontally around the curved edges.  In the seating area, custom bench seating disappears into the contemporary wall mural while subtle touches of red—namely, the supple leather chairs and crimson-rimmed, integrated chrome light fixtures—give the otherwise drab room room a vibrant spark of colour.

The lobby is brought to life by a dedicated team of service professionals which includes a Les Clefs d’Or concierge.  Same day tickets to the Book of Mormon, you ask?  How does center orchestra sound?  

At registration, Angela was an absolute delight.  Prior to my arrival, Axel Fisher, the hotel manager, ensured I receive a room with two beds despite the fact that I reserved a king room by accident.  The bellmen were prompt and courteous when needed, but never intrusive.   Sadly, the vast majority of my stay was ruined by rain but, when I needed to brave the elements, the bellmen were always out front with an umbrella ready and a taxi at the curb.  Last but certainly not least, Diane Elliott, the sales manager, is an absolute delight to work with.

During my time at the Chatwal, I stayed in room 406, a ‘Grand Deluxe Room with 2 Double Beds.’  The walls are wrapped in elegant brown suede and contemporary espresso leather.  All of the furnishings were custom designed for the hotel and several pieces were designed to look like vintage Louis Vuitton luggage.  The beds—custom, handmade mattresses that, I’m sure, cost a bloody fortune—were among the most comfortable I’ve ever experienced in a hotel.  Paired with 400-thread-count sateen linens, it was hard to get up in the morning.  The bathroom was a sophisticated combination of espresso-colored quartz, mirrors, and colored glass.  I especially appreciated the generously-sized Asprey Purple Water amenities, powerful shower, and Toto toilet with an integrated bidet.  My favorite part of the room, though, had to be the closets.  Custom, oversized, solid wood cabinetry with heavy doors nearly a foot thick scream of quality and attention-to-detail.  Inside, the lime green hangers offer a whimsical touch.  The minibar, also contained in the closet, is well stocked.  Among its offerings, I was shocked to find playing cards, candles, a backgammon board, and candy cigarettes in addition to the normal offerings!  The room was not without fault, however.  There was no view (nor daylight) to speak of, the touch-screen control panel rarely worked and the sleek, stainless steel sink in the bathroom is utterly impractical.

Directly adjacent to the lobby, one enters the iconic Lamb’s Club Restaurant.  Once the most prestigious theatre club in Manhattan, the now-public restaurant is sophisticated and, rather surprisingly, simple.  The walls and floors are painted black, so as not to distract from the centerpiece of the room: the original fireplace.  Opposite it, a large portrait of nameless faces—presumably influential producers and actors far before my time—is carried around the border of the room by individual portraits of the original Lamb’s Club members.  The custom benches from the lobby can be found once more in the restaurant—this time, finished in a bright red colour that lends an air of romance to the dark, intimate space.

Food and beverage service, sadly, was hit-or-miss.  I thoroughly enjoyed all three breakfasts I had at the Lamb’s Club without fault.  One evening, however, the dessert I ordered was substituted (without my consent, mind you) with an entirely different dessert that I did not like.  The waitress apologized but charged me for the replacement as if it was what I ordered.  Similarly, I ordered a club sandwich through in-room dining on a Sunday Afternoon.  The club sandwich was listed on the “all-day menu,” but the person who took my order told me that the “all-day menu” wasn’t available on Sundays so I had to order something else.  In short, the culinary team needs to provide greater flexibility at a hotel of this caliber, especially for such basic requests as chocolate chip cookies and a club sandwich.

My favorite amenity is the basement-level Red Door Spa.  While I was sadly unable to get a spa appointment during my stay, I appreciated the modern fitness center and amazing current pool.  While small, the area is rarely used by other guests and is such a rarity in Manhattan!

Overall, this Art Deco stunner is the best hotel I’ve found in New York.  It’s excellent location, lavishly-appointed accommodations, and impressive staff are among its most impressive attributes.  What I love most, however, is the fact that The Chatwal lets you forget that you are just one block from the epicenter of Times Square—arguably, the world’s largest, filthiest tourist trap—by transporting you back to a far more sophisticated era!

title: Wonderful location. Great staff
text:
We stayed here for five nights in early June and found the Chatwal to be just wonderful. It was close to all the plays we were there to see. Times Square, museums, parks,  were all within walking distance.  The staff was helpful and friendly.  We have medical equipment needs and they went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. 
The room was small but it was so well layed out that it really did work. 
Very quiet. No street noise.  We could hear our neighbor but our schedules matched so it was never a bother.  
We plan on coming here again.

title: Great location and service
text: Great location - if you are interested in theatre it couldn't be better.  Very quaint but also contemporary at the same time.  The staff are friendly and very helpful.  Heated toilet seat was a favorite for the wife!   It is a bit on the higher priced side but the room was large and surprisingly very quiet.  Definitely worth considering a stay if you are looking for a nicer hotel

title: splendid
text: Very good hotel, excellent bathroom, domotica... and at walking distance from Times Square, central park, Empire state building, boat trip on the Hudson yo visit "Libery Island", "ground zero"...  Close to Macy's, the famous "oyster bar" in  the 42nd Grand Central

title: Wonderful!!!!!
text: What makes this hotel wonderful is the art deco beauty with modern touches of the public and private spaces.  It is convenient to the hustle and bustle of theater district and Times Square yet very tranquil inside.  Finally what sets this property apart and makes it so special is the wonderful staff, Michael and Johan the doormen, Brandon and Manpreet our butlers, Tammy at the desk, and the concierge staff that took care of all of our requests.  They make you feel like it is your home away from home.

title: Anniversary trip
text: The hotel is in a perfect location for broadway and shopping. Upon arrival we were upgraded into room 709 that has a great patio with large table couch flowers. Hard to believe we were in NYC. Our personal butler Brandon went out of his way to see we had everything and was always correct and was interested on our show reviews. The front desk and room service was 6 star.  We had dinner at the Lambs Club and I highly recommend the Lamb dish. Service was prompt and attentive and the music was great.  The concierge was great with a small restaurant after the theater. MARIA PI  was a great selection and the owner brought us Champaign for our anniversary. We saw Wicked. Kinky Boots and Beautiful!!  If you have not seen them you are missing great theater. We look forward to a return to NYC and another stay at the Chatwal

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: I took my niece to New York as a college graduation gift.  We went to see Broadway shows and the Chatwal was in the perfect location--walking distance to all the theaters and the subway in Times Square.  All the staff was friendly and helpful starting from when we arrived at 2AM to holding our bags after we checked out but before we left for the airport four days later.  The room was lovely and very comfortable.

title: Excellent!!
text:
This is an amazing hotel! Positioned close to the hubub of Times Square...literally yards away...this place is a haven of tranquility. It is a stylish building, with equally stylish rooms and bathrooms. The quality of the fixtures and fittings is beyond reproach, and the whole place is extremely comfortable. The food in the restaurant is of equally high quality, and the breakfasts have to be seen (Eaten??) to be believed! The staff in the hotel are always willing to go the extra yard to ensure the comfort of guests...in our case we were particularly impressed with the concierge, Juan, and the Director of Butler Services, Brandon Short. 
The ability of this hotel to provide us with a quiet, comfortable, and stylish place to call home during our stay in New York City has really enhanced our stay.

title: Best Butler
text: Wonderful location - extremely close to Times Square.  The staff is extremely accommodating, especially Brandon Short (butler).  The room decor was quite trendy and the shower was amazing.  Only wished the room had been ready earlier than the 4:00 check-in time.

title: Staying at the Luxury Chatwal Hotel
text:
This was a most disappointing experience.  That said, I will say that the staff are all very friendly and do their utmost...to an extent.  The hotel now has a policy that they put a hold on $200/day to cover incidentals.  This tripped my fraud control on my VISA account, which was shut down, and it took an hour to resolve it.  I have never been to a hotel where they anticipate you are going to spend money on incidentals and therefore prepare for that.  I guess they have gotten burned, but it cost me a lot of time and grief.

The bathtub drain did not work, the shower was quite inferior; among other things there is no shower door so water gets all over the floor.  The sink was bizarre, it has a ledge and the water spattered all over (I'm sure it was supposed to look modern and hip, but it did not function well) and there was no counter space.

This is considered a luxury hotel and was expensive.  I chose it because my girlfriend (platonic) and I were going to celebrate many years of friendship, and we needed a two-bedded room in the heart of the theater district.  The location was fabulous.

But I would never stay there again.

title: Personal Attention
text: Haven't had such a good feeling about a hotel in a long time. The amount and detail of personal attention was impressive. We felt so well taken care of. We staued in two connected doors with our 3 children and will certainly be back soon. If anybody has doubts about a stay here with small children I can only recommend to reconsider.

title: Elegance in the Middle of Gotham
text: This lovely boutique Hotel is located just steps away from Times Square, but once you step inside the hustle and bustle soon fades away. The staff is excellent, pleasant and helpful; everyone from the front door to the bar/dining area to the concierge staff and front desk! Everyone truly tries to make you feel special as a guest there. The rooms are beautifully decorated, and the bathrooms are what set it apart from all the rest. Exceptional fixtures and shower make the bathroom a delight. If I had one thing to complain about, it would be the bed - just too firm for my taste, but others may find it comfortable. I wish they had Heavenly Beds! Overall we had a fantastic stay at the Chatwal.

title: WOW!
text: After this experience, we will never stay any place else. We had booked a room with king bed, etc., but upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite with separate sitting room and two bathrooms. What's not to like?

title: Luxury & Classy all the way!
text: Brandon Short and his staff made my weekend birthday get away in New York the best ! My dearest friend Windy and I shared a double suite with a terrace and the service was excellent! Clean, courteous, in the heart of everything stylish and very luxurious! Great eating recommendations, timely 24 hour service including chocolates, fruit and bubbles! Mirrored restrooms with roomy shower and heated bidet! Love this hotel and highly recommend. Ask for Brandon...he is delightful!

title: Elegance, Style, Location-What more can you ask for in a NYC hotel?
text:
The Pro's

When we arrived on Friday, our room was not ready so they checked our luggage.   By 3:30 we had not heard anything so we called and were told our room was ready.  When we returned we were greeted by name and they said "we would like to upgrade you to a suite, but we see in our notes that you would like the front of the building and we do not have any available there, would you still be interested in a suite?"  Mind?  Not at all!!!  The queen suite had two rooms and two bathrooms which made our trip even more enjoyable.  The rooms are exquisite.   If they moved, I would feel like I was on the Orient Express in the most expensive pullman car.   A throw back to a more elegant and gracious time and filled with almost every modern technology imaginable.  The hotel is particularly proud of the bathrooms and I won't ruin the surprises, but, let's just say dramatic and efficient .  You have read about the staff and it is all true.  Genuinely interested in your day, your preferences, and in making it the most pleasurable stay.  While we did not require the services of the butler, he was always available and it was always a pleasure to speak with him.

The Lamb's club-  We ate there on Friday before the theatre and took advantage of the 49$  for a 3 course pre-fixe.  Food was very good-excellent and enough variety and choices.

Breakfast-  We ate in the bar/mezzanine dining room both mornings as it was included in our package.  On both Saturday and Sunday starting at 11 am they had live music.  A Bossa Nova band on Saturday and a Jazz band on Sunday.  What a treat!!   Young and talented musicians played at just the right sound  level to enjoy but not to interfere with conversation.  We will definitely return.

The bar at night-- The bar mezzanine 
We don't usually frequent the hotel bars, but this one was too good to pass up.  How dramatic it looked at night!   After the theatre when we stopped to have a drink and snacks. (lamb meatballs and fried risotto were perfect )   The only thing that would have been better would have been one of the bands there for listening/dancing.  

The Con's-  Perhaps the only negative is some of the restaurant service.  Should be sharper.    In the Lambs club we were shown to our table in a half empty dining room at 6 pm that faced the rest room door.  When I asked for another table , the young hostess asked us to wait a moment and would see if she could make a change.  She did, she then offered us the table in the corner right next to the door that  opened to the restroom.  Really???  I finally pointed at several empty tables in the middle of the room and she acquiesced .  The young lady who removes the dirty dishes tried to take our food away before we were finished(yes, I do want those last few sips of the champagne  I ordered).  She did the same thing at breakfast.  We had to rescue our plates from her on several occasions.  Just ask and we will tell you if we are finished.   Yet, even these are small  annoyances .  The restaurant staff while not always efficient or experienced, was always pleasant.

Will we return to the hotel?  Absolutely!

title: Good things come in small packages
text: This hotel was a very nice surprise. Loved the customer service, anything we needed they were on top of it. They were always smiling and happy to help. Bathroom was very nice with the awesome heated toilet seat and the pillows on bed were very nice. Bed was just a little hard for me but I slept fine. The bar was very quaint and lovely. Perfect location to Time Square, Morning Shows, Broadway shows and shopping. Will be back. Thanks so much for such a pleasurable stay and a special Thanks to the "butler" aka owner..... for the drinks.

title: Nice rooms and great service
text:
We are regular visitors to New York and have to confess to being generally underwhelmed by the service in even the 'best' hotels.  The Chatwal was a refreshing change as the service was excellent from the date of our arrival until the moment we left. Whilst we didn't make use of many of the services the hotel has to offer, the reception, concierge, doorman and bar staff were all attentive, efficient and cheerful.

The hotel itself has a modern 'art deco' feel and, upon entry, provides a calm contrast to the hustle of Times Square outside.  The rooms feel luxurious and are well equipped (note in particular the heated toilet seats!) although a little small when compared to other hotels we have used in Manhattan.  On the negative side, the breakfast was uninspiring (there are much better options nearby) and the complete lack of a view from our rooms on the third floor somehow detracted from the feel of being in New York where having a good view of the skyline always seems like an important part of any visit.

title: what a surprise!
text: My wife and I frequent Broadway and try to make mini vacations out of our visit.  We recently spent 2 nights at The Chatwa,based on reviews found on TripAdvisor.  the surprises began when we arrived at the very unassuming front door.  We were met with a smile, and the smiles continued for the 2 nights we were there.  Service was impeccable the entire visit. My only suggestion I would have is to make the beds softer.  Many hotels now offer beds with pillow tops and the mattress at The Chatwal was quite hard.  The bathrooms were small but very well appointed.  the hotel's location in the middle of the block might make getting a taxi somewhat difficult.  All in all a very satisfying visit and yes, we will be back.

title: Boutique hotel en Times Square por excelecia
text:
Es básicamente un 100% boutique hotel de lujo. El precio no es económico para nada.

La situación es muy buena y ideal si necesitáis de servicios de mayordomo.

Buen hotel para ir en pareja, y creo que malo para ir con niños o familia. En general podemos decir que es un hotel tranquilo, con pocas habitaciones.

Las habitaciones son algo más pequeñas de lo esperado ya que el mobiliario, en espacial los armarios cogen mucho espacio. En nuestro caso no teníamos bañera en la habitación.

El Spa del hotel es gratuito, pero extremadamente pequeño, hay una piscina/jacuzzi y una pila de agua caliente. Nosotros no vimos saunas ni nada más.

El bar de la habitación es completo pero muy caro; creo que el más caro que visto nunca. (de $ 10 no baja nada).

Resumiendo, un buen sitio si es imprescindible el ser "boutique", sino ir a cadenas internacionales con ahorro de precio.

title: A pampering experience
text:
We felt so special when we were told at check in that the Director of sales would like to welcome us we knew we had made right decision to stay at the Chatwal on our way home. We had stayed at one of SPG properties in New York on our arrival to New York 3 weeks prior. 
The rooms are tiny but there is every amenity available and you will completely forget you are in Time Square as it so quiet.
What a exquisite experience accept 2 things that was not satisfactory was our very overpriced transfer from  airport which we completely squashed and our luggage could not fit in so we sat on each other. Another thing was we waited for over 30 minutes to speak to the concierge as he was occupied with other guests.  He was well aware we were waiting for him but he made us feel we less worth so he tried to get into all small talk with them. We eventually left and used our discretion.  He seen us leaving but made no attempt to even apologise that he will get back to us. A very bad taste was left after that. 
Bedsides that the staff are outstanding and the hotel and you will feel completely pampered.

title: Excellent, A Gem
text:
Stayed for 3 nites two weekends ago, and just stayed overnight this past Saturday.

I can't say enough what a wonderful hotel this is.  Boutique, "retro" ambience befitting its location in Time Square.  The moment you step in, everyone, I mean every staff member greets you, smiles at you, and will do everything to help you.  

I wanted 11 o'clock AM check in and get into a room right away.  Done.

I wanted four tickets to Book of Mormons on the day of check-in.  Done (Concierge rocks !)  This play is nearly impossible to get good tickets for.  Concierge (Juan rocks !!) got me four tickets at printed ticket prices ($260) and saved me $400 per ticket handling fee.  We sat 5 rows from the stage, center row.  I had not been able to get Book of Mormon tickets the previous 5 visits to NY staying at other luxury hotels.  

Two weekends ago, I wanted 3 tickets to Lion King on the day after check-in.  Concierge told me that "Right now, this morning, I know for fact that there are great seats still available for tomorrow afternoon's show."  He told me that instead of buying through outlet hadlers or via internet, just walk over to the box office "right now" and buy them at the printed ticket price.  I did, and he was right, and I got the tickets for great seats without any added fees.  They aim to please, and they did.

When leaving, I wanted to check out, store my luggage, go out for shopping, then have the Valet bring out my SUV, and have the bell captain load the car with my luggage, waiting for me as I returned from shopping, so I could just hop in the car and leave without having to wait, wait, wait, etc. (Like most luxury hotels).   Done.  The bell captain (Michael) rocks !!  He did exactly as I had requested over the phone, working with the front desk to time my arrival from shopping.

The Mezzanine floor Bar is wonderful.  Great martinis and staff who treat you like a movie star in the 1950's.  

Attention to details is excellent.  I stayed in Junior Suites, and those are good accommodations with wonderful refurbished rooms.  Everything works as they're supposed to.  

The Chatwal in terms of their attention to detail to physical appearance and their staff attention to our needs -- far exceeds the other luxury brands in the city.  

You know what I also liked about this hotel is that although the staff, the hotel, and the ambience is highly upscale, I felt perfectly comfortable walking around in my blue jeans and just a black t-shirt, "street-casual."  Very low-key and yet impeccably tasteful, respectful, and attentive to my needs as a guest.

If you want a Fifth-Ave or a Time-Square New York Stay, this is the place.  Once you walk through the front door into the lobby, it's so, so quiet that you'd not know that you're 50 yards from Time Square.  Sitting in the bar upstairs, you'd think that you're in the Upper East near the Central Park.   It is indeed "an oasis of sanity" and peace in a crazy Time Square neighborhood.

title: Encantador
text:
Escolhi este hotel pelas boas indicações, entretanto, não imaginei que seria tão encantador. 
Realmente ele é muito bem localizado, e ainda que esteja no meio de tudo, ainda consegue ser tranquilo, silencioso, relaxante. A equipe é muito atenta e preparada. Um lugar muito agradável para relaxar depois de um dia agitado, banheiro e quartos espaçosos, tudo muito novinho e limpo. Toalhas e roupas de cama macias. Cama gostosa. Decoração muito elegante, tudo de extremo bom gosto. Além de contar com academia e piscinas, já que em NY poucos hotéis oferecem piscina. Sendo ela aquecida, com ondas e água salgada. Destaque para o chuveiro do banheiro que parece um chuveiro de chuva e as paredes do banheiro que brilham, um detalhe que faz toda diferença. Gostei muito também do serviço de reserva de restaurantes e etc do Hotel, bem funcional, além de lhe indicarem os melhores restaurantes, serviços, peças e musicais disponíveis, eles ainda fazem as reservas e imprimem para vc com o referido endereço. Se tivesse que fazer uma única crítica, seria do serviço de restaurante do segundo andar do hotel, fui tomar café da manhã lá e por ser por volta de 11hs da manhã, o restaurante estava cheio, achei o serviço meio lento para qualidade do hotel neste momento. Mas se tiver que voltar em Nova York com toda certeza escolho novamente este charmoso e confortável hotel. Me hospedei na suíte Junior, bem espaçosa.

title: Art Deco Jewel in the Heart of Manhattan
text: We've just stayed at the Chatwal for the second time and once again had a wonderful experience!  The boutique hotel looks un-assuming from the exterior, but don't let this fool you.  You'll be greeted by the bellman who will remember you by name.  You'll then walk up the stairs to a fabulously renovated hotel lobby, lounge, restaurant and bar, refurbished beautifully in Art Deco style.  Sleek styling punctuated by just the right amount of bling are the order of the day.  The staff are extraordinarily helpful.   The bar in the mezzanine is inviting w/ great drinks and appetizers.  They host a Saturday and Sunday brunch w/ live music ensembles.  The room interiors are beautifully decorated in Art Deco style.  There is great attention to detail in the design elements.  And the bathrooms are fabulous.  From the sparkling floors to the TV in the mirror to the heated toilet seats... it just makes getting up in the morning all that much easier...  The hotel has spent a great deal of effort to ensure the hotel is safe, quiet and welcoming.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Hotel perfeito- equipe agradável
text: Fiquei uma semana neste hotel e recomendo. O hotel e super bem localizado, funcionários educados. Fiquei na suite júnior, suite perfeita, espaçosa, cama muito gostosa. O banheiro e um sonho a parte. Chuveiro perfeito, banheira de hidro. Arrumação do qto feita 2 a 3 vezes por dia, era incrível, saia e qdo retornava o quarto já estava todo arrumado. 02 piscinas aquecidas, academia boa. Eles fazem reservas em restaurantes para vc e lhe dão as melhores dicas de lugares. Fomos para Atlântic City passar um dia e uma noite, e o concierge foi muito gentil, deu a dica de ir de trem em classe executiva e deixamos as malas no guarda volume do hotel. Esta dica foi muito bacana, pois a viagem de trem foi muito gostosa e rápida e não precisamos sair cheios de malas p lá. Apesar de estar em uma região agitada o hotel era calmo e silencioso. O café da manhã e gostoso, porém caro, entretanto, bem próximo ao hotel tem vários lugares para café manhã se preferir algo mais em conta. Este hotel eu super recomendo!!
