Passei dias maravilhosos nele. Fiquei encantado com o hotel e toda equipe. E um hotel menor que os outros, o que o torna mais exclusivo. Um art decor luxo!! Algumas suites oferecem mordomos.

title: Overpriced, overrated. Terrible service
text:
I don't mind paying for overpriced hotel rooms that you can't swing a cat in as long as the staff can treat you with some level of respect.

Most of the staff fail to greet you and treat you like you're doing them a favour by being in their hotel. Again you can live that but what I can't live with is the following;

Paper thin walls you can hear everything in the hallways and adjoining rooms.

Room service that arrives cold after 90 min wait times.

Wake up call requested at 4am to get a 7am flight, didn't happen and we almost missed our flight.

Was advised their was no sporting action on in NYC when we were there, only to find out the game we were watching on TV later that night was live from NYC. 

Overcharged $250 at check out.

Call it an isolated poor experience  but what cannot be overlooked is the half a dozen messages I left for Joel Freyberg the hotel GM that went unanswered. Cleary this hotel is not interested in improving its poor service levels or listening to customer feedback and from a platinum Starwood member at that.

title: an oasis of sanity in a crazy neighborhood
text: was there recently for 4 nights for a business trip. after a few hiccups(which were addressed very quickly), i thoroughly enjoyed my stay. the butler thing is overrated & was not necessary for my stay. had a room with a balcony...amazing! i travel a lot & enjoyed a small touch which i have never seen before-in the safe, there was a mini jewelry box, very handy! free wifi which worked at amazingly fast speeds consistently! continental breakfast included & very large!! i will definitely be returning to this hotel! was able to get a facial at the spa at the last minute. tiny spa area, but the facial was wonderful!

title: Where "At Your Service" Does Begin at the Curb!
text:
Reading reviews of Starwoods Luxury Hotels is always a challenge for me when I travel. I love the hotels, but they are mostly expensive because they are historic hotels in major metropolitan areas around the world. As a business woman, mom and grandmother who has flown more than 4 million miles teaching, I always try to spend my downtime dollars well. When I booked a night at the Chatwal last week it was at the end of a business meeting when my husband could join me to belatedly celebrate his 73rd birthday. The reviews ranged from perfect to problematic. Because I am a Lifetime Starwoods Platinum Member, I always receive great service at SPG hotels. This time the great service started even before I entered the hotel, before they even knew "my status," which is the reason for this review. It shouldn't matter who you are and how often you stay, although those of use who've slept over 700 nights in hotels expect some extras. I exited my cab, exhausted, and left my expensive leather satchel with my passport, iPad and other valuables in the back seat--totally my fault!. I realized it when the doorman welcomed my husband and me to the hotel. Johan, a valet, immediately raced at top speed a long block down the street where the cab was waiting at a red light and retrieved it. Bystanders along the street clapped as he raced back and delivered it to me. 

So here's the point about the Chatwal for other world travelers. This is a boutique hotel that has a great staff, luxury amenities and an outstanding restaurant, The Lamb's Club, where we dined that night. John, our head waiter, served a truly memorable meal and I, like many travelers who eat abroad and in great US restaurants, am choosey! 

In my opinion, the hotel's marketing challenge is the number of rooms and their size. I booked a junior suite. The hotel was booked full, so no upgrade, although I asked. My room was expensive, of course. (It is New York City and in walking distance of Broadway.) For frequent business travelers accustomed to booking large rooms in modern luxury hotels around the world, the comfort is here, ensuite bathrooms are the best, but the size of the room may be smaller, from another century actually, when renowned architect Stanford White designed the structure. When you choose this hotel, choose it for the staff, the restaurant, and the location. I needed a spa treatment, but had no time. The luxurious Red Door Spa is highly touted by my colleagues and fellow travelers. Next time!

title: Best choice in NYC
text: I've stayed at the Chatwal NY for a week with my 12 year old son. We've just returned home today. The experience has been excellent. A superb location, spacious and clean room, fine swimming pool and a modern gym. By the size of it, its art deco style is very appropriate, they take care of every detail and all staff are exquisite and friendful (thanks Michael!). Absolutely recommended for anyone looking for "something more" in a hotel and do not like the huge, impersonal hotels NY.

title: Great hotel near Time Square
text: The staff is incredible. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left. The staff is well trained, seasoned, and accommodating. The beds are a bit hard, the rooms a bit to small for the 5 star rating (even though it is however, NYC)  Superior service, make this hotel what it is. The senior butler was professional, Michael the bell man very polite and thorough. Front desk very helpful.   Can't say enough about the device.

title: Quite luxury close to Times Square
text: The Chatwal provides well appointed rooms, with numerous amenities, between 6th and 7th Avenues and close to the diamond shopping district and Times Square.  The beds are comfortable and rooms quiet, unique for New York.  The hotel is a member of the Starwood program.  They have a Red Door spa and provide a range of quality services there.  They also have an exercise room and a small pool.  Missing is a business centre but the concierge will print docuemnts for you and the hotel will loan you a laptop to use with the wifi in the lobby.

title: Great Hotel
text: Great SPG Hotel with a boutique feel.  The staff is very polite and helpful and checking in is surprisingly easy even though it is in the heart of mid-town.  Nice gym and the steam shower is perfect after a workout.  The rooms are modern and beautiful.  The bathroom is 5 Star.  To boot the managers really care about ensuring your stay is nothing short of perfect !

title: Super Quiet
text:
I've stayed at many hotels in NYC, and this is one of the best.  The room was the quietest I have ever stayed in in Midtown.  In fact, we pleasantly ended up sleeping well past when we intended due to the comfort and quietness of the room.  The rooms are well appointed with electronic room controls for the drapes, lights, etc.  Bathroom is large with a nice rain shower and fancy Toto toilet seat.  

The service from the staff is also great.  They all went out of their way to help us.

I would definitely go out of my way to stay there again.

title: "Highly Recommended"
text: The Chatwal is the classiest hotel I have stayed in in New York.  The location was around the corner from Times Square and the subway was close.  The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was incredible.  I loved the shower and the heated toilet seat was great.  Even though we were steps from the chaos of Times Square, our room was extremely quiet.  The service was topnotch each and every time we encountered an employee.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great rooms, though a little dark
text: I stayed here for 6 nights a fantastic location just a stones throw from Times Square. Couldn't fault the staff impeccable in every way and the room was fantastic (especially the bathroom) though i did find the room a little dark and had to resort to using the torch on my iphone at times to find things in my suitcase!

title: Discrete Luxury Amongst The Chaos
text:
Pros: 
1. Suite with balcony is superb. The outdoor area is extremely spacious. The room itself is modern, clean and fully-equipped and the bathroom is fit for a king. 
2. Times Square is right next door and a short walking distance to all the shops and restaurants around 5th Ave.
3. Staff are friendly and professional.
Cons: 
1. None.
Tips:
1. Theatre-goers paradise hotel location.

title: Best Hotel I have stayed in NYC
text: Excellent hotel in very central location close to Times Square. Staff were very friendly and helpful - nothing was too much bother. Room was very well equipped, modern, clean and very comfortable. The shower was fantastic! Will definitely stay there again whether on business or pleasure.

title: Lovely hotel very close to Times Square
text: Great hotel with attentive staff.  Room was perfect with an amazing shower.  Very clean.  The staff were friendly and attentive and couldn't do enough for us.  Location makes it easy to get pretty much anywhere you want to in Manhattan.  For my first stay in NYC, this was a great choice.

title: ok
text: The hotel is beautiful but the rooms are small and dingy with very poor lightning (and I was in a 1 bedroom suite). I would not consider this hotel 5 star. Much better hotels in the city for the same cost. Try the Langham on 5th.

title: Excellent stay near Times Square
text:
Spent 2 nights in this hotel during Mother's Day weekend. Out of the 10+ hotels I have stayed in NYC, this is one of the best!

Pros: 
Great customer service (special attention is paid to each customer as there are only 70+ rooms)
Unique hotel experience (modern, luxurious hotel with a 1920s historical feel)
Location (close to Times Square)
Very clean

Cons:
Only 10 floors (so not a great view from the room if you care about that)

title: The Chatwall  con un encanto especial
text: Un gran hotel de lujo. Un hotel pequeño, pero muy acogedor con una excelente ubicación. El personal muy amable y siempre dispuesto ayudarte independientemente de la hora que sea ( lo digo por experiencia). Las habitaciones exteriores no son ruidosas, muy bien equipadas y el baño espectacular. Si no hablas inglés, no es problema porque hablan español. En fin, The Chatwall forma parte de mi viaje a NYC.

title: A Weekend in NYC
text:
Beautiful boutique hotel in a historic building right off Times Sq. You enter tranquility when you step inside the Chatwal and leave behind the noise of Times Sq. Perfect spot for luxury and connivence.

Very attentive and friendly staff. Quiet and peaceful lobby and balcony bar.

title: Fab fab fab!
text: Spent three fantastic nights at this fab hotel. Location great. Room amazing. Attention to detail in our room was superb: curtains, lighting, etc controlled from bed; ultra cool TV part of bathroom mirror; great shower; fab toiletries. Staff friendly and ultra courteous.  Will definitely stay again.

title: Fantastic
text:
Had the most fantastic stay, had read a number of the reviews on here and noted that the service was meant to be not the greatest. But all I can say is that every single employee that we spoke to or had contact with was exceptionally professional and went out of there way to accommodate our needs. We have stayed in the hotel over the road for an number of years, but will defiantly will stay here again. the level of service was excellent from the butler, who's name escapes me but was the most pleasant and professional person i have ever met in a hotel.

The room, which was actually two rooms was excellent, everything that you need and all the gadgets that a  gadget lover would ever want! It was all excellent and every detail was perfect.

title: A wonderful experience!
text: Just got back from a long weekend in NYC. As they say....location, location, location, The Chatwal was recommended to us by a friend and we were certainly not disappointed. Right smack in the middle of the theatre district, we were so close to everything. We were upgraded to a suite with a terrace by the helpful and engaging front desk staff, only to then be met by the GM to let us know that "whatever we can do to make you want to come back and stay with us again, don't hesitate to ask". The room was beautiful! Every convenience imaginable to make the stay extra special.A little pricey so if you are looking for a bargain hotel this would not be for you. If you want to experience NYC and be treated like this was not our first visit, we highly recommend The Chatwal. We will certainly stay here again on our next trip to NYC.

title: Intimate luxury in the heart of NYC theatre district.
text:
As I'm a Starwood member, we tried the Chatwal as it's a Luxury Collection hotel. The stay was to celebrate my birthday and we wanted an intimate hotel that was a bit of a splurge. The Chatwal delivered and was a real treat! 

This smaller hotel is perfectly located in the heart of the theatre district and steps from Bryant Park. The rooms are excellently appointed and designed with much thought to its guests. The closets are the largest I've ever had in a hotel! The bathroom included double sinks, a Japanese heated toilet (I'm now a big fan!), and bath products from Asprey of London. At first my husband was disappointed I hadn't requested a room with a bathtub. But he was quickly a convert to the huge shower with a rain shower head bigger than a dinner plate. We both wished we could take the shower home. 

We enjoyed the bar/lounge on the second floor. We went for a drink after seeing some theatre. We were especially pleased to see a well known actor, who we had just seen perform on Broadway, dining in a booth in the lounge. There was a jazz trio playing and a great whiskey list. The bar frequently has music guests so check with the front desk if it interests you. 

We didn't have the chance to eat at The Lamb's Club. But perhaps next time as I hope to return to The Chatwal.

title: Great Location and a good hotel
text: Good hotel in a great location.  The hotel was clean and the service was very good. There was a butler service available to us but he did not follow through and follow up as we are accustom. Still overall a good stay and would return.

title: Great hotel
text:
We stayed for four nights.  It is expensive, but worth it.  The rooms were larger than I expected for NYC, bathroom was large - two sinks, great shower.  The bar was very cool - lights hanging over the bar were in the shape of the Empire State Bldg.  Concierges were terrific - made great recommendations.  Although just off Time Square, we were not at all bothered by noise or crowds, so the location was just great.  
We would definitely stay here again.
My only "complaint" was that the coffee was awful - at least for our taste.  Too strong and bitter.  Picky, huh.

title: Just as perfect as always
text: I recently returned to stay at the Chatwal after a two year absence. I had high expectations as I had stayed there twice before. To my absolute delight everything was again wonderful. I was given superlative service from the moment I arrived. The hotel has an unbeatable location for the theatre, shopping and sight seeing. My room was beautiful and quiet. I am already looking forward to my next stay.Thank you particularly to Elizabeth, and the great concierge team.

title: Excellent Location & Exemplary Service
text:
As a displaced New Yorker, the last place I wanted to stay on my recent visit to NYC was Times Square. Well, The Chatwal changed that, almost instantly. I wouldn't hesitate to book this amazing Boutique Hotel again. 
When I lived in NYC, I probably walked by this hotel a dozen or so times, never knowing what an amazing experience was behind the heavy iron doors. 
We had a Junior Suite on the 9th floor, facing 44th St. The room was large, well appointed and the bathroom was stunning. Yes, the bathroom is stunning. All the glitz and glam from a long ago era neatly tucked away in a quiet part of Times Square.
The staff was extremely polite, courteous, helpful and are at your beck and call. 
I highly recommend this hotel, it's staff and the location.

title: Lovely hotel
text: Stayed with my daughter for 5 nights. We were there to visit all the sights which we did. The hotel is very boutique. Fantastic bathroom. We only discovered when leaving that the desk in the room is actually a dressing table with a mirror. Wish we had found this before!  The super king bed we had was very comfortable with lovely bedding. My only niggles are the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything!  Also the drinks for us were very expensive but this is a New York. We would return

title: Impressive Staff
text:
IMO the true measure of a hotel is how it handles things when something goes wrong. Sadly I didn't catch the Front Desk Clerks name, but she saved the day for us. 
 We booked a Priceline Express deal on impulse. Apparently, The Chatwal reserves single queen beds for these deals. Even though we called the night before our stay and requested two queen beds, our request was misplaced and by the time we made it to the hotel there weren't any rooms with two beds available. 
  Luckily the Front Desk Clerk on duty took it upon herself to fix the mistake and make things work to meet our needs. She was very reassuring and helpful, sending us out on our way to explore the city. A short time later we got a call advising a simple solution to our problem. 
  We found the rest of the staff to be friendly and engaging and hope to return for another stay sometime soon.

title: Fun experience.
text: It was great to be so close to the center of Times Square!!  The accomendations where very nice and everything is top knotch.  Wish it could have included continental breakfast, since it's a boutique hotel.

title: The Best!
text: A nossa estadia reporta a Janeiro de 2012.Este pequeno hotel de charme foi a melhor experiência de hotel que tive em New York. Começaram por nos fazer um up grade por ser a nossa primeira vez no hotel. Ficámos numa suite Queen, com direito a mordomo! A decoração do quarto era irrepreensível e a casa de banho de sonho, com LCD e tudo! O hotel tem um restaurante da moda, que vale a pena experimentar. Extremamente bem localizado! O melhor possível!

title: Wedding anniversary break
text: We stayed in this hotel for four nights at the beginning of May and it was a great location right beside Times Square and at the same time on a very peaceful quiet street for a restful sleep. I had emailed the hotel beforehand to tell them it was our 10th wedding anniversary and to ask for a good room. They offered us an upgrade on arrival and went out of their way to make us feel special for our anniversary. All the staff in this hotel were extremely friendly and helpful with anything we needed.  The room itself was very pleasant and had plenty of space. The bathrooms were especially nice with a his and her sink, heated toilet seat and fabulous shower. Our room faced onto 44th street and it was very quiet. Breakfast was available but very pricey just to get the basics such as cereal and juice. I guess back home in Ireland we are so spoiled with the huge display of cereals, beverages, hot and cold food that are so frequently available at an inclusive price where everyone can help themselves to as much as they can eat that this idea of paying individual prices for every breakfast item came as somewhat of a shock. But otherwise this hotel was perfectly lovely in every way from comfort, luxury to wonderful staff. It's location was also ideal for our needs. I would recommend it to family and friends for sure.

title: WOW!!
text:
I've travelled extensively across the world and have good experiences and bad experiences; but the Chatwal is the only one that I have taken time out to review for others. In a word, WOW!! We stayed at the Chatwal for four days and we were absolutely blown away. 

As soon as we entered the beautiful art deco building we were greeted warmly by the front desk and were checked in and in our room within a couple of minutes. Literally two minutes was all it took. 

The room, my word, I've been in some fantastic hotel suites but nothing that had the character of the Chatwal. The suede(i think?) walls with the fantastic light fixtures made it feel very 1920's luxe but it had just about every single modern creature comfort one could ask for as well. The amenities were thoughtfully set up. I especially loved the touch of adding a backgammon set in the room. 

Once we were in the room; we freshened up, and were greeted by Manpreet, who got us started with a fantastic breakfast and made plans with us for the rest of our stay. We had been traveling for a while and were craving Indian food for lunch. He went above and beyond by not only making reservations at the restaurant but also accompanied us there to make sure we were comfortable. He even arranged a special evening "chai" with "chaat" in the room of his own accord (because we told him how much we missed Indian food). We even entertained some friends one evening and all of the arrangements for dinner to be served in the room were taken care of by Manpreet with absolutely no effort on our end. 

I think the thing that struck me the most, was the staff. As an example of the exemplary service, we were on our way out one time an Juan Franco, the doorman, actually looked up the weather forecast and suggested we carry an umbrella with us. Not only that, he actually went in and got us a couple of umbrellas for us. Sure enough it did rain a little later. 

I can be quite a demanding guest and the Chatwal and Manpreet shone through every time. One example was when I went clubbing with friends. We got to the club and found a massive queue of people waiting to get in. I called him up and he had us walk in right to the front of the line. Which is near about impossible to do in a city you're visiting for four days and dont have your connections in place yet.

The lambs club. I really should do a proper review of the place by itself but that is probably for another time. Suffice it to say, MIND = BLOWN. It really was pretty special. 

Overall, On my first visit to New York, I fell in love with the city. I felt I was a part of the city mainly because the people at the Chatwal made me feel at home.

title: Beautiful hotel, walls are paper thin
text: We stayed for one night, the hotel is really beautiful and luxurious.  Many thoughtful touches throughout the room including many free amenities.  The room was spacious.  Bath and shower were top notch and bed was quite comfortable.The staff was helpful and aimed to please.  The only complaint was that I heard everything from the room next door including the toilet flushing, in full stereo.  Fortunately our neighbors were not in the room too long but woke me when they came back after midnight.  Other than that complaint it was a great stay.

title: Great experience
text:
We were traveling to NYC to see some plays and meet up,with family and friends
Very hard to find  a good hotel at rates approaching value. Multiple other reviews have praised this hotel, only four years old but polished and beautiful. 

You have to be ok with elegant lo key, not hustle or bustle , room was so QUIET. Service was   Efficient. Right in the middle of theaters

 Two issues, one is thet there are several stairs to get in which was a mild problem for our knees.
Waldo occ difficult to get w wc  because of local traffic patterns, need to go up to 6 th on occaision.
They met some great rates I found on the net with no problem, which made things much better.
Hotel picking is not easy...this was w winner

title: A great place to stay!
text: We spent six nights in NYC going to the theatre and The Chatwal is my first choice for luxury in the theatre district.  You cannot have better rooms, service and attention and walk to the theatre.  We were always greeted with smiles and "welcome home" from the eager to please staff.  We can't wait to return.  (By the way, the breakfasts in the Lambs Club are terrific.

title: Speakeasy Styling
text:
Refined midtown masc meets the upper east sides’ undoubted glamour in this Luxury Collection property. After an exhausting day of traveling out and back from the Hamptons twice, I could not wait to arrive at the Chatwal for the evening. You feel as though you are being ushered into a speakeasy, or a private label 20′s nightclub, as you enter the art deco and glossy dim-lit lobby. The rooms feature soaring ceiling heights, rich suede walls, and an ambiance of calm respite from the bustling city.
 The Chatwal is hidden just steps from Times Square, and a quick jump to Madison and Park shopping.

title: Perfect for Business or Pleasure Great Central Location !!!!
text:
The rooms are modern, spacious comfortable and clean, and very quiet. Beautiful bathroom, great shower. Lots of closet space.

So easy to move around in the area with everything nearby, Theaters, restaurants, Fifth Avenue, perfect for business meetings.

At Breakfast they serve the most luscious croissants, right out of the oven, fluffy, an amazing breakfast on the house included in the room rate.

This Hotel with the impeccable service is a gem, I truly enjoyed the stay. Whenever in doubt pick the Chatwal, good to reward oneself.

title: Top Notch Experience and Treatment
text: The hotel is absolutely wonderful! It has a very upscale vibe. The decor is sophisticated and stylish. Ever amenity is there except a good size pool and gym. The rooms are some of the best I've had. The food is excellent too. The spa is amazing. This boutique hotel obviously can provide excellent care and attention to detail given the small size. Also the  concierge is very good. I would go back in a heart beat.

title: Beautiful room, excellent bathroom!
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights at their Grand Deluxe King room with rain shower. Booked through American Express FHR. Was hoping for an upgrade but that didn't happen even though was told there were better rooms available.(and I'm a gold SPG) But since I'm already getting all the perks from Amex FHR, I guess I had to be happy with just the Grand Deluxe.

I must admit, I cheated on Four Seasons this time, but The Chatwal's interior decor was beautiful, classy and the bathroom was to die for. The room was spacious - I walked into the room and when I saw that they had laid out the slippers on the floor for me, with a note on the bed of tomorrow's weather, bottled water all ready, I knew this is no doubt a luxury hotel. 

The only complain I had was, I had a gala to attend at 6pm and when asked if i needed to get a car service, the front desk mentioned that I shouldn't have any problem if I had hailed a cab at around 5.25pm. Sure enough, I was on my 4" heels for an hour, back and forth between 6 & 7th ave, trying to hail a cab and didn't get one till 6.40pm. There were two bell men at the door. One was REALLY nice - Michael, who stood there with me for almost an hour trying to get a cab for me. That evening happened to be the evening when the President was in town, so many streets were blocked off. Nonetheless, a pre-planned black car service would have been a great idea, and I should have done it by myself. And there was another bellman who thought that me walking back and forth trying to get a cab was funny....

Their Red Door spa was good. Their Lambs club restaurant was great - I had two dark chocolate martinis...They were to die for.

Overall, I would return to this hotel and bring my kids with me on my next trip.

title: Best luxury hotel in Theater District
text: After a recent visit to The Chatwal, I was reminded of what a marvelous hotel this is. I am a theater buff, and being within walking distance of most Broadway theater is.Huge plus to me.  No more waiting in long taxi lines to return to my hotel.  This hotel is the only true luxury hotel in the theater district.  Fabulous rooms and great service.

title: Husbands 50th Birthday surprise
text:
We have just returned from a truly sensational stay at The Chatwal. The staff were so helpful and really couldn't do enough for us. I had requested a few things before we arrived , and all my requests were granted.
The room was so nice with all the quirky things like a heated toilet seat and a telly behind the glass in the bathroom. It really was very luxurious. 
Keep a look out for the complimentary coffee in the foyer which was a nice touch,even though we didn't realise this until our last but one day.
The hotel was a stones throw off the centre of Times Square but was very quiet and we slept brilliantly well .
If you want a lovely luxurious hotel with great staff right in the heart of the theatre district then this is the one to pick.
Didn't have time to try the spa. Didn't have breakfast either.
Thanks to all.

title: Trip of a Lifetime!
text: My wife and I are not big travelers, we are pretty much home-bodies and love being around family. That being said, we decided to do something very special for our 30th anniversary. We have always wanted to go to New York and see a Broadway show, so we decided to spend 5 nights in the Theater District and chose The Chatwal for our accommodations. We could not have been happier with our choice! This place was absolutely amazing and the staff (especially the head Butler, Bernard) were wonderful. Expect to pay top dollar, but what you get is worth every penny. This place is perfectly settled close to Times Square, the major theaters, and the subway. We could not have picked a better "home-base" for our trip. We either walked or rode the subway to everything we wanted to do and see. Rooms were small but comfy, the bed was firm and with a few extra pillows, we slept like babies. The greatest thing (not kidding) was the bathroom!! What luxury. The "rain shower" was the perfect solution to a long day of touring and the bidet was incredible. Never used one before, but now have one on order with Amazon! All in all, this was the nicest trip my wife and I have ever been on. Perfect city, perfect weather and perfect hotel. This will be the only place we will stay when we come back. Thank you all at The Chatwal from Chris and Leslie

title: Still a favorite in New York
text: It had been a little over a year since our last stay at The Chatwal and we wondered if it would be as excellent as our last stay. I am happy to report that it was even better. We had a delay getting in to our room (although it wasn't check-in time) but we were given the option of waiting for an upgrade or taking a standard room that was ready. We opted to wait and walked to Bryant Park (2 blocks from the hotel) for some people watching. Our upgrade to a King Deluxe room was well worth the wait. The room was spacious with a walk in closet, 2 floor to ceiling windows, a sofa and reading chair. The Frette linens are top of the line as are the Asprey  products. But more importantly, the staff is warm and welcoming and helpful. The waiters, bar tenders, front desk personnel, butlers... everyone! The hotel is centrally located and it is an easy walk to Rockefeller Center and to Broadway, Fifth Avenue, etc. It is small, impeccably clean and well maintained. We can't imagine staying anywhere else on our visits to New York. We look forward to our next visit with pleasure.

title: Although it's been longer than usual it's still our home away from home
text:
Some of the familiar faces have changed at the Chatwal but the level of and commitment to Service have remained the same. From Catalina at the front desk to Pierre and Juan at the Concierge stand to Mumfree and Brandon our butlers the people cannot be more welcoming. 
I love the decor here - it's so deco-modern. The rooms have everything you need, bed is fantastic and some grooms have a terrace. The particular one we had had a large terrace overlooking 44th. It was a bit too cold to fully enjoy but with better weather room service can be taken there or one could host a small get tighter before or after dinner or a show. The only negative of this particular room (the suites all have 2 bathrooms) is that there is only 1 sink in the bathroom. 
Speaking of room service we only had breakfast but the food is always excellent. 
The workout room is small but any workout app that can give you a routine with dumbbells a bench and treadmill will help you through it. There is an excellent Elizabeth Arden Re Door Spa and I always get a manicure-pedicure when here.

title: Best Stay Ever!
text: This is my first stay at the Chatwal and i cannot say enough about what a wonderful stay we had. Everyone from the front desk to the maid was excellent. I have tried many hotels in manhattan, but the chattel by far is superior. The amenities are excellent and customer service is wonderful. i look forward to coming back again. This is truly a first class hotel .

title: Very cool hotel, but a few issues
text: The chatwal is one of the premium hotel chains in SPG. I was kept waiting for a long time while in line. That said, the room was excellent with great amenities and built in closets. This is not your standard hotel room. The bar was also very interesting with live jazz musicians. If you want a smaller hotel in the SPG chain near broadway, and don't mind paying more, this is the place for you.

title: Maravilhoso!!!
text: Escolhi esse hotel pelas avaliações que li aqui no tripadvisor e não me arrependi!!! O hotel é muito bem localizado, aconchegante e todo o staff é muito educado e cuidadoso!! O quarto é muito confortável e aconchegante com lençóis e toalhas bastante macias! Apesar de estar numa região muito movimentada o isolamento acústico é perfeito proporcionando um sono de ótima qualidade,  e o banheiro surpreendente, tem até tv!! Meu quarto era arrumado duas ou três vezes por dia!! Acho que eles ficam observando quando vc sai e a camareira passa novamente para colocar o quarto em ordem!! O restaurante que fica no hotel é ótimo e o bar do lobby é uma boa opção para tomar algum drink enquanto ouve-se boa música para relaxar !!!

title: Did not get room type booked, service level comparable to Sheraton
text:
Staff were friendly, room was clean and check-in was quick ... good enough for a Sheraton but the Chatwal is a luxury hotel twice the rate of the Sheraton nearby. Unfortunately, it has failed to live up to the luxury brand. Every room in the hotel is supposed to have a butler service but my butler never showed up to introduce him/her self. Not that I needed one but my understanding of the butler service offered by some of the higher end Starwood hotels is the personal touch which Chatwal did not deliver. Swimming pool was out of service and front desk had to clue when it will be back in service. I had to go down to the gym to check it out myself.

Also, I booked a room with queen sized bed but received a room with two double sized bed. I did not go back to check-in to argue as it was late but that's in my view not acceptable for a luxury hotel at $500 a night.
